reviews.text: Came here with my husband. Long wait. Was quoted 30-40 minutes, which ended up being more like an hour. Ourdoor seating due to COVID-19 restrictions. The ambiance and scenery was amazing with the ocean in the background. After dinner, we ordered cheescake. I got the cookie dough cheescake this time. And I definately wasn&#39;t a fan with all the nuts in it. It had a bland taste. I&#39;ll stick to the godiva. Which is my favorite. Keep in mind parking is $7.00, which is not validated.

This location is very pretty and they have lots of seating. Just like all other Cheesecake Factories, there&#39;s usually a wait of at least one hour, especially during peak times. <br><br>We were given the usual bread and butter starter and also asked for refills. Something about that brown bread with butter that gets me all the time! <br><br>I got shepherd&#39;s pie and a s&#39;mores cheesecake. I usually order the pasta carbonara with chicken, but thought I would try something different. The shepherd&#39;s pie portion was humongous and was able to bring most of it home. I probably was full because of the bread, but oh well. The shepherd&#39;s pie was bland, so I had to add tobasco sauce. The s&#39;mores cheesecake was sweet and tasty and had no surprises there. <br><br>The service was great. He kept checking up on us and refilled our drinks often. <br><br>I would come back. It might have just been an off night with the blandness.

Y&#39;all know their food and cheesecake (although, the seasonal pumpkin ROCKS!&#34;), so this is more a review of the efficiency and friendliness of their curbside pickup. Ordered online (EZ PZ), drove up to the parking attendant, he instructed us to the tent to the left, the helpful tent guy took our name, then instructed us to park by the wall. He said the food will be brought to us. Due to the ongoing lunch special that ends Friday, he did inform me that they&#39;re running a bit late (I appreciated the honesty), but assured me they will get the food out to us as quick as they can. <br><br>About 10 minutes later, a cheerful runner brought our food over and we were on our way!<br><br>Way to run your takeout during these often frustrating Covid times. Bravo!

We are used to go to this restaurant for their wonderful patio dining. The food is very rich but very good and enjoyable. However due to covid I have been ordering for pickup lately. Our DaVinci pasta dish from last night was very disappointing. The pasta was not Al Dente but mushy and overcooked. I really try to support my local restaurants during these difficult times but this has me questioning the quality of this place...

08/16/2020<br>Food flavor is good. The taste even as takeout as I would expect from dine-in. The good ends there.<br><br>Still the customer service quality lacks. Paying close to hundred dollars for two on takeout only without even drinks. One would think I get a &#34;Goodbye&#34; or even a &#34;Thank you&#34; you&#39;d be wrong. Human Resources need to give basic training on interacting with customers or hire better quality. Those are the basis of any customer relations business. <br><br>The food overall was good. It was what I&#39;d expect from a Cheesecake Factory. Our server was very nice and friendly however, she was a bit slow on bringing us bread, filling out water glasses, and bring change back after paying for the bill. The greeters and staff that take you to your table need lots of work. They were chatting with each about non-work matters too much and their appearance was too causal for the prices Cheesecake chargers. That was a disappointment because they are the first thing we as

This is one of my favorite location. I come here when I&#39;m craving for the bread. The complimentary bread is always the best. Went for birthday and I ordered the chicken piccata and I&#39;m always happy with my food. All dishes ordered we&#39;re phenomenal as well.We had a wonderful evening and everything was great. Thank you:)

Once again, the cheesecake factory delivers wonderfully through the night. We ate there on the 16th in the evening around 8pm.<br><br>By this point, I&#39;ve come to cheesecake factory so many times that I&#39;ve tried literally every single cheesecake on the menu, except for the pumpkin, which I now got to taste.<br><br>We were celebrating our friend&#39;s 50th birthday and everything worked out smoothly. We got seats next to the dock area where we had a view facing outside and that was very nice. I tried the new Neapolitan pasta dish (I believe I may have spelled this wrong) and it was SO GOOD!! Multiple types of meat and it was just perfect. Everyone was happy with what they got and they even sang a birthday song for my friend.<br><br>The timing of the food worked out perfect, not too long, just the right time, and everyone was happy.<br><br>But the biggest, perhaps best part of the night was our dear server who took excellent care of us. I am SO so sorry that I probably will spell her name wrong but she was a total sweetheart and the moment I heard her laugh, I discerned sincerity and honesty within her, and that made me genuinely smile after a long day. Once again, I am so sorry that I may miss-spell her name wrong because she was so beautiful and I got really-really nervous and I got too shy to ask for her name once again, but I believe it was either Keylan/Keilan or Keelan. It sounded like that but I could have written it wrong.<br><br>Lastly, Cheesecake factory has been wonderful every time I have visited multiple locations and it has always astounded me with its customer service. You&#39;ve done it again Cheesecake Factory. 5/5

Oof , what a cluster! Ordered the highly touted  &#34;fantastic amazing , tremendously wonderful&#34; $20 deal. The one you see all over the net right now , you can only order it from June 29-July 3rd 2020 , 11:30am- 4:30pm.  ONLINE only. Pick up only/deliver only. It goes like this ..2 happy hour cheese burgers, 2 fries, 2 sodas, 1 Oreo dream cheese cake. Ordered my food seamlessly. Got an estimated time which was to be about 20 minutes later no problem, takes me about that long to get there. I arrive and I see part of my order sitting on the counter already. Great! So they tell me oh it&#39;ll be just a few more minutes- 10 minutes. No problem I take possession of the already melting cheesecake. 40 minutes later , yes 40, I finally get a hold of the mngr. and she said &#34;there wasn&#39;t even a ticket for you back there, I&#39;m sorry let me make the food fresh and give you free cheesecake for our mistake&#34; she goes away for about 3 minutes. Comes back with my order. That was a fast 3 minute fresh cook...??? Hey I&#39;ll give her 5 stars for her great customer service , Ashley with all the craziness going on you were a rockstar. Thank you. And thank you for the cheesecake. Well reviewers , I&#39;ll let you see my wonderful meal deal.

It&#39;s too bad that both Cheesecske Factories in the South Bay have paid valet lots. It&#39;s definitely a deterrent for me to go more often. However I know that they&#39;ve been charging for decades so it&#39;s not news. Obviously, the wait times are also another deterrent from making this an easy casual weekend meal. Even after seated, the wait staff is often very busy, seemingly covering more tables than comfortable. Although they are nice and well trained, they are hard to flag down when you need them. For these reasons, I typically only go to Cheesecake Factory maybe twice a year. <br><br>My go to dishes are the chicken piccata and chicken &amp; shrimp jambalaya. If coming during the daytime, I might get the chicken and avocado club. This is one of my favorite sandwiches in the world. <br><br>For the last couple of years, I have bought gift cards from them during the holidays, which come with aa coupon for a free slice of cheesecake after 1/1. That&#39;s an $8+ gift for every $25 gift card, so that does keep me coming back early in the year to collect my slice.

Soooo disappointed in this place! We ordered to-go and waited over an HOUR for our food and our pasta was crunchy and hard. The sauce was super oily and the bread was a rock. <br><br>We called the restaurant to ask for a refund or at least fix the problem and you can&#39;t because the number is out of service.<br><br>To sum it up: they cook gross food, there&#39;s no flavor and good luck calling them for anything.

I have been going to the cheesecake factory for years and I go every week, tonight I went there after I&#39;d called and for a takeout they said it would be ready in 20 minutes I got there and the guy said he didn&#39;t have my name on the list so I waited in the parking lot for another 20 to 40 minutes finally left I am never going back to that place again.

I ordered delivery service and all my food was horrible!!! I spent over $80.00 All my food was burnt (that&#39;s on Cheesecake Factory :-() and soggy (that&#39;s on doordash :-()<br><br>Im still in the process of trying to get my money refund and it&#39;s going on two months... Slightly frustrating... <br><br>No one wants to take responsibility an accountable in resolving this issue in a reasonable and  expected time...<br><br>Clearly, in the future I will not be eating or recommended Cheesecake Factory so much I expect ations of Cheesecake Factory for Doordash delivery... I guess we can blame it on the pandemic of 2020.

I would like to complain about Door Dash and Cheesecake Factory Service poor service.  I had a missing Santa fe Salad and a black hair in my Cheeseburger egg rolls.  No one cared. No one said sorry or comped my bad service. I got charged for both.  My salad finally came re- delivered an hour later.  When I called Cheesecake Factory they said to contact door dash but when I wrote door dash they sent me a notice that they will not refund.  This is horrible service.  It is not my fault that this service makes mistakes. Customers should not have to pay for missing food and hair in food.  Plus I paid for a higher tip to insure good service but that didn&#39;t happen.  Not happy.

Visited the Redondo Beach location with the family for a delayed anniversary celebration and everything was great. The sat us on the patio as we requested and the weather helped make for an enjoyable experience. <br><br>We started with appetizers of stuffed mushrooms, tater tots, and avocado egg rolls. We all got to sample them and were very happy with our selections. I have had the mushrooms and egg rolls before but the tater tots were new for me and they were something I would try again. <br><br>For my entree i chose the Pineapple Crispy Shrimp and Chicken. The shrimp are chicken were mixed with sliced mushrooms, snow peas, and of course chunks of pineapple. They all mixed well and made the dish very tasty dish. For dessert we picked a dark chocolate hazelnut cheesecake, and a banana cheesecake. I got to try both and each was delicious. Overall today was an excellent dining experience thanks to the location, food,  and of course our excellent waitress.
Best Cheesecake Factory ever! Great customer service Always ! Great food with lots of flavor and always well done! Amazing drinks! A bit pricey but worth the splurge!

I usually don&#39;t make any comments on YELP but I feel as this is an important issue that everyone should be aware OF. <br><br>That&#39;s the first time that I go out in over 3 months. I have been very cautious in regards to the COVID-19 situation in this country. I don&#39;t even go out for a walk. My friend convinced me to go to a restaurant so we end up going. <br><br>I decided to go to cheesecake factory because I thought they would be cautious about CDC Guidelines. However, servers would take out their masks to talk to servers. They would be close to me and my friend and do not follow the 6- feet apart. Also, my server gave me Bread and his mouth was showing, he wasn&#39;t using the mask fully. <br><br>I am so disappointed and if I get sick its because the cheesecake factory is not following the protocols necessary to keep people safe. <br><br>What matters if tables are apart if all the servers are careless? If they are not using the mask properly or being too close to people? <br><br>For everyone reading now. Please do NOT GO to the cheesecake factory. I heard other restaurants are being more cautious.<br><br> The servers are cheesecake factory are not even using gloves and they&#39;re all being very careless which is very bad.

THIS IS SUCH A BAD SERVICE, I reserve a table for 6  and another for 4  (I understand that it has to be a Max of 6) and I wait 1hour for my table that should be ready at 9 because I had Reservation. <br><br>That is not it. When we get inside some of us didn&#39;t have facemask and we ask the server and some lady dress in grey (I guess is the manager) to sit the ones that have mask first and then the rest when they find theirs, but the manager was so racist with us and she doesn&#39;t have any education and respect and she keeps saying that any of us can have sit. <br><br>I had never felt disrespected like this before.<br><br>Anyways after all this, I can say that the server was very nice with us his name is Ryan and Channce.

Had to wait over an hour for my take out. It was only two meals then they forgot one meal at a time it was ordered and I have to wait again another 15 minutes for the second order all they can say is they don&#39;t know what happened and apologize, then turn around forget utensils after high make sure I requested them. I don&#39;t think I will be back at the cheesecake factory

Just had to share...a month after our one year anniversary, we finally got around to eating the top layer of our &#34;wed&#34; velvet cheesecake. It defrosted PERFECTLY.<br><br>The catering staff thoughtfully saved the top layer, sealed it in a freezer bag, boxed it up for us and arranged for my friend (who was acting as my coordinator) to bring it home.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory last night it was horrible let just say that I spider fell out of a spiderweb on to me and then ran across the table to the floor on top of the hour and fifteen minute wait  I have a spider they need to do better i
It was amazing the Hibachi steak and the Tiramisu on Nov 14. The food were super delicious and we both gave an five stars to the food. Please continue to support local business.

The worst place we&#39;ve ever been. Waiting for 40 min is fine, we understood it. But after being sat down waiting for the waiter for another 40 min is incredible. I asked many times why no one wanted to take an order from us. Was so annoyed. Everyone was just stupidly telling that they are not our servant and let the servant know about us. There should be team work, I believe. But everyone there is super selfish. Will never come back to this place. And more, I was not the only one who was annoyed. More than 5 tables were super annoyed with the service. If there would be chance to give the minus 10 stars I would definitely give it. Do not recommend

This Cheesecake Factory location is great! They make the food like the Cheesecake brand. I ordered a Chicken Madeira and it was exactly like how they are to make it. The Chicken was moist, there was a lot of thin sauce with creamy mash potatoes. This is my favorite dish and I order it a lot over the last 9 years. <br><br>I believe most of the locations are good, just avoid the Sherman Oaks location as the chef team must have changed about 4-5 years ago and the Chicken Madeira there is dry with hardly any too thick sauce (over reduce it) and not-creamy mashed potatoes. It&#39;s been that way over the last 4-5 years, sometimes are more dry than others. We will drive further to a better location. <br><br>Thank you Redondo Beach for reminding me how good this specialty dish is. The rest of the food was excellent too. I let the waitress know how good it was.  We love Cheesecake Factory and hope all locations can make a Chicken Madeira as good as Redondo Beach does!

This review has been long overdue ( im so sorry SCARLETT) <br>Long story short.. <br>One thing I&#39;ve noticed since most restaurants have opened back up is that good customer has gone completely out the window. Not here though. We continue to come back to this very location because every single visit and every single server that&#39;s helped us out continues to meet or exceed our standards. Down to the parking guy out front, to the check-in lady, to our servers. One person I&#39;d like to put a spotlight on is Scarlett, she has seriously set the standard to what  great customer service should always be. Such beautiful, genuine energy. Very professional and 100% attentive to her customers and never made us doubt her experience or professionalism. She was great!!! Just an amazing human being PERIOD. Thanks for making our visit the most memorable one Scarlett.

The view was amazing, and the food was delicious. The only downfall was the service. We kept waiting around for the waiter to bring our stuff, and had to keep asking different waiters to bring our refills/ more drinks

This has to be my FAVORITE Cheesecake Factory. The views are amazing and make you feel like you&#39;re eating on some huge YACHT(esp when you have. Window seat overlooking the docks)<br>The wait time was pretty long (as expected with first come first serve style places), but the food was DELICIOUS!! We love the brown complimentary bread option at Cheesecake Factory and so we were able to swap our white bread option with ALL brown loaves. <br><br>The waitress was pleasant and the food was delicious! (A bit pricey but that&#39;s expected with the Cheesecake Factory chain). But oh man did I mention the VIEW!!! So magnificent and really makes you feel like you&#39;ve been transported to a ritzy new life!<br><br>My ONLY complaint has nothing to do with the food or ambience, but the PARKING. On Sundays (which I expect is a popular day) there is VERY LIMITED self-parking...so nearly EVERYONE had to pay $4 for valet parking just to eat at the restaurant.<br><br>If I&#39;m ever in the area again, I&#39;ll definitely return!

Good evening,  <br>It brings me sadness having to put 1 star to this review. We waited 3hours outside for the hostess to texted me. <br>I went up to her at 7:30pm and she stated that we only needed to wait 30min, it was then 8:56pm 4min before the restaurant closes luckily I went up there again to get QRF scan and be able to see the menu we were so hungry that as soon as we go inside we wanted to order our food. Anyways, I ask the hostess &#34;how many more people before us now&#34;, she said &#34;I texted you since 8:10pm&#34; which at this point idk if it was true or not. I showed her my phone and said to her no text from you guys. we were waiting out in the cold in front of them, I&#39;m trying to understand what was so hard for her to either call my name or say if we needed help etc. We then go inside, and the other hostess with an attitude stared at me and I stared at her i felt like I was in a staring contess, instead of her leading me the way to the table I felt like I had to do her Job. I decided to stay there and  eat since we had already waited for so long. Our waitress Tatiana was nice ill give her 5 stars<br>I understand we are in a middle of a pandemic but it doesn&#39;t justify attitude towards us.

One of my go-to places for happy hour!  3-6pm Mon-Friday in the bar area.  They have $8 full-sized appetizers and $5 cocktails/drink specials!  Also a plus, this location is right in the marina so you can catch a beautiful sunset right after your meal.<br><br>Food:  my absolute favorites are their avocado egg rolls.  They&#39;re so yummy, creamy, and filling with the delish, sweet tamarind dipping sauce.  I also love getting their southern chicken sliders!  4 sliders with yummy, fried chicken, pickles, tomatoes, and lettuce.  I would pass on their hummus though, the pita crackers seem deep fried and they cancel out the &#34;healthier&#34; option I was hoping for.  Hummus was just alright.  <br><br>Overall, decent prices! Parking is valet only, around $5.  Service tends to be on the slower side, but it&#39;s a good place to try some new apps and have a view :) would recommend!

So made an online order with a 6:15 pick up time for curb side pick up.  Sitting in my car with no notification my food is ready so asked one of the women working the outside service tent.  She says they are 1 hour behind.  Wouldn&#39;t have ordered from here had they told me when I picked 6:15 pick up it was actually going to be 7:15.  Plus the online ordering system wouldn&#39;t recognize my gift cards.  Whoever set up the time for pick up system should be replaced.

Went to this location a couple of time I think the management needs a change ..he does not know what customer service is not going to mention any names<br>But he has a Beard .. ordered top shelf drinks and a lot of floating bugs so be careful when you order drinks there they didn&#39;t come from the air like he says .. he said he was gonna compensate the drinks and didn&#39;t <br>I personal think that is gross and they should check their bottles more often !!! I understand with the COVID that staff is limited but he should be checking <br>Food was good ... no bugs there !!! Thank god
Everything was fine however the dish I ordered said it was angel hair pasta with shrimp but the noodles were just spaghetti.

Ordered takeout after hearing about 7 for $20 deal, but somehow was not an option when I went to order. Ordered over an hour ahead of time and waited at restaurant 30min past pick up time for food. My green salad only had the lettuce and tomato and nothing else, when there were no modifications made. Gave us bread but no butter or utensils. Food was good but salad was absolutely terrible with mainly just lettuce &amp; ranch.
Sooooo happy to be here again! Our favorite bartender just made the best martini my husband has had in months! Thanks Romone! So happy to see ya again!

The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints especially with the warm bread served at the beginning to the &#34;bottomless&#34; menu that will take an hour to read.   It&#39;s nice that they put the calorie count so you can make &#34;room&#34; for the cheesecake.  By the way, many of the  cheesecakes hover over 1300 calories with the Oreo at 1600! <br><br>If you go all out, run the 1/2 marathon in two days...<br><br>Enjoy.
I just tried the  hibachi steak and avocado rolls...so delicious! Everything else is awesome too. <br>I can&#39;t eat that steak once every two weeks it&#39;s so delicious!!! Yum!

I know we are getting take out during this time BUT come on guys. I ordered pasta carbonara, the noodles were undercooked and this dish had no flavor whatsoever, it&#39;s inedible to say the least. Moving on to the cheesecake did you see it? Cuz I barely can , I saw dollops of whipped cream and a fingers worth of cheesecake . I ordered two other entrees for family they used the same unflavored undercooked noodles and threw wilted basil in it . My daughter ate the chicken and threw out the pasta. Spent $85 on this disaster -truly disappointing. Not going to try again I don&#39;t think.

Absolutely AMAZING! <br>Amazing food and Wonderfully kind staff! Made our experience 100x&#39;s better. I believeeee the waitresses name was monica, but I could be mistaken. Also our wait time was only 4 mins because of the Yelp reservation! I higgghly suggest it on a busy night ! But absolutely wonderful food and cocktails. Flawless night with my 2 favorite people in the world. Good job guys, definitely coming more often. The only downside (which they cannot control) was the parking. Its only  valet when in the lot, but you can park outside (we did). Great evening and great experience. Even when it was busy the waitress always came and asked us how we were doing.

Wrote this review before even opening my bag. Sooooo on top of all of this they give me the wrong cheesecake. Unbelievable. Called the manager who didn&#39;t seem very apologetic at all and he voided my payment but that&#39;s it. Who is going to give me my time and gas back. This place is far from my home and I have nothing to show for it. Ridiculous!

Attention to people who orders a Take-out order.<br>First time ever ordering an online order.<br>I had ordered $160 worth of foods +4 slices of cheesecake. <br>The pickup time was 12:30pm but I had to wait additional 10 min. For my food. <br>The staff delivered food to my car directly and said everything&#39;s in the bag. <br>I trusted the staff, there is no way I can have gone through to check all the bags asking him to wait etc. <br>I left the restaurant and was almost home (20 min. Or so passed), the Cheesecake Factory had called me saying my 4 slices of cheesecake was not picked up.  WHAT?!<br>If I go back then my rest of my foods will get cold and soggy but I had to pickup my cheesecakes since today is my birthday and that was the main reason for today&#39;s order. <br>The whole trip took 1 hour and yes, I had to reheat some of my foods to eat. <br>If my first online order goes this wrong, then I believe there&#39;s a lot of mistakes on online pickup orders.  This needs to be addressed and the staffs needs a huge attention it since now it&#39;s a huge demand.

As usual, there is nice seating in the outside patio.   There were fewer people because of covid and that made it nice.<br><br>Be aware that if you use the suggested gratuity on the bill, you will be tipping  on the tax too.

Last time I was here I opted to get the salmon that my husband got.. well unfortunately this time it just wasn&#39;t as good.. still tasty but not to the point where I would order it again. My husband didn&#39;t really enjoy his jambalaya because the onions and bell peppers were burnt. Management did however take it off the menu. My son LOVED his nachos...  my daughter.. lol.. this girl literally ate the breading off the corn dogs and was done, she&#39;s not a huge fan of meat. <br><br>We also ordered the crab and artichoke dip as an appetizer.. I did not like it.. it tasted like a tuna melt and I&#39;m not a fan of warm tuna.. would not order it again..<br><br> Came to Cheesecake Factory today for brunch for the first time..  it was Easter but we arrived shortly after they opened so there wasn&#39;t a problem with getting seat. We sat on the patio to enjoy the beautiful cali weather. The food was good..  I ordered the jambalaya hash which was surprisingly good.. it had fried eggs, I&#39;ve never been a fan of eggs but it was a good combo. I only wish the hash had a few shrimp to really make it &#34;pop&#34;.  My daughter had the waffle, it was very good.. crispy yet fluffy.. she&#39;s only 4 but was able to devour 3/4 of it.. My son got the brunch combo and hubby and omelette special... they all raved about how delicious the syrup mixed with butter was.  Never thought about Cheesecake Factory for brunch but now I have a new choice.

We had an awesome COVID friendly dinner for my friend Tonya&#39;s birthday. Marcio was an amazing waiter! He was quick, attentive and funny. He even sang Happy Birthday to my friend. We will definitely be back.

The Valet Parking Service is absolutely horrendous . Greedy and disrespectful. Not the best way to start out a visit for a nice meal and dessert with family. <br>Our server was super nice and very helpful to make suggestions for food and drink items. My family&#39;s meals did arrive to the table 7 minutes before mine. Not thrilled about that. <br>The a/c was up way too high. It was really cold in our section. Not only was our table shivering but the others around us were too.<br>To top it off... $4.50 for the thieves outside to hold me keys while I ate. I parked and retrieved my own car. <br>I will continue to patronize The Cheescake Factory, but definitely not this location until they get rid of the parking clowns.

Kelsea P was amazing! We came after a wedding with a party of nine so we had to sit at separate tables. She was so sweet and accommodating with a large party during COVID. She was super helpful and provided amazing service. If you can ever sit in her section you are very lucky!  Thanks Kelsea

Long over due review, but couldn&#39;t come at a better time! I have NEVER had a dish that wasn&#39;t absolutely amazing here! For some reason, this location is better than the rest! I&#39;ve ate at several locations and this one is the best. Food is alway delicious and very generously portioned. They have been running promos lately (I&#39;m assuming cause Covid has affected them) so we&#39;ve been ordering them more often. Everything comes so neatly packed and perfectly prepared. We don&#39;t usually order cheesecake but since they&#39;ve been running promos we have.. O M G! I have never had cheesecake like theirs! I can not stop raving about it and recommending it to everyone! Please, treat yourself or a loved one.. it&#39;s terrible times, splurge, get the pumpkin cheesecake!! Enjoy every bite!! I bet you deserve it. You can thank me later! <br>Our favorite dishes are the herd crusted salmon, miso salmon, the avocado egg rolls, the sliders, the Orange chicken, and all of their pastas, burgers, pizzas, and salads lol!! Carrot cake cheesecake, pumpkin cheesecake and the raspberry lemon cheesecake. <br>Again, never had a dish I didn&#39;t like but these are our usual go tos
Awesome cheesecake with strawberries. The pasta with broccoli was not so good. The noodles were undercooked. The sauce etc was good though.

This is our go to place for a good meal with a stunning view. Always ask for a good marina view, they will do their best to suit you. Their food is great. We love their calamary for appetizer, Pan seared salmon with angel hair pasta for the main course and Red velvet Cheese cake for dessert. You can&#39;t bit that!

We really enjoyed our first meal at a physical restaurant since this whole pandemic started. <br><br>Bree and Pam were our servers and they were phenomenal. Thank you ladies for your exceptional service.

Where do I start we had a wait that was 2 hours and that was due to outside seating so we understood but after sitting at our table we Ordered appetizers which was buffalo wings that was gummy and cold .then ordered our steaks well which came back medium and our potatoes was cold so they took it back and brought it back medium well instead of well potatoes still cold it just seemed like they was overwhelmed and was rushing the food . We didn&#39;t receive no apologies just we will take it back .. By then we was ready to go but we did order a cheesecake to go and that was the only great thing about our date night at the Cheesecake Factory won&#39;t return any time soon

Cheesecake Factory is a classic South Bay favorite! I&#39;ve been coming here with my family for several years. For the most part our visits have always gone well, although I do think they need to invest in a remodel. Some of the seating areas are so tight, I think if they had less booths or redesigned the space it could be made more spacious and modern.<br><br>Pros <br>- food <br>- healthy options <br>- our server was amazing, the hostess wasn&#39;t the nicest <br>- the bread! <br>- location <br>- small self parking area <br>- bar area <br>- so many menu options! <br><br>Cons <br>- if parking is full you must valet<br>- tight space <br>- not too stroller friendly <br>- dated design

The food is always great, the service not so much. <br>It always takes forever for our waiter/waitress to come around.. I understand the food taking long bc it&#39;s being cooked and I&#39;m fine with that..BUT it&#39;s the poor service that keeps me from coming as often as I&#39;d like...<br><br>Btw, I absolutely LOVE their Orrin cheesecake, it&#39;s amazing!

Oh my, this was by far the swankiest cheesecake factory I have ever laid my eyes on. Valet? Check (good thing we walked there). Marina view seating? check. The atmosphere really was glorious. <br><br>I should also mention that our server was attentive, food was on point, and everything was priced the same as a normal Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>We will definitely be back next time we are in the area.

Wanted something lite. Walked over and picked up to go order. These nightmarish food things are allegedly cheeseburger egg rolls. They were cold and awful. The staff was in complete chaos even with very few dining in(outdoors). Had to ask for bread, utensils and butter.  I understand that Covid is throwing things off but it&#39;s been here for awhile. Do better CF.

Quickk and friendly service. No wait if you get there before 6:30 on weekday. The bread is always good there--not and freshly baked. <br><br>Got a house salad and chicken taquitos app. Wife got crusted chicken Romano. Said her noodles weren&#39;t al dente enough and the sauce tasted a little more watery  (maybe the noodles?). <br><br>They&#39;re always solid with a reliable menu.

We ordered food tonight. Had it delivered by door dash. They were timely and no issues there. <br><br>As far as the food we ordered. Wishing and hoping it would have been bas if we were dining there. I highly DO NOT recommend d take out. Not only was the food very mediocre, the portions s were small m!  We ordered 3 entree&#39;s because my husband is 6&#39;8&#34;.. We were very disappointed and realized cooking at home seems to be the way to go. I never post but this experience put both of us realizing it is better to cook and eat at home. Stay safe!

Cheesecake factory is definitely my favorite chain restaurant :) I usually hesitate to write reviews that aren&#39;t for small businesses, but thought eh why the heck not. This is a beautiful location, parking is valet or street.<br><br>Came in on Saturday night and sat at the bar. Service was impeccable, accommodating, and friendly (I forgot to get the name of the bartender but he was such a doll!). Cheesecake factory is known for it&#39;s HUGE menu and HUGE, high calorie entree portions, of COURSE it&#39;s cheesecake, and I am in love with the free bread they give out. Got the ahi tartare ($9) which was TEENY for the price but beautifully presented and delicious, and the eggroll sampler (4 types of egg rolls plus 4 dips, $14) which was SO greasy. <br><br>4 stars for the overall experience :)

This review is for a holiday party in one of the upstairs rooms. We have a gracious client who hosts a party every year and they go all out. Open bar with servers walking around with fried avocado and other appetizers. Dinner is a buffet with roasted turkey, ham and traditional sides. After dinner we trade white elephant gifts, followed by coffee, tea and 2 flavors of cheesecake. Valet parking is included and my favorite part is watching the boats decorated with lights from the large window. I look forward to this party every year.
Great Quality Service . Food was Delicious &amp;&amp; View was Awesome Thank You CCF . I suggest you book a reservation instead of walk-in I&#39;ll save you a little more of time .

I love the cheesecake factory never any complaints except for this time. I ordered the factory chopped salad and it was awful. No flavor and the lettuce was wilted and the salad did not have enough of all the items that were suppose to be in the salad. The server asked how was the salad and I advised him I was not happy . He never once asked if I would like  to get another item or seemed to be concerned. Ithe other food items were fine  I spent quite a lot of money that evening but was unhappy

I use to go to this location back in 2005. Started going back here since it is closer to my job now. Service is still the same though. Waiters are not so attentive. Once you get your food it&#39;s like they vanish. All their Hostess need to be happy and greet customers not just look like they are their for a paycheck. <br><br> <br>The 4 stars is really for the Gluten Free Godiva Chocolate cheesecake. <br><br>Remember to carry cash for the valet!

Came here today for a late lunch (around 2pm).  The perfect time as we were seated immediately at an outdoor table right at the window.   No crowd at this hour, which was lovely.<br><br>Note that during lunch and dinner rush, it is busy and very loud (unless you are seated outside).<br><br>Love the huge menu with so many choices that it&#39;s sometimes difficult to decide what to order.   They also have a skinny menu I usually order from. <br><br>Today we ordered mozzarella cheese sticks and fried zucchini for starters; Asian chicken lettuce wraps; steak tacos; bacon carbonara pasta and <br>Xx.  Also had a skinny margarita.  Each table is served their yummy rye and white bread. <br><br>Valet parking $2.50.<br><br>Can&#39;t wait to go back.

My family has come here for special occasions for years. Staff is always attentive, the restaurant is clean, and everyone always finds something they can eat. <br>We came in a huge group last night and the staff was perfectly efficient, welcoming, and prompt. We can always count on Cheesecake Factory. Thank you! <br><br>Favorites: Cubano Sandwich &amp; Almond Crusted Salmon and Kale Salad.

Whenever I am at The Cheesecake Factory, I have trouble selecting my entree. Their myriad selections and pages filled with lunch specials, pizzas, burgers, pasta, salad and more always get to me take my time and narrow down to what I am craving. I have never tried the burger, so that day, I decided to order a burger. <br><br>This review is based on the two items that I ordered at the restaurant:<br>Macaroni and Cheese Burger (Charbroiled and Topped with Creamy Fried Macaroni and Cheese Balls and Cheddar Cheese Sauce. Served with Lettuce, Tomato, Pickles, Onion and Mayo),<br>Very Cherry Ghirardelli® Chocolate Cheesecake (Cherry Cheesecake on a Layer of Fudge Cake, Loaded with Cherries and Ghirardelli® Chocolate). <br><br>The taste of the Macaroni and Cheese Burger still lingers in my mouth. The cheese perfectly melted over the patty and the macaroni lightly stuffed within. The patty cooked to medium and was very juicy. After I finished my meal, there was a slow hand-clap in my head. It was great. <br><br>The burger comes with a side of fries, but for few dollars more, you can upgrade to sweet potato fries, which I highly recommend. <br><br>The Very Cherry Ghirardelli® Chocolate Cheesecake is now in my Top 3 cheesecake list for The Cheesecake Factory. It tasted much like the Spumoni ice cream from the Old Spaghetti Factory. This would be anyone&#39;s favorite for cherry lovers -- another slow hand-clap in my head.
One of the favorites with a great selection of desserts that are always awesome. The food is very good with a varied menu that has something for everybody&#39;s tastes.

Got my food an hour after I ordered. When I got it the food was cold and soggy. I sent it back &amp; guess what...30 mins later it&#39;s still not ready. The other two people in my party were already done with their food. The manager John was alright and offered me a side salad while I waited, which I kindly said no. He didn&#39;t bother to check on the table until the 30 mins passed. The waitress was sweet but way too slow to be working at this busy of a restaurant. My New Years resolution is not to step foot in this cheesecake location...nothing but terrible service. How hard is it to make a hot sandwich? Won&#39;t be coming back. <br><br>Update: got my food packaged to go and look how many fries they gave me...I&#39;m pissed y&#39;all

Can&#39;t go wrong at Cheesecake Factory. This location is quaint compare to the other locations I have been to. This is right at the marina. Very romantic if you are out on a first date or celebrating a special occasion, this fits the bill. The servers here are very attentive and friendly. My husband and I met up with a friend from Maui and we took her here. We started with appetizer and shared the Avocado Eggroll.  I ordered the Farfalle w/chicken and roasted garlic. Our friend got the Thai Coconut Lime Chicken. I sampled hers and it was delicious. It&#39;s tangy and if you love coconut, like I do, I recommend getting this dish. It&#39;s very flavorful and I admit, I was a bit jealous.  Hubby got the Steak Diane (wonder why the steak is called Diane). I sampled this and it was very rich. If you are a meat lover, this maybe for you. <br><br>I always leave room for dessert. It&#39;s a must. Do what we do. We order one to share and another to go!  We shared the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake and the Vanilla Bean.  The Mango Key Lime is tart but not light. The Vanilla Bean tasted like plain vanilla ice cream. It was good but too plain for me considering all the other flavors. I think our friend was over whelmed and almost felt guilty of all the food that she was eating so she settled for just the Vanilla Bean cause when she tasted the Mango Key Lime, she was all over it.  Sorry, but there is no such thing as diet when you dine here. Get ready to SPLURGE. This location is valet only.

My husband and I eat here 4 times a year or so. We came here Labor Day weekend 2020 During covid. The friendly hostess told us the wait would be 2 hours. We had nothing to do and nowhere to go so we said fine. The called us after an hour and a half. We got seated immediately. Our server came over right away, she was friendly and attentive. Our drinks came out right away. Our food came out very fast. Nice and hot. Enjoyable evening Great food, great job.

Came with some family members for a religious celebration meal, and the food experience was so subpar. The good of that meal was the garlic cheese bread and chicken pasta dish. 3 of us decided to order steaks, and we all ordered medium, but that means extra well done here. The steaks also get marinated in A1 sauce from the night before, which is unmentioned in the menu, so even tho we asked for no salt on one, it was still super salty. My uncle couldn&#39;t tolerate the saltiness, and the waitress was quick to offer a new one and offered a salad while he waited. Unfortunately the second steak they brought out was still salty from brining in A1 from the day before, and was even more cooked/burnt from the first one, to the point that he couldn&#39;t chew it. Again the waitress handled it totally appropriately, and offered him to pick a different dish to go since we couldn&#39;t wait any longer in the restaurant so he switched to a chicken dish. My cousins mashed potatoes also had a large incredibly hard unknown substance buried in it, and they did correct that. <br><br>It was such a bummer that half the group didn&#39;t enjoy their food experience, but I have to say the actual customer service was amazing.

We have been loyal customers of the Cheesecake Factory for years and have NEVER been disappointed.  In these tough times, they have done what they could to survive and they have continued to NOT disappoint.<br>Please support this fine restaurant in anyway that you can until things get back to normal.  We will, all, be glad that they are still there when we can return for a normal, relaxed meal or celebration.

We had an excellent server and the food was wonderful. Great job with social distancing. I think to require people wear mask when entering and until they are seated.  Also, one of the servers nose was completely out of his mask. I thought about saying something to the manager but she was not wearing her mask properly. Cheesecake Factory instruct your employees on how to wear mask<br>Properly and please require the guest to wear mask<br>as well. Thank you, MJ

I went here for my 21st birthday and I don&#39;t think I would come back to be honest. I went on a really busy week because of course my birthday is the same week as graduation week so that was a little bit of a problem. But the food was okay. Nothing to big.  The service really did suck big time. The lady we had kept forgetting to get our refills we had to ask her about 3 times if we could get a drink. She seem like she was too distracted to get us anything. And the alcoholic drinks are not bad either I mean I don&#39;t drink so... to me I considered it really strong since I&#39;m new to it.

Always a good and reliable menu! Great place to celebrate! Big and noisy, fun and good service. My son chose this for the cheesecake, but the food was plentiful and tasty. Located in the scenic Redondo Harbor- it is a beautiful location!

Literally can&#39;t follow simple directions through an ONLINE order. Extra sauce doesn&#39;t mean NO SAUCE. And an order of asparagus..does that sound like green beans to you??? So dumb. And I didn&#39;t even get blue cheese with buffalo blasts. Y&#39;all need to lock it up.

Enjoy this location being right on the water and it has a bit more of a slightly upscale vibe when you pull in bc of the mandatory valet. This location is consistent with their food quality and service. Even with the super extensive list, I normally stick to my norm: white truffle white chocolate cheesecake, both breads (no brainer) Cajun jambalaya, salmon w/peas, or the Jamaican shrimp and chicken w/plantain. Their strawberry martinis are made with fresh strawberries, so it brings a nice balance to the drink that&#39;s not overly sugary. They have a good happy hour too!

This visit was just okay. A was a disappointed. I haven&#39;t been here in over a year so I was really looking forward to it.  Here&#39;s why I gave it 3 stars.<br><br>Pros:)<br>-Friendly server<br>-Food quality was good<br>-Big portions<br><br>Cons:(<br>-We were seated in the round booth with a low back wall near the hostess. A couple of people were standing waiting for their name to be called to be seated, leaning over us while were eating. They&#39;re having their conversation standing over me. <br>They were standing in the dinning area and many servers &amp; the hostesses walked by them and never asked them to move. They were there for over 40mins!<br><br>-My food was cold. Cold mashed potatoes &amp; chicken Madeira &amp; steak Diane. (The food quality was fine, just cold)<br><br>I didn&#39;t send it back because at this point I just wanted to eat and get out. I didn&#39;t even want to stay for dessert and I love cheesecake.<br><br>I will still return because I really do like their food. Next time I&#39;ll make sure to ask NOT to be seated on those booths again and cross my fingers that my food is hot.
Delicious but little expensive for foreigners lol.<br><br>Unfortunately, menu book and so on is sticky so I hate it.
Very clean and organized restaurant, delicious food and dessert, excellent service. Super recommend!<br>I will return to the place whenever possible.
It&#39;s a chain but I won&#39;t lie, I LOVE the salmon, mash and asparagus dish with that creamy lemon sauce. Get extra! If you don&#39;t you&#39;ll wish ya did! Oh and that brown bread..... yummmo!

Another review making me think-- &#34;wow, I really need to go on a diet.&#34; Every bite tastes so good though! I am going all out and giving 5 stars because not only do I really enjoy Cheesecake Factory, this one has a great view of the marina! So why not... I ordered the lunch special chicken piccata with mashed potatoes. There was tons of flavor in the sauce!! The capers tasted amazing. Our appetizer was the sweet corn tamales cakes which I have and always will enjoy!

Update: I did contact use the contact info cited below to express my concerns. I have not heard back. As I said. Please improve on your valet service and their professionalism. <br><br>PLEASE, IMPROVE YOUR VALET SERVICE!<br><br>It is very frustrating to have the valets park your vehicle here because while they&#39;re fast to obtain your keys upon your arrival...it can take a long time for them to retrieve your vehicle after your meal. You stand there in the COLD when you can SEE your car parked 20 feet in front of you. Yet they do not allow you to just take your keys and walk to your car. <br><br>That being said, last week, a friend and I drove up and noticed there was an open spot in the regular lot. I sat in the car to wait for them to move the car ahead of me left for valet so I could drive into the lot. The valet guy KNOCKED HARD on the window of my car to get my attention which was incredibly rude. I pointed that I was going to park in the lot to the right. He motioned for me to get out of the vehicle again. I was so irritated I just drove away and we ate elsewhere. Don&#39;t put your hands on someone else&#39;s property before they&#39;ve given you permission to do so. <br><br>Onto the happy stuff now...<br><br>I have never had a horrible lunch or dinner here. This is mainly because the servers are kind, attentive, anticipate needs well, and actually manage to have individual personalities. <br><br>I love coming with girlfriends, ordering salads to share and all the delicious appetizers we care to taste. <br><br>Many of the appetizers are fried/heavy...but you do not come here looking to restrict your deliciousness. <br><br>I don&#39;t drink, so I never order drinks...but from appetizers, to full meals, brunch, and dessert...there are many, many delicious options to choose from. In a group of 20, everyone can order something entirely different and be equally happy with their choice. Name another restaurant where this would be likely to occur!<br><br>Oh, and to leave out of the part about the view would be silly...if you sit near a window you will enjoy views of the Marina :)

Just to start; they do not take reservations and the wait time can vary from 2-3 hours since I think they only have seating for 10-15 people at a time. I know there are restrictuions and we are in a pandemic, but wait times still aren&#39;t very good. During the pandemic of course indoor seating is unavailable but outdoor seating has umbrellas for shade and heater for warmth. Need a mask to get in and then you can take it off to eat. The waiter was very nice and quick to attend to us. Quick service and great food is the reason for the 2 stars if it was based off the entire experience with wait time included it would be 1 or less stars. I had the Steak dian and Chicken madera it was really good.

The food is typical Cheesecake Factory food...meaning it was awesome.  First time at this location.  It&#39;s very different for a CF layout wise.  There are beautiful views of the boats in the marina.  The staff was very attentive and friendly.  It is not too far from where I lice so<br>I will definitely be here often
Came here with my friend and it was perfect! Haraldo is the worlds BEST WAITER. He&#39;s good at what he does and I hope to have him as my server again when I come back.

It&#39;s probably best to avoid this restaurant during the pandemic because not only their service is slow, they won&#39;t even try to accommodate for the fact that they&#39;re slow. <br>Try ordering from them after the pandemic is over.

Horrible! Let&#39;s just say them cooks and servers need refresh training especially them cooks. I ordered jambalaya like always have for the past 10yrs but this time it was watery greasy and flavorless. When I say gross I mean gross. The service was bad everyone seemed lost and confused. I didn&#39;t get the water I asked 3different severs for and I never got the bread I was told I was getting. On top off not getting all the food I ordered and still got charged for.

This place has the WORST customer service I&#39;ve ever experienced!! Tried calling them to place an order - the rude girl on the phone did not want to help. Ended up placing an order online at 11:30 when they opened, and wasn&#39;t able to place order for immediate pick up, had to schedule it for later in day - only to get a phone call 15 minutes before pick up that our order was cancelled cause they were unable to fulfill. I will NEVER eat at this establishment again!!

If you look at my reviews you can see I am a tough critic. I do not give 5 stars often but darn this place is good! And it is a chain! lol I have lived in this area my entire life and now I get why the cheesecake factory is still here. <br><br>For the record I cannot stand the forced valet parking (Valets damage cars) but I parked on the street and fed a meter and the noise inside is outta control BUT the food and drinks were sublime and the service great! <br><br>We ordered a Burger, Margarita, glass of White, crab bites, carrot cake and pumpkin cheesecake. All but the pumpkin cheesecake where magnificent. The cheesecake was good but needs more spice to me. The bill was great in that it honestly put the tip using the pre-tax total and gave you options of 15-20 percent. <br><br>The location is great- on the water and it is easy to find. The decor is attractive. I LOVE the fact they put the calorie count on their menus. If I were to change anything I would add a few healthy options. Their salads have no protein options, are dull, and most look less healthy than the fried food. And I would also take 25-50 items off the menu-it is excessive and overwhelming for a guest.

Date night with my husband! Absolutely delicious , great environment. Valet parking with a beautiful view of the ocean l. We had the avocado egg rolls they were good and the dipping sauce was different but tasty. My husband and I both ordered Steak and mash potatoes, we waiting about 20 min for food but definitely worth it.

It&#39;s Spring time, beautiful, sunny weather in SoCal. Having lunch outside was the best. Really enjoyed our server. He was attentive and very friendly. Food was amazing and the weather made it even more perfect. I finished my lunch off with a delicious slice of Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. It was so yum! As we left the restaurant, the workers greeted us and wished us a good day. It was so nice of them. Lovely restaurant and atmosphere.

Even though the weather was chilly, we chose to be seated out in the patio. Our waiter was super friendly and helped us chose, since we had questions about flavors and food portions. As always the cheesecake was awesome I&#39;m glad they offer sugar free. (Sugar triggers my migraine). Made my night the perfect date.

I went to Cheesecake Factory and ordered a drink at the bar. The bar tender recommended something assuring me I would love it. We sat down at our table and I tried the drink and I didn&#39;t like it at all. I asked our server if I could switch the drink out for something else and he said I had to ask the bar. I went to the bar and he said I had to ask the server. I went back to our server and he said to ask the bar. I told him I already did and I was told to talk to him again. So he said he was going to bring the manager. Manager comes 10 minutes later and says she can&#39;t give me a refund. Mind you, I never asked for a refund, I just wanted to switch the drink out. The manager finally agrees to switch the drinks out which took another 10 minutes. Over all it took 30 minutes to switch out a drink which should have taken 5 minutes. <br><br>Plus our server, Anthony, is extremely rude and talking down to us as if we aren&#39;t the costumers. Every single person who works here has been rude and disrespectful. 100% would not recommend this location. We were in a group of 12 and I understand that the food won&#39;t come out fast but it shouldn&#39;t take an hour and a half.

We were biking yesterday and thought of stopping by quickly to grab lunch, I think it was around 11 am. We asked the staff (a guy and a girl) what time will the restaurant open. They told us it will be open by 11:30 am (it&#39;s fine, no issues here). We had one more question but they already turned their backs against us before we could even ask! We had to run after them but they still ignored us and went ahead with their traffic/logistics planning. We were really upset with the way we were treated. I don&#39;t want to wish ill to the business but I hope you guys would change this habit, most especially a lot of people nowadays are seeking for an outdoor dining experience and might even ask a lot of questions than we did.

We celebrated with a rehearsal dinner this past weekend. It was nice. Food was good. Cheesecake amazing. Only thing I wish was the clearing of tables. It was buffet style and plates were piling up. <br><br>Overall, it was a beautiful night with family!
Always love food from here. Yes, it maybe a chain but I love eating food from here. Cheesecake is always bomb. Pricey for just a slice though.

We were a group of five at the restaurant. The waiter was rude and inexperienced at the rules of serving during this pandemic. We had reorder mashed potatoes because they were cold. The waiter went to get the new mashed potatoes and stopped by a table talking to other people at a table near to us. Then he walked over with the order. The waiter was told WHY during a pandemic food should go directly to the table ordering and talking over the food is maybe helping to spread germs. He was upset because he did like that he was wrong. The manger came out and was nice but we were done. We ordered a dessert to go and he gave us the wrong one. We paid the bill and left upset. We been going to this and others cheesecakes for many years. Also when we travel we go to other states to eat at Cheesecake Factory this was terrible. And my friend said the service was bad recently when she came. I hope they learn from this post.

Ordered a the New York steak and mash potatoes and Mac and cheese, yes I paid $1 more for the Mac and it was the best decision. I asked for the steak to be medium well done and it was exactly like that they asked me if I wanted A1 sauce and I got it but did not pour any of it on it as it was not needed. The steak had so much flavor the mash potatoes had great flavor and the Mac and cheese was my favorite dish! The Mac &amp; Cheese  was something I will be going back for. The waitress over heard me talking to my friend about my finals and how I was stressing and struggling so when we ordered our dessert she brought it and it said good luck on finals!  It was the sweetest touch and made the entire meal better. D<br><br>My friend ordered fish tacos and those were amazing I tried one and it had a lot of flavor despite the onion. I will say the onion was not over powering so it was a good crunch that added to the plate. <br><br>Will definitely return to this location. <br><br>It was not my first time here but it was the first time ordering steak and I did not regret it.

We went to Cheesecake Factory for my daughter&#39;s 30th birthday.  The food was delicious but the service was terrible.  We asked for more bread and the server said it was in the oven.  After we got our side salad and appetizers we were then told there was no more bread.  Our water was never topped off.  The server was only seen when dropping off our food.  He never came back to see how we were doing.  We asked for mustard and never got it.  And when he did come by he was rude.  2 stars is for the food.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. We are big fans of Cheesecake Factory for many years and have always gotten consistent service and food at multiple locations in CA and other states.  When we moved to the Redondo area, was excited to find one.  Each and everytime we go, it has been disappointing but because we believe everyone can have bad days, we have given them chance after chance. Same on me on wasting my time and money.  We will not return to this location and will make sure my friends and families also do not return.  We want to support business during COVID-19 but the people who work there have no idea how to run a business during this time. They should just remain closed.

Ordered  the crab cakes and the chicken chipotle pasta to go in Redondo Beach CPK.  The food pick up was a bit confusing because staff was unhelpful.  The food was good but the crab cakes are not what they used be.  Now the crab cakes are these round small crab meatballs which were probably frozen and then defrosted and deep fried.  They tasted OK. The pasta was good though.

Sat at the bar the bartender was pleasant and helpful in explaining suggestions for drinks and also wines that would go with my dinner I ordered the steak diet well done the waiter suggest that I get the half of the steak with the chicken great suggestion to chicken was juicy tender and perfectly cooked the mashed potatoes and asparagus were also pleasantly seasoned<br><br>Parking is limited you must have cash in order to pay the valet which is the downside or you need to walk across the street to the hotel and pay four dollars to use their ATM<br><br>I would say this is one of the cleanest friendliest and most professional he ran cheesecake factories that I&#39;ve been to the hostess a polite the managers are helpful the valet people are kind and willing to go the extra mile to make your visit the bar is well kept and professionally ran

I ordered take out and this is the Herb Crusted Salmon with steak Diane. The salmon is supposed to come with a white creamy sauce and it does not, the salmon is actually burned. The steak only has a few pieces... it is very dry as well as the salmon. I&#39;m very disappointed because I always love the food here but this disappointed me.

This Cheesecake Factory in Redondo Beach at the Marina is one of my favorite locations because it offers such amazing views. I recommend a sunset dinner or having lunch sitting outside on the patio enjoying the view of the Marina. <br><br>Tip: <br>Valet Parking is mandatory for this location, which I do not appreciate! They have a large parking lot that can accommodate plenty of free parking to their customers. They could offer a valet service for those who would want it for a fee which I feel would be more appropriate.  <br><br>There is Meter parking in front of the restaurant if you want to go that route.<br><br>THE FOOD: <br><br>*Our server Leyloni G was great. She was very pleasant and came up with some great suggestions. <br><br>Thanksgiving Day Sandwich: This is exactly how I want my next day Thanksgiving sandwich! This sandwich had a perfect amount of Turkey, Cranberry Chutney, Stuffing, and Mayo. Served with either Mashed Potatoes and gravy or Sweet Potatoe Fries. I got Fries! This was delicious!!  A perfect sandwich!<br><br>Skinnylicious Grilled Steak Medallions: This dish was pretty tasty and only 590 Calories. The perfect amount of food.  Fresh Asparagus, Shiitake Mushrooms, Sauteed Cherry Tomatoes, Crusted Croutons, Mashed Potatoes, and Madeira Wine Sauce.<br><br>Cheesecake: It&#39;s what they do best, oh yeah, their whipped cream is to die for. OMG! They have over 30 different types of slices to choose from and they are NOT low on the calories but who cares!! Go run a few miles the next day and enjoy. I am guilty, I have tried almost all of their cheesecakes over the years. But this time around I had the Dulce De Leche. It was fantastic!<br><br>Overall this place has everything to eat. The menu is like a Food Bible.  Plenty of choices and the portions are huge. If you are looking for great comfort food this is your place. You won&#39;t go away hungry.  I would recommend this place! Enjoy.

Ruined our Father&#39;s Day dinner. <br>1. We went through the entire online ordering process, only to receive a message, at checkout, that online ordering was unavailable. <br>2. Exited to try again &amp; received message on first page. <br>3. Tried phoning, as website advised, and for 35 minutes the line was busy. <br>4. We finally got a recorded message telling us to press 1 for reservations or pick-up, but once we did, we got the busy signal again. Door Dash made no mention that online ordering was unavailable.<br>5. Google info indicated it was open for pickup and curbside. We can&#39;t eat in due to an immuno-compromised daughter. Dad had been looking forward to cheesecake as a Father&#39;s Day treat. <br><br>Their google entry and website should have given notice days ago they weren&#39;t taking orders by phone or online, since they are a popular spot for occasions. No consideration for customers. I would give 0 stars, if I could.

Every time we come here we get the WORST service. The waiters always forget about us, we have to ask for the bread &amp; somethings always  wrong with the bill. We come here often because the food is great but dam the service sucks. Please get it roge

Love the Cheesecake Factory! I always go to the Cheesecake Factory for my birthday and any kind of special event. This was my second time at this location and my first time going during the day. We went around 11am on a Sunday and it was pretty busy but we were still seated within 10 minutes. We lucked out and got a seat near the window and could look out onto the dock. The lighting was also perfect for food photos.<br><br>I always order the spicy chipotle chicken pasta, hands down my favorite pasta from anywhere. It is perfectly creamy and savory and the asparagus and chip pieces on top provide the perfect crunchy texture. I got this in the lunch size (about 1/4 smaller than the dinner size) and it was perfect.<br><br>My boyfriend got the chicken Parmesan pizza style which is basically a pizza with a chicken crust and tomato sauce on top with cheese and angel hair pasta. The chicken crust was pretty good on the edges, but things were a little mushy towards the center.<br><br>His parents got the miso salmon (dinner size) and chicken piccata (lunch size). The miso salmon looked (and tasted) amazing! I was pleasantly surprised. It consists of a miso glazed salmon on top of a bed of white or brown rice, surrounded by snowpeas and miso butter. Highly recommend.<br>The chicken piccata comes with sauteed chicken breast, lemon sauce, angel hair pasta, mushrooms and capers. This dish was also pretty good - I really liked the lemon sauce. <br><br>For dessert, I ordered a slice of the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake and it was delicious! A little sticky from the caramel but it wasn&#39;t super sweet since it had a macadamia nuts in it. But I loved the crunch from the nuts and the white chocolate paired so perfectly with it. I think this might be my new favorite cheesecake!

I was there this pass weekend! 6-13-61<br>This place is just living up on its name! Thai chicken wraps, some of the lettuce was brown! My basil spaghetti dry and cold, the service was very slow, while we waited to give our order the employees were socializing among each other just like filling around, I have been to this place about 10 times, but this last experience was very bad! So sad because I like this restaurant but also their tables, chairs , ac vents are getting old!

We went to this branch with two visiting guests and former classmates of my wife. We were a big group. I had the fish and chips and this was the worst I&#39;ve ever had compared to other restaurants. The fish sizes were very uneven and the four pieces should have been counted only as two pieces considering that they were minuscule. In addition, the fish was oily with not much flavor. It tasted like it had been in the freezer beyond its useful date. The fries it came with were bland and also tasteless.<br><br>The parking is valet only. I never use valet parking for security reasons and not having self-parking is a big negative for me being disabled. I had to look for parking on the main road and had to walk quite a distance back to the restaurant.

To start off, I&#39;ve been coming to this Cheesecake Factory since the early 90&#39;s and have always been quite pleased with the service and food. Last night was a different story....<br>The 4 of us arrived at 5:30pm because we were going to a movie afterwards at 7:30pm. On any other given night, 2 hours would have been plenty of time. We sat in the bar as there was no wait. Our server greeted us quickly and took our drink orders. No issues.<br>Then he disappeared for about 20 minutes. He finally came back to take our order. It&#39;s now 5:50pm. At 6:15pm we see our waiter and ask him to please check on our food. He comes back about 5 minutes later saying they had an issue in the kitchen but our food will be coming out soon. He even mentioned that his manager gave him the ok to give us cheesecake. Ok....I&#39;m ok with this.<br>About 15 minutes later, the manager comes to our table to say that there was a computer screen glitch and tables whose orders were on this screen were lost so they had to re-enter the orders but food would be out soon and they were very sorry for the wait. We accept this as we know things happen but also let her know that we have a movie at 7:30pm. About 5 minutes later, our food arrived........or I should say 3 out of 4 entrees arrived. We figured the last entrée would come soon so the 3 of us who had food did not start eating. After 10 minutes and no sign of our waiter again, I got up to go and look for someone. I found many of the servers standing at the bar having conversations. I found our server in the mix and asked him to please check on our 4th entrée as we only received 3 about 10 minutes ago. He looks at me a little perturbed and asks another server if they can check on our 4th entrée, orange chicken, because new customers arrived in the bar area that he needed to go greet and give menus to. I thought this was a bit rude. I go back to my table and two minutes later, the 4th entrée arrives. So now it is 6:47pm.<br>We eat......we give up on the movie and just decide to have a relaxed dessert and coffee after our dinner. Once again, our waiter is nowhere to be found. Oh wait, he&#39;s at the bar again shooting the breeze with his fellow coworkers. I wave him down so we can get cheesecake menus. He brings one for the 4 of us. Another 10 minutes later he takes our order. We all order a slice each and request them in a to-go box because we never finish the whole slice. I also request no extra whip cream. We order 3 coffees as well. The cheesecake all comes out nicely, although mine had the extra whip cream......grrrrrr.....<br>Our server says a new pot of coffee is being brewed so it will be out soon. Waiting, waiting...........all done with cheesecake. One of my friends finished hers just waiting. Coffee finally comes out when we are no longer eating. We take a couple of sips and our server brings our check. 5 minutes later, he comes back and asks if he left us our check.<br>I say yes but the cheesecake is still on the bill. He says what? And I remind him that due to our 45 minute wait for food, his manager offered us cheesecake. So he takes the check and removes one cheesecake. We look over the check again and look at that! Now there are 5 entrees on the bill even though we only ordered 4........I show it to our server again and now he looks irritated. Sorry bud, we are the ones that are irritated. In the end, this whole dinner took 2 hours and 45 minutes!! <br>I am thinking this was just one bad night and I hope I&#39;m right.<br>The table next to us changed patrons 3 times during our one seating.<br>I give 2 stars for the food and cheesecake which is always good but service was poo-poo!

Date night with the  was great. This Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorites. We sat my the window over looking the Marina. It was dark but you could still see all the boats. The waitress was great, service was great. Food was delicious. The pineapple Mojito was delicious too. Please see pictures. Will be returning sooner then later.

I love Cheesecake Factory but today was just horrible the  seating was by far the worst, imagine having ac blasted on you and your food the entire time you&#39;re there and yes when they finally bring the manager to talk to you so she can turn off the ac you already told your server to take your steak plate away because it was just too cold to eat and I had to ask over and over again and say my food is getting cold. Well the ac was finally off five minutes before I actually got the bill ... I didn&#39;t even want to talk to the manager I just wanted the ac off .

THE WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. I came on a Wednesday night around 8:20pm....waited 20 minutes before I was seated which wasn&#39;t bad BUT I waited additional 40 minutes for our entree to arrive and other people that came after us got their food! <br><br>I got the shrimp scampi and steak Diane. The steak had no flavor and the shrimp was burnt! How can you present that to your customer knowing it looks like that?! I have never had a bad experience with Cheesecake Factory and because of this....I will never dine here again. Not to mention the Manager still gave us the bill to pay for our appetizer even though they messed up on both our entree.

How can a restaurant have such delicious food that has tasted the same for over two decades?! We regular order To Go food supporting our local restaurants and their staff that needs to continue getting a paycheck due to Covid. Our favorite dishes which are enough to feed an army? Louisiana Chicken Pasta ( rich but delish!), Avocado Egg Rolls ( the sauce makes these!), any of the chicken dishes ( Marsala etc...), Steak Diane ( perfectly cooked every time), The Habachi Steak is also great. The Jambalaya Pasta also a favorite. Great sides. Can&#39;t go wrong and we always have leftovers for snacking the next day. Our only complaint is the phone hold before placing the order. If they just let whoever places these orders answer the phone without transferring it or holding, they would have more people ordering. We have friends who won&#39;t order because of this. But it&#39;s hit or miss and worth the wait for us because we love the food. Best to pick up over delivery in our opinion too as they deliver through a third party.

Went with friends, and we had a blast. Our server Michael made our evening enjoyable and he was very patient with our orders because we were a big bunch so thank you Michael. I ordered the Old fashioned burger with fries. Normally I eat half, but today I was hungry and I ate the whole thing so yummy! My friends ordered some appetizers- Avocado Egg rolls &amp; also the Buffalo Blast. Wow! These flavors are yummy! We sat in the patio and you have a beautiful view of the docks of the boats still very pretty and in such nice weather. Definitely coming back here when I&#39;m in the area. Even the hostess who seated us was nice. I didn&#39;t get a name but I&#39;m assuming the entire staff at fantastic!

Ordered dinner through DoorDash and while the delivery was definitely five stars, TCF is worth zero stars. <br><br>- Eggroll Sampler Platter - several were crumbled in pieces which made them no longer finger food and extremely messy. <br><br>- Porkbelly Sliders - the meat was so dry it was like eating jerky. I rinsed the meat off and gave it to my dog. <br><br>- Everything Flatbread - the only saving grace. <br><br>- Salted Caramel Cheesecake - ever so gently placed into the container AFTER they broke the piece in half and flipped it on its side. Genius people. How about just get a new piece?<br><br>Definitely wouldn&#39;t recommend. Here comes the standard response or none at all...

Never will i ever go back to another cheesecake factory after this experience. Wish i could select 0 stars. <br><br>Ordered and paid on line at around 12:20. Online said my food will be ready by 12:52. Started walking over from my dads boat at 12:50. Short walk. Had to wait in a long line to find out i have to wait for a text message telling me my food is ready. Waited an HOUR. Yes, almost 2pn. Asked a young woman out side where is my food, it&#39;s been an hour. Talked to a guy standing near by and asked how long he&#39;d been waiting. He said he&#39;d been waiting since 11 after they lost his order. After that i&#39;d had enough, asked the young woman how i get a refund because i&#39;m not waiting anymore. She said i&#39;d gave to go and talk to the manager. To me, that would probably take another hour and it was not worth it to me. Walked away in disgust at them being completely unprepared and understaffed. Ate the $20 i paid for food i never got. 20-30 minutes later i get a text. By that time i was already eating somewhere elses food.

I came here with coworkers during lunch on Friday, which turned out to be a great time to come. It has been a while since I have come to this particular Cheesecake Factory because it is extremely busy in the evenings and on the weekends. <br><br>Their location is great, right next to the marina. They have limited free, self parking. The rest of the parking lot is valet, which costs $2.50. <br><br>The food portions are still big. I ordered the Asian Chicken Salad off their Skinnilicious menu, which is a nice alternative. This menu offers meals that are fewer in calories than the regular menu. It was a pretty large salad; I couldn&#39;t eat it all. Yet, I still ordered dessert, the Coffee and Cream Chocolate Cheesecake. When you are the Cheesecake Factory, it does not make sense not to order a cheesecake.

We&#39;ve been coming to this restaurant for years. Everything has always been great...up until now. In August, for my moms birthday, she craved Cheesecake Factory. We bought $270 worth of food plus her whole cheesecake. We went to pick up food. Got home and realized tons of the food were missing. We don&#39;t live as close so it wasn&#39;t easy to just return, especially if it&#39;s for a birthday. They even missed her whole cheesecake which was going to be her &#34;cake.&#34; I called the manager and she refunded me $ and also sent me a gift card. Yesterday, my friend and I, go and have lunch. Friend ordered a $40 plate of steak, medium rare. Steak gets there and it&#39;s well done. They take it back to remake it. 40 min after, still no food. Finally, my friend got up to let them know to cancel the meal. Sad to see this place has gone down.
I love this place great food good service even in the midst of this covid 19 they come through with great service.

WORST SERVICE EVER.<br><br>Been coming here for years and have never had any bad experience whatsoever until recently. I was here about a week ago I believe it was Tuesday 8/20/19<br><br>Server name was &#34;axle&#34; or some sh*t like that probably his stage name <br><br>HE FORGOT TO PUT IN OUR ORDER. Waited for over 45 minutes without food. The people that sat behind us that came way after got their food first. And when I looked up to see the server and saw that the runner had dropped off the food at the table behind us first, he knew he screwed up.<br><br>He had to call over his manager MEGAN I believe her name was, to come and explain what happened for him. He didn&#39;t have the balls to even come check on us or apologize. <br><br>My bf wanted to stay of course he was hungry and the manager promised they would make our food priority. I got my food first and my bf was still unfortunately waiting.. <br><br>He finally got his food. Now check this out..<br><br>To make this situation even worse, THE FOOD HAD CHEESE IN THE SALAD AFTER MY BF TOLD THEM HE WAS ALLERGIC TO DAIRY! My bf ate the salad almost complete and the cheese was buried at the bottom of the plate. We explained many times in the beginning that my bf couldn&#39;t have dairy. <br><br>Well whatdayaknow, they F*cked up yet again! Now my bf is pisssst. So he himself calls the manager out.
