MEGAN now comes back for the second time to the scene you know &#34;apologizing and this and that&#34; what manager&#39;s do (the only thing they can do) to butter you up once they&#39;ve f*cked up. <br><br>Im giving this a 1 Star  only because the manager did everything in her power to talk us up and trying to make us feel good in the end and I give her credit for that.. she felt so bad she ended up comping our food (she mentioned the food was free with the exception of tip to be given) we can care less for free food we weren&#39;t there for that, it was a beautiful day that was ruined by simple orders and instructions..simple job that had to be done. MY BF WAS NICE ENOUGH TO STILL TIP THESE ID*OTS AND GAVE IT DIRECTLY TO THE MANAGER) lol <br><br>The clueless server came back in the end. ALL LATE .. acting sympathetic like he cared but I didn&#39;t see him throughout the whole time. The conversation ended awkward cus after that he just walked off like nothing. .. WHATEVER

This Cheesecake Factory has the best views of Redondo Beach marina, the patio seating we were seated had a even better view on the water and a very relaxing vibe.  <br><br>I have always liked The Cheesecake Factory even though I don&#39;t usually order their cheesecakes. I liked the new snacks and small plates menu along with the new specialties. We ordered a few small plates to sample like chicken nuggets, edamame, skinnylicious salmon roll and Korean spicy cauliflower, they were very comforting and flavorful. Hubby had carne asada steak medallions, they overcooked it the first time but the second time was done right that hubby liked his steak so much. When it comes to The Cheesecake Factory, I don&#39;t think about calories and sodium, just love their signature rich flavors. <br><br>We shared a bottle of Prosecco, food and drinks were great paring, our server was very attentive and friendly, it was a perfect Monday late lunch for hubby and I. We will come to this Cheesecake Factory often, it&#39;s actually the closest location to me too.

I came here on a Sunday around 5 pm with 3 people and we were seated immediately!! We were served fresh bread and butter when seated which was delicious!! I ordered the truffle honey fried chicken, mashed potatoes and asparagus! It was amazing! The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside! Valet parking is $4.50 but there is metered parking on the street. This location has great views of the Redondo Beach Marina!!

I been coming to this location for years because I love the service and food but this time around they disappointed me really bad. I got there at 12:55 and requested a table at the back of the restaurant not on the front of the entrance of the restaurant because I have a 1 year old daughter and I feel more comfortable at the back area and they said it would be 1 hour wait I don&#39;t mind the wait as long as I got the tables at the back. When they text me that my table is ready, the guys said &#34;I know you requested the patio tables at the back but at the moment I have the from tables&#34; are you serious .!??? I clearly said I don&#39;t mind the wait and you call me and tell me you have the front open. I said  told him I requested the back because of my child and how much longer the wait would be for the back and he said another 30 minutes. That&#39;s unbelievable, I said it was fine my daughter was hungry and we had already waited over 1 hour .!!!! When I got seated the waitress said would you like to order but we had no menus, I said we don&#39;t have menus and she said &#34;oh it&#39;s on our website you can check on your phone because we want to do contactless with the menus&#34; but yet everyone else had a menu. I understand and don&#39;t mind looking on my phone for the menu but they should let me know at the from when I first came in to check in. There are very disorganized and have no control of the people waiting outside. They should NOT let them sit so close to us if they are waiting!! That&#39;s why they text them the table is ready, literally they are all waiting around where we sit to eat. That not 6 feet distance !! Not the tables were 6 feet apart. It makes me sad to say this but this will be the last time I come back, they are very unprofessional and very disorganized!!!

If i could leave a negative 5 stars I would.  This is the second time I&#39;ve come to this location. And had horrible service. And both times the manager Erin Fish provided even worse management service.  She gave excuses as to why her server was performing so poorly.  I will never come to this location again.  The server Caroline performed horribly

If I could give no stars I would. I had the worst experience ever here on Saturday, January 4th, 2020 @ 10:25 pm. A friend and I went to dinner to have dinner. When we were seated it took a good 15 minutes before our server finally came over. He took our order for water and bread. But before he walked off I informed him that I was ready to order. So I placed my order. I order the Thai Coconut-Lime Chicken with extra onions, no cashews, no mangos, and no coconut flakes. Then I wanted to order a Santa Fe Chicken Salad CHOPPED with Balsamic Vinaigrette. But something said no order it for here then just pack it yourself. So I did. My friend didn&#39;t want anything. So he leaves then comes back 10-15 minutes later with our water and bread. Now he only bought us the wheat bread. I let that go. Then about 10 minutes later out comes my food with him and another server (a girl). The Thai Coconut-Lime Chicken had a piece of pasta on the plate (hints cross contamination). Then I see my salad. It was not chopped and had the four slices of tomatoes around it (as pictured on the websites menu page) looked awesome, but not what I had asked for. So I said it&#39;s not chopped, the girl server said yes it is, I said it&#39;s not and the tomatoes are still whole. She then says well that&#39;s just for garnishment on the plate. I said I understand that but I wanted it all chopped together. She said it&#39;s chopped, then put down the plate and walked off with the worst attitude ever. At this point I called her a rude bitch. My original server said I will remove the tomatoes. I said ok but it&#39;s still not chopped like I asked. He was so confused and I said I would like it chopped finer then this, he still couldn&#39;t understand what I was requesting. So then he said let me get the manager. I said yes please do. So the manager comes over introduce herself (I forgot her name, but nice lady) I explain to her and show her both of my meals and the issues. She didn&#39;t seem to cate to much about what was going on with the Thai Coconut-Lime Chicken with pasta that doesn&#39;t come with pasta. She was more focused on the salad and she too couldn&#39;t understand what I meant by chopped. She asked what do mean chopped? This is our chopped. I said no it&#39;s not. I informed her how I was just there on December 12th, 2019 to celebrate my 40th birthday and had no issues when ordering this same salad the same way. She then said well I can see if the chief chopped it the last time and if they have the work space to do it. I said you know what it&#39;s ok. I&#39;m good because I can&#39;t understand how no one can&#39;t comprehend chopped or chopped finer. She apologized and I told her I can&#39;t understand what&#39;s do hard about chopped. She then said again this is our chopped, the salad is prepared daily in the morning, I said it can&#39;t be because you don&#39;t offer this salad chopped and if it&#39;s prepared in the morning that means they didn&#39;t do like I requested. So then I just told her at this point I&#39;m not even hungry and I&#39;m not trying to be rude or disruptive or cause a seen. So I don&#39;t want anything. She then said well I hate to waste this food I&#39;m trying to help you. And was very apologetic, and I told her I hate to waste it too, but I&#39;m no longer hungry and I&#39;m not gonna pay for something I&#39;m not gonna eat. She said I&#39;ll take care of it. Then I started to explain to her why I request this salad chopped. It&#39;s for health reasons. I then told her again when I was here just weeks ago I didn&#39;t have to do all of this. When I go to the one in Marina Del Rey I have no problems. She said I just really hate to waste this food. I said you know what I can feed someone I see. I&#39;ll take it and give it away. So she left and packed the food up and I left. <br><br>Now as I&#39;m walking out it&#39;s like 4 other groups of families complaining about their service. I was like tonight was just not a good night to come here. A lady outside smoking said no it was the worst experience ever tonight. And my friend and I was like ok it wasn&#39;t just you. It was bad all around with different servers.

Disappointing experience at an establishment that should have better systems in place in case something goes awry. <br>Food was as expected (not mind blowing, 3 of 4 items edible) but management lacked the necessary experience to make things right.

Even though they offer &#39;lunch&#39; sized portions, they manage to fill you up to the point of being stuffed!<br>We dropped in for lunch. Enjoyed the patio although with the sun in the afternoon, it would be nice if the glass walls could be lowered to enjoy the breeze.<br>The Sheppard&#39;s Pie had a tasty topping of taters and the meat and vegetables hidden below were hot and tender. The bad news was they seriously lacked seasoning.<br>The almond crusted salmon was cooked nicely with good flavours. A good size portion with tons of salad underneath.<br>I enjoyed the clam chowder although it was a bit on the salty side.<br>Sadly we were too stuffed to be able to cram in a piece of cheese cake!

Went here for the first time on my birthday. I had a great time. There was a lovely view of the beach. There menu was very impressive with lots to choose from. Overall a great experience. Ended my night with a tiramisu cheesecake. Will be coming here again!

My hubby, friend, and I just got back from dinner at this place. The experience was very lackluster. I&#39;m happy I had a gift card because that&#39;s honestly the only thing that prompted us to go. I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo thinking nothing could go wrong with a simple garlic/Parmesan/cream sauce. BOY WAS I WRONG. This pasta dish had no flavor to it and literally tasted like water with pasta. I tried putting salt but the shaker on the table wouldn&#39;t dispense any even though it was full?? The waiter kindly took off the plate and the manager came to talk to me about what was wrong. She was surprised I didn&#39;t like it because it was one of their most popular items. Anyway, my previous visits have been way better than tonight&#39;s and I wish I could remember what I used to order because it&#39;s been awhile since I dined here. Probably won&#39;t be back.

My husband, myself and my 2 daughters decided to get out for lunch today and chose the Cheesecake Factory in Cerritos. Nice patio area and with an hour wait time they allowed me to put my name on the list before even getting there, so that was nice. NOW!!! once we were seated is when everything changed, our server was really nice but not the best at her job. Our bread was cold (both times) so cold that the butter was too hard to melt on it. I ordered a diet coke, my husband a regular coke only for her to get to the table both times and forget which was what so we had to do our own taste test to figure it out. At that point I decided to drink the water only. She didn&#39;t know the difference between thousand island and blue cheese (which my husband hates blue cheese) and that was mixed in his salad. She said she asked the kitchen and they told her it was thousand island ‍ We asked for the Manager Marsella who was very apologetic and did her best to make the rest of our visit a little better. Thankful for her being on top of our food and order and taking over!!!! Not sure if I will be back anytime soon, but she deserves 5 stars.

I love the Cheesecake Factory!  Their cheesecake is my absolute favorite, and I eat it regularly.  However, the food at this location has continued to decline.  (Other Cheesecake Factories have not had this decline.)<br><br>Recent Complaints during several different meals (We used to dine here regularly until now):<br><br>1. I had a rubber band in my food.  The manager came over and said that the rubber band was from the cilantro, and it accidentally made it&#39;s way into my food.  He apologized, but did not offer us any compensation.  I was on a lovely date with my hubby and did not want to cause an issue, so I held my tongue until now.  I literally had to pull a purple rubber band out of my mouth and wasn&#39;t even offered a dessert.<br><br>2. My artichoke had paper in it that said artichoke.  The waitress comped this without us having to ask.  This made me lose my appetite. <br><br>3. My miso salmon, which I usually love, was overcooked.  It still tasted good enough, so I did not complain.  I was on another date with my hubby, and wanted to just enjoy my evening with him.<br><br>4. Today my cheesecake had paper in it.  I pulled it out of my mouth, unrolled it, and discussed it with my server.  She apologized and said that the cakes come with this paper to separate the cheesecakes.  I did not make a deal about it.<br><br>5. My salad today had almost no chicken.  I thought the kitchen forgot the chicken.  I was showing our server that they forgot the chicken, when I finally spotted a piece after moving the salad at least 5-6 times searching for chicken with my fork.  She had the manager give us more chicken.  The rest of the salad was seriously lacking in ingredients.  There was a skimpy amount of corn, beans and cheese.  We just ate at the Pasadena location twice, and their Santa Fe salad was amazing.  I don&#39;t like paying $16 for lettuce.<br><br>I still LOVE their cheesecakes, but this location has lost my business until they CLEAN up their act.  I don&#39;t appreciate finding rubber bands and paper in my food on a somewhat regular basis.  I was only offered something to make up for these faux pas 1/3 times I found foreign objects in my food.  This location is skimpy on their ingredients.<br><br>The cheesecake is still AMAZING =).  The new Celebration Cheesecake is yummy and fun!  The view is very pleasant, ocean and sailboats.

If I were asked what my last meal would be, the Chicken Marsala from The Cheesecake Factory would definitely be it. There is a huge variety of food options here. Yet, I find myself ordering the same thing each time. Lol If you love mushrooms and chicken, you should try it out. The nice thing too is that when you get seated and before your meal comes, they give you bread and butter. Between the white and wheat bread they give, I would say that I am drawn to the wheat bread more because it is softer and has good flavor. The ambiance is nice. This is a place that you can go dressed up or go casual. The cheesecakes are good and I end up getting the Vanilla Bean cheesecake because it&#39;s not too rich and just right for me. Not to mention, their whip cream is fresh. I will definitely be going here again.

Bad service. The manager was so racist with my and my friends and that&#39;s not fear, also we been waiting for 3 hours to be seating and we had a reservation, everyone was super mean except Ryan, he is really nice!!!
Food is great birthday song resounds through the halls. buy why do the have to charge $4.00 for a $,10 cent soda drink don&#39;t they make enough off everything else?
Always hits the spot. Brown bread + chicken Madeira + vanilla bean cheesecake... you will not be disappointed. Oh and the view doesnt hurt either! Most of the time there is a wait tho!

First of all, the food and service was great! I would give the restaurant itself a 5 star. There was plenty of seating for everyone and we got sat right away and everything was delicious! <br>BUT..... pulling up and only having Valet parking available and basically being told to get out and not even have an option was kind of rude. <br>AND....it&#39;s cash only <br>AND.... the only place to get cash is at an ATM in the hotel next door and that charged $5!

It was my first time going to that Cheesecake Factory location. It was really different from other locations that I been too. It was on my birthday. I would say I had the best service a customer could have. Our waitress was so attentive and worked really hard. The food was good.  I would say everyone was satisfied with their order.

Came to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate a birthday. I was very pleasantly surprised to be seated quickly in a party of 4. My waitress Lidia was really sweet and attentive to my table. The food came out very quickly. Everything tasted absolutely delicious. I am happy to say that it is always a pleasure to come here and make Epic memories with friends. Thank you for the great experience and until next time.
Well we all know cheesecake factory .. Amazing food AND DESSERTS!<br>This location has a great friendly and hard workers <br>The place looks to be organized and well managed !!
Great food. Service is good. Menu is deep. Parking is valet. The place is always busy.

This is a very nice Cheesecake Factory. We always sit in the patio because it&#39;s beautiful. The service is normally a solid 7/10 everyone is kind and does their job but no one goes above and beyond. I ordered the Combination Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane, my sister ordered the Shrimp Scampi and herb crusted salmon, my mom ordered some type of steak. All the meals were very good and the presentation was also great. <br>I don&#39;t have much to say about this Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s pretty much exactly what you&#39;d expect from a Cheesecake Factory.

Parking is valet so be prepared but you can opt to do self parking. I prefer valet.<br>Service: from the host to our server it was just perfect very attentive we sat in the patio area but still received excellent service. <br>Food/drinks food was just amazing and let&#39;s not talk about the ditty martinis , they were the right amount of dirty. Lol<br>Like I said we sat in the patio area and the ocean breeze and sunset were just perfect for a great dinner will definitely be going back.

I came here with a large group for a birthday party. We got a table outside and enjoyed the weather. It wasn&#39;t too busy as we came midday midweek. It was an enjoyable experience as it was wasn&#39;t that crowded and our waitress was attentive. Of course, the sourdough bread is always a favorite! I got the bistro shrimp pasta. I guess I should have asked more questions about it, but I didn&#39;t think too much of it since it was a popular dish. The pasta was very oily at the bottom, and it was getting a bit too salty for me to finish off the dish. I also wish the shrimp wasn&#39;t so battered. Overall good experience but I&#39;ll order something else next time.  <br><br>Anything to suggest?

Just ordered miso salmon to go and this is the worst miso salmon I have ever had from Cheesecake Factory. The one from Pasadena location is always very tasty but the one from Redondo beach location tasted no flavor at all. You can obviously tell they forgot to put miso when they cooked it. Miso flavor didn&#39;t go into salmon at all. Spent $18+ for nasty salmon.

Been to the Redondo beach location<br>Couple times over the last 2 months<br>Extremely disappointed, took 45 minutes<br>To get our food, once received was cold.<br>After about 10-15 minutes was finally able<br>To get the attention of our waitress.  Took<br>The order back, manager came over to<br>Apologize, said your order will be up shortly <br>30 minutes later we finally got it, and yes<br>Still Luke warm.   This location needs a<br>Serious overhaul on customer service<br>And perhaps a little better training for<br>Their waitresses.  Very disappointing <br>With the prices they charge and the<br>Lack luster service.
Came to celebrate my hubby bday  anthony v our server did great host n the team satiefied made his day special will be bak soon

I have had terrible experiences and terrible service at this location and I thought I would give it a second chance so I ordered the fish and chips to go and it was not fried through they were mushy and disgusting very disappointed

We ate at the bar and had a wonderful experience. Humberto provided excellent customer service and made fantastic drinks. We had whiskey &amp; Ginger and Top shelf margaritas. The food was fantastic too. If you don&#39;t want to wait for seating,I recommend eating at the bar with Humberto.

The food was good like always. You can count on consistency at the Cheesecake Factory. Our appetizer came out at the same time as our food, coldish cheese dip with the pretzel. The first waitress was amazing, short hair, attentive and then we got a switch, that&#39;s when things went downhill. The takeover waitress was quiet, almost shy and slow, not good for the service industry.
The location was amazing, they also offer valet parking. The view is great. The food was fresh and dessert was delicious. Very big portions for the price your paying at such a beautiful location!

My boyfriend and I came here for lunch. We normally go to the one located in marina del rey, but decided to come here because we were in the neighborhood. It was nice weather so we decided to sit outside. Our server was Darlene, and she was amazing! We both ordered the shrimp scampi and steak diane and we absolutely loved our food!! Neither one of us eat cheesecake so we ordered the godiva brownie sundae and it was delicious! Love the chocolate candy that comes with the sundae and the flavor was so rich and the almonds went very well w/the fudge, ice cream, and whip cream. Overall we had a gr<br>eat experience and will definitely be back.

Had a decent experience here.<br>Came on Saturday with my boyfriend and the service was good. We got our food pretty quickly and the experience was good. I don&#39;t why but it wasn&#39;t amazing.. that is the reason I&#39;m giving 4 stars

I came here with family for a early dinner. We ate in the bar. They have a happy hour menu and you can get the full menu too. We shared a few things off the happy hour menu. The slider were great as we&#39;re the chicken sandwich they come with the toppings on the side. The restaurant looks over the harbor was that&#39;s very nice.
Never disappointed here.!!!!! Calamari and a cocktail on this early am visit. Keep up the good work everyone!!!!!

Overpriced, understaffed.  Our large group booked the upper room and we were unable to get table service for wine and cocktails.  Trying to get two glasses of wine for my wife and I proved to be impossible without us both having to go down stairs.  I will not book this venue again.

Very disappointed. Waited over 40 minutes yesterday for my takeout order after i was told it was gonna be 20 minutes. And after almost walking out without the cheesecake i paid for i get home not even thinking to check if they gave me the correct dessert. So the next day I&#39;m very excited to eat my dessert and it&#39;s nothing that I&#39;ve ever asked for. I&#39;m so pissed. Never eating here again. Calling when they open to ask to be compensated because this is ridiculous.

We wait for an hour due to covid, have a group of 8 with two kids so total 10. Of course we understand the wait but making us sit separately....as a table of 10 is sitting across the way....you couldn&#39;t have given us a time for a bigger table to become available.
They have awesome food and a great upstairs space for medium size parties.

Took my wife&#39;s family from Mexico here the staff was really kind and made the environment really great all of our food was cooked to perfection  no complaints on our side will def be back for a date night with the wife!
Service is great and of course the cheesecake as well. But food is super overpriced for what it is. I think I&#39;ll continue going only for cheesecake and drinks.

We arrived at 1:30 and was able to sit anywhere we would to in the bar section. <br><br>Long story short, recommendations from our server Erin were good. Although it was super busy , every table around us got bread and we never got ours ! Also, never got straws with our drinks unless asked, and other tables drinks came with straws with their drinks . ..<br><br>Mimosas was pretty good. <br>Food was good<br><br>Bathroom was messy.

The server Ryan is super professional and the food was amazing. Ryan made recommendations and kept checking on us. The manager came over and spoke with us as well. I love that they were playing Christmas music and regular music. Every time was working together to make sure the experience was great. He was great couldn&#39;t ask for a better server. This was our second time here. This may be our new CF over Marina.
It&#39;s a great location ,food is good ,staff is iffy at best ,tables are too close to each other ,next table you fell is right on top of u
Extremely bad service, didn&#39;t even stay there. They wouldn&#39;t let my group stay in the same table. Really don&#39;t feel like coming back!!!

Hubby and i come here often. Food is ALWAYS good and the service is impeccable. A little pricy for the quality, but still worth it. The obvious star here being the vast array of cheescakes! Try the Godiva if you absolutely love chocolate!

Paolo made the experience so much better. He&#39;s such a great server! The food we got came out fast and it was really tasty. My girlfriend and I ordered the factory combo which was the chicken Madeira and the steak Diane. It was quite filling along with the delicious avocado egg rolls as an appetizer. Thanks again Paolo for the great service. We will definitely be coming back!

Trying to understand the pandemic and the changes in dining? No excuse for the waiting list procedures. Waiting longer than expected and skip, until I notified the staff. Then sat in maybe the worst area. Facing the parking lot versus an ocean view. Hopefully waiting staff and food will make up for the wait?

WOW!! From the moment we pulled up, to the end of the visit -- AMAZING!! <br><br>FAST seating - I was told 20 min wait (which is still not bad for a Saturday night) &amp; ended up only waiting about 5 min!!! <br><br>Our waitress was very professional &amp; friendly! Thank you Korina!!!! <br><br>The food was DELICIOUS!! <br><br>Overall - SATISFIED, FULL &amp; HAPPY!
Great experince thanks to Tomika! Very knowledgeable and attentive! Super nice and friendly!

Today for Mother&#39;s Day we went to get a take out order, because of the Coronavirus. It was chaotic and we had to wait a while for our order, but two employees made the wait worthwhile. Both John and Jackie, who work behind counter, were So kind, patient and courteous!  They went above and beyond to help us get our order. While we waited to for our food to be packed up, we also saw John &amp; Jackie continuously were professional and kind with everyone!  The employees had to hear a lot of complaints more than compliments, but these 2 employees didn&#39;t skip a beat. They just kept smiling and kept the orders moving. Many people were upset about the wait and chaos, but in the big picture, it&#39;s a first world problem. Our meal at home was excellent. Hopefully next year, we won&#39;t have the Coronavirus to deal with. If we do, we will have the knowledge to navigate through it though!  Thank you Cheesecake Factory, Redondo Beach!!

My baja chicken tacos came with old guacamole. there were red stems and flakes all over the rice in my dish. The limes were browning. We had to ask our waitress for the same things multiple times and still were never brought out (we asked for water 3 times). Didn&#39;t bring a chamomile tea bag for my hot water.  She barely came to check up on us.

Had an early dinner this day before Memorial Day. It all started &amp; ended very well. First, some house cleaning out of the way. That is to say, this by no means was our first time eating at a Cheesecake Factory or this particular location, not even close. <br><br>Again, starting with what was to be a 20-30 minutes wait, was 4 minutes. We were ushered to our table, which was window side, yet full of afternoon sun &amp; no way to block it. We mentioned this to our hostess, who immediately took us to a table 4 down &amp; just across the shared isle. Terrific. Our waitresses was as pleasant, accommodating &amp; knowledgeable as could be, we felt in good hands. After we asked, she suggested a few dishes &amp; I took her up on mine, my wife stayed her course. When brought out, they were both great. The Evelyn&#39;s favorite Pasta, for my wife &amp; a small Caesar Salad &amp; the Spicy Jambalaya Pasta for me. Of course we had our share of there pumpernickel &amp; sour dough bread. Yet managed to save room for cheesecake! Since our last visit, they added a new one, called Celebration. Looks just like a piece of birthday cake &amp; to a degree, tasted like it to. Yet not to overbearing. With vanilla ice cream to accompany it, this was delicious. All during our meal our waitress it seemed couldn&#39;t do enough for us, including taking several pics.<br><br>After dinner we took the obligatory walk by the boats in this part of the marina then up &amp; out through, Sea Level at the Shade Hotel. <br><br>A 5 Star visit.

I had visited this Cheesecake Factory with my two friends for the first time, and I can say I quite enjoyed myself. I ordered the Fresh Basil, Tomato and Cheese Flatbread and it was so yummy! Our waiter was a kind guy and very attentive to us. He was always asking if we needed anything else, willing to answer questions that we may have had. The only thing that was keeping me from giving a full 5 stars was the menu not having prices on certain items on the menu. Like the actual cheesecake, desserts, and the beverage options! I just went on ahead and gotten the original cheesecake. What I also really didn&#39;t like was how gross the woman&#39;s bathroom was! If I wasn&#39;t so disgusted I would have taken a picture. I understand it&#39;s a bathroom, but it&#39;s unacceptable to be as messy as it was. But overall I enjoyed myself and I&#39;d definitely go back!

The Cheesecake Factory is a reliable chain, there&#39;s nothing per se, for me that is on the menu that&#39;s a signature dish where it&#39;s a unique &#34;must have&#34; item to come here for as a go-to destination for dining.  <br><br>As a disclaimer, I&#39;m not a fan of any Cheesecake as desert, so by namesake and in my review, I can&#39;t address it for that aspect of dining. <br><br>The menu, to their credit is big and diverse, so most won&#39;t find it hard to  find something to eat here.<br><br>The prices and food quality / food quantity is okay, it&#39;s not cheap-eats, nor is it fine-dining, it&#39;s probably about $20 per person or call it $30 if you add a desert and beverage (not free ice water), which is about $40 per person after paying tax and tip for lunch or dinner at minimum.  They do give free complimentary bread and butter, so if you&#39;re hungry starving when you walk in, load up on bread then decide what you want to order.<br><br>Parking is easy in their lot, which has Valet service.<br><br>The view of the harbor is nice if you get a window seat on a clear day.

I had a tough time locking down a location for my 40th birthday dinner. Most restaurants wanted a buyout for my party size (give or take 40 guests) which ranged anywhere from $4,000 and up; translation $100 person and up equates to RIDICULOUSNESS. After several failed attempts to settle on a reasonable price point that was affordable along with an inviting ambiance, I reached out to Cheesecake Factory. I was told they did not make reservations on the weekend, however my party size could be accommodated if I arrived one hour or more before the party time. GREAT! I arrived just before 5:40 for my 7:00 dinner. My party size was an expected 36 (32 showed up). I was greeted by a young lady, whose name I can&#39;t remember, who was very pleasant. She listened to my need and explored my options for seating in the restaurant. I told her I was open to options and told me the manager would be over to walk me through the restaurant to choose my preferred seating location. Alex, the Manager, came over and greeted me with a smile; also very pleasant. Alex mentioned the patio area as an option which sits to the right of the entrance. It was PERFECT! Guests could come and not have to walk through the entire restaurant to find us. It was a heated patio too so I knew my guests would be comfortable. Alex explained he would situate the tables into chef&#39;s tables about 6:30 which was completed 10 or so minutes before time. Alex had another gentleman assist with lighting the heaters. Alex provided instructions re guests arrival and remained very professional and pleasant. Daniela and Tyler were our servers. LISTEN! Those two young people handled us SO well!!!! Their hospitality was top notch!! There was a third young lady who temporarily came in to cover Tyler&#39;s break. I believe her name was Marisela. She was good too! The other manager even helped out later in the evening. I didn&#39;t catch her name but she was awesome sauce as well. The ultimate vibe I wanted for my dinner was a good time with a relaxed environment to include great food and libations. I TRULY could not have asked for better. I prayed that God would work everything out as I asked for my birthday and He did that!! Every restaurant before Cheesecake was a roadblock. Either plates were too pricey and not enough product for the food or the drinks were limited in some way or other. Some of these restaurants want you to sign your name in blood they are SO high!!! GEESH!!! Cheesecake Factory offers a variety of great food and DELICIOUS libations. Two of my guests were ages 5 &amp; 7 and they enjoyed their little selves. As a matter of fact, my nephew ate and went to sleep. LOL.... I ordered the Pineapple Moscow Mule first. SO GOOD!!! I also ordered the Georgia Peach...THAT DRINK BLESSED ALL OF MY 40-YEAR-OLD LIFE!!! Order that drink and you won&#39;t regret it. There was only one guest whose food was not to his liking but Daniela was attentive and brought the manager over to make sure my guest&#39;s needs were met. He ordered another dish and was satisfied. I had an AWESOME night!! It&#39;s always clear when you&#39;ve chosen the right venue because everything just flows. It&#39;s not hard. I wanted to make sure my guests would come and enjoy dinner without going bankrupt and Cheesecake did not disappoint. Thank you staff!! I applaud your professionalism, hospitality and great dispositions. I&#39;ll have to come back to post pictures from the night when my photographer sends them.

We were a large walk-in party of 20+! It took them a couple hours but we expected it! There was almost no error on an order except a child&#39;s adult sized order. We had about 4 servers. Glad CF has plenty of menu options to accommodate my dietary needs. My filet mignon and steamed asparagus was delish.

This is my fave Cheesecake Factory in the area because of the great views, good service, and cool building that houses it. I&#39;ve always love their menu, although I do miss the stuffed chicken tortillas they eliminated! The strawberry shortcake is great, as is the brown bread with butter. Make sure you ask for it! Also, cash valet parking or coin parking is all you&#39;ll find!

Absolutely terrible experience with the wait staff - William in the bar dining area on March 8th.  Initial attentiveness was reasonable to start including water and drinks, however once dinner orders were provided to William we had extensive wait times for any food to arrive at the table - to the point we actually had to find a waiter to inquire routinely where our four dinner entries were.  The original waiter William returned to inform us the meals would arrive shortly.  Then we received 3 of the 4 entrees and the fourth never arriving.  William and the evening manager came to the table apologizing for the service issues and we were informed they would comp cheesecake for assistance as we missed our movie plans due to the wait.  We again had to inquire and waited an additional period of time for the fourth diner to arrive at the table.  The food was fine and the desserts were good however when the bill came, nothing was comped off of the bill AND we had one entree  billed twice (the fourth dinner which was probably forgotten about)!!! After numerous corrections with the bill and almost three hours, we finally were wrapped up to leave.  Unfortunately a poor experience on this visit.

i am disgusted with the customer service i received tonight. I always come here and receive great customer service  and tonight was just the absolute worst! we had to ask another server for what we needed (straws, and to go boxes)because our server only came TWICE!!! and we were here for an hour and 30 minutes. We never received our bread, straws, and on top of that our server KEEYLN messed up our order! i asked for spicy chicken and well done  and she gave me the opposite and i had another order which was asked to substitute the corn with fries and then we asked the other lady who brought out our food and she looked at me like i was dumb &amp; she just laughed then said she would come back with fries and 30 minutes passed by and she never brought out my fries and kept passing by laughing and staring i am beyond angry at how these 2 girls weren&#39;t taking their job serious. I Understand that as a server you have multiple tables to attend to but both girls passed by us multiple times and were serving everyone else around us. I had to go up to the front to ask for my check and when the lady in front desk told me she would get our server to give us our check she took 10 more minutes and she was just standing around. i didn&#39;t feel comfortable even eating my food or just even being inside at the booth because of how horrible the service was here. i also had to go up and order my cheesecake because Keelyn did not ask if we wanted dessert. I don&#39;t know if it was the way we were dressed that they took us as a joke but regardless it is your job to treat the customer in mannerly way and clothing shouldn&#39;t matter. instead of standing there or looking at us from other tables up and down maybe you should learn how to work! I Most definitely did not tip her because of the attitude and TRASH service she gave us but i did tip the guy server that helped us out because this was the most nicest and sweetest thing because he did not need to attend us since he wasn&#39;t our server and he went out of his way when we asked.

The Cheesecake Factory is the perfect &#34;go-to&#34; restaurant when you&#39;re with a group of &#34;I-don&#39;t-care-where-we-go&#34; ers. I&#39;ve even been alone and that&#39;s great, too. <br><br>My most recent trip was alone around 3:30 in the afternoon. I was seated next to the window that overlooks the marina and boats. Beautiful spot! <br><br>I ordered the Cobb salad which was about the size of Mars, but I&#39;m not complaining! Who complains about TOO much food? It&#39;s called a TO-GO box! To go home and enjoy and eat again (which is like typically an hour after I leave the restaurant ;D ). <br><br>My server was Travis and he was super kind, attentive, and prompt. He immediately greeted me with bread, water, and even offered his favorite recommendations which I love (more reasons to come back and try new dishes)! <br><br>This place can definitely get packed. Like, DMV packed. Just find an awkward time to eat on a weekday and do it. The bar is also self-seating, so opt for that if you can&#39;t swim your way to the host/hostesses booth. <br><br>Attached pictures are of the Thai Lettuce Wraps (appetizer) and the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta that I&#39;ve had before too, DROOOOL! <br><br>Writing this has sure sparked my craving for some avocado rolls and thai coconut chicken...

I ordered a huge to-go order from this restaurant. <br>Upon arrival I took a deep breath because I just KNEW they were going to get the order wrong. <br><br>JP is AMAZING!!!! Although the cook forgot an item, with JP&#39;s attentiveness, she caught the error before we left.<br><br>JP&#39;s customer service is AMAZING!!! Unforgettable smile and cheerful personality, thanks girl!!! <br><br>Pros: <br><br>Friendly and attentive staff. <br>Delicious food. <br>Nice view. <br>Valet parking. <br>Yummy cheesecake <br><br>Cons: crowded<br>I would not recommend coming to this establishment on a Sunday evening.

I swore this location off years ago due to bad service and dirty silverware, but my gf said it was under new management so I gave it another shot. It was good 2-3 times, until last night... <br>We waited 45 minutes for our steak and burger and they were both cold, so we asked them to remake it. ( Also, the waitress dropped of a steak knife for me to use that was OBVIOUSLY dirty, idiot...) <br>The second round came out another 20 minutes later and was no better than the first! Irritated, I just asked for the check... Then they were going to charge us full price after waiting over an hour to eat and never getting a decent meal. I refused, paid for my glass of wine and left the waitress a pity tip. Next time I&#39;ll make the drive to Houston&#39;s for a real steak and some professional service. This location is, has been and always will be a big turd. See ya never Redondo Cheescake Factory! :P

Love this place and their food. Cooks had one slip up in the kitchen ending with some plastic in my dish. Call down speak to the manager who says he would love to replace it at my convenience.  Come down two weeks later to enjoy a nice free meal on the house when the manager explains to me she cant comp the meal because it&#39;s a holiday weekend and the Calabasas headquarters offices are closed. Haha what a joke. I love this place but apparently management needs some training in customer service!!!!

What a Horrible experience! Never going back.  My family and I went to this Cheesecake Factory on May 19th for our Sibling Reunion luncheon as we are 60+ and the majority live in the South Bay. There was a party of 10 as spouses were included.  Mind you we are not old, slow moving and white haired as we are physically capable and mentally astute with all of us being retired professionals.<br><br>First, the entry and exit to the restaurant parking has a bike path in front, (an accident waiting to happen), coupled with mandatory valet parking?!? The menu selections were far pricier than that found on the internet with the food being mediocre at best. I can tolerate all of this however my main complaint is the service we received or should i say NOT received.<br><br>We were seated in the very back with no view of the harbor as the chairs are too low if you sit on the upper tier.  It took three hours for our party to be served our food as our waitress, (she&#39;s fortunate i am not including her name), serviced all the other tables but ours as we saw at least 10 parties seated, served and gone before we even received our food, leaving us only with the drinks we ordered.  I felt the waitress avoided us as i even tried flagging her down by waving my hand and she definitely avoided eye contact with me turning her body while she was at the adjacent table.<br><br>To add insult to injury she got two orders incorrect making my sister and sister-in-law wait even longer.  The waitress even argued with my husband who was displeased with the wait time for the wrong orders...an additional 20 minutes.<br><br>They did comp one of the wrong orders and i am guessing inspite of the horrible service my brother gave her an 18%+ tip.  I wouldn&#39;t have... as what was suppose to be the start of a nice sibling reunion dampened the experience.  My question is... Where was the manager that day, inquiring is everything alright?  As it certainly was not!

So when it comes to Cheesecake, at the very least you know what your getting into. If you&#39;re me, there&#39;s a list of pasta dishes that call you back. Or maybe your in the mood for a Madeira Chicken? Today was a Pasta Da Vinci day for me and I got exactly what I wanted. It is like 3 pounds of pasta, mushrooms, chicken and sauces that make you happy. It&#39;s not great, but it&#39;s good. What&#39;s for sure is that you get a ton of food and the bread keeps coming in so long as you ask. <br>  My son on the other hand did not enjoy his meal. He ordered the kids pepperoni  pie and while his pallet might not be the most refined on the planet, he knows a good pizza from a bad. And I tasted and agreed. This is nadatgood. The pepperoni was over cooked, the cheese was cold, the crust was unevenly cooked and it tasted store bought.<br>  Last but not least, my daughter ordered the kids spaghetti and that was a solid buy! Most spaghetti and meatballs are usually drenched in mediocre red sauce. This was above average taste and still drenched in red sauce but when your resourceful like me, too much sauce means more bread for this guy.  <br>  I have no complaints about the service or staff. The food comes on time and of course the Cheesecake was delicious! We ate a slice of the Celebration.  I&#39;m gonna come back at some point! It&#39;s a forgone conclusion. This was not my favorite meal at the CF, but there&#39;s more hits than misses when I eat here so I&#39;m coming back for more!
Too noisy and so busy at all times such a long wait.  Food seems more seasoned/ salty compared to other locations. I only go to get to go...but not even that anymore since food got much more salty

Took my kiddos here for their bday dinner. Service was excellent! The food however was very disappointing. We ordered the nachos and they were terribly greasy and had a weird sweet red sauce, and the jalapeños were mushy and sweet. We also order the potato skin tots, which were just a greasy doughy mess. We were shocked because Cheesecake always has great food. Hopefully it was just a fluke

The food was great. The servers are very attentive. I had the shrimp with angel hair pasta. I also ate the avocado egg rolls. The chocolate cake for dessert  was nice. The server always made sure we had drinks and plenty of bread. The view was also wonderful.

The waitress &#34;L&#34; was not to write home about<br><br>She cleared away my knife and spoon with my bread plate quite thoughtlessly<br>And  after the first drinks were served she never came back<br>Thanks  to another waitress my wife was able to order a second glass of wine<br>TCF normally keeps better staff

I&#39;ve been here many times pre Yelp. Located in Redondo Beach near the pier on restaurant row. They have a very tiny self parking majority of time you will have to valet park since they have a bigger lot. Coming on a Sunday or Saturday for brunch to sit inside can be a wait from 45 to a hour during the brunch time 10am- 2pm we sat out in patio which was less of a wait. Service is ok food wise can be slow but service in general was good. I ordered the lunch pasta special for the pasta with shrimp and sausage minus the onions and peppers but it was still spicy for me now I know next time to stick with the shrimp and angel pasta or the four cheese pasta. Also got a Godiva chocolate cheesecake to go hopefully that won&#39;t disappoint later on. Overall I like coming here just the parking and wait time discourages me but I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back again.
Watch your receipt<br>They charge you for stuff you didn&#39;t order<br>Happened 4 out of the last five times <br>Rip off

This one of the nicest Cheesecake Factory&#39;s I have visited. The ambiance is incredible and the service in really really nice. <br><br>The food however, unfortunately, is just as bad as any other Cheesecake Factory since their flavors had a decline for whatever reason... when was it, around 2010? I feel like it was at the same time as they started sharing how many calories are in their dishes... such a shame for it used to be a nice place to indulge in every now and again.

We love Cheesecake Factory. It never gets old and I have to say running events here are always a treat for us. The service and staff are awesome and they help us run our events well. Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory? I have been eating here since I was a kid. I have never been disappointed with anything on the menu. My all time favorites are Chicken and Biscuits, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, Chicken Madeira, Thai Chicken Pasta, all their salads, and more. Oh and of course you cannot eat there without having their calamari for appetizer. And last, of course a slice of any of their cheesecake which banana cream is my fave! #maxreeceatssouthbay

This is the first time ive been to a cheesecake factory (I&#39;ve been to many) where i was honestly iffy about my food..i ordered the almond crusted salmon salad. <br> On one hand the superfood salad base was delicious!! It had kale, quinoa, brussle sprout shavings, avocado, cranberries and an olive oil based dresing. <br> On the other the salmon had a very weird flavor.. I almost felt like thats what cat litter would taste like, it was an upleasant surprise to say the least! I was with my boyfriend so i didnt want to make a fuss about it and ruin our time with complaints. I just pushed the salmon to the side and ate the salad base. <br> I was very let down but just sat there with a smile wondering what the heck was that taste?! <br> On a side note our waitress was delightful and definitely made it much harder for me to give lower stars. If it werent for her, the salad and my boyfriend i would definitely say 1 star here.. I wont be back to this location.
Waiter Kento is a Gem!  Very nice personality and smiled the whole time.  Kento is a very accommodating waiter. <br><br>Good luck in whatever you do beyond The Cheesecake Factory.
Cheesecake is always amazing,  but happy hour was disappointing. Expensive options for basic food. Ordered the long island, but not sure if any alcohol was in it?!. Service was friendly.

Have to comment bc we had such slow service and a bug in our salad. The quality of the food was and is poor every time I come to this location. I&#39;ve tried to give it several chances for redemption. But each time I&#39;m disappointed. With this last experience that&#39;s got to be it for me. The location is nice by the harbor with the view. But it&#39;s not worth it. Press on.

This place needs a serious lesson in good service. We got there on Saturday and we were never asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside. The stewardess seemed &#39;blazee&#39; about service. They initially sat us inside and we asked if it was possible to be sat outside. We were not demanding in requesting it and were told it would not be a problem. We had to go back to the stewardess at the front and did ask politely and they sat us outside at a table that was very poorly placed right in the sun. There was an umbrella that the chairs were actually partially on which made them uncomfortable and there was an umbrella that did not even cover us in the shade from a hot sun. <br>When I looked back, I noticed there were many tables that were available in the back, not just one or two, but many, that were in the shade and we could have been sat there.<br>I do not believe that some people working here like their jobs or get their jobs because the looks on their face were less than friendly. <br>I like Cheesecake Factory and never had a problem until now.  We do not plan on coming back to this one. Terrible  service!

I have been a customer of this Cheesecake Factory since it first opened.  I understand that we are in a pandemic but wanted to support a local place to celebrate my B-day.  We were very sad with 2 of our entrees.  My sons chicken Alfredo had no flavor and was cold.  My chicken Madeira had gristle in most of the chicken making it inedible.  I requested extra Madeira sauce for my meal and did not get.   My Daughter and husband had salads, so that&#39;s a no Brainer.  The size of the cheesecake slices we ordered are much smaller than the normal piece we order for the same price.  I understand that things are tough but I would hope that the quality and portions would remain the same.  Hopefully when this pandemic ends things will be better.

We had a great night for friends and family gathering. The waiter was attentive and pleasant; the good was delicious.  <br><br>When I left the restaurant for my car at valet, that was what went wrong.  I submitted the ticket to valet and asked them to break $20 bill for tip.  Though I didn&#39;t realize that valet charged me $4.50 out of $20.  I turned around gave the guy who brought over my car $4.50 plus tip.  Then I found out I double paid.  I went to the valet and told them the story and tried to get $4.50 back.  however, the guy who took over my car denied the $4.50 and said he only got the tip portion of it.  <br><br>I left speechless.  I am very shocked that $4.50 can buy a person&#39;s honesty.

It is absolutely great that the cheesecake factory is open during these times and I commend the staff for coming to work BUT my experience was not great AT ALL. I came on 8/24 for my daughter&#39;s 10th birthday. There were 5 adults, my daughter and a baby. We arrived at 5 and was seated by 550pm for dinner. Mausino I believe (a chipper friendly African American guy). We ordered 7 appetizers (spinach dip, crab cakes, crab dip, chicken taquitos, and tex mex egg rolls. Then dinner spaghetti, chicken shrimp pastas and chicken/shrimp meals. We watched another guest being sung happy birthday to another guest (adult) by 3 or 4 staff members) awesome then 2 people come out with my daughter&#39;s cake after waiting a long time for it to come. My daughter asked &#34;Why didn&#39;t more people come out for me? &#34; The staff member with out waiter wasn&#39;t even singing at all . Then to put the icing on the cake 2 of my guest woke up with possible food poisoning (vomiting and using bathroom in extreme discomfort) including me. I am not happy  dieento all of being sick and for my daughter to feel less just because she saw more singing to someone else which the only staff was just standing there not cool. I love love love the cheesecake factory but I will not be back here.

Service is the pits at the bar - even when not busy. No excuse for that.<br>However, the avocado egg rolls were bomb and they were recommended by the bartender in a rare moment we could speak to him. The woman dining a couple of stools down from us was pissed at how she was being treated/ignored so we know it wasn&#39;t just us.<br>The cheesecake would be my last dessert ever if I could choose one - it is so good. When ordering from the counter at the front, be prepared to wait about 20 minutes. You are put in a queue and have to wait until all take out food orders are taken by phone and completed. If I were the owner here, I would have someone just doing cake to-go orders to expedite things and keep people flowing out the door.<br>Recommended are the dulche de leche caramel and Adam&#39;s peanut butter and fudge ripple. Thankfully, I do not live near here or I would be here too often/at the gym too often!

Stopped by to get a slice of plain cheesecake to go and got the smallest piece of cheesecake I&#39;ve ever seen from a Cheesecake Factory. The woman who helped me actually took the slice off of a plate that looked like I was meant for a person eating at the restaurant (not from the whole cheesecake in the case), so I&#39;m wondering if I got a piece that was not fit to be served to a table. A total rip off for $8.

We went to you last night and really enjoyed the food and had excellent service from Ryan, the gentle giant. He gets 5 stars from us. What a nice person. The only slight complaint we have is that when the staffwere clearing the dishes around us, that they were clattering annoyingly loud. We&#39;ll definitely be back.  Maybe the clanking sounded extra loud because of the screaming kids, but we don&#39;t hold that against the cheesecake factory

Cheesecake Factory is a chain that is consistent no matter where in the country you are, and that&#39;s what I love about it. For any of you that have been to Pappadeaux&#39;s- same type of deal, it&#39;s always good. <br>This visit was no different. The hostess was pleasant, our server was very nice. We ordered the Strawberry Lemonade (delicious). Had the calamari, and fried mac and cheese. My entree was the lunch Herb Crusted Salmon which was cooked perfectly- the salmon was moist, mashed potatoes were warm and asparagus in a butter sauce?? We also ordered the lunch Meatloaf, mashed potatoes and instead of the corn we subbed for spinach. Everything tasted great! <br><br>I&#39;ve been coming to the Cheesecake Factory since a teenager and it&#39;s still reallt good food.

Ordering online was so easy. We were stuck In LA due to the coronavirus having our flights canceled 3 times. Fast service, hot food and great customer service. Food was hot and prepared excellently. Thank you

It is a very bad service,we have been waiting for the table outside for 30 min and then they gave us a dirty table inside,next to the kitchen noise area a with no sorry.When I asked about table outside again they said wait for 30 min .i will never go there again.never recommend it.

Torrance you fail me again !!!!while I appreciate the manager taking off my plate and appetizer I feel it wasn&#39;t enough! Cross-contamination is no joking matter. Your lucky i wasn&#39;t allergic and just get sick from fish! Anyone with a shellfish allergy would have puffed up! Liability City!!!!!!!!A shame I left hungry still paying a bill and left with the horrible taste of fish in my mouth !  so maybe don&#39;t use the same oil you use to cook fish with anything else !!

Usually I love the food here. We picked up food on Mother&#39;s Day and it wasn&#39;t the same. I got orange chicken and the portion seemed smaller. Also ordered the Caesar&#39;s salad which was so good the first time I got it. This time the lettuce was all withered the dressing seemed watered down. It just wasn&#39;t good. The cheesecake was great though. I got the same one I always get banana cheesecake. The girl who helped was very sweat. I&#39;m hoping the food was just bad this time cause it was too busy. Going to comeback soon.

Horrible customer service!!<br><br>I walked in thinking I would just grab a cheesecake and go, considering almost every time I&#39;ve dined here has been an utter NIGHTMARE!<br><br>I stood, waiting, for about 7 minutes before someone actually helped me. There was one woman there, servicing another customer, but looked over to me standing at the counter and asked, stupidly, if I needed help. I wanted to reply with something facetious, but I held my tongue. Instead I replied, &#39;when you&#39;re finished with your customer you can help me.&#39;<br><br>A couple of more minutes passed, then an oriental man (manager) walked out, right pass me; he didn&#39;t acknowledge me standing there nor offer any assistance. He stood there for about a minute or so, then a man walked in and stood at the counter. He walked straight over to that man and began &#34;helping&#34; him.<br><br>From what I gathered of the exchange, the man had been a problem in the past and the manager was threatening to not only call the police on him but BAN him from the restaurant!<br><br>The manager accused him of being aggressive, in the past, though I saw none of that whilst standing there. As a matter of fact, it was the manager that was being aggressive.<br><br>His energy, tone and demeanor were extremely hostile. The customer, however, was being quite docile.<br><br>Then another employee/waitress (tall with reddish/blonde hair) walked over and SHE began berating the customer (for alleged past behavior).<br><br>Now, as a customer that doesn&#39;t know what happened with these people, let me state this:<br>I don&#39;t care what that man did, all I care about is what I saw and, NO CUSTOMER should&#39;ve been privy to that exchange!<br><br>The &#34;manager&#34; should&#39;ve taken that customer somewhere private, like the area they have upstairs and had a conversation with him outside of our ears.<br><br>The manager and that waitress were extremely unprofessional and should both be fired. I left there feeling like shit. So much so, that I decided to write this review in their parking lot.<br><br>Like I stated before, the horrible service here has kept me from dining in. My guess is, the customer he threatened to have ARRESTED may have had similar experiences here.<br><br>When I finally got served, the woman helping me asked, in a non-concerned(more mocking manner), &#39;how is your day&#39; or something to that effect, because she could see I was upset, and though I wanted to tear into her with my words I simply said &#34;I don&#39;t like the negative energy of the employees.&#34;<br><br>She bid me &#34;have a good day&#34;, but I truly doubt she meant it.<br><br>They need to look at themselves, deeply, before they accuse the customer(s) of being out-of-line.

I have been here many times over the past 5 years, no denying that the food and cheesecake is delicious. However my last experience was awful, went for late lunch / early dinner so had nothing in my stomach and me and my mother who was here on vacation ended up getting food poisoning. <br><br>Needles to say the hygiene at this location is very poor! Service all round is also very bad with the exception of a few servers really doing a great job. Wish there was more options for Cheesecake Factory in the South Bay as all others I have been to have been excellent! <br><br>Btw this locations valet situation is a joke, such con men so be careful! It&#39;s actually more effort to valet as the parking spots are on the door step, had to wait forever for my car which is no fun with my family and 2 babies. Such a scam! <br><br>Cheesecake Factory these issues have been brought to your attention many times by South Bay residents, stop ignoring the feedback and do something about your only one location covering such a big radius!

The Cheesecake Factory is the place for a family! I always go to the Cheesecake Factory for my anniversary,my wife and my daughter love it so much,this is my second time to come in this branch,first time was at the shops at Mission Viejo mall,it was very nice as well,but here I loved the location and the view is amazing we got a table near the window,i love the food and the customer service is always nice and fast,the waiting time is not that bad about 20 minutes,the food is always fresh and delicious,recommend this location for everyone and definitely will come back soon.

#intermittentfasting gone wrong.  Truck you #cheesecakefactory <br>How can you make so many dishes bad for your health but yet terrible tasting at the same time. Job well done. But I won&#39;t front, your #Cheesecake is straight tastebud heaven.

NEVER going back. Over an hour after ordering, our server said she was going to check on the food. Fifteen minutes later, we just asked to have our food packaged &#39;to go&#39;. A little more than fifteen minutes later she came back with the food. I wish I could show you a picture of the train wreck they put in the containers for me to take home. <br><br>I guess I should have been more vocal. I just have a real problem spending $70 for two people to be treated like this. I go out to eat to have a pleasant experience. If I wanted to be treated like crap, I could have stood in line at the DMV and paid for someone else&#39;s car registration. <br><br>Once I got home, I was so upset, I couldn&#39;t even eat.

I&#39;ve heard amazing things about this restaurant. My cousin actually works here so I was given a whole list of dishes I HAD TO try and had to stay away from. I have to say I was pretty disappointed. The food is so pricey and I know you get what you pay for and you definitely get enough but I almost feel like you get too much. I know that&#39;s not what someone typically would complain about but it was too much for bf and I. Then again I guess it could be related to that fact that they give free bread and who the hell doesn&#39;t love free bread??? CRAZY PEOPLE Thats who !<br>But I do have to say their service is top notch. That is why I give them 3 stars. Another reason I docked two stars is because I do not feel their food was of the best quality. I would expect better quality if I am paying that much for it. Their cheesecake is amazing though!

ordered the 7 for $20 on 07/03, which is claimed to be the last day of the promotion. i&#39;m waiting for my order and I get a call from doordash saying that cheesecake factory is unable to fill the order. they did not offer me anything else. just canceled the entire order for me. don&#39;t advertise that the special will last until 07/03 if you&#39;re not going to honor it. AT LEAST offer me something else. very upset. was waiting all week to get to get this
Worst service ever. Not only did the food take forever. They messed up on our order and the bill three times. We were there for almost 3 hours. Missed our movie. Won&#39;t. Ever eat here again

The service was horrible.The egg rolls were so greasy.We had servers switched back &amp; forth.A person on my party asked for a hard boiled egg on her salad the waitress repeated hard boiled why did her salad come out with a fried egg..Just not a good night for the Cheesecake Factory Friday August 23,2019 &amp; the sad part of it not a busy night been there on busy times &amp; excellent service will not be going back ever

We waited about 30 mins to sit down a group of 8 people. The manager comes up an asked if we wanted to sit at the bar. We said no thanks we are still waiting on the rest of the party. We waited another 20 minutes our name gets called out. Well they walk us around the dining room area only to sit us down in the bar area where we had said no. Maybe it&#39;s because we are Hispanic or maybe because we have kids. <br><br>They did have two free tables next to the window. But they needed to check first if it was even possible for us to move. We come to this location often I can&#39;t say I&#39;ve ever felt this way about this place. Hope it&#39;s a good meal because it would be the last one in a long<br><br>Update:<br>Today 09/27/19 <br>Got here at 3:25 pm they told us it would be 20 mins. My wife was asked to update them on our party being here. She did but was told the server wasn&#39;t here yet we have to wait till they show up. We are only here because my wife likes the food an today is her bday. If it wasn&#39;t for her liking the food we would t be here.<br><br>And of course they sit us at the bar area. Waiting all this time for no reason. Oh an no waiter.

Delicious food, great menu with plenty of options, fantastic happy hour, and enormous portion sizes.  I never understand how some people don&#39;t like The Cheesecake Factory.  The Nachos are a great happy hour selection, as are the Fried Mac &amp; Cheese, and the pastas are always a strong choice.

This is definitely the nicest Cheesecake Factory that I&#39;ve been to. The location right on the marina is beautiful. The restaurant is huge between seating in the bar, main dining room and the patio (heaters available when it&#39;s cool outside). Good service. Be prepared to pay for valet parking ($4.50 in the evenings)
For me it&#39;s like a fancy buffet style kind of food. Really packed and noisy. Food is average.

I love this Cheesecake Factory location. It is right by the ocean. They only offer valet parking and it costs about $4.50. Service was always great. I always order the bistro shrimp! It is very flavorful and saucy. It is quite a big serving so leftovers are highly likely. There are just so many selections of not only food but for the cheesecake! Ordered the s&#39;mores cheesecake and it was delicious. Very rich and a big slice!

Valet parking is $4 cash only.  No validation.<br><br>There is metered parking on N Harbor Dr. and a paid parking lot at N. Harbor/Beryl.<br><br>You can also find metered parking on Catalina Ave.<br><br>If you want free parking and don&#39;t mind walking a tad bit, you can find it in the neighborhood around Beryl/Torrance Blvd (north to south) and Catalina/PCH (east to west).  Just look for the Bank of America, Redondo Beach Police Station, or St. James church and park around there.  FYI you can park at Bank of America after hours on Sat and all day Sunday as I have never heard of them towing during those times.
Always a great expat Cheesecake Factory. Quality and service are expected as so many people waiting in line to get in.  Try red velvet cheesecake and original are always my fav.

Comparing with the Pasadena location (which I considered as 3-stars), this Cheesecake Factory had a pretty spotty service - food took forever to come and the waitress never followed up and asked about what drink I want.<br><br>***<br><br>Miso Salmon (Fresh Miso Marinated Salmon Served with Snow Peas and a Delicious Miso Sauce - brown rice, $20): Quality of fish was pretty average (tasted somewhat stale) and the only decent part about this dish was sweet teriyaki sauce - basically a completely overpriced dish for the quality you are getting in return.<br><br>***<br><br>Good complimentary brown bread and easy self parking (especially during weekday lunch hours), but those were the only two positive things I can think of.

Service is pretty terrible here. I&#39;ve come here a few times to order to go. This last time, I ordered the ahi tuna salad, when they were reviewing my order I noticed the &#34;salad&#34; was literally a piece if tuna. When I spoke up, the person argued with me saying that&#39;s the salad, I said where are the mixed greens? Then finally she went to the back and told us it was the wrong item. We had to wait an additional 10-15 minutes. I get that they are busy but they really need to work on customer service. They let us keep the mistake piece of tuna, so I guess that&#39;s something?

Great food <br>Always such great customer service. <br>But this time our waitress wasn&#39;t as great. Other then our food coming out so late she refused to separate our checks because she said it was going to take her too much of her time .

We arrived for a birthday party. 10 of us total. We had also guests from overseas and wanted to take them to someplace nice. We were very disappointed with the food. I have come to expect over the years great food and great overall dining experience. Each of us had the same poor quality dishes.  We were all dissatisfied with the quality of the food that was ordered. Mashed potatoes were cold, dry and clumpy. The steak and pork chops were unseasoned and lack any flavor at all. Almost as if it was boiled in water. We ate at 9pm so maybe the kitchen wasn&#39;t up to preparing the food the way we come to expect from previous visits. They have really gone downhill. It was definitely not worthy the price we had to pay for the meal. No way we were going to order dessert. Not going back there again.
I like this restaurant. Good quality for food . Good staf . Good staff. Good menu. Good environment.<br>I like all of things of there

Me, my husband and a few friends went there today for dinner and my husband and I ordered 2 beers, my husband&#39;s glass was cracked on the rim and we let the manager know about it, the woman came to us very polite actually and told us that she was gonna take care of my husband&#39;s drinks, but let&#39;s be clear my husband was bleeding a little bit, not that much but we let her know that it could&#39;ve been worse because if he licked the rim he could got injured his tongue or something even worse... the thing is that at the very end when the check came we were been charged for one of his beers, I mean I know she came and talked to us but not even a complementary dessert or something, or not even took care of the drinks like she said that she was gonna do, Why do you need to talk to the manager 2 times in one night if she already knew that it was soo wrong bringing a broken glass to the table.. we paid a bill for almost $170 but if my husband didn&#39;t make a scene for an injure for a broken glass they should have been more thoughtful about it because if we had wanted even a law sue we could have against you.. I don&#39;t want free stuffs but you should take care of your customers... besides all of that the restroom was a mess, all dirty... worst experience ever in one of these restaurants.<br>I&#39;m posting this because The Cheesecake Factory people reply me and told me to go the the website, and I went there and they are asking for my address and my phone number? why do you want to get my personal info?

First of all, who charges $4.50 to park your own car, NO I didn&#39;t want my car parked, so I chose to park it myself and they charged $4.50 anyway. <br>I was in the mood for a good steak, so my nephew and I both orderered the New York steak. Now you would expect a good steak for $22. What we got was a steak and eggs type steak that you would order from Denys. But we weren&#39;t at Denys. No salad, that was extra. I asked for medium, but got medium well because it was so thin. <br>They came to the table twice with the wrong plates. Coffee got cold before they decided to refill. Sorry, but not for me. The other plates looked good, should of never ordered steak at this restaurant. $49 later, I wasnt happy, there are many other places much better.

I ordered the Chicken Bellagio, basil noodles w/ two chicken cutlets. There&#39;s prosciutto and arugula on top as well. They give a pretty large portion and everything goes really nicely together.<br><br>The food was good, but the conditions of the restaurant were disgusting! There was dirty water all over the floor, and I was wearing flip flops. When I sat down, my shoes sloshed in the mysterious water on the floor. It was disgustinggg and totally ruined my mood for the rest of the meal. Additionally, Cheesecake is always super dark, so I couldn&#39;t even see what I was stepping in. It was disgusting.

I&#39;m a fan of the Cheesecake Factory chain. The food quality (decent, consistent) and quantity (big portions) here are consistent with that of other locations. <br><br>Notable mentions that are specific to this location:<br>- View of the docked boats is unique. Can sometimes see seals. Entertaining when they bark and communicate with nearby dogs <br>- Parking: Only valet or metered parking nearby. For free parking, you&#39;ll need to trek quite a few blocks up the hill and into the residential area<br>- Proximity: Close to the Redondo Beach Pier dining, shopping and bar scene<br><br>While most Cheesecake Factory locations are good for kids, I don&#39;t think the restrooms here have been fully thought through with a family in mind. For example, while there is a family bathroom (yay!) and a diaper changing area, there are no paper towels to dry baby hands. FYI - Babies freak out when the super loud air blowers are on and they definitely will not let you stick their tiny arms in the two-hand drying cyclone. They freak out with full force! <br><br>...Pretty please with cherry cheesecake on top: Offer paper towels in the family bathroom.

Visited for some food. Was good experience. We were seated at the patio and when we sat it was so funny we were burning. I asked the waitor to be seated inside and we were relocated immediately. Ordered some spaghetti and meatballs and chicken Madeira and shrimp pasta. Everything was delicious and fresh. Would definitely be coming back.

Wowzers! The SALTED CARAMEL CHEESECAKE is to die for! Smooth,not extremely sweet,caramel on top was just great and oh,I can eat the whole slice if I wanted to. <br><br>Parking was terrible but there was valet service and because we came here for a to-go-dessert so there&#39;s a saved space for such. There was no line at the CC counter so it was fast. But for a Wednesday night,I didn&#39;t expect this place to be super packed with diners!

Came yesterday for my moms birthday. We were a party if 8. My main annoyance was the waiter Matt. Some of my family members are vegan so of course they had multiple questions on the menu items and what they could order. Matt seemed uncertain on the items and had to go check in the back several times for confirmation.  He seemed all over the place and didnt really acknowledge everyone. When we finally ordered he forgot my beverage and part of my family members order. Luckily their item was not even added on the bill. Basically his service was horrible. Dont think I&#39;ll be dining here for a while.

Went for Dinner for  my husband Birthday . It have change alot. Service was alright one waiter was great but our main waiter was in training cause he seem confused. Bread was hard they change the Lemon Herb chicken. Steak was tuff my shrimp didnt gave no season. My Hennessy Sidercar was good.. Maybe next time the food will be good.

Was meeting a friend for dinner in a Thursday night and since everything practically closes in the beach area at 9PM I found that they are open here til 11PM. Definitely a score. Well I picked her up at 7:30 we drive here, there is valet parking, unless you can use meter parking, good luck finding a spot. Ok so we entered and as  soon as you walk in, on the left there are all the wonderful, mouthwatering cheesecakes lol. But that&#39;s for desert. We checked in and they called us within 5 minutes with our table ready. I choose a booth for 2 near the window looking at the docks. Hint if it&#39;s night you can pass this up. Nothing to see here. Besides if your big eaters like us, get a bigger booth, so your not cramped in with food.  We ordered appetizers the teriyaki cauliflower, and the avocado egg rolls for starters.  They where like both very flavorful and scrumptious. For entree&#39;s we ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and the charred tuna.  These where definitely cooled and tasted great.  And the kicker is we ordered desert to take home. Of course the cheesecake. Just choose your preference in flavor, there is no losing here.  Three thumbs up.

I&#39;d like to start off by saying that I don&#39;t usually give businesses one star reviews, however I feel like this specific incident should have been avoided. <br><br>I had placed an order online yesterday (5/10) for a 10 inch Oreo Cheesecake to be picked up today (5/11) at 12pm. I received a confirmation email stating that my order was confirmed and would be ready for me at said location and time. I arrived at the restaurant and had mentioned I was there for a pick up, again, stating I had placed it online the day before. They DID NOT have my order there at all. I was lucky that they had the cheesecake I needed available, but now I have to wait 2-3 hours for it to be thawed enough to eat and it does NOT have the birthday message that I had needed it to say. I did not have time to find another option so settled for the mostly frozen cheesecake. <br>Why implement an online ordering service if the restaurant won&#39;t even be receiving the orders? It may not seem like a big deal, but if you&#39;re trying to order cakes in advance, I recommend not using their online ordering service.

I love Cheesecake Factory it never disappoints. excellent service and good food. I had dinner with a friend on a Thursday evening and walked right in and was seated right away no line which was surprising.
