We decided on appetizers, we stated with the crabcakes they were so good , next we had the chicken lettuce wraps and they tasted as good as they looked our last dish was the Ahi tartare WOW it was so  good we ordered a second one if you haven&#39;t tried it I highly recommend it. The presentation and the taste of the Ahi tuna was mouth watering.

I normally love Cheesecake Factory but my experience tonight was horrible. I went here for my anniversary and had to promptly pack up my food and leave. They sat a table top of 8 behind us who were already obviously wasted. They continued to serve them drinks while they got louder and more profane. They reached a point where they were loudly yelling sexual comments and how &#34;wasted&#34; they were. When we told the manager, she said she&#39;d &#34;observe&#34; but didn&#39;t apologize for our experience or really seem to care. You would think after spending $120, customer service would be a bit better.

Had a pleasant meal tonight. The Caesar salad was perfect and the main meal was truffle honey chicken with mash potato and asparagus. The chicken was so moist and the asparagus was also delicious. Our server Lydia was so awesome she was so attentive to our every need. Even though it was very busy that had no effect on our service.  Thanks Lydia for the great service.

Just had the best happy hour with an upbeat beauty server named Tamika. She is a ball of energy, very accommodating and refreshing. Now-  about the food!  Fried zucchini was superb. $6.95. The taquitos were excellent $6.95 and the pork belly sliders were to die for. $6.95.  Add a little wine and a superb view- what&#39;s not to love?
This place was great! We sat outside in the chilly weather they had heaters and it was perfect along with the cute view. Great breakfast

Best experience ever at any cheesecake venue in my life. It started with the Manager Samuel ( I believe his name was ) He made me and my family celebrating my Aunts birthday incredible. We always celebrate at cheesecake but he made this time special. The server the server was great also. Mensor or Menson something with a M and foreign sounding. Food was prepared perfect. Every bite full of flavor. But like I said the manager made it above good. Will continue to come back to this location because this was awesome.

I usually go to this restaurant. Everything was good most of times. Somethings we are in waitlist but it&#39;s ok. The quality of food is great but 2 weeks ago I went with a friend for our lunch, everything was good but the waiter was pushing us to eat and pay quickly. She gave us the check 1 minutes after starting eating and periodically went to our table to see if we already put our card or cash inside the bill. That&#39;s disgusting me a lot. I didn&#39;t give any tip and stopped going there for a while.

Private Party held in Harbor Room<br><br>Thanks to Jackie and Danny for helping us throw a 90th birthday party!  Everything was so easy.  Food was great AND service fantastic.<br>I didn&#39;t know much about putting an event together and Jackie walked me thru every decision.  The day of, Danny was there making sure everything went smoothly.  When I arrived 2 hours before the party I found the room looking beautiful with tables set exactly as we had discussed.  I was offered suggestions re placement of cake, flowers, sign in book etc.  Very helpful. We had some toddlers and many elderly.  Some of the servers took it upon themselves to assist those who needed help thru the food line and back to their tables.  Everyone was kind and polite.  I cannot thank them enough. Would definitely recommend Cheesecake Factory Harbor Room, Redondo Beach for a private event.

Cheesecake Factory always has an incredible variety when it comes to cakes, and everything looks too good so it&#39;s hard to choose. Slices are huge and calorie dense but once in a while it&#39;s ok to indulge. The oreo cheesecake is good, Linda&#39;s Chocolate Cake is like heaven in the form of a cake!! So delicious. I also love the Salted Caramel and the Key Lime cheesecake.

Grrrr....Wasted good money on greasy omelette breakfast. <br>#1. Dry, barely toasted, pale beige, English muffins, <br>#2 Greasy, stale potato nuggets, crisp as croutons, passed off as some kind of potato fries,         #3.Last-of-the pot, bitter, lukewarm coffee. <br>#4. No milk or sugar. Good thing I like my coffee black. Inattentive service. Finally flagged down server for butter &amp; jam. This is the 3rd visit that I&#39;ve had poor service. Now add the horrible food and, with regret,<br>I finally had to update my review.
Good service, good food and our server was great. It was a very busy night and she still kept up with all her work. I am satisfied with my experience again and look forward to coming again.

Service at this location is always pretty much hit or miss we actually had an appetizer and a small plate the best part about the meal was the bread that was served with the butter. The outside patio wasn&#39;t as clean as desired and for it being such a slow day the service was really slow

We had an amazing experience with this location. We are continually visiting The Cheesecake Factory in different cities and this has to be our favorite location at the moment. We have our waitress Melissa F to thank for a well served meal and very pleasant service. We capped our night off with the Strawberry Shortcake, it is our new favorite at The Cheesecake Factory which is a bit ironic. Do yourself a favor and try the Strawberry Shortcake.

Family dinner with the fam bam great for large parties but the menu is so deep what to order? That is up to you. They got everything. The view is the best part. See all the boats. The service is standard. Come for the view and valet parking sometimes is the only parking option.

it makes me sad to write this review because i am  a very frequent customer (at least twice a month) but this time was horrible. it took 22 minutes for us to even be greeted and given menus. the waitress finally showed up and threw them at us without even a hello and rudely barked &#34;what do you want?&#34; i have never experienced a more unpleasant person in my life. as for the food it came out lukewarm and the rice was hard. when i mentioned this to a manager she simply said &#34;oh well that&#39;s all we had at the moment&#34; so she admits that they gave me leftover rice that was under its usual level of quality... i can&#39;t believe how disgusting this entire experience was. i expect more from a company such as cheesecake factory... this isn&#39;t a chili&#39;s but might as well have been.

Horrible experience talking on the phone with them. We have big group and tried to make a reservation on not a peak time. The girl answer the phone and said it&#39;s not a peak time so you can walk in, but come in an hour early so you can have dinner at 4. ‍ that totally not making any sense. Not going here , we got booked at Samba Brazilian Steak place nearby.
Food was excellent! But the downside was cash valet parking only; no option to self park in their parking lot. We didn&#39;t have cash and had to look for ATM machine.

Warning, this place is so dirty. They&#39;ll happily seat you at a table that hasn&#39;t been bussed, and your feet will be slipping around in noodles and sauce. They&#39;ll be happy to serve you a glass of water in a dirty mug with food chunks all over. At the end of your meal, they&#39;ll make you pay for it all as well, so please, just tell your friends NO when they suggest this establishment. Escalating these matters to management will not achieve anything.

We had guacamole with chips after taking a few bites I felt something chewy in my mouth I thought it was the the skin of the avocado. I looked closer and examined it it was a piece of napkin or something. It was kind of gross we just stopped eating it. It was weird like how in the hell did that get in the guacamole it makes you think. I didn&#39;t complain I still tip the waiter for his effort but I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;ll be back here again. It really wasn&#39;t a pleasant experience but the rest of the food was okay.

Meh, it&#39;s the same thing at all locations, just I didn&#39;t prefer the style of this one. It seemed old and not as well kept as the others I&#39;ve been to. The service was great and food consistent to the brand. <br><br>I sat at the bar and had a beer and potstickers and sliders. Hit the spot and was exactly what i wanted. The bartender and I got to talking and he was recently promoted to bartender from bus boy. So incredible, i do love that the company allowed advancement. Of course I&#39;ll be back because I do love the restaurant.

I&#39;m Black (You&#39;ll see why I say this in a moment)<br><br>While parking my car, my friends said they were being seated.  When I arrive at the host stand, I alert to two ladies that my friends were recently seated but I&#39;m not sure where.  The manager says, &#34;I just sat some people, I think they&#39;re your friends.&#34;  This lady takes me to a table with 2 black people and then tells me, &#34;this is the table.&#34;  I looked at her and said, &#34;I don&#39;t know these people.  My friends are not black!&#34;  I was pretty annoyed that this lady assumed I would be meeting other black people.  <br><br>Anyways, I got past that point and had a nice dinner service with my multicultural group of friends.  Everything went as expected.  Servers were attentive and food was good.  Our orders arrived promptly and at the correct temperature.  <br><br>Other annoyance was the parking situation.  This restaurant was only offering valet.  I personally like to self-park.  I was able to find metered parking right by the restaurant for $1.50 per hour.  The meters had a slot that looked like it was for a credit card.  I tried to use my credit card but it didn&#39;t fit, I guess those meters don&#39;t take credit cards.  I didn&#39;t have enough change in my wallet to park on the streets so I valeted.

The service was polite and the food was good this time. However, the server offered to bag my food as I did not eat much (full off bread).. and GAVE ME THE WRONG FOOD. I woke up salivating for my food from last night and instead opened a partially eaten burger. I am so upset.
Excellent place... food is amazing...service was solid and we sat window view, all was great

Found a hair in my avocado eggroll. I talked to manager and removed avocado eggroll from our bill. We lost our appetite and could not finish our other dishes. Mistake happens but it was very unpleasant experience.

Went here last weekend. Ordered shrimp and chicken gumbo and they served it to me without a single shrimp!!!!the waiter said there was shrimp there but I showed it to him and there was nothing. He brought it back to the kitchen and told me the chef forgot the shrimp ...not funny!!!! The server was not friendly and always tried to avoid us . Will not comeback here anymore!!!!

BEWARE OF FORCED VALET PARKING: giving the place a 2 star because they MAKE you Valet Park (at least the attendant that day - march 19, 2018) even if there&#39;s plenty of space in the parking lot. That pretty much motivated me to submit this review. Ive never been to a place where they force you to valet park. in my experience at other places, it has always been optional unless there&#39;s no parking space available. My sister parked her car herself and was still given a valet ticket and made her pay. You guys need to do something about this, because this is a major turn off.<br><br>DISHES: we ordered the usual bellagio chicken and the amount of pasta wasn&#39;t as much as the other cheesecake factory places that ive been at. then the cajun shrimp jambalaya, the pasta was a bit overcooked.<br><br>SERVICE: good.
Nice view, mojito taste good, the brow bread it&#39;s the boom ! I had to go to Albertsons to get a bag the next day coz it was so good !

Did not like the experience at this particular Cheesecake Factory at all.<br>I come on a Saturday night and many things went wrong. First of all, no way to park your car without having to pay the valet, because the street parking is so expensive that you literally need a bag of coins. The wait was 40 minutes to get a table, which is reasonable during weekends. Once we got seated, the AC was blasted at our table for the whole dinner, making the experience very chill. Also, some tables are in areas where you can barely see anything due to lack of lighting.<br>Once our server got the orders, we had to wait another 40 minutes for the food to come, making the total wait time unacceptable for this type of restaurant. My impression is that the place is definitely understaffed and 2.5-3 hours for a mediocre dinner is absolutely not worth it.

Cheesecake Factory can be counted on for consistently good food, ambiance and service, and this location is no exception. Their ridiculously large menu and excellent view of the ocean makes this a great place to celebrate a special occasion. <br><br>I came here on a Sunday for dinner to celebrate my mom&#39;s birthday. We were seated right away at a nice table with a view. I split two appetizers with my boyfriend. We ordered:<br><br>Avocado Toast: Cheesecake Factory is trying to hop onto this trendy bandwagon. Their version is a bit underwhelming. They take the standard bread they give you before the meal, toast the crap out of it, then pile some avocado on top. The bread is simply too hard and thick to eat easily. Otherwise it&#39;s quite tasty. <br><br>Samosas: this appetizer comes with 4 small pieces. They&#39;re fried nicely and have a good curry flavor. The yogurt sauce was pretty good too. <br><br>The service was excellent as per usual. They gave my mom a complimentary sundae and sang happy birthday to her. Pricing is the same as every other location - the good thing is generally the portions are so large you get two meals out of it. Don&#39;t skimp on the cheesecake - it&#39;s the best part!

Cheesecake Factory is average. Decent food but below average service. Also, valet fee is $4 cash just to park here. C&#39;mon. And they don&#39;t mention CASH ONLY anywhere. Nearest ATM is $6 fee to withdraw $20. <br><br>Terrible business decision in terms of their parking. Ruins the entire meal and experience.
Always a pleasure - great view of the harbor.  Made a reservation and was seated right away.  Note that there is a $4.50 valet charge.

The Cheesecake Factory is a chain, and some are better than others.  My recent dinner experience at this one was not good.  Slow service, very loud, bad drinks, rude waiter and very expensive given the quality of the food.  At least at brunch or lunch you would have the pretty view.  Go elsewhere for dinner is my advice.
Been to this location a few times. Tonight was the best. Our server Tyler J. was the best server we have here. Probably the best server we have ever had. Very entertaining and very helpful.

First of all I have to say that I love Cheesecakefactory. The menu is insanely long but there is literally anything for anyone. Too bad they only have vanilla ice cream. It was funny because they have like 200 items but only 1 kind of ice cream. That&#39;s not my complaint though.  I had the worst server in history. From the get go we felt that she didn&#39;t want to be there. Never checked on us, didn&#39;t refill water, butter or bread- i had to ask for everything. She forgot my salad dressing. She never said anything nice such as thank you for coming or anything else that would make the costumer feel welcomed. When cleaning the table, she waved her fingers to let me husband  know to hand her the plates-unreal. Lastly after we paid with gift cards and cash, she came back to me and said that the tip is not sufficient. So rude. I gave her a 15% tip only because of all of it. I would have given not even 1 star after this experience but the food is always so good that&#39;s why 2 but i don&#39;t know if i am going back there again anytime soon. This waitress was the worst in history. I have to add that i never in my life wrote a bad review but it has been 2 days that we were there and i still think about it. Its so sad that someone like that works in such fun field!!!
Awesome vegan lunch today.  Sweet potato fries hold the chipotle mayo add a side of shallot vinaigrette.  Evelyn&#39;s Pasta hold the pesto so good, they just need more vegan options.

Ridiculously long wait for to-go-order quoted to be ready in 15 minutes. I called at 7:55 PM the order wasn&#39;t given to me until 8:33. What the frick. The manager offered the explanation that the orders were backed up. People arriving after me received their orders before me. I am very patient but this was not acceptable. Interesting that miraculously the order appeared when the manager came to explain after I waited for her for 7 minutes and offered a wack apology. Disappointing service.

For some unknown reason, this is the only Cheesecake Factory I ever been to in my life.  The location is very good as it is near the beach.   You will find a plenty of VIP parking here, but there are also a small general parking near the right hand side of the entrance area.  <br><br>My wife and I did not have a reservation, but luckily we got the seating by the window side which provided us with a great view of nearby yatchs and ocean.  Also, the staffs were very friendly and very courteous throughout our meal.  <br><br>Bistro Shrimp Pasta - Crispy battered shrimp, fresh mushrooms, tomato, and arugula tossed with spaghetti and a basil-garlic-lemon cream sauce.  This dish was chosen as it was recommended by one of my yelp buddy and it sure made me very very happy!!!  Thank you, Lisa!!!<br><br>Miso Salmon - Grilled salmon with Miso flavor, and rice with snap peas.  The salmon was very very tender and juicy!      <br><br>Sorry, no dessert as we were too full!<br>Come to think of it, I never had their cheesecakes...

Is there a cheesecake heaven? Yes, there is. You don&#39;t have to die to go there, just get yourself to the Cheesecake Factory. The name tells the truth, it us a factory. A factory of yumminess. Cheesecakes in such a wide variety of flavors, it tickles the mind. So many possibilities. Just one mouth. However can you decide? Can&#39;t help you with that one. But just reading all the cheesecakes is a marvelous thing. <br>But there is more, with real food that is interesting and tasty. Great appetizers and small plates, for times when you are hungry for just something small and yummy. They bring you free bread and butter. The bread changes a little, but it usually includes the dark soft squaw bread and it&#39;s yummy. <br>My favorite appetizer is the Stuffed Mushrooms with it&#39;s fontina and parmesan cheese, garlic and herbs in a yummy sauce. White Bean Hummus served with warm flatbread, is worth trying. The Beets With Goat Cheese is really good, made with fresh beets, apples, baby arugula, pecans and vinaigrette. The Warm Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip is sooooooo good, and the grilled sourdough bread they serve it with is a great pairing. Yum.<br>When I am feeling virtuous I order the Kale Salad, with cranberries, apples, marcona almonds and green beans, with a yummy buttermilk black pepper dressing. It is so yummy, it doesn&#39;t feel like diet food, it tastes like I am indulging. My friend swears by the Kobe Burger, with its American style kobe beef with sauteed mushrooms and onions on wonderful fresh bread. He says he craves it. I believe him. His face looks so blissful when he is eating it. They offer huge portions. Bang Bang Chicken is not to be missed. The Chinese Chicken Salad is yummy and enough for three meals. The Orange Chicken is the best Orange Chicken-EVER. The Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta is as interesting as it is delicious, with lots of layers of flavors and textures, with asparagus, peppers, peas, garlic, with perfectly prepared pasta and seasoning. They have seasonal favorites and such a huge menu. So many choices. Ordering always takes a long time. Always a dilemma, to try an old favorite or venture out and try something new? <br>Great views of the ocean and the marina. Lovely sunsets, if you time it right. They have indoor and patio seating. They have a wonderful special events rooms upstairs. They have a friendly cheerful wait staff. They have a bar and you can wait here, if you are waiting for a table. Great food, great service and predictably amazing cheese cakes and desserts. Really, if they just had the spellbinding White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake, I&#39;d keep going back. It&#39;s that delicious. Don&#39;t take my word for it, go and taste it for yourself. Discover which Cheesecake captures you. Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake, Dulce De Leche Caramel Cheesecake,<br>Chocolate Coconut Cream Cheesecake,Tiramisu Cheesecake, Chocolate Mousse   Cheesecake,Vanilla Bean Cheesecake, Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake......AH!!

I came in tonight to celebrate my mom. The food and service was exceptional !! My mom has end stage heart failure so every moment truly counts! Dinner was perfect! Our server was very kind and attentive !! Delicious food! Even better cheese cake! With all that said, the best part of the night was how compassionate the server and manager were when my mom choked on her ice tea and got sick. Her heart works at only 10% so a choking spell Like that can be very scary!! They comforted her and didn&#39;t make her feel embarrassed at all!! I seriously could go on about how happy my overall experience was at cheesecake tonight!  Thank you for helping make a great memory for us!!

Feeling disappointed <br>Just finished having dinner about  an hour ago   with my husband and son.i order filet as usual ,since my husband was a bit tired I decided I would take my unfinished filet home ...as I was eating the rest of my filet I realized that it was nothing but fat and gristle and I couldn&#39;t continue to eat it ,so I ended up having just mashed potatoes and green beans ..good thing I ordered fresh banana cheesecake to go .i also took a photo posting shortly ..<br>Erica Terry<br>I&#39;m sure my comments aren&#39;t important but just thought u should know

Let me start by saying that I love the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been coming to this location since 1988. <br><br>These 2-stars were barely earned.  We came for a small family dinner (5 people) for my daughter&#39;s 16th birthday.  We were seated in a booth right next to a screaming child.  I would understand if they were busy, but they weren&#39;t.  I mentioned to the hostess that this wouldn&#39;t work and she just stared at me like &#39;what do you want me to do?&#39;.  We kept the table.<br><br>Then for dinner I ordered chicken marsala with pasta.  There was so much parsley sprinkled into the food after cooking it was all I could taste.  When I mentioned to the server she looked at my plate and agreed with me - that was all she did.  We also had to ask for bread.<br>The cheesecake was good as expected.<br><br>The &#39;birthday sundae&#39; was nice - but the fudge was so rock hard it couldn&#39;t be spooned out.  My dad also had ice cream with fudge and had the same issue.<br><br>Overall I was very disappointed with the service, the food, and how run down this location has become.  I remember now why it was a year since our last visit.

HAPPY HOUR ....not so happy.<br>Me sitting in the bar.<br>Order drink, bartender in a frantic voice.<br>&#34;Are you sitting here ?&#34; Cause managment frowns on taking your drink back to your table.<br>Me : I have a table outside but ill drink it here.<br>Totally blew his mind !<br>He asked me twice again and repeated the HH policy.<br>I said dude why are we chashing our tail im sitting here !<br>Now I notice smiles from everybody at the bar.<br>Dude clam down.<br>I took my drink to my table

If I&#39;m paying $$ much for a nice restaurant I&#39;m expecting for it to b good !  Well it&#39;s not ! Very disappointed. Food was nasty and the service was terrible ! Such an bad Attitude like excuse me whatever happen to the customers all first with nice attitude ! They don&#39;t even know what hot wings r cuz they didn&#39;t give me hot wings . I got some burnt bs that&#39;s not even wings ! Come on now ! Stop burning your food and give the food that I asked for ! B nice your your customers !

I don&#39;t normally venture out to this area but I was here the other day to celebrate my uncle&#39;s 80th birthday and we got a decent portion of the upper restaurant to ourselves for a few hours for lunch.<br><br>My cousin chose the food for us that was laid out in a buffet style which consisted of 3 different salads (Asian chicken, 2 cobbs) halibut, chicken with almonds or some type of nut and some sweet sauce, filet mignon, rice, mashed potatoes, steamed veggies and a fruit platter. I enjoyed most of the food but I wasn&#39;t a big fan of the cobb salad since I don&#39;t enjoy blue cheese. My favorite definitely was the filet since it was nicely seasoned and tender. The sauce that came on the side was wonderful as well. The chicken was alright although it was a bit dry. Halibut was tender and the capers helped out the dish.<br><br>I was surprised we ended up getting some cheesecake later for dessert since my relatives already brought a birthday cake in. Unfortunately I was not a big fan of the tiramisu cheesecake. At first I had no idea what flavor I was eating until someone mentioned it. It had a very subtle coffee flavor and the temperature of the cheesecake was lukewarm at best. Overall I would definitely not recommend this flavor.<br><br>Also another downside to this location is the fact that you have to do valet parking and pay $4.50 otherwise you will have a hard time finding a place to park elsewhere.<br><br>Service was decent as our server was attentive and cleared plates frequently. The view from the 2nd floor of the docks and all the parked boats was nice too. But aside from all that I wouldn&#39;t bother coming here in a inconvenient spot where you have to valet park and deal with the bike lane as you enter/leave the restaurant.<br><br>If you do want dessert skip it here and go get some ice cream nearby instead.
The wait was justified and not too bad. <br>The Factory Nachos have a layer of salt on each chip. Tooooooo salty.

All time favorite restaurant!!! I love this place!!! I always order the salmon!! Strawberry martinis here are the best!!! Whether you come with a group or solo, it&#39;s worth it!! No reservations, unfortunately but definitely worth the wait... can&#39;t wait to return

I thoroughly enjoyed it. The food wasn&#39;t great but the staff was sooo friendly and the outside patio area was refreshing. I also enjoyed the little birds that picked up our sons scraps from the ground. They were some bold birds, lol. I tried the bread that the Cheesecake Factory was oh so famous for. The white bread was blah but the brown bread was delicious. <br><br>And of course, I had to try the infamous cheesecake. At $8.00+ the white chocolate raspberry slice wasn&#39;t dripping gold but it was definitely worthy of a round of applause. <br><br>I&#39;ll be returning!

My first visit here was disappointing because their pasta was sub par. The shrimp was overcooked and overpowered the entire dish. I  came back for a birthday event and was very impressed. First off, our waiter Esteban was amazing and on top of everyone in our party of 10&#39;s order. When my aunt asked where the restroom was he went as far as walking her to it instead of just giving directions. He went above and beyond for us and we couldn&#39;t be happier with his hospitality and service. <br>The complimentary whole wheat and sourdough bread was warm and fluffy. It was nice to munch on while waiting for our food. The mac and cheese balls are deliciously decadent, the zucchini strips are good as well. I ordered the herb crusted salmon and was floored with the taste, portion size and presentation. The salmon was cooked perfectly and was so juicy; the light tangy lemon sauce complimented it very well. I loved that the mashed potatoes were creamy and had red skins left in. The asparagus was fresh and still had a bite to it, not droopy at all.<br>Esteban was helpful with helping choose cheesecakes. The 30th anniversary, tiramisu, and adams peanut butter cup ripple cheesecakes were delicious.  <br>This last experience was amazing and I hope to visit again soon.

My order:<br><br> Chicken tequitos with a salsa on top. But the best thing ever is the cheesecakes. I normally get the carrot cake cheesecake but this time I ordered the banana cake cheesescake. My co-worker got a delish dish of strawberry short cake.
Hands down my favorite place to get chicken Alfredo at go at-least 3x a month service here is always good drinks are good too

This place is so amazing OMG!! I love it you could never go wrong going to the Cheesecake Factory for delicious food &amp; a great time honestly! I ordered the &#34;herb crusted salmon.&#34; that comes with the mashed potatoes &amp; asparagus. it was A1! Hubby got the chicken &amp; Avacado club sandwich &amp; a side of French fries. We couldn&#39;t go home without some cheesecake so we purchased 6 slices worth. And so far my favorite happens to be the the &#34;Ultimate Red Velvelt CC.&#34; I&#39;m definitely looking foward to going back next to try their alcohol mixed drinks! So worth it!

So my cousin and I came here for a celebratory dinner and I have to say dinner was fantastic! I order a Pasta Da Vinci (smothered in grated Parmesan is the only way, trust me) and he ordered the Shrimp Scampi &amp; Steak Diane. As an appetizer we had the Crab &amp; Artichoke dip. It was good! When our food arrived, unfortunately the steak was well done, BUT..Ashley our waitress immediately fixed that little problem and sent it back to the kitchen and revised it for us. Ashley was such a sweet gal, and she deserves every bit of good! Thank you Ashley for turning the night around, and to the kind manager who checked in on us to make sure we were okay. Five stars for customer service and all over kind. We&#39;ll be coming back!

Brought my mom here for her birthday celebration we had a great time in a lovely view of the Marina out here sunset is beautiful. The food is as good as always and the quality is always up to Par, will be back many many more times.

Now, nothing more than a &#34;used to be&#34;.....<br><br>I don&#39;t CF much; way too expensive but in the past, for something special, I&#39;d go. I&#39;ve been to many other locations from Honolulu to Miami...but this particular location in Redondo Beach was at one time only an annual thing after getting our taxes done. Tradition I guess.<br><br>Yesterday&#39;s meal: Chicken Chopped salad that my husband said was delicious. I ordered the teriyaki chicken and instead of rice, asked for noodles. The server said l could order any kind of noodles so I asked for angel hair. Got bow tie...and absolutely the driest pasta I&#39;d ever seen or tasted. Clumped together (you need a touch of oil if you serve it in a bowl with nothing on it...and it would have made a better presentation if the noodles were on the plate with the chicken on top, not in a bowl as if they were a side dish), the top of the noodles was dry and crispy and tasted old. The veggies that resembled stir fry were ok; the teriyaki glaze on the chicken was delicious....helped moisten the VERY dry chicken. These were chicken breasts that were flattened and over-cooked. A chicken wing was attached, which shouldn&#39;t be on a filleted chicken breast....Breast only. No bones. But again, the glaze was wonderful.<br><br>The s&#39;mores cheesecake....sinful. Rich. Sweet. Too big. Over-priced at $9 but that&#39;s CF. You know the prices going in...but the cheesecake was delicious none the less.<br><br>OK, but not the greatest meal, nor the greatest Cheesecake Factory experience.

We came here last night to celebrate my mom&#39;s birthday and service was great but will never come back again. My husband had the chicken Parmesan sandwich and garden salad and he got food poisoning.

I love this Cheesecake Factory that is right on the water.  We sat out on the patio... And it was great!!! It&#39;s huge and there&#39;s tons of seating.<br><br>The menu is incredible with something for everyone!!!

One my favorite CCF locations! There is always a wait, but usually not very long. I like the convenience of a valet or the option to self park (better to valet). The service is always very great. <br><br>Last visit we were seated in the patio area near the ocean. The scenery was very relaxing and pleasant. Our server (Nice, young african american male. First name begin with a W?)  was very attentive and courteous. We ordered salmon for my son, buttered pasta with shrimp for babygirl and I got my fav bistro shrimp pasta.<br><br>My son said the salmon was delicious! He usually order fish and chips, but he said this was almost better. For an extra $5, we added shrimp to my daughters kids pasta. There were 5 tiny shrimp on her plate. For $5 they should added 10 shrimp or at least 5 large shrimp! The bistro pasta was very tasty (as usual). Thin spaghetti in a creamy lemon sauce, shrimp, tomatoes, mushrooms and arugula. I always enjoy the bread and butter as well. Espcially the brown bread (it&#39;s either squaw or molasses bread). <br><br>For dessert we had the 30th year annivesary, s&#39;mores and Craig&#39;s outrages cheesecakes. The fav was the s&#39;mores cake, but they all were awesome! <br><br>I really, really , REALLY wish CCF would bring back the pecan pie cheesecake. Oh man, that was good!!!!!<br><br>It&#39;s been worth it every time I visit.

Husband and I had a Gift Card from our Anniversary and decided to grab dinner To Go. We called and were left waiting for almost 15 min and were wondering if that was normal. We stayed on the line cause we were hungry and well they took our order and we got there shortly after and watched sunset and then got our food pretty fast. When we got there it was over 75 people waiting and they were busy. Explained the waiting on the phone. We were super content with our food and it was delicious and didn&#39;t haven&#39;t to wait long time after calling and even enjoyed the banana creme Cheesecake. Overall experience on the TO GO was great. Really enjoyed the pasta and husband was happy with his Steak.. Amazing Location, Great Food, Customer Service was great!

Well I was going to complain about the extortion I encountered at the valet but I just looked at other reviews and saw many of the same complaints.<br>I almost always carry cash just in case but this time I forgot to bring some. Cash only valet which you find out after they have your car and keys. I was directed to shade hotel (New by the way) what did they do prior?? The ATM charged 5.00 does the valet owner operate that ATM?? Then my bank charged me another 2.50.  The food and fun at Cheesecake Factory is basic family friendly fun. Menu with something for everyone. The valet service here is completely unnecessary and therefore dampens the experience. Not to mention dodging bikes and pedestrians on the way in. Great job On the part of the City.

I&#39;m tired of this place always getting my order wrong! <br>I don&#39;t know how they stay so busy. I think it&#39;s because they have so many menu options. <br>Tonight I ordered fettuccine Alfredo with chicken ( we go NO chicken) and it was super bland and I ordered sourdough and brown bread and only got the brown. My advise on to go orders is to check before you drive away as I find its never correct. Poor service for big prices!

Well, I have to say that the management or upper levels of management got a huge 0 and all of the poor employees, chefs and workers got a 5 yesterday.  Yes ,Mother&#39;s day is always a bit chaotic and I understand it is worse so because of the pandemic, but the extremely unacceptable wait for food ordered online and 2-hr 15min delay is beyond unacceptable. Someone has to be realistic and update their computer software to limit the orders for takeout somehow. As a great example, Porto&#39;s in Buena Park started allowing online ordering at 4am. Only a certain amount of ordering slots were alotted each hour until filled up.They weren&#39;t trying to pack in orders and that gave a swift pick up experience. Yes, some did not get to order (me) because they were at their limit. How does Cheesecake Factory not realize this would be an issue and just go ahead and limit the amount of orders per hour?. I ordered at 1220p for a 3pm pick up . I figured maybe 30 minutes more of a wait past that could happen.Nope ,it was given at 515p! and then I get a text at 550pm saying my order is ready! This was either greed or bad management truly. The poor workers were getting  fussed at and running back and forth trying their best, but the poor souls never had a chance! I feel bad for them for having such a crappy experience, too. My hats off to them, but corporate dropped the ball.  Yes, you are losing money and need to get some in, but at the cost of so many ruined afternoons? I hope this was a learning experience in case Father&#39;s day rolls around and has to be done this way! My good was excellent, so thank you chefs who are probably icing their arms today!

Went for Happy Hour last week.<br><br>Service(A+, the server was on top of it!)<br><br>Location(A, right on the harbor)<br><br>Avocado Eggrolls(A, delicious)<br>Portabella, Avocado and Zucchini Fries(A, the garlic dipping sauce was great)<br>Southern Fried Chicken Sliders(B+, solid appetizer)<br><br>J.W&#39;s Pink Lemonade(B, Vodka, Raspberry Liqueur and Lemonade)

So far...sad <br><br>Birthday dinner  for the wife. Seating us in the corner in the back. Not a busy night up front but for some reason we sit in the boondocks. <br>Dirty table and the cushions covered in food. Looked like someone wasn&#39;t wiping down properly,  just pushed the food off the table onto the seats and floor. <br><br>Bang Bang chicken- Dry dry chicken. Wife sent it back for a chicken Parm sandwich which Was decent but not something she really wanted. Just played it safe with the usual which is the sandwich. <br><br>Jamaican Black Shrimp- good. Saucy. A little kick. Good plate here. <br><br>Drinks. Two Sodas. Refilled once. <br><br>Dessert. Black Out Cake- Good any day. <br><br>Waiter was all over the place. The poor guy was very tired. He had taken over for the original who first saw us when we seated but then had to go since his shift was over. So this new guy took over and he apologized to  us and the two tables beside us for his lack of service, but he said he was overwhelmed by to many tables he already has at the same time. So it became a waiting game for anything after the drinks. The waiter was sweating tired I saw his face giving up. I really wanted to help him. So I never asked for anything more. We just waited to catch him in a breather and then I&#39;d ask. <br><br>To cut it short. This waiter was obviously over worked. Someone should have helped him. But no one did. Where is the supervisor? <br><br>Besides that. It was a mediocre dinner.

My husband and I loved this Cheesecake Factory location when we visited back in March after we had finished viewing our wedding venue (just 5 minutes away in Redondo Beach).  We were hungry between appointments so we stopped by for some appetizers!  I ordered the ahi tuna appetizer, while my fiance (now husband) ordered some fish tacos. We also ordered some drinks - the mojito and margarita were excellent.  Very delicious!  And we had an awesome view of the water in Redondo Beach :)  In fact, we were seated by a window overlooking the marina.  Service was excellent, parking was ample, and we had a fantastic experience all around!

Oh why do I still go to these type of restaurants expecting good food?? I ordered the enchilada plate. Rice was old and hard. The enchilada sauce was just plain tomato sauce with no spice. My wife ordered chicken, it seemed like they just threw worsechiester sauce and oil on it. Definitely the food did not look fresh. Overpriced. We will not be coming back. The food was not worth $80. You pay for the view of the marina, i guess. With so many good spots in LA, these big chain restaurants are falling behind. But people still go...

After my awful experience at The Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica I thought I would never return to the chain again.<br><br>A friend suggested we meet up in Redondo Beach and decided he wanted to meet at Cheesecake Factory.  Upon entering I was greeted by the three people working at the front desk. Since this was a Thursday night we were seated right away. <br><br>Our server Gerardo G was beyond awesome... such a friendly and amazing guy.  We ordered and the food came rather quickly.  My friend had the meatloaf and I had the pasta carbonara with chicken. He raved about the meatloaf; however, while the pasta carbonara had plenty bacon and the noodles were hot and fresh the sauce was kinda bland. Maybe I am too picky, but I would try it again.<br><br>Overall, everything was great as the manager came by and introduced himself as we told him the service was awesome.<br><br>If you decide on this place ask for Gerardo!

I am a huge fan of chain restaurants, please don&#39;t slight or judge me. Ever since I was a child, my brother always bragged about the cheesecake factory, well he loves cheesecake.<br><br>The portions are humungous and so impressive! I ordered the shepherd&#39;s pie. Also at our table were orders of pasta, spaghetti, steak, and salad. We could have split the 5-dishes with only 3 and finished our food. Prices are around $15-$20 per entree, so a bit more than the average chain but they try to make up for it with the scrumptious flavors and large portions. This location is always always packed but it&#39;s because it&#39;s right on the water and fits crowds for birthdays perfectly. If you don&#39;t want to wait for a table, you can sit in the bar area (it is loud!) but you&#39;ll be seated almost immediately.

The Cheesecake Factory has honestly been one of my favorite restaurants in the South Bay so it makes me feel a bit heart broken writing this, but even though their food is quite good the customer service here is unsatisfactory. <br><br>Today was a prime example of a horrible experience I had when I ordered my favorite dish of Eggplant Parmesan and requested that the pesto be replaced with marinara(because of my allergies). The waitress came back a while later saying that the pasta itself was made with pesto and asked if that was okay, I said it wasn&#39;t and that I would like regular spaghetti pasta with marinara sauce. We had an understanding or so I thought. About half an hour passes and my meal finally arrives, but it&#39;s the wrong order. The waitress that came out with my dish was different from the waitress who took my order so she went to go consult with her about this error. I was out eating lunch with my mom and her order came out just fine(even though her order was modified too) so I told her to eat without me. <br><br>The waitress comes back about a minute later and tries to convince me that she made a mistake telling me that the pasta was covered in basil oil, not pesto, so there shouldn&#39;t be a problem. She then proceeds to ask me what I am specially allergic to within pesto which made me feel like she was trying to find a reason to get me to eat the incorrect order and not have it remade. I tell her this was not what I ordered and just it&#39;s presence in front of me started to give me a lot of anxiety. She retorts that I never said that I wanted marinara on my pasta and that I said I wanted it on my eggplant. Again, this woman was not my original waitress who took my order so I don&#39;t know where she got that from and as I even clearly stated before, I told my original waitress that I wanted regular spaghetti with marinara instead of the pesto. However, she kept pinning the blame  on me and looked at me like &#34;what do you want me to do about it&#34; so I told her I wasn&#39;t comfortable eating this and that I wanted what I ordered. She was obviously annoyed at this point and went back to the kitchen. <br><br>My order was brought out again and she asked it was correct, it wasn&#39;t, but I said it&#39;s fine because I didn&#39;t want to cause more of scene then this was already creating. My original waitress came by asking if everything was alright because she noticed that I haven&#39;t even touch the food after ten minutes and I tell her that I wanted to take the food home. She could clearly tell I was very upset at this point because I was on the verge of tears out of pure frustration so she quietly packaged it up and left it on our table. I ended up wasting about $20 on a incorrect order I was not satisfied with and what made this all worse was that it&#39;s not going to be eaten at all and was literally going to go to waste. <br><br>The only good thing that came out of this was the Fried Cheese small plate with marinara sauce I ordered before things went downhill. The Fried Cheese small plate ended up becoming my lunch along with two small slices of the free bread which was sad because I haven&#39;t eaten all day and was looking forward to a meal, not a snack with a side of attitude from that waitress. <br><br>The wait for the small plates was about 20 minutes while the main course took an additional 30 minutes. My mom actually ended up falling asleep waiting for the food to arrive which I thought was sad that service was slow enough that there was time for a nap. <br><br>Valet parking is available and is $4 during the day and goes up at night. There is also street parking available which I believe is about $1.50 or $1.75 an hour which may be cheaper than valet depending on how long you plan on staying so make sure to bring quarters.<br><br>There is also a great view of the marina and it&#39;s especially beautiful during sunset. The lighting inside the restaurant itself is quite dim so it&#39;s best to come during the day time when there is a lot of natural light if you want the best pictures of your food.

We went to the redondo beach location Cheesecake Factory and I definitely appreciate that they were able to accommodate our huge party (30) so quickly and last minute. The service by our server was as expected. The food Myself and my husband ordered was delicious; jambalaya, cheesecake, chocolate cake, Tex mex rolls! So delicious.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory last night with my family. I have ordered the crusted chicken Romano and ate only a little bit because I was pretty full from the bread, but I got my meal to go. Now I&#39;m eating it for breakfast and have found not one, but two small black hairs. I know these are not my hairs because I have pretty long brown hair and these were very small hairs. Now I have to throw away basically half my meal, and this one is not that cheap. Sucks cause it did taste really good, but that&#39;s just so gross.
The take out service was awesome and chicken farfalle amazing! I also had the corn tamale cakes which were yummy.

After our dinner which was great, service was great as well but as for our dessert I decided to grab it on the go I chose two flavors my total came out to 19 dollars for two slices! Only two slices so I figured okay they better be big slices for a ridiculous price of 9 dollars a slice welp I was sooo wrong they are tiny slices! I am so mind blown ! Was not what I expected and I&#39;m so disappointed that they would give such tiny slices for such a high price, all I wanted was to enjoy my dessert now I&#39;ll be eating my cheesecake baby slice thinking I could of bought a full cheese cake from costco for the price of one

Expectations always met; great patio; great drinks; great big portions.  You can&#39;t beat it.  You know what you&#39;re going to get.  (PS.  As Yelp&#39;ers, we like a little mystery and tend to go to boutique places)<br><br>* Bread &amp; Butter: It&#39;s free!  Amazing and usually warm, a dark bread (like squaw) and a baguette.  More please!?!<br><br>* Large menu / large food: Pages and pages of selections, and always leftovers.  Each plate is 2-3 portions.  My favs: Chinese Chicken Salad, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, Famous Factory Meatloaf, Chicken and Biscuits, Orange Chicken, Chicken Marsala and Mushrooms.  Ultimate favorite?  Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp.<br><br>* Great appetizers: Try the Parmesan-Garlic Cheese Bread, Avocado Eggrolls, Tex Mex Eggrolls, Ahi Carpaccio, and the Fried Calamari.  I nearly like the apps more than the food.<br><br>* Cheesecake: galore!  My favs are: Carrot Cake Cheesecake, White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake, Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake , Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake, Snickers Bar Chunks and Cheesecake, but my absolute fav, Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel Cheesecake.  (note: I repeated the word &#34;Cheesecake&#34;, because I can&#39;t get enough of it.  Cheesecake!)<br><br>===========================<br>What makes this location unique?<br>===========================<br><br>* Wonderful patio: Overlooking part of the marina, views of boats on the water is fantastic.  Second only to the Marina Del Rey location.<br><br>* Service: always nice, always well-trained.  Maybe a little hard to flag down because they cover a wide area, especially if on the patio (walking to/fro), and are busy.<br><br>* Valet parking: required for the lot, unless you want to do meter parking on the street which is 24/7.<br><br>* The wait: While you may have a little bit of a wait, it&#39;s worth it.
Food is always great here . But it doesn&#39;t get better than the desserts. <br><br>Some are too sweet some are just prefect.
Great people with great food. The service was great. Daniel R went above our expectations. This young man deserves 5 stars himself. Keep up the great service .

I always like coming to this Cheesecake Factory. The menu has a wide variety and a nice selection for anyone in your party.  The location is pretty--it&#39;s right by the ocean, and you can see all of the boats outside in the marina.  The overall atmosphere is nice, from the décor to the friendly staff. Also, the restaurant and bathrooms are kept pretty clean. Parking is not the best, but if you don&#39;t want to valet, it&#39;s not usually too difficult to find metered street parking across the street.<br><br>Appetizers:<br>Let me first start off by saying that I love crab cakes. I mean LOVE. Whenever I see them on a menu at any restaurant, I am immediately drawn towards them.  So over the years, I&#39;ve had quite a few different ones. I can honestly say that Cheesecake Factory has THE best crab cakes I&#39;ve ever had. They are my absolute favorite! I am a little disappointed, though, that lately they have become smaller and smaller...but other than that, they are amazing! These crab cakes contain a lot of crab!...not just filler like many other restaurants.<br><br>Avocado Egg Rolls are also a must-try! The contrast between the avocados, sun-dried tomatoes, and tamarind-cashew dipping sauce, create wonderfully complex flavors of sweet, salty, and tangy.<br><br>Entrée favorites:<br>- Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta - Lot of veggies, but delicious flavor! The sun-dried tomatoes and pine nuts definitely make this dish!<br>- Bistro Shrimp Pasta - I&#39;m pretty sure I saw this on one of those lists of really unhealthy pasta dishes...but let me tell you, it is worth those calories! Crispy battered shrimp, fresh mushrooms, tomato, and arugula tossed with spaghettini and a basil-garlic-lemon cream sauce. Does that not sound amazing or what?!<br>- Pan-Seared Salmon with Angel Hair - The lemon-caper sauce is really good!<br>- Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic - Mushrooms, pancetta, and peas are great combination in any pasta!<br><br>Dessert:<br>I know we&#39;re talking about The Cheesecake Factory here, but truthfully, I&#39;m not the biggest fan of cheesecake. GASP, I know. However, they do have a few non-cheesecake options, to which I am very pleased with. Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake is definitely the way to go if you want something sweet, rich, and chocolate-y! A slice of this 7-layered cake is HUGE, so make sure you bring someone to share it with!....or not...

It&#39;s located right by the water and if you sit by the window you can have a great dock side view while you eat. They have a heated outdoor area also which is great for the evenings/nights. They&#39;re pushy with their valet parking which isn&#39;t free. They should offer free valet for people who eat there. There is a side for free parking but the space is very limited and most slots are reserved for carry out.

I went there with my family on my birthday. Most of the stuff we came for was out, no ahi tuna, no artichoke, not even brown bread. Not acceptable. <br><br>I don&#39;t really understand whats the need for a valet on a empty parking lot either. Either way, We&#39;ll try a different CCF next time.

Came to watch the cavs game and asked over 4 employees to put the game on and still didnt happen...i finally walked over to the host stand to ask the manager to put the game on...still did not happen...bartender was no help at all...wish i could come back but after this circus show just to watch a basketball game...wont be back.  Way better places around cheese cake ..   Thumbs down...thanks for the great experience

Parking sucks. Only real parking available is valet. There is 5x more space for valet than normal parking. The valet staff is rude. The food is not good enough to put up with that nonsense. Won&#39;t be coming back here again.

Came here for my nephew and I birthday ;)  we enjoyed our time . Food was your typical Cheesecake Factory food :)  there is no self park at this place and valet for lunchtime $2.50 <br>There&#39;s sitting outside and inside .. Nice view of the water.

I have frequented this location over the past couple of years- and am always met with exceptional service, a great view, and tasty dishes. <br><br>Our waitress Sara is lovely! :) She recommended a couple of dishes that were delectable, and was so pleasant and friendly every time she checked up on us. <br><br>Altogether, the staff are friendly. The Valet even pointed us to an area where parking is free. (avoiding the 4$ charge) Not only that, one of the servers (who brought out our dishes + showered the pasta in cheese) went out of his way to bring our table Sriracha, even though for some reason the bottle exploded on him when he opened it! (he came back with splatters on his shirt), + with a HUGE grin and good attitude despite that happening. <br><br>The view is beautiful. It adds to creating a pleasant ambiance! I would definitely recommend bringing a date or your mama here :) <br><br>yum:<br>-Sweet Corn Tamale cakes (has sour cream, salsa, avocado &amp; salsa verde). It reminds me of corn bread, with a twist!<br>-Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta (has chicken, asparagus, peppers, peas, garlic, etc). This pasta dish has so many different textures, and comes in abundance! My friend and I split this dish and didn&#39;t even finish the whole thing. It leans toward the creamier side, but is delish to have once in awhile. <br>-Carrot Cheesecake (ONE OF MY FAVORITES)

Great customer service at this location, even though it was really busy my party of 5 was sat very quickly. A busser brought cut up  bread and bananas to my kids which Ive never had at Cheesecake Factory but it was greatly appreciated.<br> Our apps and food came out really quickly for how busy it was.

The hostess was very curt and off putting. She told me that I couldn&#39;t hold a table for a few minutes while I waited for a few more members of my party to arrive- in a very vacant restaurant.<br><br>Update:<br>I later found out that there was a very large private party going on on the second floor, which added some extra stress to the staff.<br><br>Once seated, our sever was amazing, and the food was delicious, so I&#39;m updating my review accordingly.

I have been here before other then the food being and tasting so good, the service here was terrible because they were busy but the server was slow and they were backed up. They were very nice tho and they explained how busy they were. It could have been better.

The Redondo Beach Cheesecake Factory used to be the best in the LA area, but it has gone downhill severely in the past few years as the prices have gone higher and service and quality have suffered. The lackluster wine is crazily overpriced for a half glass and the coffee is outright disgusting.  It is hobo coffee that has been laying around all day. Their espresso is no better. It&#39;s obvious they are use cheap rancid beans. The signature dishes are still tasty thanks to copious butter and the fish and meat are still good quality. The outside patio area needs to be cleaned and repainted and the view of the harbor is its only saving grace. Also, the clientele and servers leave much to be desired. It has become an overpriced Norms with cheesecake, except Norms has decent coffee.

The location for this specific Cheesecake Factory is amazing. I mean, right on the marina? It&#39;s the perfect date spot! I saw a lot of couples on dates and anniversaries here while I dined with family. The hostess was very pleasant and sat us right away. 6pm on a weekday is the perfect time to come as when we were leaving around 7.30, there was a line out the door. <br><br>Our server David was very nice but all his &#34;lines&#34; seemed rehearsed. He misinformed us about an appetizer we ordered but he was very gracious and apologetic when I pointed it out. It wasn&#39;t a big deal. 5 stars for him. <br><br>The food here is never that great but people come because they&#39;re BIG PORTIONS. Mashed potatoes with the shrimp scampi was delicious. The chicken piccata was good too but after a while you get sick of it cos it&#39;s very rich. Jambalaya pasta, STAY AWAY if you&#39;ve ever had jambalaya elsewhere or even know what it is. The jambalaya here should be renamed as chicken with bell peppers (not spicy at all). <br><br>All in all it was a pleasant experience. I&#39;ve been here about 10 yrs ago when I first moved to the US. Wasn&#39;t impressed then, isn&#39;t impressed now. The service is what gave this place my 4 stars. The hostess, our server, and the Filipino valet guy were all so great and professional.

Terrible experience. They force you to use valet parking to park near them, charge you $4.50 and the valets tampered with my possessions. Service was terrible. I wasted a little milk on the table from my coffee and asked the waitress to bring something to clean it up.  She dropped off towels and left the wet towels on the table. Did not offer to clean up the mess. The wait staff kept interrupting our conversation and only paid attention to the female member of our party, showing me their backs. Rude staff. I called the manager and they never gave me a discount for the poor service. Babies everywhere were screaming. This is not the place to go for a nice quiet dinner or to have a conversation. It was stressful from beginning to end. Long wait to get in.

Like eating here anytime of the day . everything on the menu taste delicious. Dessert is good too. Drinks are good  but expensive. Make them at home. Service was good.llan to order everything on menu Sooner or later, it will take some time.

The food was not too bad but the service was HORRIBLE. Took over twenty minutes to just order the food. And an hour to actually receive the food. Our waiter was NOWHERE to be found. And it took twenty minutes to receive a slice of PRE-MADE cheesecake. Only thing our waiter was quick at was getting our check.

This is a nice location. Had a great night out with awesome food and drinks. Our server, Amorina, did an amazing job being friendly, making sure our drinks were full and food was good. Will definitely be coming back for great food and service.

Today I celebrated 20 years with my company and select this place to celebrate with my family and coworkers. We were very happy with the set up and the beautiful view we had.  The customer service was great they were very nice and had no complaints. Everyone at the lunch was very happy how everything ended. The food and dessert was delicious. They had a drinking bar that was very convenient for everyone to serve themselves as needed. My kids were very happy with there order and the time they took.

The chicken and shrimp jambalaya here is amazing and they let his tie rods are good to with chicken or shrimp you won&#39;t be disappointed. If you&#39;re looking for a wonderful drink lady try the shaking lemon drops they are really good

This place has not so good customer service.   We got here at 6:45pm. Waited about 10-15 minutes for a table not bad.  Let&#39;s talk about the server.  First got our drinks fairly fast.  Waited 15 minutes to take our order never checked on us.  That was 7:15.. we just got our food it&#39;s 7:37.  Again, haven&#39;t checked on us.  My drink is empty.   7:40 finally heard from the waiter.  Guess what my dish is done wrong.  I come to this place for the chicken Bellagio.  Now I don&#39;t have food to eat.  At this point I just wanna leave and never come back. When I asked the manager back he said do you want my manager to tell you that. The server name is Paulo .  I said yes!  My party finished eating before I did. I will never come back here.
Normally we love coming here because the food is always excellent. We were triple wammed tonight on poor service, freezing cold crammed seating area &amp; our food was cold. Extremely disappointing!

I&#39;m not sure what happened but I went there for my birthday dinner 10/09/19 and the food and service was bad.  We were seated right away which was nice.  It took about 15 minutes for someone to come by our table and take our drink order; we order our appetizers at that time also.  While we did our drinks promptly it took another 20-30 minutes to get our appetizers. When the appetizers came the avocado rolls were barely luke warm and the Brussel sprouts were raw/cold.  When I was finally able to get the waiters attention he took them back to be cooked. The entrees took a long time and were cold too.  At that point we were just tired of waiting and ready to go home. It seems like that particular night they were under staffed (something was really off). It&#39;s a shame to spend so much and have a bad experience.

Great place to come down to on a sunny day, to sit on the patio, and have a view of the marina while enjoying some good food.  Absolutely loved the tuna tataki salad last time I was there. Restaurant does a really good job working with various food allergies which is nice.  Kid friendly as well.

This rating is purely about the take out service and policy. <br>As a customer I was instructed to place my order on line to avoid a 10-20 minute wait time just to place my order by phone.<br><br>This is a complete failure is customer obsession and a positive experience. <br><br>I order from other restaurants and I want to point out CPK has their focus spot on. When you call in during busy times, an outside service picks up in a quiet surrounding. They know who I am based on my call in ID and after I order commit to a time. <br><br>Never have I sat on hold so long as to hear 4 songs until I finally gave up. I called back and asked for a manager and simply it was restated they have online options or I could wait for one of the two people who could help me after they completed the other calls.<br><br>Well my order apparently (would have been a decent size for 4 people) will now go to another restaurant who is customer focus from the moment it starts.
This is one of my favorite restaurants. The food is fabulous and many things to try out. Highly recommend

I don&#39;t usually care to write reviews for big chains, but this Cheesecake Factory is legit. Ask to sit on the outside patio if it&#39;s a beautiful day!  The service is great, the ambiance can&#39;t be beat with plenty of space and located right on the water, and the food and drinks... impressive menu, big portions, consistent flavors (esp important if you are the type that orders the same thing every time), and really tasty. Don&#39;t forget to order a slice of cheesecake! TIP: Only eat half of your meal so you can get the yummy dessert =) The slices are HUGE and I generally share with a couple people (and we don&#39;t always finish).<br><br>They have a good sized banquet room and bar upstairs. We almost had our wedding reception here (they can set up your ceremony there too) but it could not accommodate our 200+ guest list. I&#39;ve been here for a buffet style birthday lunch as well and the party attendees were not disappointed. <br><br>The only reason I&#39;m docking is because of the required valet ($4). NOTE-There is metered street parking available now if you would rather save a couple dollars.

Ordered the the Ribeye steak but was served a club steak. $28 <br>I&#39;ve work in a meat dept long enough to know the difference. <br>I didn&#39;t make a stink as the server was polite and had done her job well, so here I am on Yelp.

Disappointed ,coffee cold and old weak,salad soggy  and steak was burnt. The customer  service  was good ,the manager  was  wonderful  and gave us a discount  for food being so late so we were embarrassed  to complain  about the overdone steak basically  we left the whole plate . The salad was not crispy  it was soggy for the money they charge they should have better food. Also the piece of  Cheesecake  we got was so small for the price not good.

Seven of us went for happy hour and dinner. The  happy hour drinks were a bargain and the appetizers were delicious. All of us really liked our dinner entrees and felt they were creative and excellent. Good time.

We came on a Sunday night, 30 min wait, lobby was packed. We were really hungry, so out of curiosity, we checked the bar out, plenty of open tables. We ordered buffalo blasts, herb crusted salmon, and bbq ranch chicken salad. Surprisingly, despite the wait, service was fast and friendly. Food came out fast as well. We had Travis as our server, he was great.

I always find this to be one of the better cheesecake factorys to visit and dine at. I&#39;ve been to quite a few locations around the USA. They some how have a wide choice of food items to cater to almost any individual. Tonight&#39;s server was Kevin during my visit on 10-14-17.  Look forward to visiting this location again when i can.

I&#39;m not sure how many of you are familiar with their Sunday Brunch but if you are in search of something special, give their Ricotta Lemon Pancakes and their Brioche French Toast a try. The pancakes are my first favorite... very rich with Ricotta and zesty with the lemon. I&#39;ve personally tried to make them and they just did not come out the same. The Brioche French Toast is decent and huge. Both are great for sharing. <br><br>This popular spot packs a unique breakfast to be tried and tried again. The view of the marina in the morning is pleasant and you can always follow with a stroll to the pier if you are too full to make it back to bed.

Went for dinner with my baby to redeem a gift card. We went on Saturday night during Halloween which was awesome! While most were out trick or treating the streets were quiet and so it was easy to find parking and get seating on an otherwise busy evening. <br><br>Our server Wendy was nice courteous and professional. We started with a fresh house salad and bread with olive oil. My girl had tempura shrimp with flatbread pizza which was tasty and delicious. A bit on the heavy side but tasty nonetheless. <br><br>I had the veggie burger on brioche with fries. The bun was a little thick but the burger was well cooked. We finished with a seven later chocolate cake which was decadently rich but more like seventeen layers. We&#39;re still finishing it today. <br><br>Will definitely be back and this time will eat a little lighter. The only real challenge is that there are almost too many choices and the portions are too large. If they can pair both down they&#39;re fully on point.

This place is always provides an entertaining environment for evening fun with friends and family. If you&#39;ve been to any Cheesecake Factory, you would know that they are great for appetizers, dinner, or dessert. You can rest assured that you will always find a wait before sitting down for your dining pleasure. This restaurant in one of the more popular spots around the Redondo Beach area, so enjoy the atmosphere with your dinner and have a great time!

I&#39;m sure a poor review won&#39;t make any difference to this behemoth. It&#39;s a shame. I used to always say that&#39;s one big chain restaurant that almost always delivers a positive experience. Sadly not true anymore. Sorta like buca di beppo (what in the world happened to that place?).<br><br>Even though I asked for an inside table, the hostess suggested first available as it would be a long wait. Our buzzer went off quickly then we were sent through a parade of empty tables and booths inside to literally the farthest table outside. The waiter there visited us once every 30 min or so. And even apologized repeatedly and thanked us for being patient. Which was weird because it was a Thursday night at 9pm and it wasn&#39;t that busy. <br><br>Food was ok. About the level of BJ&#39;S. But rather expensive for the level of food which is a glamorized Dennys. <br><br>The kicker was everyone in our party had diarrhea all night. Thank you for a literally s****y night.

I took my friends who never been to LA before at this location. And I was PRETTY disappointed.<br>meatball spaghetti: meatball was not heated up enough <br>Everything pizza: it&#39;s better to get frozen pizza at the target <br>Steak: we asked medium rare, but it was medium well done<br><br>Also we got a cup of coffee and there was something dirty on the cup. The waitress(looked like a manager?) didn&#39;t apologize with that and just took them away. Then She brought the coffee back with just removing the dirty on the cup. It was not a new cup or new coffee. We were unpleasant but didn&#39;t even want to expect or ask the better service from them. We just left.

Free parking is limited, probably not even twenty spaces. Otherwise you have to pay $4.50, which is self park/valet. Steer parking is metered &amp; doesn&#39;t accept credit cards. So the area is not parking friendly at all unless you intend to pay. The bar doesn&#39;t have a tv; it&#39;s located in the dining area. Overall, just not a bad experience, just not convenient depending on what you&#39;re looking for.
Fried Mac and Cheese Balls?  These were sooo good!  They were perfectly crispy and the marinara sauce hit the spot!  @eat.drink.post

I come to this location quite often, but recently I came to grab a few slices of cheesecake and had the most pleasant experience due to a wonderful girl named Mia. She was so kind, prompt and personable. I ordered the s&#39;more cheesecake &amp; asked her to toast my marshmallow topping just a bit more than usual ( basically burn it) lol  and she happily made sure it was super perfect for me. <br><br>Thank you Mia :)
Nice family dinner with a great view and great service. Made reservations and got seated right away, food was amazing!

Ok not bad, crowded as fck.  I don&#39;t take the Ferrari,  maserati or bugatti here, only brings the porsche, don&#39;t like the valets to rough handle my babys. Good food, i wonder if the other customers leave they nice cats in the garage too?
No.thanks im done ?mmm never again i dont give 2nd chance n ur not gonns change the parking anyhow bye Felicia

My hubby &amp; I didn&#39;t request to sit near a great view, but we got one anyway. We were seated outside under an umbrella. I wish the umbrellas casted more shade, but my husband wasn&#39;t bothered too much by his arm getting burned. The views of the marina were nice. I had only two complaints about this place...<br><br>1). Valet parking is $4. My hubby didn&#39;t want to use their services so he asked to park our car himself. It just doesn&#39;t seem like a valet restaurant. Very unnecessary. Maybe next time we&#39;ll use the meters on the street. <br><br>2). Sparrows &amp; other small birds kept flying in for scraps. <br><br>When we had lunch here, it was a Monday at around 11:30. It was moderately busy while we were there, then when we left at around 12:30, a few groups were waiting to be seated. <br><br>The restrooms were clean. They are located at the front to the left of the desserts, fyi. <br><br>I had the turkey sandwich with a side salad from the lunch menu. The portions are generous. To drink, I had the &#34;Frozen Iced Mango.&#34; It was so delicious. It even came with a slice of pineapple which I don&#39;t care for, but I even nibbled on it a little. I just wish they had blended it a little more. It was a little on the chunky side. <br><br>Our waitress was extremely attentive and friendly. She tried fairly hard to get us to order some dessert, but I had to decline. I don&#39;t have a yearning for sweets after every meal is all. <br><br>While I am not Cheesecake Factory crazy like some people I know, this location is a fantastic one.<br><br>Review #195

It has been a long time since I been here and I remember that the food was really good, but today WOW it was great. Had the chicken salad and some wings and my son ( Sahm Irvine ) of all the places in the world he just had to have a burger with fries.<br><br>The services was 100% great and the restaurant was very clean not too loud and not too busy. We both had a lot of fun here.<br><br>I will make sure that we keep coming back here for now on. And lets not forget about the cheesecake, our tummy did not have enough room but maybe next time.....Food is great all around.<br><br>Harry Irvine
While this is a chain, being on the water and with a local staff it has a beach feel. It&#39;s perfect when you just don&#39;t know what you feel like eating and want a great view.
This specific restaurant is being sued for discrimination, very disappointing news, some of the staff does always seem a little standoffish.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory for happy hour for the first and I might say its very impressive, the drinks is worth every penny, and the appetizers of course is amazing, the dish I had was a burger it comes with two patties which is great, I will be back nice place to socialize and hang with friends for a reasonable price, I WILL BE BACK

8 regular parking spots for self parking and 50 for valet.  So basically it&#39;s forced valet for the majority of your customers.  This is piss poor customer service.  It&#39;s one thing to offer the service, it&#39;s another to force customers to use it.

Simply AMAZING! I was craving chicken piccata and I was near the Redondo Beach area. I was very pleased to say the least. The staff is extremely friendly and the food was very delicious!! This is the first time I&#39;ve had EXCELLENT at any restaurant! Our waiter Rob was AMAZING! He was very knowledgeable. He breaks down the meal you choose and asks if everything (the ingredients) are everything that you&#39;re okay with. He&#39;s very energetic and is simply fun to talk to. He&#39;s is so funny as well!! The restaurant is also by the water, so you get a view of the ocean and boats. Very nice! I&#39;m sold! I&#39;ll never visit another Cheesecake Factory again. This will be my go to from now on! Thank you Rob! <br><br>&#34;It&#39;s not my job, it&#39;s my pleasure!&#34; -Rob

At first our service started of horrible but the manager Megan come and made sure we received a good server. We had Tyler and he was very excellent he was very attentive we really appreciated his service and the way The manager Megan made sure we received our food in a timely manner thank you

I love this resturant, I have been coming here since I was a child.Sadly, I wont be going to this location again.The service is terrible.I went on a wednesday, no crowd, and had to wait over an hour for my food.The server who attended us was lost in his own world and worked at a very slow pace.I asked for some reccomendations, he didnt have the slightest clue to anything.<br><br>After my shrimp fettucino came, it was room temperature.I complained to the server and he said it is served lile this.I never had such cold pasta.<br><br>You lost a loyal customer cheescake!

Sometimes, it&#39;s just better to go corporate because you know that all the locations are consistent. My daughter and stopped here for dinner. We sat outside overlooking the harbor.<br><br>I had the endive salad. My daughter had a main course and dessert. She was happy, and that is all that matters to a mother.

Somehow I almost always end up here whenever my parents are in town to visit and it&#39;s not even because of the cheesecake!<br><br>FOOD:<br>I ordered the Pasta Da Vinci and I had them substitute the penne pasta for bow-tie pasta this time. They can substitute for other pastas as well which is a nice option. Portion size is pretty big here and it&#39;s often hard for me to finish what I order. You can always take part of it home though so you can save some room for a slice of cheesecake :)<br><br>The Pasta Da Vinci comes with sautéed chicken, mushrooms, and onions in a wine sauce. The chicken is tender and slightly crispy at the edges. Overall most pieces aren&#39;t too dry to eat comfortably. The sauce has a hint of sweetness to it and you can barely taste the wine. Solid dish. One of my favorites when the pasta doesn&#39;t come swimming in sauce which is what happened this time unfortunately. In general the pasta dishes here are usually quite oily and the sauce quite heavy so I like to request for the sauce on the side. It&#39;s a hit or miss with this request because sometimes they get it right and sometimes they don&#39;t. When it does, I&#39;d give it a 4/5, otherwise like this time, unfortunately it&#39;d only be a 3/5.<br>Overall: 3/5<br><br>SERVICE:<br>Usually within a few minutes of sitting down, someone comes by to drop off some warm bread to snack on. It&#39;s always nice when you have to wait a bit for your server to come, which is typical for a Friday or Saturday night. We didn&#39;t have to wait too long for our food to arrive and our server checked up on us from time-to-time.<br>Overall: 4/5<br><br>DECOR/AMBIANCE:<br>Casual. They try to make the restaurant more upscale by dimming the lights at night and having a heated outdoor patio. The restaurant is situated at a nice spot overlooking the bay but you can&#39;t see much at night. There is a bar area off to the right where people can watch sports and grab drinks. You can also eat there as well if you don&#39;t mind smaller tables. Some of the tables in the restaurant itself are a bit small and it can get cramped, especially if you&#39;re at a table for 2.<br>Overall: 4/5<br><br>There is a parking lot out front but it is valet only unfortunately. There are a handful of spots to the right of the lot for people picking up to-go orders. If you&#39;re lucky maybe you can snag one of the metered parking spots along the street on Harbor Drive or park by the pier and walk over. Overall a casual, kid friendly place that&#39;s perfect for parties and dinners with friends and family.

First off this post is all about the service. The food was good and the experience was even better. Reasons why..<br><br>MARCIO D. made it one the best experiences I have ever been in a restaurant.
