Greeted us with a smile from the start. Made great suggestionds to me withy drink (Cucomber lemonade) my lunch (herb crusted chicken). He checked on us every 5-10 minutes, he was pleasant the whole time AND because it was my lady&#39;s birthday... He sang to her.... Who does that and had the pleasure to do it?  MARCIO!!!!<br><br>He made it Tue best experience I have ever had in any restaurant. He is the man and I&#39;d go if I knew he was waiting on us.... <br><br>Great service and a super cool dude. He alone gets 4.5 stars, the food gets the difference. Lol
The service was great, we did not have to wait long,  the food was excellent and we got to look out at the water while eating which was a triple plus

Valet or street parking only, which was ridiculous<br><br>The service was ok, but you could tell they were stretched thin.. took a while for her to take our order<br><br>The soda was flat.. asked for another one, but still no carbonation<br><br>No birthday desert.. thought they used to give one.. The server brought us a mini double shot glass sundae &amp; they sang, which was nice<br><br>My son ordered the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake, which he said was delicious<br><br>The food tasted good, medium priced &amp; large portions.. unfortunately it gave my son and I food poisoning..<br><br>***Overall disappointing experience, wont go back

The food is always good, but the service last night was lacking. Our server (tall dude with thick beard) forgot to bring bread, butter, beer, lemon. Had to constantly ask other wait staff as our food was getting cold. Also, he refused to serve me my birthday sundae - my birthday was just a few days past. His response, &#34;My birthday was in April.&#34; Rude. I should have called the manager. Our bill was well over $200 and I should have gotten that sundae for free. Had my family there who just arrived from out of town as well.
If you expect me to spend $25 on an entree, you better not mess it up. Now if you want me to never eat there again, mess up the same entree TWICE.

Went for a business meeting with three of us. Arrived at the restaurant at opening on a Friday, 11:30 a.m. and it was already getting busy.<br><br>My only complaint is about the huge size of the menu; really too big! So I gave up on that and ordered from the Skillylicious menu which is their collection of fresh options with lower calories. <br><br>I had a garden salad - small - that was not small at all. Very tasty. Enough veggies - carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes  and zucchini - that I didn&#39;t even need dressing. Nor could I finish it. <br><br>For the main course, I had Shrimp Summer Rolls. There were 4 - 6 wrapped rolls with asparagus, shrimp, mushroom, cilantro and rice noodles served with peanut dipping sauce. There was too much food to finish. <br><br>The two others I was with enjoyed theirs as well. One of the gentlemen was on a very restrictive diet and requested much of it on the side and our server had no problems with any of the requests. She was super prompt and polite and her service was excellent. <br><br>I recommend The Cheesecake Factory for a nice lunch overlooking the harbor. The view was excellent! Sort of know what you want to eat or expect to spend 15 minutes reading the choices. Although we skipped it this time, the cheesecake is also excellent with white raspberry chocolate being my favorite. <br><br>Valet parking is $2.50 or you could probably park not right in the harbor at no cost.

I came here for my bday (dinner) on the Monday. The wait wasn&#39;t bad. I can&#39;t recall our sever name but I definitely will remember her face right away. We&#39;ve order a appetizer buffalo blast she came back 15 min early saying &#34;we run out of buffalo blast&#34; didn&#39;t explain why? We&#39;ve ordered our dinner and never brought us bread. She doesn&#39;t come back and check on us (how rude) I was so disappointed at Cheesecake Factory. Customer service isn&#39;t great like it used to be. I had to ask for another server to  help us out. Not sure if the management is diff but I am not satisfied with the service. Sucks because this one of my favorite restaurant to go!
As usual great food great service. My favorite place to visit either its my birthday or friends birthday.
Always good service friendly staff the only thing I don&#39;t like there the parking other than that highly recommend it

A sweet lunch @Cheesecake Factory for the sweetest mom ever :).<br><br>Happy Mother&#39;s Day! I took my mom out to lunch at The Cheesecake Factory today for a Mother&#39;s Day lunch.<br><br>I love this Cheesecake Factory location because it has a great view of the Redondo Beach harbor! It&#39;s so lovely to be enjoying lunch with my lovely mom enjoying a lovely view. The blue skies, sunny day and pretty boats made for a great view.<br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=dDHGb9kpkmlO10aYaS_svw&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>We started off lunch here with some warm complimentary bread! They bring out two types of bread, sourdough and squaw bread. I like the squaw bread the best. It has a slight taste of sweet. <br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=FKfwx7FXq4XGmdRp2a3M3Q&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>My mom and I chose to get the portabella mushroom, avocado and zucchini fries from the small plates menu. I like the small plates menu because they are small sides that are like appetizers at a cheaper price. These fries we got were only $6.95. It was a such a great deal! Three types of yummy breaded and fried veggies that were served piping hot along with two types of yummy dipping sauce.<br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cdql8ODXH7qjUuLAgAwoBQ&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>The menu of Cheesecake Factory is huge! I am fond that there are several vegetarian items and a skinnylicious menu with healthier entrees that are still yummy but less calories. <br><br>One of the nicest vegetarian entrees I have gotten is the garlic noodles. It has asparagus, shiitake mushrooms and oven roasted tomatoes on top of spaghettini noodles with garlic sauce.<br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=9bj5HOg3RLGmuzqIGRvqwg&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>My mom&#39;s favorite is shrimp with linguine. It&#39;s a great looking dish with long thin noodles topped with large succulent shrimp!<br> <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=O3MO2MkZ6ylXICmSHuG7bw&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>For this Mother&#39;s Day lunch, my mom and I ordered two classic favorites. My mom got the most popular chicken dish, chicken madeira! It is no wonder this is so popular because it is delicious. There are two large chicken breasts topped with asparagus, mushroom madeira sauce and mozzarella cheese! It comes with two large scoops of mashed potatoes too! It&#39;s one large and tasty meal. <br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=1LRKwAqNdjizRsxx1d-NuQ&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>I chose to get the lunch portion meatloaf! I was so surprised at how big the lunch portion is! It comes with two large meat patties that were topped with thick gravy and grilled onions. It came with a side of mashed potatoes and corn succatosh. The meatloaf and mashed poatoes were so soft. They pratically melted in my mouth! The succotash had a such a great flavor to it.<br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ylDUaEhGrPk6ZhbFe4Z2fw&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>My review would not be complete without mentioning the cheesecake here! It&#39;s one of the hardest decisions on which cheesecake flavor to get. There are so many! <br><br>My mom and I tried the Oreo dream extreme. I loved how it was topped with an Oreo cookie! It&#39;s more chocolate flavored versus Oreo though, thus making it very chocolatey bold and rich in taste.<br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=7VmKtGuwj8xSzczxX7uONw&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>Our favorite cheesecake is the red velvet! It is just the right amount of sweet. The layers of red velvet cake is nice and moist! <br><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=GP2iK7CVcbU64ceQVXl2IA&amp;userid=H4BiIX0gU-Fc2S487g7z1Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a><br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a wonderful place for bonding with my mom. It has a nice view and good eats! My mom deserves no less than the best and I am thankful this place offers the best variety. Every item we have tried here is scrumptious and awesome! Thanks The Cheesecake factory for making my mom happy

How can you not love the Cheesecake Factory? We were seated within a few minutes since it was relatively busy. Our server was friendly and pretty knowledgeable on the menu, it is a huge menu. We ordered the mushrooms, tomato basil pasta, and sweet corn tamale cakes. I&#39;ve been to many different Cheesecake Factory&#39;s around the US and this was just as great as the rest! The pasta was delicious, the chicken was hot and perfectly cooked. The mushrooms were very tasty as were the sweet corn tamale cakes, those are a hidden gem on the menu! The only issue with our visit was the parking, we had to pay I think $5 for valet parking, you cannot park the car yourself, and there is not a lot of parking on the streets. Redondo Beach is not exactly in LA, and to profit off of $5 just to eat at a restaurant was not favorable. Other than that, we would go back and try a slice of cheesecake next time! Highly recommend!!

Kinda over did it on refeed day...so full, but worth it.<br><br>Got there at around 6:30 on a Friday night, and already pretty crowded. They don&#39;t allow everyone to be seated until the entire party here but luckily the people we were meeting up with were already there.<br><br>Never been there at night, but the interior was dimly lit, great for an intimate date night out. Unfortunately, the place we were sat didn&#39;t have any direct light over so reading the menu and eating got to be a little difficult.<br><br>We started off with the chicken taquitos, the Nashville nuggets, and the calamari.<br><br>The chicken tacquitos were great, definitely a huge upgrade compared to any hole in the wall Mexican take out place. Nashville nuggets had a spicy flavor that went great with the ranch it came in.<br><br>The entree I got was the chicken maderie with the herb crusted salmon. Came with a side of mashed potatoes and string beans. The salmon could&#39;ve used some more salt/flavor, but the sauce that the chicken came with went great with the mushrooms on the side.<br><br>For desert we had the cheesecake, tiramisu cheesecake, and the apple pie, damn we were stuffed. The cheesecake was pretty dense but delicious, whereas the tiramisu cheesecake was much lighter.<br><br>Last but not least, love the bread and butter that comes with it.

Though they tend to overbrown the bread on my girlfriend&#39;s Cuban sandwich, everything else is fantastic, especially the cheesecake.  <br><br>Not crazy about mandatory valet parking ($4), either.  We have a wheelchair tag, but those spots are almost always full.
Waited 20 min to get drink orders. Waited 40mins to actually get drinks... over an hour and still waiting while others around us who got here later already eating....

How can I say this place is so so good.<br>Some of the best cheesecake I have ever had.<br><br>The burgers are on point. Steaks are great, everything is really good.<br>Me and my family love their buffalo blast.<br><br>Great atmosphere with a great view of the ocean.
Gave 1 star because there is no -1 star<br>Want to have food poison come here<br>The place is dark so you don&#39;t see the c r a p food you are eating

In recent years,The Cheesecake Factory has become like a factory where the establishment crew performs in a perfunctory manner and the food is laced with mediocracy. It is a place where quantity supersedes quality and thrives.

Did not necessarily mind the long wait due to Sat night before Mother&#39;s Day.  Did mind being set in open air section with no warning.  Ordered to go cheesecake.  Opened today to see I had been purposely given a shortened price of cheesecake.  Whipped cream strategically placed to cameofloge the shortened piece.  No Bueno
Asked for a well done burger and I had a totally burnt and bitter one. Not what I was expecting.<br>Too dark, too busy and you are forced to pay for valet parking plus the tip. Will never  be back.

The great thing about Cheesecake Factory is there is always something for everyone!!<br><br>I love their Vegan Cobb salad delicious! So many veggies and I love it.<br><br>Fish and chips is done so well it&#39;s still light and flaky with tummy fries.<br><br>If like fish their miso salmon is delicious. I always crave this one.<br><br>Avocado egg rolls is another favorite! <br><br>Cheesecake:<br>- Red velvet cheesecake<br>-chocolate Godiva cheesecake<br>- just plain is always a good choice

We&#39;re huge fans on TCCF but this location is really old, tired and run down. Do yourself a favor and go to the one in Marina Del Rey on the water or 3rd three Promenade in Santa Monica. Maragrita&#39;s were also HORRIBLE! I don&#39;t mind paying a lot but the drink was tiny AND weak as can be!

Travis the server did not give me my current change back. My bill was 45.57 i gave him 60.00 he gave 13.00 back instead of 14.43  he came to our table with an attitude upon greetings us. He can keep the 1.43 because he may need it. But i will not bring my business or my money to this place again<br><br>The food was good. Thanks to the chef.<br><br>But that guy Travis needs to be retrained or let go.

It was crowded this night but nothing negative to say.  I know what to expect.  It seemed as if the place was a little short staffed or the employees were exhausted from a busy day.  A few of the waiters dropped plates and beverages but good thing the customers were very understanding and polite.  My plate was dropped but luckily it didn&#39;t spill on me.  Apparently the plate was really hot.  Our waitress recommended some really good cheesecakes that we ordered and took home to eat later.  <br><br>I love this location, right on the marina.   You can see the boats and water.  Such a good change from the typical cheesecake factories or restaurants.

I&#39;ve been there with some friends, food was alright, but one of my friend took the Alfredo Pasta and it had no flavor, no salt, pepper or nothing, it tasted like water with pasta. The waiting time was also very long, we asked for the check and we waited like 20 minutes and they were nobody. Not a bad place but I will go somewhere else for that price.
Beautiful view and awesome customer service. Be prepared to pay for valet if self parking is full.

Food and service was amazing! They have never disappointed us! My husband always tries their old fashion because they change it up every season. The Thai lettuce wraps are my favorite! Only thing about this place is the parking! Horrible parking but honestly worth the wait
Cheesecake Factory is always good! Best bread ever and I specially like the Redondo beach location because it&#39;s by the beach! I love the view specially in winter with the amazing sunsets

This cheese cake factory has a nice view and the food is ok here. Lots of options to choose from and warm bread while you are waiting. The portions are pretty big. Seems like a pretty popular place. <br><br>The cheesecake by far is the best here and today we took home a 10in tiramisu and 7in Fresh Strawberry. <br>Beware -They have this unwritten rule that if you buy a whole cheesecake it comes frozen. It does not say that anywhere so even if you see a whole cheesecake in the window they will say you have to pay per slice even if you want to buy the amount of a whole. Luckily the manger worked with us.

Arrived around 3:30 and 4 parties had been waiting along with me. Hostess was a bit rude to begin with cause I interrupted her while on her phone. No big deal everyone has phones. Everything was going well, until I found some hair in my meatloaf. Brought it to my servers attention &amp; she showed very little concern about the issue. I had to explain my reasoning to order another meal. By the time my fresh plate was brought out my group was finished eating and preparing to leave so I just boxed it to-go. To top it off I was just trying to celebrate my birthday and didn&#39;t even get to eat my meal after spending $100+ on lunch for 2. Very disappointing...wish the staff was more professional about handling these issues.

Not impressed with the food here last night unfortunately. I had the Truffle Honey Fried Chicken which completely lacked flavor. It just tasted like bland fried chicken. I was also disappointed that the asparagus that came with it was completely unseasoned, just plain cooked asparagus. I found that very strange.<br><br>My boyfriend had the Chipotle Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich and we were also surprised by the lack of flavor in this dish as well. I would say these are both menu items to avoid. The French fries however were very good and their fresh bread never disappoints but that&#39;s just about the only positive thing I have to say about the food we ordered.

Cheesecake Factory, thanks for the response but seeing as though I have no reason or initiative to re-visit your establishment, I highly doubt that I will return. Thanks for taking the time to address this issue.

My wife and I are not usually ones to complain, but  here is some feedback for staff and management to improve future dining experiences for pretty much anyone! First off serve on clean plates! Had to send the dirty bread plate back. Secondly we need knives to cut our chicken, that&#39;s just a give in shouldn&#39;t have to ask or flag you down for the basics. Third the mashed potatoes were runny ! Come on cheese cake factory we thought for sure at least the food would be good. This is a prime location you have to step up your game, your prices are not that cheap to go out like that!

This review is specific for the special events team. This past April I had my wedding reception on the 2nd floor of the Cheesecake Factory. Jackie, Addie and Danny were all great at staying in communication with me during the planning process. Unfortunately I procrastinated and in the last 2 weeks I had to bombard them with e-mails to follow up on last minute items. They were all very professional and helped me plan everything to the last minute. <br><br>I was also concerned because the restaurant is still open during the whole event and I was worried I would feel like we did not have enough privacy. However on the day of the event we had all the privacy we needed. Our dj was still able to blast his music, we danced, talked and was able to be loud if we wanted. The food was great and best of all very affordable for the area. <br><br>My wedding was everything I visioned it to be and it would not have been possible without the staff and amazing space that the Cheesecake Factory provided. Thank you again!

I went in to get their carrot cake for my husbands bday and I&#39;m so glad I did. Everyone loved it and even though it was a round cake it went a long way, there was enough for our whole party and then some. I wasn&#39;t expecting it to be so expensive but it was totally worth it for the occasion although I wouldn&#39;t buy it on a regular type of event, it is that fancy and pricey for a carrot cake.

I&#39;m a super fan of Cheesecake Factory. Food is always great and our server is always friendly. Great thing about this cheesecake is its right next to the water!  Get outside seating in the summer.

Service took forever. Food was not that great. Got the Chicken Romano. Got desserts to go because it was taking it so long. Then they couldn&#39;t figure out our gift card so our desserts melted why we waited 30 minutes for the check. Also the valet was rude.

Comparing to the Marina del Rey location, we found this place to be a little more efficient.   It was crowded (tons of birthdays) yet we were seated quickly.  Valet parking was $4 and quick.<br><br>Food arrived hot and fast, though the bar took a little while on our margarita.<br><br>The margarita was TWICE as big and TWICE as strong than Marina del Rey, so we&#39;d go back to this location just for the cocktail generosity.<br><br>Our server was OK---definitely a personality clash with us.  I think he thought he was being funny or witty, but sounded more condescending than anything.   Things were said like &#34;whoa, that&#39;s a lot of food&#34; and &#34;man, that steak didn&#39;t have a chance, huh?!?&#34;  were just not appreciated by us as we were eating, especially since the tone came across as very judgmental.    Other things were said but I think in this case we just wanted him to shut up and stop interrupting with his snarky comments.<br><br>Overall, we liked the location &amp; would consider the drive to return here over Marina del Rey.

Cheesecake Factory is the kind of restaurant you go back to week after week because it&#39;s so good and they have so many options to choose from. They was over 200 menu items so you are bound to find something you like  <br>The food is a great value considering the huge portions you get. The food is always consistently great, but the same is not true about the service. <br>The service is good most of the time but sometimes it can be pretty bad. TIP: do not sit outside at this location. The service has always been so bad whenever we sat outside. <br><br>I usually get the miso salmon with mashed potatoes instead of rice, which is $19.99. The portion is huge. One of my favorite dishes. <br><br>The side of Mac n cheese, which is almost $7. Is the best Mac n cheese I have ever had. It&#39;s so cheesy and saucy it&#39;s sooooooooooo good. <br><br>ANOTHER TIP: if you want the salad get the garden salad. It&#39;s 6$ and almost the size of an entree salad. <br><br>Some other great dishes are any pizza, eggplant parmigiana, four cheese pasta, almond crusted salmon salad and avocado egg rolls. <br><br>This is one of my favorite places to eat. If they can just perfect the service it would be the BEST place to eat.

I haven&#39;t visited a Cheesecake Factory for a while, however I am very familiar with how long it takes to be served at The Cheesecake Factory. But this time it was more than that. When ordering our entrees, orange and terriyaki chicken we ordered it with brown rice. After the average cooking time for Cheesecake Factory, our food finally arrived but it had white rice, not brown. We told this to the server who removed it to change it for white rice. About 15 minutes went by and our server had not checked in with us and we found it odd that it was taking so long to change rice. We asked our server who we waved down and she said oh it should be out in a moment and then disappeared into the back. A manager came moments later and explained that the situation was that when the food was returned the Chef saw how over cooked my husband&#39;s teriyaki chicken was and decided to redo his plate. I asked her what about my food and she said I will bring it out to you. So I received my food and it was great but it took another 20-25 minutes for my husband&#39;s food to come out again. All the time our server completely avoided us and did not give us an update on my husband&#39;s food. When the food finally arrived, my husband&#39;s chicken still looked a bit overdone. I understand things happen but I think the customer service aspect could have been aloooooot better. The manager never came by to see if we were satisfied with our dining experience.
One of my favorite places to go have dinner. The food is amazing and I can always count on them for the best customer service!

Always good food and good service. Love the Cajun chicken Little&#39;s and I always get it with a side of angel hair pasta mixed lightly with butter and cheese! Love the ambiance and a view of the harbor is a plus.

I went to this location yesterday for brunch so I can enjoy my birthday weekend brunch. However, this was the worst location out of all Cheesecake Factory I ever been to go eat!!!! Experienced the WORST SERVICE from several servers and the hostess here. My husband and I were extremely disappointed because it took about 20 minutes just for us to get a glass of water and bread. I&#39;ve tried to get a total of 3 servers attention and a hostess but none of them bothered to help. All I was told is &#34;I&#39;ll have someone get you a server&#34;. They all told me this while they decided to help other customers after being seated. I don&#39;t remember all the servers names but one server in particular was a Asian girl with a long braid. She had a attitude and kept giving me a bitchy look. None of the servers make eye contact and even when they see you trying to get their attention they ignore you and walk by. When I said excuse me to the several servers they looked at me as if I was being rude. They look at you knowing you needed something and still walked by our table without asking if we needed anything. Everyone including Ashley a manager and Chris the general manager needs to do their job properly. Second, no one was sincerely empathetic. Ashley still wanted us to pay for a meal that was cold, we had to keep asking for condiments and glass of milk that was ordered. She also asked if we wanted to order something else. Why would we order more food to spend more money??? We had to keep asking for things which made me lose my appetite. Mind you, another table had the same level of service which was horrible. It wasn&#39;t extremely busy considering there were a lot of open tables. Another note, other customers that arrived long after we already got to the restaurant were served right away after they were seated. I honestly feel that this place is racist because my husband is black and the other table that had horrible service were black as well. All other tables that were served right away were NOT BLACK. Your fake ass apology did nothing and learn how to treat customers who pay with their hard earned money to dine at your location.

Came on a BUSY Saturday evening. We were asked if we wanted wait for an outside/inside table, or if we wanted to just take first available. We opted to just take whatever, because we were in a hurry. Plus, the weather was nice, if we were inside or outside, it really would not matter.<br><br>We waited maybe five or ten minutes, and were seated in a nice booth towards the back of the restaurant. It was really busy, so I was surprised we got seated so quickly. The service was super fast and friendly. My bf was wearing a chive shirt, and one of the managers came over and said &#34;chive on!&#34; and said dessert was on her. Cool random act of kindness...<br><br>I got my faves. Louisiana Chicken pasta and tex mex egg rolls. I have tried many dishes at cheesecake, but these two, I always go back to. <br><br>The pasta is bow tie, in a light, yet flavorful, slightly spicy Cajun style sauce. It is topped with 4 thin chicken cutlets that have been breaded with panko and expertly fried. This dish never lets me down. <br><br>Tex mex egg rolls are a delish combo of chicken, corn, black beans, rolled into a wonton wrapper, then fried, and served with a creamy avocado sauce! My bf LOVED the sauce. It is kind of addicting, and I&#39;ve often wondered how they make it. Must google that after I finish this review. <br><br>BF ordered the Kobe burger. By the time we had our drinks and appetizers, he was pretty full, but the burger isn&#39;t too over the top. He was able to finish everything (except for the fries) and I boxed most of mine to-go. I think it was a perfect meal before our big Saturday night. I will definitely be coming back!
Great food like always! Nice location in front of the Beach with an amazing view! <br>Convenient valet and self parking.

Came here for a birthday dinner last night. Requested to sit outside on the heated patio, for a view of the water, and we were sat right away. The heaters were very warm , but we did request to have some turned off, as it was very hot with all of them going. The host gave us menus, but forgot a kids menu for my daughter. Our waiter came over after about 10 mins and I requested one then. We placed a drink order while deciding food, and we also got complimentary bread. It took a while for the waiter to return to take our order. He apologized, knowing he took a long time. Everything we ordered came out good. The cheesecake was probably the best part of the meal.

First of all I completely agree with this valet parking scam.  Really now.. you have a handful of self-parking spots and a couple hundred &#39;valet&#39; ones.  How about making the back part of that big lot for valet and let your customers park their own cars. Most places have the valet spots out of the way anyway.  It&#39;s not like you&#39;re not making enough money off the meals and drinks that you have to get a couple more money dollars off folks.<br><br>The server we had was great - no complaint there.  <br><br>I ordered bang bang chicken and shrimp.  There wasn&#39;t one piece of shrimp on the plate. It was good otherwise but the chef should&#39;ve thrown a couple shrimp in there.  I was half way through the plate when I realized that and should&#39;ve said something to allow that to be fixed, Since I did not give them a chance to fix that all I&#39;ll ask is you remind the chefs to be more careful for other customers. <br><br>My husband got the spaghetti and meat balls and said it was very good.<br><br>We probably won&#39;t go back over the parking alone. Pathetic.

I was here late Saturday night for dinner with the family. Waited around 10-15 to be seated. Ordered guacamole and chips as an appetizer. It was pretty good I have to admit I was surprised. On the down side it took us around 1 hour to get our food on the table. My 3 year old daughter was super frustrated, lol. Once they brought the food for some reason it took them 10-15 minutes more to bring our French fries. I do not understand how it took them longer to cook fries than to cook a well done steak. As far as the service it was ok. A bit below average. But it was 11 pm so she might have been tired. Overall it was ok.
Was having a great dinner until I found a hair in my food. Told myself it was just a fuzz of some sort that landed on the food, but then I found another one baked into the cheese.

Our little set up for a joint baby shower lunch.  Thank you to our wonderful Sierra for being patient with the arrival of our guest and a huge thank you to the host at the front (forgot to get his name), he gave our two guest of honor their baby shower pins before arriving at our table.  I would recommend if you&#39;re going to have gifts at your table reserve for 1 or 2 more than who&#39;s coming.  Just so you have more room.  It was my first time there so I didn&#39;t know better but we had a lovely time. Thank you staff at Redondo Beach Cheesecake Factory!  You must try the avocado rolls!

Decided to have lunch here on Sunday afternoon and came right at the end of the Brunch menu so the location was packed, there was a few minute wait for a table but not too long, the staff is friendly and the food is good, even the lunch portions are on the large side so you probably won&#39;t go away hungry.<br>Two members of our group ordered the lunch Fish and Chips, 4 large pieces of fish each so they could have shared and still had some for later, Shepard&#39;s pie (lunch portion) was also very large and we saved some for later. Service was good and the staff was attentive, the location was on the noisy as many of the patrons are not aware of what an inside voice is.<br>Prices are reasonable for the portion size and quality of food, would return again.

So, I was expecting so much more being by the ocean, but it turned out to be just an &#34;average&#34; restaurant. Nothing stood out, nothing over the top. Truly not impressed. The service was good for as busy as it was, our waitress and waiter turned out to be pretty good which is what made the difference. Even though she had to take her lunch break, she left us in good hands. <br>It seemed to be a super busy night, lots of people, 2.5 hour wait (unless you sit in the bar), and this was Saturday evening. Probably could have found something better. So this Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t bad, but certainly not the best. Good thing they have great waitstaff!!! They make the difference...

Im a huge fan of this chain and was extremely excited to enjoy the offerings closer to home. We ordered three apps, two mains, and were planning on getting cheesecake to go. <br>I was beyond disappointed -- 2/3 apps were incorrect, 1/3 had contamination (blonde hair from maybe the server). I mentioned this to the server and, though she was nice, she did very little to fix the situation and we just asked for the mains instead of reordering the apps. When the mains arrived, my dish was great but my friends was completely at room temp -- how does that even happen? We decided to cut out losses and not waste any more time (diabetic and insulin dependent..  couldn&#39;t wait any longer). We paid the bill, including the three apps that we didn&#39;t consume as well paid for his steak which also wasn&#39;t consumed. <br>I&#39;m hoping this was a one off but spending nearly $200 on wine and food that we didn&#39;t even eat... kind of seems unreasonable.

Came here for brunch Saturday to only find out they have brunch on Sunday&#39;s only. <br> <br>Bloody Mary was okay. Nothing special couldn&#39;t taste the vodka. There were no olives. It was super basic with 1 celery stick. <br><br>Tuna tartar was REALLY small. My husband and I each had 2 bites and it was done. Came with 4 small tiny wontons. <br><br>Also ordered an apple juice but after not getting it for 15 minutes I was over it. She came by to ask if we needed everything and I told her to cancel the juice. She didn&#39;t seem to remember hence why we were still waiting for it. <br><br>I ordered the &#34;Renee lunch special&#34; I asked for Caesar salad as my side (it cost $1 more) but got an arugula salad. <br>The turkey sandwich was plain and turkey was fatty. Potato soup was really tasty.<br><br>My husband got the fish tacos and they were mediocre. Rice that came with it was salty.<br> <br>Other:<br>If you sit by the window it&#39;s a nice view <br><br>Overall way overpriced for the food and drink quality.

Went in today and was told 30 min wait. After one hour, we were still waiting. So, we asked the receptionist how much longer. He said: &#34; our server is down and it will be another 40 min&#34;  I  am not sure what it means, but I think it is wrong. No announcement about the server down was made and no apology was made. Very unprofessional.

We celebrated my godfather&#39;s birthday, upstairs, in the private Sunset Room. The staff was outstanding, professional, efficient, friendly and very accommodating! The meal was delicious. All in all, a wonderful experience. We enjoyed Avocado Egg Rolls, Coconut Shrimp, Herb Crusted Salmon, Grilled Steak Filet, Chicken Piccata and Tiramisu. Here is a video of our party:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZIv722496s&amp;t=17s

My husband is building a hotel around the area so I came to visit and check it out. Cheesecake was close by so we stopped in to just grab dessert. But we ended up waiting for a long time for a waiter to show up at our table so we just got up and ordered cheesecake to-go. Strawberry cheesecake is always consistently good across all Cheesecake Factory&#39;s. Service was just really slow. <br><br>Great view of the marina.

If i can give them 10 stars i would!! Our waitress Irene was absolutely THE BEST! I wanted to cry n hug her!!! Seriously! My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary and we were so undecided on what to pick. She suggested an appetizer for us and my entre!! I must say the fried mac and cheese balls were to die for! And the Chicken Bellagio plate was the best!!! We had the best service! But u know what else, she went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience! By bringing out our dessert with &#34;Happy Anniversary to you&#34; That was it!! She made our night!! To the manager at this location, Irene is a keeper!!! She was beyond the best!!! Thank u! We had the best experience here and the food was amazing!!! Plus the view was the best!! We felt like royalty there!

I came here on  Sunday, May 2, 2015 around 11:30am. It was already packed! Beware, there is road construction on Harbor Drive, and the entrance to the Cheesecake Factory can be missed. Upon arrival, I found out the only choice was to Valet park... ugh... $4. not including tip. I was not happy about this, but I didn&#39;t have a choice. I didn&#39;t see any street parking available, due to the heavy road construction, so I reluctantly gave my keys to the valet. This was the only negative aspect, and I later learned this parking lot is a city lot and The Cheesecake Factory must pay the city for the use of this lot. <br><br>As soon as I arrived, the receptionist greeted us with a smile and asked if we wanted to be seated inside or outside. We opted for a quiet area, inside. The overall restaurant is noisy. We were seated promptly and Michelle, our server greeted us an truly took care of us during our lunch. <br><br>The menu is extensive, and I haven&#39;t been to a Cheescake Factory in years, so it took we a few minutes to decide. We both decided on the LUNCH menu, which is the best bang for the buck!<br><br>The bread basket arrived shortly after we ordered. Warm piping bread.I restrained myself from eating more than one piece because I wanted to save room for my salad and later cheesecake. <br><br>We started with the avocado eggrolls! OH MY! I could of had this for a meal. It comes with 6 pieces, and splitting it between us was easy, but I could not imagine eating more afterwards, but I did. These rolls have a crunch, the creamy avocado with the sundried tomato and the chimmichuri dipping sauce is incredibly tasty!  <br><br> My lunch size Luau salad was large, tall, stacked architecturally, and beautiful. I admired it for a few minutes, before breaking it down. Every bite was superb. My friend ordered the Chicken Piccata, which looked heavenly! My friend told me her chicken piccata was &#34;melt in your mouth&#34; delicious. My salad was so delicious, I can still taste the different textures, ingredients which make this combination a perfect salad. <br><br>We both enjoyed our lunch, but saved room for a cheesecake dessert! We split the lemon raspberry cheesecake. The crust is made from ladyfingers. Overall, this is a light cheesecake, not heavy and rich. We both loved it. It was a perfect ending to a great lunch. <br><br>Thank you Michelle for serving us with a smile and taking good care of us. I am quite impressed with this Cheesecake Factory for their promptness, friendly staff, beautifully presented dishes and attention to details.

I pretty much like everything about this particular location in Redondo Beach.  Being that it over looks water is a nice touch.  Of course I ordered my usual, Jamaican Black pepper Shrimp.  Sometimes, I opt for chicken instead.  Every time I mean to try another dish, I end up changing my mind and order my favorite go to meal.  Always a good crowd of people there, friendly atmosphere, attentive servers.  I&#39;ll definitely be back again.

This Cheesecake Factory location in particular is a hit or miss. On the upside, the view is nice, it&#39;s tucked away from a bunch of pedestrian foot traffic and thankfully it&#39;s not actually on the pier where all the tourists congregate. On the downside, service is mediocre at very best and just bad at worst. My boyfriend took me here for dinner twice in the past month. The food is always great. The first time we were here late on a weekday and it was a quiet evening dinner on the docks. The second time we were here in the middle of a Saturday afternoon and it was very loud and busy. Nothing wrong with that, hey, it&#39;s a popular place! However, I don&#39;t think the staff is quite equipped to keep up with the large crowds during busy hours. My boyfriend actually got gum on his pants when he slid into the booth from brushing his knee against the table corner. Someone had chewed their gum and stuck it right on the corner and the staff had completely missed it during cleanup! It was so gross! We alerted our server and showed him the gum stuck right there on my boyfriend&#39;s knee. The server didn&#39;t seem to really care at all, but did get the manager over. By the time the manager made it over, he&#39;d cleaned the gum off his pants and the manager&#39;s offer was to pick up the dry cleaning bill... who in heck dry cleans jeans? If we&#39;d been in nice suits that would have been a great offer but we were in Saturday afternoon casual wear. The jeans can be washed, we were upset about the cleanliness of someone else&#39;s gum from someone else&#39;s mouth on his clothes and embarrassment of having a stain there at the second. Plus pulling it off was not fun at all! We should have at the very least had our appetizer comped or received a coupon good for a future visit. I understand the manager&#39;s thinking may have been sometimes people come up with lame excuses to try and get a free meal so he was offering a useful, non restaurant related remedy. However, to us with a genuine complaint and a general disgusting problem this really wasn&#39;t a good deal. I wish he&#39;d left the gum on his pants for the manager to witness, maybe then he would have been disgusted too, but he just wanted to get cleaned up. <br><br>Other users have mentioned disapproval of the forced valet parking, and we have to agree with that. It should at least be optional, they certainly have the space for it. During busy times there&#39;s always quite a line to get someone to park your car and the same for going back out.<br><br>In summary, Cheesecake Factory is always tasty, but I wouldn&#39;t go out of your way for this particular location, unless you just have to have a dockside dinner at a chain. Otherwise, there&#39;s lots of other restaurants here to choose from and LA has plenty of other Cheesecake Factories. Don&#39;t go out of your way, and check your tables for gum.

Please don&#39;t visit this location. We came here and was told the wait would be an hour. We ended up waiting 2 hours. Then when we were seated, it was puddles of water on the floor as we had to wait another 7 minutes.We were given one slow ass waitress who just kept apologizing. I am more that done! The food was not good and I will never return here again. Please don&#39;t bring your birthday party here!

This is our favorite TCF, it&#39;s truly worth the drive because the wait is always reasonable compared to other locations. When you get here you pull into a driveway lined with beautifully lit trees. Our go to order is the shrimp scampi and for dessert the tiramisu cheesecake. Shout out to the support staff here. The bus boy and bread guy who also packed up our left overs for their great service.
Nice variety of delicious desserts! A nice place to hang out with your family and friends !

Food is awful. Ordered fish tacos. Came with way too much cabbage and onion. Turned my stomach. Rice was undercooked and bland. Husband had chicken and biscuits. No gravy like traditional chicken and biscuits. Will not be returning. Food is virtually inedible.

VERY HORRIBLE SERVICE. I came here yesterday on a rainy day and it was not even as busy as when I usually come. My mother and I come here every other Wednesday on a date and we come here for any special occasion this is our go to spot and we have always have great service but yesterday was terrible. My friend came into town and we came here as a late night dinner to catch up and we had a bad experience. Our server barely came to the table, got our orders wrong and we never received bread. We had to ask another server for stuff because our server was not on top of it. Two of the servers that attended us kept passing by, attending other costumers and would look at us instead of attending us. My friend had to go and ask the lady in the front for our check because we literally could have left and both of the girls servers would have not notice. There was people sitting behind us and to the side of us and they would pass by and attend them every few minutes but to us they didn&#39;t. When we finally received our check she was laughing and looked at us as if we were a joke. I did not feel comfortable eating there I just wanted to go home and now I don&#39;t even want to go there anymore after this experience. My friend and I literally got there with a good happy positive vibe and once this happened we just left mad with negative energy. Very disappointed.

The worst experience in dinning of my life. I cannot believe the service i received,if I was a Heath inspector I would of shut that place down. From dirty  forks to dirty drinking cups. My water cup was disgusting. Good thing I looked at it before I took a sip. There was brown gunk all around my glass. But the worst part was the server. Did they just hire these unprofessional servers. My server kept calling me baby and sweetie and sweat heart in front of my bf the whole night until he was fed up he spoke to him about it and the server ran to the mgr to say he threatened him??? Are you kidding!! Who does that, and the management believed the server, what ever happened to the customers always right or at least the minimum,treat the customer with respect. Well, never ever going there again in my life even if the food was free!!!
Came in here for brunch with my son after a morning biking on the beach and as always had a great time. My favorite are chicken samosa and chipotle pasta.

Their tacos were pretty good, I&#39;d go for the beef instead of chicken cause the chicken has a weird tang that just wasn&#39;t doing it for me. <br><br>Other that that, yea I agree they have an insanely long menu with foods that have a whole bunch of [UNNECESSARY] ingredients.

if i can put 0 stars, that&#39;s what i would rate the service and food. i ordered the chicken sandwich and it was super thin to the point where it was all breading i bit into. i waited 2 hours for a table and it was not worth the wait. i also ordered sweet potato fries but the fries were potato at the TOP and then sweet potato at the BOTTOM, with it being an extra $1 charge as well. i barely finished my food. the bread was my favorite thing i ate. i can go to chick fil a and get a BETTER chicken sandwich... not worth $16

Your restaurant forces all of its guests to valet park. Self parking is not an option. That&#39;s fine, but the valet doesn&#39;t accept credit cards and you don&#39;t have an ATM on the property. WTF. <br><br>If valet parking is mandatory, all payment options should be accepted. I&#39;ve literally been driving to your restaurant and realized I didn&#39;t have cash on me and decided to eat elsewhere just because I didn&#39;t want to have to stop at an ATM on my way. <br><br>Not to mention the ATM fees your company is missing out on...<br><br>Get it together.

This was the worst service at this restaurant. We waited at our table for 20 min before our server approached us. Then we asked for water and took another 20 min. I was upset because I can see my server talking and fooling around with other employees. Then the food was not that great. I regret spending 200$ dollars at this restaurant won&#39;t be returning. Very overrated and service is not great.

Last time we were here we got serviced pretty fast( October 2018). We went today as a big group (11 including 3 small kids). It was very disappointing because we had a long wait. We noticed couples coming after us and getting seated way before us. The notice came very clear when we were the last staying. A host said it was because we had a big group and that was the reason when we were getting passed up! SO IT IS NOT FIRST COME FIRST SERVED. We arrived at 9pm didn&#39;t not get served until 11:30pm. Still noticed a group coming in after us and got their meals serviced before ours. Restaurant does not take reservations either!!! The host also gave some arrogance we still had to stand in between dinning round for 5 mins to wait to get seats on a table that was suppose to be ready. Luckily our waitress was pleasant. As far as the host should be accountable for the way they seat ppl and in order as they should b seated!!!

If you don&#39;t want to pay for valet parking, get there as early as you can. There&#39;s about 15 spaces for non valet and about 100 for valet. <br><br>I got a lunch pasta dish with chicken and basil. My bf got breakfast. I should have gotten breakfast. The bottom of my pasta bowl was swimming in butter, and the pasta as a whole wasn&#39;t anything special. We ordered the oreo cheesecake which was really rich and chocolate-y (yum!).<br><br>The service we received was great! Our waiter was really nice and made sure everything with us was okay and that we had ample shade (we sat outside and she helped move an umbrella to better cover us.)<br><br>We called to make reservations before they opened. They told us we could make a reservation between 10 (when they opened) and 11. So we said okay, and asked how busy they expect to be at noon. They repeated that they opened at 10 and we could make a reservation then. We repeated our second question. They repeated their answer. WTF guys. We weren&#39;t asking for reservations anymore! <br><br>But four times a charm! We got our answer after a short OHH!

This is actually my favorite CCF location because it is by the water. All you see are the boats in the harbor and not really the ocean, but nonetheless, it&#39;s still very nice. <br><br>Let&#39;s start out by saying that parking here sucks. It&#39;s valet only $4 plus tip. However, I believe on the weekdays, you have the option to self park in the very tiny lot on the right after you enter. Later on, I found out that the parking lot isn&#39;t owned by CCF so they had to pay the city money to use it and therefore, the fee passed down to the consumers. It still doesn&#39;t change my mind about how sucky the parking is, but at least I understand. <br><br>Next, please come early. The lines at this place is strangely outrageous. To be honest, CCF isn&#39;t even such a great restaurant, but this location is always packed and I don&#39;t understand. For dinner time, try aiming for 4-5 because you&#39;ll have to definitely wait any time after. <br> <br>The menu has a lot of variety and can be overwhelming at times because of the many pages. Keep in mind, the portion size at this place is really big and I have never finished anything that I&#39;ve gotten here. The give free bread!! Who doesn&#39;t love free bread!? My favorite is the wheat one, it&#39;s way better than the white one. As for entrees, I think the spaghetti and meatballs was pretty good as well as the parmesan chicken. My mom seem to really enjoy the meatloaf. For dessert, you HAVE to get a cheesecake. The cheesecake here is absolutely delicious. I&#39;ve tried the red velvet, mango keylime, and strawberry. All three were really good! <br><br>Overall, it&#39;s a pretty basic American restaurant where you can probably find the food here at any other American restaurant (except the cheesecakes).

Went in this afternoon for lunch with the family. We were a party of 9 and the service was great. We were taken care of from beginning to end. The appetizers were very tasty, the cocktails were perfection, and the food overall was good. We all ordered lunch size portions and they were huge - we could have shared. Overall it was a very nice experience and we enjoyed ourselves

I guess its a thing for Cheesecake factory to hire staff that are not so friendly and are in a hurry to go home. I usually come here for dinner, and i always feel like I am rushed to order, eat and pay the check.<br><br>The waitress wasnt very welcoming and kept bugging us if we are ready to order. When you have a Menu that is the size of my  VLSI Design book, you should have atleast given us 5-10 minutes to order. She came 3 times in a span of 5 minutes to see if we were ready to order.<br>Also she asked us if we wanted bread, i dint know bread was only given if customers wanted to eat. I thought it was complimentary for everyone. And she gave us right before the appetisers came out .<br><br>Nonetheless food was OK ,and pasta was little hard for my liking. May be its al dente ,who knows .
We came for a wedding reception and everything was excellent. Service was impeccable and the meals were delicious. We hadn&#39;t been here in quite some but we will definitely return in the future.

Visited on a busy Saturday night. We asked for outside seating and were attended to in under 30 minutes. We were given a good spot overlooking the marina and it was just what I was expecting! <br><br>Entrees came out quick and servers were everywhere willing to get you what you needed. I had the bacon-bacon burger and while it may not have been the best burger I have had. I enjoyed all the food and all the service we received. I like this particular location due to its overlooking the ocean. $4 for valet parking. Not a huge line for cheesecake either.

Good food and service. Unfortunately the parking lot experience ruined it. Came early in afternoon and was directed to open lot with no signs saying valet only. Parked and walked with elderly mother in law. When getting close to entrance someone started rudely yelling at us. We stoppe and they rudely said we needed to pay valet. We said we were directed here and why would we be walking if it was valet? Other areas were clearly marked valet but not our area. They said we could park for free. But when we came out, the same ordeal occurred.  I would have just paid but they got so rude I stood my ground. Cheesecake should demand signs be put up especially for early crowd when it&#39;s not obvious.

I &#34;LOVE&#34; me some Cheesecake Factory!!!<br>I recommend the Miso Salmon with extra miso glaze (cheaper during lunch )<br>2nd recommendation: Bistro style shrimp scampi and lastly the Firecracker salmon rolls.<br>See you there!

I noticed the on my last few visits the the staff is overwhelmed running and serving a busy busy place like that. They are just not up to it. We were a party of five sitting at the little round high tables in the bar (waiting for our main table in the restaurant). We waited 30 minutes for our cocktails while watching a bored bartender cleaning his work station. Now when we let them know our frustration and the girl said basically &#34;yes they are overwhelmed&#34;.  <br>We then moved to the wonderful outside patio and enjoyed our great food and had a blast ... even tho for 2 hours nobody bothered to clean our table or remove empty glasses etc.<br>it&#39;s complicated. :-)
11 public parking spots? Seriously wrong. Joe&#39;s Crab Shack just around the corner doesn&#39;t charge a dime. Food was just ok.  Better choices abound nearby.
Strong island ice teas and the chicken bellagio made for a fun and yummy night with friends.  <br><br>The place was crowded, but just grab a drink at the bar and chill.

It&#39;s crazy how one bad experience can ruin how you look at a restaurant from then on. <br><br>I&#39;ve frequented different locations and had good experiences, but this would be my first time here at redondo beach. We chose to have dinner here for my birthday. <br><br>Business was busy as usual and luckily we were seated right away. We were facing the marina but it was already too dark anyway to enjoy the view. This was on a Tuesday evening. Ordered our drinks and appetizer and those arrived in a timely manner. However my strawberry lemonade was super sweet so I asked for a glass of water to dilute it. Our food arrived and everything was going well until my water finally arrived. <br><br>Our waiter, Dan reached over my daughter to hand me my water just as he bumped into another waiter and SPILLED HOT COFFEE ON MY DAUGHTERS BARE BACK! Common sense would be to deliver the hot beverage first, right? Now I know accidents happen but this could have been prevented. He then delivered the coffee anyway to the patron who ordered it! He did offer us some towels, which I asked him to make cold. He wasn&#39;t apologetic at all and became absent after he spilled the coffee. This would&#39;ve lessened the hurt and embarrassment we had to endure because of his negligence. The manager, Jennifer was the most apologetic and helpful of the night as she called paramedics to check my daughter out. What a fiasco huh?! <br><br>Before this incident happened, he delivered a coke refill to our table but pretty much ran over with it, slammed it down and rushed to the next table to retrieve an appetizer plate that had been wrongly delivered. They were already digging in when Dan removed it and said &#34;this isn&#39;t yours, this is for another table.&#34; He ran off with that as well, unknown if he delivered it to the correct table. I found out on this night that he was a new hire. <br><br>The food we ordered was good, however the circumstance we endured. We had shrimp and angel hair pasta: 3 stars. Crispy chicken costoletta: 5 stars. Steak Diane and chicken Madeira: 3 stars because there was a huge uncooked potato in my mashed potatoes. Lol. And my little one enjoyed her bow tie parmasean and butter pasta. <br><br>Our meal was cut short, we didn&#39;t even get to enjoy cheesecake. No birthday cheesecake for me!!!  ;(  <br><br>This is the nearest Cheesecake Factory we live by and will probably only order cheesecake to go. Never will we dine in at this location again. The experience was too traumatizing for all of us.
Horrible service, they left us for more the 40 minutes without water, nobody cleaned our table, they didn&#39;t bring the right food , poor management. Never more

I come to Cheesecake Factory occasionally and we always had good time and good food. <br>Today the service was horrible, it took forever to have someone attention and actually I went to pick up the menu by myself. <br><br>Positive note was one of the waiter (Marcio), from another area, that after he recognize our disappointment he tried to do everything ti make it up.<br><br>Finally we got the food and most of it was cold. <br>We called the manager and she was nice and deeply sorry for what happened. <br><br>They cut the bill taking out the cold dishes. My points was not to pay less, the dinner was ruined at that point, but I hope they understood what was wrong this night ( I saw other people complain too). <br><br>Bottom line the manager and the waiter handled the situation well and for that reason I&#39;ll give this place another chance.

The ribeye steak was good.  The pork chop were excellent.  The chicken Alfredo was good.  But the service was below standard.  They took 10 minutes to take our drink order.  Then they took a while to bring us our bread and drinks.  Once the order was given the appetizer (avocado eggroll very good) came out quickly but the food took a while to come out.  The refills took forever and forgotten once.  This is not always the case with the service.

What a wonderful experience!! The Rib eye steak was cook to perfection, appetizers were great, and cocktails! Thank you Valerie for making my Birthday so special being a young server with a 5 star customer service!!!! I was impressed with all servers attentiveness they all work as a team and that speaks volumes !

Why is Cheesecake Factory so damn expensive?!?It was my kid&#39;s 21st birthday and this is the place she chose, I had a salad which was really good the Sheila chicken salad however $14.95 for some lettuce! Really. Our waiter which I forgot his name had a accent maybe Russian or Ukraine not sure.. But he was excellent kind of reminded me of a Arnold Schwarzenegger

I usually only go to The Cheesecake Factory once a year because it takes me so long to go through the menu lol, but that&#39;s my own personal opinion. Overall, the service was great! Brandon our waiter was fantastic, I didn&#39;t have to ask for another lemonade he had it ready. The wait was not long at all which was great! Plus, the food was hot and came out on time without a long delay to me. I enjoyed my time there and I had lunch for the next day!

Valet parking only. Beautiful view. The staff was very attentive and very nice.  Indoor and heated outdoor seating.  Very busy for dinner!  <br><br>It was only 5-10 min wait for a table at 5pm on a Saturday.   I asked for first available and they let me know outside was heated and it was.  Not too hot or too cold, very comfortable.   Our waitress was named Antoinette and another dude named Evan.  I&#39;ve been to a lot of Cheesecake Factories and they were the best by far.   The view from our table was great. It was nice and quiet outside.   Lots of birds flying around but not in an Alfred Hitchcock kind of way.  Food was good as it always is in any Cheesecake Factory.  Waitstaff sang Happy Birthday to everyone in a sincere tone lol yes,  I can tell the diff! Come eat here it&#39;s great!

1. I&#39;m only giving 2 stars because we got free cheesecake. Otherwise it&#39;d be a hard 1. <br>2. This is the closest CF to my house but I&#39;m gunna drive to The Grove from now on cuz I&#39;m over this location. <br><br>They were out of fried Mac &amp; cheese balls, didn&#39;t prepare the artichoke correctly so it was inedible, totally forgot one of our members food (and accused us of never ordering it, wtf?) <br><br>I would call before you come to make sure they have what you&#39;ll want to order.

Our dinner was delicious and our waitress, Jazmine, was so nice and helpful. I would definitely come back and order even more. I highly recommend Cheesecake Factory, especially this location. The ambiance is so nice and every staff member we made contact with was very kind.

What a difference good service makes--upgrade!<br><br>Last weekend my bf and I came here for our Fridate bc I&#39;d been craving the Louisiana chicken pasta.  I got the IPA they had on the menu (not Stone, I forget the name) and it was really good. We also got the fried cheese (mozzarella sticks/triangles) which was deeeeelicious.<br><br>This update is just bc our server, Rachel, was on top of her game that night. I commented about how dark our table was and the fact that I needed a flashlight to see the menu (not joking).  The table next to us was really annoying as well with a bunch of teens mindlessly backing up into my bf w/ their chairs like they were the only ones in the restaurant. Basically, I was being a negative Nancy and expecting the same bored service on top of being next to these obnoxious kids, lord!<br><br>Thankfully, Rachel was super sweet and also not just sweet but interactive without being intrusive. She was really bubbly and smiley and looked happy to be there.  I was telling my bf that I read all the recent reviews and it seemed like everyone was complaining about horrible service (on par w/ the service we received last time), but Rachel was the exact opposite and her efforts were noticed and appreciated.

Was in town on business and decided to visit the beach area and dine at this Cheesecake Factory, it was the first I ever tried when I lived in Hermosa Beach years ago.  I love the consistency of Cheesecake Factory and the reviewer who commented the food is average must be a jealous competitor!  I&#39;ve never had a bad meal nor bad desert.   The menu is diverse enough to satisfy even the pickiest eater. I had my entre of choice, a Cobb salad. I have yet to taste a Cobb anywhere else that even comes close to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s.  A local, home grown waiter, Michael, was fast, efficient and attentive without being a pest. Michael was friendly without coming across insincere.  A good guy and waiter. I asked for specific items and he brought them immediately without having to remind him. Good job.  Hoping Cheesecake will continue to keep quality high

I ordered a tossed salad w/out dressing w/grilled chicken off the app menu. The thing was huge! I had asked one person if it was the right one due to the size and instead of answering he just said &#34;I&#39;ll get your server&#34; I thought that was a weird response considering he works there and it was a pretty basic question.<br><br>The person I was with (not a date-yes in today&#39;s world I feel obligated to add that in, ridiculous) ordered a salad off the entree side. While I loved the size of my portion I kinda feel like it should have been smaller than the entree and not the same size. <br><br>The server:<br>Busy, but kept a smile on her face and was nice<br>And kept my Diet Coke full (needed the caffeine, ha! When around some the caffeine is needed)<br><br>The food:<br>Great size, and looked lovely<br>The grilled chicken didn&#39;t really taste fresh and appeared unevenly cooked (dry/tender)<br>The croutons were old and stale<br>The bread was cold<br><br>I did notice a few tables in my surroundings getting neglected, as I was viewing the people around and their facial expressions they weren&#39;t too pleased with that and neither was I. <br><br>Some workers didn&#39;t look to happy to be there while others put in the extra effort to make the best of it.<br><br>I would still go back and try another meal, another time when I have a bigger appetite and order something other than a app salad. <br><br>Until next time...

I had the meatloaf with the brown sauce.Did NOT like it...YUCK. Then the cheesecake BANANNA CREAM tasted really tuff like it was in the frig for weeks.<br>Parking really small.I know i will NOT come back.

My boyfriend and I love Cheesecake Factory. We came to this one last night and waited a few minutes to be sat, which was fine. The host sat us down, and we were not helped promptly. We noticed servers just walking around helping other customers acting oblivious. After 10 minutes, our server came up and just acted nonchalant and kind of seemed careless, lacking energy. He didn&#39;t even apologize for the long wait. We also noticed that he was walking around and joking with other customers before he came up to us... it was like he knew we were waiting and he didn&#39;t care. It was really weird and we were very thrown off. So we left without food or drinks, we just felt too uncomfortable to even dine there. Pretty unfortunate since we were excited for a yummy meal : (
Always love the view of the boats docked next to the restaurant. The service is always great!

This Cheesecake Factory is a lot better than other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s that I&#39;ve been to. The best thing about this one is the location. It&#39;s right by the water in Redondo Beach. You can sit by the window and see the harbor or even outside too. <br><br>The wait was around 15 minutes when my boyfriend and I came for dinner on a Saturday night around 6PM. We asked for the first available seat and were seated outside.<br><br>Our server took awhile to come greet us. We were started off with some bread. I think the bread is my favorite part of Cheesecake Factory....that wheat bread and sourdough bread..I can eat baskets after baskets. i should definitely stop though because I always get full before my meal even comes out yet! Oh well. No regrets.<br><br>For appetizers we got the avocado eggrolls. Man, these were AMAZING!! The portion was huge and we were already full after just finishing these. I also ordered a cup of soup of the day which was baked potato soup. Bread dipped in soup = HEAVEN. <br><br>By the time our entrees came out, I was already super full. I ate maybe about only 1/4 of my pesto pasta. My boyfriend ordered the Mac and Cheese Burger. It was huge and he definitely had a hard time finishing it as well. But he pulled through and ate most of it. Good job boyfriend!!!<br><br>Food was good. I think we ordered too much. Next time, we&#39;ll definitely order less...and I need to learn to control myself with the bread haha.<br><br>A side-note, our server was a little bit...slow. He didn&#39;t seem to know the answers to a lot of questions that we asked. Plus, when I asked to substitute the chicken for shrimp in my pasta, he didn&#39;t give me a substitution price. It turned out to be $7!!! Like wow, $7 to substitute chicken for shrimp? If I knew it was going to be that much I wouldn&#39;t even have done that! <br><br>Oh well, now I know.

The food is good, however, 2 major issues with this establishment one is the fact that their cutlery/forks and spoons aren&#39;t left on napkins or plates, instead they&#39;re on the table itself and everyone knows how restaurants clean tables... with a wet rag and that&#39;s disgusting unless you think bacteria adds flavor. Second issue is the valet parking, for an establishment like this you&#39;d figure they would accept card payments but that&#39;s not the case, me and my wife had to walk next door to be charged 5 dollars withdrawal fee from the hotel&#39;s atm on top of the 4 dollar valet fee. It&#39;s an just an inconvenience. Once this Cheesecake Factory leaves the Ice age of primitive technology I&#39;ll be back.

Don&#39;t understand how this place gets a bad review, been coming here for about 20 years and it&#39;s always a great experience. The staff is always awesome and the food is always good. Keep up the good work guys!
in general food was okay and staff was less than okay...maybe better management? definitely not worth $50. if you&#39;re looking for somewhere cheap, this is not the place.
Such good food! I&#39;m in love with the Louisiana spicy chicken pasta! So goooodd!!! I would strongly recommend that and the s&#39;mores cheesecake!
I had their Smoke BBQ burger  the other night and it was huge! Everything about it was delicious, just to big for me. Always satisfied where I come to eat here. :)

Update: After they messaged me, I followed their instructions and called the restaurant. I was placed on hold for over an hour only to end up getting asked why I was on hold when the original person was supposed to go find the manager. They said they&#39;d call me back. 2 weeks later nothing. I called them, same thing happened... No manager, nothing. Therefore I gave up and won&#39;t be eating here again and will deter my friends from eating here as well.

We were a party of five and My spicy cashew chicken plate came with hair in the mashed potatoes. Server took my plate and said they will replace it within minutes. 20 minutes later another server brought me a pasta plate instead, took it back and I didn&#39;t get my food til everyone in my party was done eating and we received no apology for the hair or the delay. As we were leaving we asked for the manager in charge and asked if he was aware of the incident and replied that he was informed and his exact words were &#34;better late than never&#34; and he said that he is only in charge of the lobby and the bakery and that he overheard of couple of hair issues at the same time. I think that is a very bad management especially at a big name of chain like this one.<br>May 12, 2016 at 6:00 p.m.

Don&#39;t really wanna slam the place, (hence the three stars), but...<br><br>When we arrived, we decided to sit in the bar area because of the wait time we were presented with at the front. Service here was slow. I mean S.L.O.W., slow. <br><br>Slow, slow, slow, slow, slow...<br><br>I believe it was partly because our server was relatively inexperienced. Nice kid... I mean really nice, but obviously he was new and the bad part of it was, the Cheesecake Factory management team either didn&#39;t recognize it or they just didn&#39;t seem to want to provide him any support. Even though there were many other employees in the area, serving other customers. Seriously, it felt like we were part of a &#34;stress test&#34; in a Bar Rescue episode!!!<br><br>One of the dinner orders was incorrect, (maybe it was the noise in the area), which resulted in my daughter waiting an additional 30 minutes for her meal, (can you say COMP?), and our dessert order was incorrect as well.<br><br>Bottom line... got there at 7:00ish and didn&#39;t get to pay our check until ~9:35... That was a couple drinks, an appetizer, 4 small meals and a desert order. Nearly 3 hours!!!<br><br>While we don&#39;t frequent the joint, we&#39;ve been here before and have always been satisfied with the quality of the food, the service and the overall value. We&#39;re hoping this was an anomaly...

This was me and my fiancee first time at this one we usually go to Westminster but we decided to go to redondo beach try a different one. Big mistake our server was nice and polite she served us very well. Me and my fiancee order the factory burrito grande i asked for extra cheese came back with less cheese and I&#39;m not the one who sends my plate back don&#39;t trust no one when i send my food back. We ordered cheesecake to go and when we got home our stomach was all jacked up glad we have two bathrooms. We won&#39;t be returning back to redondo beach cheesecake factory at all. That was a big mistake going to that one!!!

We enjoy the food choices and ocean view here. However, the past few times we&#39;ve visited the service has been poor. We&#39;ve asked our waiters for something and they just won&#39;t return or will come back 20 minutes later and have completely forgotten what we&#39;ve asked for. The manager even had to step in once, but the waiter still did not come around. I&#39;m really disappointed that it&#39;s continuing to happen. Maybe they&#39;re understaffed or maybe the waiters are just lazy. Either way, thumbs down.
The food was rwally good , nice atlasphere, reasonably priced, i would definitely go back

The food here was so awful last night, I am compelled to write a negative review and i try to avoid those.<br><br>Let me begin by saying that The Cheesecake Factory is MY FAVORITE restaurant and I have gone there for my birthday every year for the last 12 years. Mistake - attending the redondo beach location. <br><br>I ordered the buffalo wings which are usually, AMAZING.. They were dry and tasted old like they had been under a hearing lamp for hours. They didn&#39;t even LOOK appetizing. <br><br>Next, I ordered a signature dish I&#39;ve had a million times - chicken and shrimp gumbo. I could tell when it was first brought to me something was wrong because it looked orange and creamy more like a curry. Tasted like tomato sauce with cream - awful. I took 1 bite and sent it back and ordered nothing else. <br><br>My boyfriend ordered he Jamaican black pepper shrimp and chicken, another dish I&#39;ve had a ton of times. The brown rice was mushy and WAY over cooked and same goes for the plantains - They LOOKED burnt, but were soggy and dry than the sahara desert. Chicken was dry...<br><br>I normally get cheesecake but I was so turned off by the food, I decided to play it safe and just go home.<br><br>The service was good and he was patient with our unhappiness  and the drinks were excellent.. Unfortunately the most important part is THE FOOD.<br><br>WILL NEVERRRRRR ATTEND THIS LOCATION AGAIN AND I STRONGLY ADVISE AGAINST WASTING YOUR MONEY HERE, go to the Cheesecake Factory on Ventura in Sherman oaks, worth the drive to avoid this mediocrity.

The food was really good, I&#39;m not a big fan of the cheesecake factory restaurants but this one was good. The food had great flavor and the drinks the bartender recommended were simply amazing. They both were made with berries and peach, I forgot the names of the drinks but I will post a picture of them and if interested  in purchasing them just show them the pic and hope that helps.<br><br>As far as the food goes I got myself the bbq pulled pork burger and I loved it. My girlfriend got the oramge chicken nothing special but good. The oreo cheecake however hit the spot, a must try. As far as all cheesecakes factories go this probably is my favorite, mostly because service was good and food did not dissapoint.

The food was good, service was terrible. Maybe saw the waitress three times. Celebrating a special occasion, really thought this was a fun place to do it. Waitress goes on break just as desserts were going to be placed. Her replacement says hello then walks away. So then again we wait. Don&#39;t know if we all would be back real soon? Disappointing
I really like their cheesecake. Services is decent. The food is pretty good. I like it
Miso salmon was perfect!!! The sauce was delicious! My new favorite. Service was amazing <br>I be back soon..

This is by far my husband&#39;s and my favorite restaurant. Always good food and excellent service. And of course delicious cheesecake! We have gone and dined in and ordered for pick up many times.. and never disappointed!

Came back here recently after a long walk with the family around the marina.  The restaurant has a view, good food, valet parking so what not to love?  How about Long wait line and the restaurant does not take reservations.  Service was slow.  Appetizers and entrees were brought out at the same time!

Not really fair to give it less than 3 stars but cannot give it more. Went on July 22, 2018 at about 7:30 to have dinner with my family. Unfortunately I didn&#39;t carry cash with me and the valet told me without cash I couldn&#39;t park in the lot. I asked if I could self park and was told no. I asked him if there was nearby parking and he directed me to a bank several blocks away and told me to get cash. We left disappointed and had dinner somewhere else.

The menu is huge. It took some time to look through it all. It&#39;s quite an impressive menu. The waitress was very pleasant. The view from the Cheesecake Factory looks over the marina, providing a gorgeous view while eating. We tried two different cheesecakes and thought their cheesecakes weren&#39;t as good as their dinner foods.

It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve been to cheesecake. I have always thought the BJs copy was almost as good but at a better value. I&#39;m impressed they have taken all the dumb adds out of the menu and made it so the cooks can actually execute it. A great food happy hour even if they only have two beers on tap??
