Never have I been disappointed at a Cheesecake factory.<br><br>Parking:<br>Ever since Redondo Beach did the street renovations, street parking hasn&#39;t been great.  Parking has become more limited to the valet ($4 + tip), or the self-park lot if you&#39;re lucky...I&#39;m never lucky, or I&#39;m just too hungry to wait for someone to leave, lol.<br><br>Service:<br>**RESERVATIONS ARE NOT ACCEPTED, so always inquire about the wait if you know you won&#39;t be able to sit and wait for a table**<br>The service at this particular location has always been great, and the servers have always been very attentive.  I&#39;ve noticed that the bar area tends to get less attention, so sometimes you&#39;ll just have to flag down any server you can make eye contact with, but otherwise they&#39;re pretty good.  They pack your leftovers too, and are always happy to check with the kitchen if you&#39;re concerned about substitutions based on preference or dietary need.<br><br>They accommodate large parties here, and are also really great when it comes to hosting large events upstairs.  I had my grad luncheon here and they&#39;re fantastic at helping you plan and really make it exactly how you want it (e.g. linens, decorations, menu, etc.).<br><br>Happy Hour: <br>Happy hour is 4-6pm, and they have a pretty decent selection of appetizers and drinks.  Really sad that they removed the calamari from the happy hour menu, but happy to say that the avocado egg rolls are still there!  Fun fact: portion sizes during happy hour are the same as in the normal dining area, so be prepared to get stuffedddd.<br><br>Food:<br>PORTIONS ARE HUGE...and they also offer complimentary squaw and sourdough bread with butter.  Contrary to the more upscale restaurants, Cheesecake factory offers scenic waterfront dining where you can ALSO get your money&#39;s worth when it comes to portion sizes.  Most dishes average about $16-$18, but I almost always leave with leftovers.  <br><br>There&#39;s a ridiculously large selection of chicken dishes, but they&#39;re consistently prepared and yummy.  The chicken piccata, chicken bellagio, chicken stuffed tortillas, and moroccan chicken are all great.<br><br>The appetizers are pretty well-sized for a family of 4/possibly 5 if you&#39;re eating it along with the endless bread.  Desserts are obviously cheesecake or cheesecake, lol.  Personally, I&#39;m anti-cheesecake, so I can&#39;t say whether or not they&#39;re good.  However, I&#39;ve dined with enough people who love it, so it&#39;s probably worth it.<br><br>P.S., they&#39;re brunch menu is delicious!

Second time here. Our real plate of good was good. Waitress was alright. Drinks were ok. Appetizers was not so good. We got grossed out when we found something unusual. Waitress apologized...we didn&#39;t even eat half of it.  (On a good service restaurant, the manager will come apologize and it&#39;ll be taken off our bill) None of that happened. Which is fine but come on!! Anyways not again.

What&#39;s not to like? It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, you know what you&#39;re getting before you even walk in. The food is always good, the portions are huge, the only issue is the drink prices are inflated. The restaurant does have a great location, kind of annoying that you can only valet park.

Vegetarian options need improvement. Last night, I had a pasta dish. It was ok at first, but then it became boring to eat. The pasta noodles were also slightly hard, and it felt like it came out of box.  The price for lunch and dinner were very expensive for a regular meal.

I was really unhappy with my take out order today.  The online ordering system disallows placing an order before 12:00 pm.  I need the food earlier so I went into the restaurant at 11:15 am.  They said the food would be ready at 11:45 am.  The food did not come out until 12:05...they delivered it to me without apology even though I was clearly upset.  I will not be back.

Pros:<br>* Fast service<br>* They will fix errors<br>* Pretty restaurant - good for a big group<br>* Pretty scenery (boats and marina)<br>* They sing Happy Birthday to the Birthday person<br>* Skinny Menu<br><br>Cons:<br>* Valet only. Metered parking outside the area.<br>* Messed up my order- I ordered shrimp tacos, they gave me chicken<br>* Accidentally charged us a extra drink and we had to discuss it with them<br>* Tacos were not good<br><br>Overall... eh.

I always receive great service when I come to eat here! The menu has such a wide array of food options. I recommend any of the pastas, they&#39;re so great and the portions are pretty big. <br>I just wish the parking lot on the right was expanded more because it is almost always full when I come so I am forced to pay for valet.

This is my One of my Favorite Cheesecake Factory locations  The food here is delicious! For appetizers I like to have the avocado rolls or chicken nachos, they have a variety of delicious appetizers  Most of the time I order Salmon, grilled atlantic salmon or Herb Crusted both are very delicious  This Cheesecake Factory also has a great selection of wines! I prefer my wine a bit bitter (not sweet) so I order the Cabernet Francis Coppola. My bf likes the sweet so he&#39;ll go for the light colored Chardonnay. The cheesecake is the best!!! I love the Oreo cheesecake with the whip cream on the side! Iva actually tried many cheesecakes from here! My favorites are red velvet, Reese&#39;s lemon meringue, white chocolate raspberry truffle, snickers bar cheesecake, birthday cake cheesecake, and chocolate! The view here is beautiful; we like to sit out by the dock when we come in the evening overlooking the ocean its a nice place to bring a date, celebrate a birthday with friends or family, or just come to enjoy delicious plates off the menu

I love coming here for lunch and sometimes just for dessert and drinks. My favorite dish is definitely the small plate Truffle Bacon Grilled Cheese. As simple as it sounds, it&#39;s really one of the best sandwiches ever. The bread is crunchy, yet buttery, the cheese is always super gooey and you can&#39;t go wrong with bacon. Even though that is a fav, I&#39;ve still basically tried everything on all 72 pages of the menu at least once and I&#39;ve rarely been disappointed. Sometimes the service is lacking, but they can get pretty busy so it&#39;s understandable.

3.5 stars!<br><br>Been coming here for about 15 years. Geez, that makes me feel old~ I&#39;ve tried a lot of different items. Here is the rundown...<br><br>Appetizers:<br><br>- Tex Mex Eggrolls (Southwestern style eggrolls with avocado. Pretty good)<br>- Spinach and Cheese dip (pretty standard, nothing spectacular)<br>- Fire roasted fresh artichoke (I liked this, but then again, I love artichoke!)<br>- Lettuce wraps (I really like the lettuce wraps here. Simple, clean, and yummy)<br>- Sweet corn tamale cakes (These are also really good. I love sweet tamales)<br>- Crabcakes (not bad, but not great. Order it from a seafood place, not here)<br><br>Pastas:<br><br>-Garlic Noodles (pretty good. I add chicken to it. Garlic sauce, tomatoes, mushrooms and asparagus. Simple and flavorful)<br>- Evelyn&#39;s Fave Pasta (its just ok. it sounds better than it tastes. has eggplant, artichokes, olives, pine nuts, and tomatoes)<br>- Farfalle with chicken and garlic (also has peas and pancetta in it. pretty tasty)<br>- Shrimp with angel hair (one of my mom&#39;s faves... just like a scampi)<br><br>Other entrees:<br><br>- Steak Diane (a staple my family orders every time. Decent price and good flavor)<br>- Shrimp scampi (pretty good. standard shrimp scampi. I ordered this a few times already)<br>- Miso Salmon (personally I think miso sauce on fish could be with butterfish and nothing else. wasn&#39;t too impressed)<br><br>Cheesecakes:<br><br>- plain (you can&#39;t go wrong with plain, creamy, delicious cheesecake!)<br>- reece&#39;s peanut butter chocolate (it was way too sweet for me)<br>- kahlua coffee (one of my faves. its delish!)<br>- chocolate rasberry truffle (a friend ordered it for me. big mistake because i don&#39;t like rasberry in my dessert. my friend seemed to enjoy it though)<br>- Adams peanut butter cup (again, too sweet for me!)<br><br>Cocktails:<br><br>-Mojitos (I just stick to the mojitos. pineapple is the best!)

Almost everyone I know has been to cheesecake factory! It&#39;s an ideal place to go if you&#39;re hungry but it&#39;s also appropo for special occassions. That would make sense because some of the food is so sinful. I highly recommend the Godiva Chocolate cake. It&#39;s about as healthy as walking up to a hog and taking a bite out of it, but in its defense, it is to die for! It also has an amazing view in certain places. You just have to make sure you get there quickly.

So I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory locations in the past 23yrs and have always order the same dish ...shrimp jambalaya with rice. But over the years it have changed...qualities have gone down. Hey there Cheesecake Factory where are the sausages , mussels, and jumbo shrimp???? I really didn&#39;t know that chicken and small shrimp came with my dish, the funny thing was price is $20.00. I wonder if it was worth it...,I find it hard to not write this review. It was not good at all , I have never take the time to write reviews but I&#39;m so disappointed because I consider to go to Cheesecake Factory, is consider a luxury....so I&#39;m sort  upset that after $340 tab and a $68 tip.....I&#39;ll just take business elsewhere!!!

My all-time favorite! I have chosen this place for my birthday dinners several times already. Service never fails and so many good food options to choose from. <br><br>I highly suggest trying their herb crusted filet of salmon, fettuccine alfredo (also good w/ sun dried tomatoes - something I recently tried!), &amp; their farfalle pasta. For dessert, I recommend the red velvet cheesecake &amp; the chocolate tuxedo cream! Oh and can&#39;t forget about their fresh whole wheat bread &amp; butter! Mmm.. definitely starts off the meal just right! <br><br>This particular location also has a great view of the beach/port so you can choose to eat outside on a nice, sunny day and enjoy the view :)

Normally I love the hell outta this place. Waiters are always nice and on it. Last night I went to get cheesecake for myself and my boyfriend. Too bad they didn&#39;t give me what I ordered! I was pretty pissed since its 18 bucks for 2 slices. They gave me key lime which would have be fine if I wasn&#39;t craving what I&#39;d ordered and dislike key lime. I didn&#39;t want to drive all the way back  since I had just worked at 15 hr day. I still highly recommend this place. I love the food and will still go again and again as i have for many years
My favorite Cheesecake Factory location. For some reason, I like this one better than Marina, Pasadena, or the Grove. Actually, I don&#39;t care for the Grove location at all.

My two usual go to meals are the steak Diane and shrimp scampi along with a Pacifico on draft followed by a kamikaze shot. Prefect place for a late dinner or brunch outside. Service here is always great

This is a place that I try to visit when here in Hermosa Beach. I love the menu especially the cheesecakes. There is such s variety of foods and the view is awesome. <br><br>Just make sure you save room for the portion of food you consume. The portion sizes are probably for two. They also offer lunch portions on most if not all of their foods. <br><br>I always love the Chicken Romano (lunch portion of course). I also get the beef sliders and Mac and cheese balls. My favorite cheesecake is the Tuxedo cheesecake. <br><br>Above all be sure you exercise before you come here this will most likely take up most if not all of your calories for they day.

No parking except valet<br>The website indicates that there is self parking but when you arrive you are greeted but valets that don&#39;t communicate to you that the only self parking is the 6 spots on the street in front of the restaurant...what a joke.<br>The view...what wiew..all depends on where you sit no privacy just an endless march of people past you while you try to eat and the bathrooms suck.<br>The food is just average <br>Cramped spaces for larger groups<br>This place is dated a throw back to the eighties <br>The utensils we received we dirty and the server couldn&#39;t get our order correct <br>Forget having the server split the bill do it yourself <br>So dissatisfied <br>Oh P.S. the Cheese is great

I have always enjoyed the food and service here. Best to go during non peak times as the wait for a table can be long. The service has Lawry&#39;s been good and the food selections excellent. Ironically I&#39;ve never tried their cheesecake. Maybe next time.<br><br>Parking is another issue. I don&#39;t like valet parking so I always park on the street at a meter. But I&#39;ve never had a polemic finding a parking space.

The food is good, but this restaurant&#39;s heyday is in the past. I have been coming here with my family since the first Bush was president, on a regular basis I might add. I doubt there are that many people who have dined at this restaurant more than we have.<br><br>1) The food is still good, but the portions are not nearly as large as they were 10 years ago. In fact, in the 90s, the portions were borderline comically large. This is not the case anymore.<br><br>2) Customer service has DIMINISHED. The new waitstaff is NOT well trained. I can excuse inexperience, but stupidity and arrogance I will not. <br>       a) Months ago, the waitress abandoned us for 20 minutes. We got the manager who                      explained she switched serving areas and forgot to tell the new waitress. No compensation or even apologies from the manager. Wow!<br>       b) Another time, we ordered a salad as an appetizer. The waitress brought it during our dinner. We reminded her that we wanted it as an appetizer. She blamed the kitchen staff, said it wasn&#39;t her fault, and offered no apologies. Young lady, seriously?!?! And you think this is going to win you a generous tip.<br><br>Last point, Cheescake factory, I understand this isn&#39;t FINE dining, but for the love of god, can you please instruct your waiters to bring NEW glasses for refills on soft drinks. It&#39;s tacky and inelegant to have to hand your drinks to the waiter...which brings me to anther gripe. Instruct your waitstaff to place the plates and drinks on the table INSTEAD of handing them to the patrons. This isn&#39;t the hillbilly hoedown.

I come here quite frequently &amp; never had any real issues besides dirty silverware &amp; glasses (now I just ask for plastic forks and a straw) but last night was very disappointing.  Everytime I come I get the same thing...Farfalle pasta with roasted garlic. It comes with chicken but I always add shrimp to it. So I ordered it, and asked &#34;can you add shrimp?&#34; The waiter says no problem, but I guess on the ticket he wrote &#34;side of shrimp.&#34; When my food comes, I get the pasta with a side of GRILLED shrimp on another plate with the tail still on &amp; cold!! So I ask the server who brought out the food why isnt the shrimp mixed with the pasta? She blames it on our waiter &amp; says &#34;he wrote a side of shrimp and the cooks like to make it just how its entered in.&#34; I said okay and asked can they remake it with but with shrimp added? She didnt seem to have any issue with that. Our actual waiter then comes over to blame it on the kitchen &amp; said he told them to add it in. Honestly I didnt even care. I just wanted it remade. Now, this is the disappointing part. They bring the pasta out I look at it &amp; see all they did was put the grilled shrimp that was previously brought out in the pasta, put it in a pan, &amp; mixed it in!! I know this because the shrimp still had the tail on &amp; it was grilled. Mind you, I ALWAYS get this item &amp; when it&#39;s done correctly, the shrimp isnt grilled &amp; the tails aren&#39;t on! I just dealt with it because I was so hungry but the shrimp was definitely overcooked. Pure laziness! I added a star because our waiter was actually really nice &amp; I know it wasnt his fault. I&#39;ll definitely think twice before coming back to this location.

Extremely long wait! Their food isn&#39;t that great to wait that long! <br><br>Problem could have been solved if they only took reservations but apparently less &amp; less restaurants believe in reservations!  <br><br>Added the 2nd start because our waitress did what she could to sweeten the sour experience! <br><br>Then to top it off the restroom was out soap at one sink and out of paper towels. So I snatched a dinner napkin off a table on the way back to my seat!

Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food is pretty consistent across different locations, however service isn&#39;t. Service is what this location excels at. Yesterday evening, Anthony our server was A+. Attentive to our table and really chill. The food was good as usual; I got the fried macaroni &amp; cheese, chicken parm &#34;pizza style&#34; and my fav, lemoncello torte.

What happened to this restaurant? We used to love the food here. Stopped by for happy hour. Retiring the cocktails as both were sugar bombs. Chicken sliders looked great but tasted like used oil. Yuck! The Vietnamese summer rolls used to be great. Our order of tools was mainly noodles in a wrapper. Total bummer!
Skinnylicious menu is awesome. I recommend the steak medallions or the Tuscan chicken which me and my husband split along w the appetizer Caesar salad. Always consistently good.

I wasn&#39;t sure I would like this place. Huge menu, it was kinda overwhelming at first. But, we dove in and tried a bunch of stuff.<br><br>Fried mac and cheese-good<br>Burger-good<br>nachos-good<br>sashimi-good<br>chicken in a pink sauce with pasta-A OK.<br>Salmon-suprisingly good<br><br>But, what really sold me was the next day I heated up the other half of my daughters burger and it might have been better than 90% of the burgers ever....!!! That&#39;s a burger.<br><br>Last piece of advice....<br><br>Start backwards and have cheesecake first!<br><br>I&#39;ll be back again.
This place is one of my favorite places . No matter what cheesecake you go to the service and the food are always awesome. I love their happy hour and I love their cocktails .

I got rip off by a unfaithful Asian man, I gave him a 20 to pay for valet parking and he gave me 13 back. I asked how much I valet? He said 4 dollars. I said you gave me 13 he said no I didn&#39;t. I can&#39;t stand liars. Don&#39;t trust this guy if you go there.

Grear location, on the pier. The Cheesecake Factory franchise always has a place in my heart and tummy! Their menu is extensive. Everything and anything from healthy salads, burgers, pastas, pizza, asian, Mexican, you name it.. And of course, their cheesecakes are amazing. My fave cheesecake is plain with strawberries! Def go on an empty stomach and try not to get full off their complimentary breads and butter (trust me, it&#39;s hard not to!). Always good service. Portions are large and prices are decent. At this particular location, you&#39;ll have to valet your car if you&#39;re not lucky enough to find metered parking.

Officially my family&#39;s number one restaurant to eat at. The price is just right<br>And the good is great. Every time i come here I order the Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>And the nachos. Mmmmmmmmm. Yummy! <br>Also lets not forget about the variety of cheesecakes that you have to choose from. One downside. Sometimes the wait is a pain in the ****<br>I wish that they could make membership cards. If they did I would gladly apply since My family and I go often. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Adrian  the server .man one of the best servers iv ever seen in my life . I&#39;m in the culinary industry and Iv been a executive chef for 5 years and I&#39;m very impressed<br>With him he is Very kind Hearted and very humble cheese cake factory needs to give him a raise or even make him a manger I promise u he will make the business grow . He was just very impressive I will be back at this location again just because how our service was thank you again for this

Service is great and food is even better. This is my go to place when I have late night cravings. Plus its over looking the beach. Highly recommend!<br><br>Favorite appetizers: corn tamales &amp; avocado egg rolls &amp; calamari<br><br>Must try: Pasta Davinci &amp; Hibachi Steak

+ 1st redondo beach, ca cheese cake factory &#34;review&#34; of 20.14<br><br>2nd time @ a cheese cake factory! Our waiter &#34;Brando C.&#34; was very nice and respectful (he gets 5 out of 5 stars) the cheese cake factory gets 4/5 because I didn&#39;t like:<br>1) hot chocolate <br>2) the rice <br>3) $4.00 for parking (I didn&#39;t like that b/c we already paying 4 the food now I have to pay 4 parking. It&#39;s like a trick the factory has b/c &#34;I&#34; didn&#39;t c no free parking but there are coin meters. <br>4) the oreo cheesecake <br><br>I did like:<br>1) Teriyaki Chicken <br>2) Baked Banana <br>3) Caramel Pecan Cheese Cake<br>4) The outside view (looking onto the water &amp; the boats)<br>5) the Pager <br><br>The outside eating area has heating lamps (that came be hot to seat by)<br>the star pager b/c it was crowded &amp; we went outside and they paged us so we will not miss our turn. We didn&#39;t have to wait long to be seated. I had the cheese cake factory &#34;slice of joy&#34; cards (2) which means my friend &amp; I cheese cake were free!<br><br>™ 1.1.14

Umberto , the bartender is such a nice guy! You can tell he has plenty of years of experience by his precision and the way he makes the drinks. He is always giving great customer service to my husband and i ! he has a smile on his face.all the time and is eager to serve and makes sure that were always happy.

I am a HUGE fan of the Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Club. Please give it a try.<br><br>This is one of my favorite locations due to the scenery. If weather permits, sit on the heated patio.<br><br>If in the mood for dessert, you can&#39;t go wrong with the Strawberry covered cheesecake, Pineapple upside-down cheesecake, or the Banana cream cheesecake.

I am giving these guys a 3 star because the location is super nice and I love the setting and our waitress was super sweet. On the bad side it took them forever to seat us because the girl was very unorganized but we finally did get a seat. Let&#39;s get to the reason i should have given them a 1 star is because we waited over a hour and a half to get our food after ordering it and they did state the kitchen was really behind but when the food finally came out it was not even cooked on half of our plates. I hope they are able to get this together because it is a very nice place and let&#39;s face it the cheesecake is impeccable. Note that below they have replied and I did speak to a manager at the Cheesecake Factory he was a nice man and comped our cheesecake which was very nice but again you cannot change the experience but we will come for cheesecake just not the food. The food was not good and hasn&#39;t been on any occasion that we have been there even without all the other.

Great American restaurants! <br><br>Large menu to choose from, they offer different variety of foods. You can get almost anything from tacos, pizza, pasta, steak or etc.... Great to go with large groups regard food choice but no reservation is accepted. The portions are large and you can share. Free breads at the beginning... They are always hot and yummy!<br><br>Services is great, they are very attentive and always checking on you. Kids friendly place , offer a place a bread with smiley face for your little one :&#34;)<br><br>I love their cheesecakes....little pricy per slide but it is huge... Usually get them to go and enjoy at home.

This is my favorite cheesecake from the IE to the LA area. My husband has been in the club and restaurant industry for over 15 years and this place far exceeds the rest. Jessica the Bar-back needs to be a server or a bartender!!! Personality honestly will not disappoint. Meeting the GM was slow but he worked a 14 hour shift......we can all relate. PLEASE come and see JESSICA and RAMON at the bar they will not disappoint. Good drinks and food. Fast, easy and honest on what&#39;s the best to order!!!!  I can&#39;t stress enough. We came on  a date night from our kids on Friday night. Sit at the bar and ask for. Jessica and Ramon!!!

This location is one of the ones I&#39;ve been coming to for a long time. The food is always great, with a novel for a menu to find something for all appetites. If you can&#39;t resist you must try a cheesecake of course. I get the Louisiana Chicken pasta almost every time, if your a pasta lover then you must try! <br>The dining area is massive, with a bar, outside, and multiple inside sections. It&#39;s located next to the harbor and has a great view for those sections near the windows. <br>The servers are all usually friendly, fast, and all around good customer service.

The food is alright but the service is HORRIBLE!! The waiter told us his name and left for about 10 mins. He stopped in the hallway with some girl which looked like flirting then about 3 mins they asked us for our drinks. My aunt asked the waiter if we can get butter and bread, he said sure. The waitress took our order and drinks. The meals came out and they forgot out of our 15 meals. The food wasn&#39;t even that good. My cousin asked for a side of extra white sauce to go on her pasta and it was soooo watery, it was like milk. The butter and bread still hasn&#39;t come out so we asked the lady for it. Time past and we got our bread,finally but not the butter. My cousin&#39;s fiancee asked for coffee before she ordered her food. They rarely checked on you for refills or to ask for something. We ate <br>and the checks came out. They messed up on our checks! I get that its alot of people but we asked him and he said &#34;Yes, got it... 100%&#34; with an additude. We still haven&#39;t gotten our bread nor coffee. We told him that and he said &#34;I didn&#39;t want to bring the coffee because the machine wasn&#39;t working properly.&#34; He wouldn&#39;t even have told us anything if we hadn&#39;t have asked him. Anyways the lady did basically most of the work, she helped us with the check problem and that was it. I&#39;ve been to different Cheesecake Factories with larger parties and this has been the worst experience after having to wait 2 hours to be seated.

I had to pick a restaurant to have my anniversary dinner at, and my cousin suggested The Cheesecake Factory. Bang bang chicken and shrimp is our favorite dish there. Service is always great, and portions are generous. I had enough food left for 2 more meals! We also like the warm bread and butter too. The view is great if you go before sundown of course. Lots of different yummy cheesecake to choose from obviously.      -Enjoy life ;)

Ordered the red velvet cheesecake and it was heavenly. Usually the place is packed with people, this day was slow so we got served right away. Very friendly and attentive staff and delicious cheesecake.
Their food is excellent , even when they messed up they fixed it expertly and my only complaint is that you have to pay for parking when their self parking gets full , which is tiny

Okay, seriously had the beat time at this restaurant last night. It all started off with Jazmin (host) who was such a kind girl. She greeted us and even asked where we would like to be seated. Wow !! Thank you so much for asking. Then our server &#34;Natalie S&#34; this girl is such an angel. She treats us with such love and kindness her service has been one of the best service I have ever received in my life. She never forget what we ask for, she is on top of refills she does not rush us out. You can tell this girl truly enjoys working there. Its employees like that, that truly make the business. <br><br>From now on I am requesting her as my server if I had the option of putting 10 stars for this employee I would. She goes above and beyond. Employees that brought our food and drinks out were so sweet and attentive ugghh!! i love it when i receive outstanding service like this. Tho thumbs up!

Order delivery through DoorDash regularly. They specifically let you select at checkout if you want bread. I never receive it. DoorDash said they would take care of this more than once and they have not. <br><br>Do not order delivery if you want bread and utensils AND do not use DoorDash. Poor customer service.

Ryan is the man best server here hands down the food was great the service was on point and overall we had a great time i highly suggest this place for food and good customer service friday night at 7:00pm not to bad of a wait either only about 10 minutes

Came here for dinner tonight before my brother goes back to college. There was a good amount of people waiting outside, but the wait was only 15 minutes, so they were quickly seating people. <br><br>The location is very nice (sitting on the ocean), but the free parking is very limited, so bring some quarters for the meters across the street. <br><br>Our waitress was friendly and although very busy, she was attentive and helpful. <br><br>The appetizer/complimentary bread is very good. I really like the brown with the oats. The texture is so soft and chewy, with a slight sweetness. Tasted fresh and was perfectly warm when they brought it out. <br><br>The menu is huge and many items aren&#39;t the greatest for you, so I definitely appreciate all the Skinnylicious items they offer. <br><br>I decided to get the skinny lemon garlic shrimp, which is served with angel hair pasta and asparagus. I got the sauce on the side and only added a part of it to my dish. It was very flavorful and the shrimp was cooked nicely. I would definitely get that again. A bit expensive for the amount, but it was quality. <br><br>My whole family really enjoyed their meals as well. My mom said the skinny turkey and avocado sandwich was really good and was surprised that it was under 590 calories. <br><br>For dessert we ordered the Kalua and the Craig&#39;s carrot cheesecake. Both were delicious! A definite cheat day, but we enjoyed every bite of it.

i love this restaurant&#39;s customer service and food. the waiters and hosts are always so friendly and welcoming. the estimated time wait they give you is usually correct or close to being spot on and the wait time for food isnt so bad.

Came here for Saturday brunch, which is available until 2PM. when we were getting seated, the hostess was extremely attentive and made sure to let us know if there was anything she could do to make us more comfortable, like turning on the heater since we were complaining it was cold, to let her know and she&#39;d be glad to do it. She was very sweet and set the tone for our meal. We also had a good waitress. <br><br>I ordered the Fried Chicken and Eggs Benedict with the Whisky Smash, and both were AMAAAAAZING. I don&#39;t know if it was because I was hungry, but man it was so good and five star worthy! I would also recommend the Irish coffee MANHATTAN, it&#39;s amazing for any coffeee lover out there.
Came here to celebrate my moms birthday. Everything was delicious. Our service was excellent. Surprisingly we were seated right away even though it was a Saturday

I love eating at The Cheesecake Factory.  I go there every week in Honolulu.  I was on a business trip in California and decided to go to this restaurant with my husband and friends.  Our food was good.  However, upon eating the bread, my husband noticed a bug on our bread.  I was so disgusted by that bug that I honestly lost my appetite.  We let our server know and they went to inform the manager.  The manager took a while to come to our table and when she finally did come she did apologize, stating she has no idea where the bug came from and that she informed the kitchen staff.  She asked if there was anything else needed, we told her we didn&#39;t want anymore bread.  We then asked the server for the bill and it was very disappointing to see that our bill was the full price.  They didn&#39;t comp our meal in any way or even offer a free dessert.  I wouldn&#39;t have taken the dessert because finding that insects makes me wonder how clean that kitchen really is but I believe the manager should have at least gave a discount on our food, but she did nothing to compensate for finding an insect in our food.  Won&#39;t visit this location again and I don&#39;t recommend it to anyone.  Just so sad because the server was nice but expect to pay full price regardless of what you find in your food.

Our server was great! The food was awesome. The reason I had to knock off 2 stars was because of Ashlyn. After we got some food bagged up by our server, we went to the cheesecake counter. Ashlyn greeted us and I asked her for two Oreo cheesecakes. She rung me up and handed me my receipt. I didn&#39;t give her any tip because she didn&#39;t show me why she deserved one. All she did was push a few buttons. She hadn&#39;t done anything. So when she sees she got no tip she decided to take her sweet ass time in getting said cheesecake. It took her 10 mins (I counted) for her to give us our cheesecake. Mind you, WE WERE THE ONLY INES THERE AT THE COUNTER. There was NO ONE else in line. It was about 4:30pm on 4/18/17. Just my boyfriend and I and Ashlyn. What she could have done to receive a tip was get my order, show me how quick she could get it to me and how efficiently. Instead she did the opposite. Then when I took my bag and told her thank you she gave me an eye roll. Advise to management: reprimand and retrain her. Everyone else in the restaurant was super pleasant but her.<br><br>Update: after the manager of the Cheesecake Factory reached out, I have to update my review. They seemed genuinely concerned that I had poor customer service from one person. I&#39;d hate for one person to reflect the entire store. I have now updated my rating to five stars. They definitely made up for it and know the value of customer service.

This review is for Paolo, who is truly one of the BEST servers I&#39;ve ever met!! I&#39;ve been going to that Cheesecake Factory for 10 years and Paolo is by far the best I&#39;ve seen.<br><br>Paolo took care of our party and went way above and beyond...he knew the menu back to front, went out of his way to explain things to my family and gave us A+++ Customer service. He made us feel like we were part of his family and we felt so valued as customers!!<br><br>I don&#39;t normally post reviews just for the service but in this case Paolo really earned it. He is the epitome of what every restaurant would want to provide their customers. <br><br>THANKS PAOLO!!!!

Disclosure. This is in re DoorDash order. <br>Order for 5 people. One item completely missing. Another item is incorrect. Called cheesecake and was transferred to someone whose only response was to go to the DoorDash app and request a credit for the missing item.  She didn&#39;t even take down the order number to look into it. <br>I asked her while convenient to pass the buck to DoorDash, the item was missing because cheesecake failed to place it in the to-go bag so why would cheesecake not take ownership of the error.  The person hung up on me.  <br>The least a restaurant should do in such a situation is to 1) look into why the item was missing to ensure it does not happen again (I.e., at least ask for the order #), 2) Offer something for the customer to come back. Neither was done.  <br>Will not be placing any orders from cheesecake and despite being a frequent patron of this location, based on the way they handled the aftermath of their own error, won&#39;t be dining at the restaurant in the future either.

Horrendous! (Part 2 of 2)<br><br>Moving right along, the food was passable, not exceptional. Having to eat it fast due to the arctic blasts hitting me, and the constant crashing from the busing station, had so deadened my senses as to make my &#34;dining&#34; experience, every bit as exciting as eating a burger at a bus stop.  One more point, and this was due to the proximity of the order station.  If you are a server, and you are working within earshot of your customers, having side conversations amongst yourselves is really unprofessional.  Your job is to serve, but otherwise be invisible.  The restaurant guests are really not interested in your personal lives.<br><br>What a horrendous (yes, HORRENDOUS) experience.  Let&#39;s recap, shall we.  1) The longer than predicted wait, 2) Being seated at a table that should not be located where it is, 3) Cold arctic air blasts, 4) Loud crashes from busing station, 5) No server for 15 minutes after being seated, 6) No drinks 15 minutes after ordering, 7) Having to track down the Manager to get things moving, 8)  No water, 9) Having to beg for bread, 10) Food order finally placed after having arrived at the restaurant nearly 3 hours earlier, 11) Food arrives COLD.  After all of that, plus the spoken apology from the manager, one might expect an adjustment of some sort on the bill.  Nope.  Not a word.<br><br>So, fellow restaurant patrons, do you think this behavior by the Cheesecake Factory can be excused, or at least explained away.  It was a busy night you say.  So what, they knew it would be a busy night, they&#39;re in the restaurant business.  I don&#39;t expect them to launch rockets into space, but I do expect them to know how to manage a restaurant.  Why would they seat us, if they were incapable of serving us properly?  I don&#39;t blame the server, by the looks of it she was working 4 or 5 tables.  I blame the manager.  The strategy must have been that once we were seated, it was harder for us to walk out.  My family was held hostage by the Cheesecake Factory in Redondo Beach for 4.5 hours.<br><br>For everyone reading this, do yourself a favor, find another restaurant.  Find a restaurant that prides itself on providing a dining experience, not just a place to sit and eat a meal.  Find a restaurant that appreciates its patrons, and lives by this time honored statement;  &#34;A happy customer will tell their friends, an unhappy customer will tell EVERYONE.  There, I just told everyone.

I looooove this place! The food is always amazing and they have such a wide variety of options. You would think they would slack on the quality because of how many options they have, but everything I&#39;ve tried is delicious. Plus they have cheesecake, which is always a plus (I get the Godiva cheesecake). The service is consistently good as well. This is me and my boyfriends weekly favorite spot.
Great service and great staff ,steak Dian was great and taste good .the waiter was great and friendly .

My cobb salad tasted bad I looked it was wilted lettuce, my sons fruit was old and discolored. They said they would redo my salad they did minus half the ingredients. The staff was nice but food terrible. We will not return.

As one of the original supporters of the Redondo Beach Cheesecake Factory, even having worked there in the late nineties, our family has frequented this location for over 20 years. We&#39;re sad to report that everything here has gone downhill. From the inattentive service to the decrease in the quality and portions of the food, to them taking over 8 parking spots for &#34;food delivery&#34; trucks and &#34;to go&#34; orders to now no longer including a drink with the kids meal even though their menu says that it is included (still charged $1 per drink).  Had to repeatedly ask for bread and our waters were never refilled. The FINAL straw was the behavior of manager Ashley Contreras. On a prior Cheesecake visit with a party of 12, a particularly bad incident involving hair in our food and then being charged twice for that dish, prompted her to offer to buy dessert for the entire table of 12 people. We decided to take a pass and she gave me her business card saying &#34;the next time you come in I would like to buy dessert for the entire table&#34;. Well I decided to take her up on the offer today and as luck would have it she was actually working in the restaurant today.  I told our server about the situation and Ashley herself came over with the 4 desserts we ordered telling me that she had taken 2 off of the bill. I reminded her of what she had last promised and told her that she had given me her business card and I offered it for her to see. She promptly accepted the offer, took her business card from me and said &#34;well yeah that&#39;s me&#34; and put it in her pocket and walked away. Thank you Ashley for keeping the Cheesecake factory classy with your excellent managerial skills and hospitality. Our family is done with this establishment! Only giving an extra star for the nice busboy who was only person who gave us any service.

Back again today!  Still very busy but we found two seats at the bar. Good thing we sat here :). Otherwise we would never have seen Jessica - the AMAZING bar back, work her tail off. Management, if you are reading this, Jessica is awesome. Seriously- the reason your bar runs so smoothly is because of the girl supporting your bartenders!!!!!!  Give that girl a raise!!!!

We don&#39;t really have that many problems here, but when we went here for my brothers birthday, the waiter was aware that it was his birthday, and she still gave us terrible service, and at the end of everything, she didn&#39;t even sing or bring cake for him. But I decided to give them another chance on my birthday, and the waiter was so nice. He was really attentive and always made sure that our drinks were filled, and always asked us if we needed anything else. It got kind of annoying, but at the same time, we&#39;re glad that he did that.

SLOW 20 minutes to get waters!, inattentive staff, freezing inside, and ridiculously dark. The food selection is fabulous but the flavor is average at best. Just not worth the money. Slow waitstaff on more than one visit, shows they have no intention of improving.

Early afternoon lunch before 2 is best. Like any other Cheesecake Factory, parking and general wait time can become crazy. The food here was excellent, and our server was very attentive. Sitting outside is highly recommend. There&#39;s a lovely view of the marina, and beach birds. While these restaurants are a bit on the pricey side, it&#39;s definitely worth the cost and wait time.
Love this place every time I visit. They have the best happy hour in the South Bay. Fried Mac and cheese balls and factory nachos are delicious.
Here with my work &#34;squad&#34;. Love this location! My happy hour food is delicious.  Buffalo Blast and Tex Mex Rolls!!

This location has gone tragically downhill. Its dirty (hello, clean the floor) and the service is terrible. The waiters are not trained well and seem to be overwhelmed. Meanwhile, others are walking around aimlessly. Quality of the food also doesnt seem great. Ive given then several chances recently and it just isn&#39;t getting better. I think their management needs to address some of these issues....if you are reading these reviews and responding, I am sure you can see the common complaints. Spend less time on yelp and more fixing the issues in this place.
The food was great. Everything is made fresh to order. When food is good it&#39;s a little fatty, just keep that in mind.

Our waiter marcio was amazing. He was charismatic, funny and a great singer. Without me asking he turned down the ac because he could tell I was cold. The valet was great too. We told them we were walking to the bank nearby because we didn&#39;t have cash. He told us to take our car so we didn&#39;t have to walk. I was surprised he trusted us to come back. Overall great experience. <br>P.S. We did go back to pay to valet.

My wife says the chicken and shrimp was good but not very good.  I am very disappointed in the Giant Classic Burger.  My burger was very dry and tasteless.  A good burger should be juicy with a lot of flavor.  Your cook does not know how to cook a good burger.  The service and server was Excellent!

It was a great place to celebrate a family birthday of more than 20 people and the service and the food was excellent. That&#39;s why we went again this weekend to the one closest to us, in Beverly Hills, to eat a good burger! But that experience in 90210 was very upsetting. :&#39;( *check my review on that location

Oh yeah, this place is always a staple for date nights. Killer sunsets and great cheesecakes, naturally. The main courses are pretty good but nothing too special. Again, view and cheesecake. Try to come early but this place can really fill up for dinner. Seriously, this wait has deterred many in the past. Overall solid choice for dinner, but only for the right occasion.

The Cheesecake Factory is pretty much self-explanatory. <br>This huge restaurant chain serves so much good food. The menu has so much to choose from so there is always a hit-or-miss menu (for example, orange chicken and Jamaican black pepper shrimp). But, there&#39;s always more good food than bad ones. Whenever we go to visit, we love to order spicy chipotle pasta (which is a must-order dish!), crispy crab bites, nashvill hot chicken nuggets, roasted pear and blue cheese flatbread, crab and artichoke dip, miso salmon, steak diane, and bang bang chicken and shrimp. We go to the Cheesecake Factory every once a month so we tried so many other dishes as well but cannot remember all at the moment. <br>The portion sizes are large enough to share with everyone at the table. <br>There is nothing to say about their original cheesecake because it&#39;s just so good and melts in your mouth. <br>Customer service is excellent. However, during lunch hours the service is noticeably more slower for some reason. They are always packed on holidays and wait is little long on weekend nights so always try to go on weekdays for better food and service. Try to sit outdoors because inside is always too loud and the wait is shorter for outside seating.

Second night dinning here, got seated right away, service was excellent. Hanna our server was great.  Food was very good. I had the spicy cashew chicken w Brown rice.  We shared a cheese cake enough for 3. I would come back again but heading home.

I visited on 7/30/15. All of the servers&amp;staff were pleasant. They checked on me in a timely manner&amp;all. They were very professional. I always get The Strawberry Cheesecake&amp;decided to try The Red Velvet one since it was Nat&#39;l Cheesecake Day. It was delicious! Also for Happy Hour, one can&#39;t go wrong w/The Cosmo!
This place is very nice and intimate and the food is delicouse its a great place if your gonna take your girl out on a romantic date highly reccomend!

Let me start off by saying I&#39;m easy to please when it comes to waiter service. <br><br>parking was horrible! yes, I know its the beach by the harbor but I mean come on! your going to turn your entire parking lot to valet only? seriously? <br><br>the wait took FOREVER and this was on a Thursday! <br><br>we ordered<br> <br>Pineapple Mojito DELICIOUS! <br><br>mushroom and zucchini fries.<br>chicken mediera<br>steak diane<br><br>all were delicious except for mushroom &amp; zucchini fries reason being.......<br><br>The food came out before the appetizer! MY NUMBER ONE PET PEEV <br><br>Our waitress came by and apologized , asked if we still wanted the appetizer? NO, not really, no need now. She responds with another apology and says she will speak with her manager to see what they can do.<br><br>she comes by again and totally disregards no appetizer.<br><br>um, ok...........<br><br>This wouldn&#39;t have been such a big deal if we weren&#39;t waiting on refills ....<br><br>THE BILL<br><br>the appetizer we never received, the one she was going to speak to her manager about....IT WAS ON THE BILL.<br><br>HORRIBLE.

Had a great time with 24 people from Sam&#39;s Club.  I enjoyed the Chicken Bellagio and Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Ripple Cheesecake.  Derrick S, Jose R,  Khyreen H, Derrick Y, Frannie G, Laura C, Omar, Kristin, Victor, Nancy, Boyfriend Alex, Brian, Nick, Steven, wife, Vanessa, Anthony, Mikey, Adrianna, Josh, Seth, Daniel, Wyatt, and David.  Barbara was our server.  Look forward to hanging out next month.

I like this restaurant but I cant speak on the sit down dining experience as I always get take out since I live a block over. The food is always good and they dont take long to have it prepared. The parking sucks for take out especially on busy days and the valet guys are cool but I had one ask me a dumb a** question when I parked in the take out area. He said &#34; are you getting take out?&#34; Well DUH if I park in the take out spot it must mean I am ordering take out. I asked him why he thought to ask me that his response was &#34;people do that a lot&#34; so I asked this clown do I look like the type to do that? He looked stupid I pulled off....other than that one time this place is cool

I came here against my will. My children were treating so I was dragged.... this place NEVER lets me down. No matter what I order they will not have it available. Tonight not only did they not have the food item I ordered... The table that we were seated at was dirty, it had dirty silverware placed on the table, and after I ordered my food the server came to let us know the food would be out shortly never mentioned the item I ordered was not available. When they came to place the food on the table is when I was told they have good news and bad news.. TF!!! This is the 2nd time in 8 months that I&#39;ve come and been disappointed. Then she tells me they have 280 items on the menu. Girl BYE!!!
Speedy service as usual Priscilla was awesome came in around lunch. Food was nice and hot. And had a great view of the dock. Never dissatisfied. Thanks cheesecake factory!

Blonde haired server named Leighan wasn&#39;t very polite to my table. We came at around 10:50 on a Monday night but we were unaware the kitchen closed at 11:00 and if the host told us this it wouldn&#39;t be a problem. We were seated quickly in a very nice booth but Leighan was definitely trying to rush us out and it was obvious. The restaurant still had 10 other tables with people eating.

Was there last night and of course everything started off pretty cool until the food came!  We ordered 5 appetizer and everything came out completely cold! Like it had been sitting in there kitchen for an hour before being served to ya! We asked for our waitress 4 different times over 25 minutes, was told when they couldn&#39;t locate the waitress that they would send management and again nobody showed up! All of food was sitting was now freezing!  Finally a waitress (not our waitress) comes over and is super rude to us for God knows what reason and takes our food away and said now she has to reorder everything!!!  Like that was our fault?!  Finally our waitress comes back and said they were doing a &#34;company alignment&#34; what ever that is! So now after 40mins we are now explaining that our food needs to be reheated we never got anything back except for on Appetizer and the other food we are still waiting for and my my friend that had joined us late was still waiting for<br>Her meal!! And guess what that meal was never even ordered!!!  So my problem wasn&#39;t that we had horrible food my problem was really watching all the staff talk about us and whisper about of table! How does the customer become the problem when we didn&#39;t have a waitress for nearly 40mins and no food for damn near 1 1/2 hours! The original waitress was nice at the start but it pisses me off that they couldn&#39;t say sorry for the problem and the fact that everyone in there was talking about us instead of trying to get our fucking food!! Even when we got up from our table on 5 different times to ask for help!!! Never will go there again

I love the location of this Cheesecake Factory, very calm and relaxing, especially since it&#39;s basically on the beach. I recommend sitting outside, especially on a beautiful day. You get a view of the ocean, which is stunning. Our server Axl Dean was great. He didn&#39;t rush us and was very attentive. I was overwhelmed by the menu, so he recommended the Crispy Chicken Costoletta and it was delicious. It comes with asparagus and mashed potatoes, but I substituted the mashed potatoes for french fries and the asparagus seemed over cooked. The dish was great. My favorite part was the lemon sauce, terrific. The entire experience was great, however there is one down side. There is only valet parking. If you don&#39;t want to do valet, you have to park outside at the meters. Valet is $4. Overall, it was a great experience and I would come back!<br><br>P.S. Get the Red Velvet Cheesecake, it is the bomb!

The food was bland and service wasn&#39;t too great. Very noisy and I don&#39;t understand why it&#39;s always busy. Maybe I&#39;m just the odd one out but aside from the actual cheesecakes, it didn&#39;t live up to the hype for me. I ordered a fillet mignon but it came out very hard which is the opposite of what the texture of the meat is supposed to be. I&#39;ll probably just order dessert to go if it&#39;s needed.

This is my Favorite cheesecake I always go to the one in Marina but I have came to this location only twice and it&#39;s way better than the one in Marina. I came today with my mother and brother, we were seated in a timely manner and the waitress I didn&#39;t catch her name but she was a very sweet blonde young woman. She was great very nice got our food and drinks to our table very fast and the food was delicious! We eat a lot we&#39;re big people who like to eat and none of us finished our plates the portions were so big! The waitress had to leave and she left us with another blonde woman with curly hair and glasses who was also pretty awesome. No complaints everything about the service and the food was just delightful.

This is a nice Cheesecake factory location that is not too crowded (unlike most others I have been to) and they have mandatory valet parking for $4. It&#39;s in a nice location next to the marina with nice views. The staff is very nice and friendly. Would come here again.
Rob is the best!  Great service and stellar personality.. Makes it pleasure every time!!

I went to the Redondo Beach location on yesterday to celebrate my birthday. First of all, they have very limited self parking and about 200 valet parking spaces.  I observed one valet guy pull a vehicle out of the self parking space while another valet guy pull right in behind with another vehicle. So, their mission is to keep the self parking lot full, so they force you to pay for valet. Granted, $4.50 is not a lot for valet, but if you&#39;re being forced to pay is just bluntly wrong and the food was just okay. This was my first and last time at this location.

This place never disappoints! We ordered fried mac and cheese balls, Tex mex egg rolls, sliders, and a whole lot of mojitos. If you are a fan of cucumbers I suggest the cucumber mojito, my friends ordered the pineapple mojito (which is a little sweet for my taste) but they loved it. <br>Sara was our waitress and I loved her. She greeted us,  got our orders right, kept checking on us even with a full house, suggested drinks, didn&#39;t rush us, she made us feel really comfortable right from the beginning. I was very impressed. Give the girl a raise =) <br>We sat @ the Bar and still had a really good view of the water and boats

Celebrated my friends 50th bday. Made reservations 1 week in advance for a party of 10. We were seated on time.<br><br>Our server was fantastic. .<br>I was able to decorate the table with Beautiful pink balloons and green beads..<br><br>The food was good, although we all noticed the temperature of the food could had been warmer. <br><br>Restaurant was clean.<br><br>We were lucky to find self parking to avoid the $4.00 valet. Self parking is to the right of the restaurant. .<br><br>Reservations suggested.
Love The Cheesecake Factory! Returned tonight for a filet and view. Service was incredible. Food delicious.

Fabulous fried mac n cheese balls. How can you go wrong with mac n cheese that is fried and covered in marinara sauce. You cant, I would order this. Also, the crusted chicken romano is one of the best dishes in my opinion.

So i ate dinner here on 9/24 thursday.  Food wasnt terrible, server was not spectacular either but i digress.  I just had a simple spaghetti and meatballs, which i only ate half, they give such a huge serving.  The sauce seems like they just pureed a few tomatoes and added some freshly diced tomatoes and heated it, that was a negative.  I had to take it home.  So on 9/25, the next day, i try to eat the left overs, which is not bad since the sauce is not so watery now.  I cant believe its better a day old...  hahah.  Anyways the reason im putting this review is that one of the meatballs is a sponge.  I am hoping its just a piece of bread balled up.  Becuase i am not a fan of getting a small bowel obstruction.  Im going to try to add a photo of it.  The cooks, and who ever does the prep are terrible letting this go by and get served.

This is quite possibly my favorite location until yesterday&#39;s dirty cup incident. I had a plastic cup of water and once I had finished my water and the glass was dry on the inside I noticed a major coating of caked on dirt in the inside of the glass. As my waitress was about to refill my filthy glass (that I almost threw up after seeing the inside), I stopped her and pointed it out to her. She was mortified but did nothing to rectify the situation except bring me a glass of water (not a plastic mug). We gladly paid our bill and left but doubt we will be back as God knows what&#39;s on the rest of the dishes. Check out the photos of the mug yourself. Such a shame...

Great food, horrible service. No one acknowledges that you are there.  Wait staff friendly but had too many tables.  Had to wait for 10 minutes to get someone to even come and acknowledge we needed to be seated. When someone came up behind us and said they wanted a window seat, the hostess switched and gave them the table that was to be ours...yes we saw them do that in the paper they use to seat people.   Did I mention while we were waiting to be seated there were 3 people behind the counter helping 1 person get one piece of cheesecake?  Oh, and later i found the hostess in the bathroom texting?  Not going back. It&#39;s a shame as it&#39;s a beautiful location.
Food was good but even better customer service from the waiter serving us the view is outstanding. Had the hibachi steak was delicious

We have been at this restaurant several times but I must tell you about our visit today. The food is always good but today our service was the best ever. Our server Rachel could not of been more attentive and pleasant during our lunch. She is probably the biggest asset to this restaurant and should be told so. I only wish during all of our dining out experiences that we could have servers act as professional and pleasant as Rachel. If you are lucky, you will be seated in her section.
Toyota has been sponsoring Special Olympics of So. CA Summer games for over 20 years. our lead has taken us to Cheesecake Factory to celebrate another successful event.

Every meal I&#39;ve had has been delicious &amp; more than enough left over for a snack later. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants. The service is always excellent &amp; no matter who I&#39;m with we have a great time in a great atmosphere.
Food and service is always great and their cheesecakes are even better!!!!<br>I like their pasta there , u think it&#39;s called jambalaya pasta . Also their Customer<br>Service is really good

I&#39;ve been coming to the restaurant for over 20 years and so why the review now, well, we have never had a server that took care of us as well as Adrian did. <br>We are a family of 15 that came in here for a late lunch, 8 adults and 7 kids and Adrian was absolutely awesome, took care of us wonderfully and with patience. Everything was perfect and on time. Thank You Adrian for everything and making out experience a pleasure.

The waiters service was excellent, and the food and drinks were amazing. But I was really disappointed by the service the lady in the entrance at the cake bar was providing. All I got to say is that if you&#39;re unhappy, try to pull it together, because no one needs a nasty attitude from someone that they don&#39;t know. My sisters dad asked a question (he doesn&#39;t speak English perfectly but it&#39;s understandable) and she responded in ways that made us think that she insinuating that he was stupid and couldn&#39;t understand. She repeatedly rolled her eyes and clearly showed she didn&#39;t want to be there. If I was any other person I have slapped the stupid out of her, but no one likes to start drama. What&#39;s the point of it if the person could just fix their attitude. Really recommend for whatever her name was to get it together.

This is the first time I have ever had bad food at the Cheesecake Factory. I value this restaurant because of its consistency with great food whatever you order. I ordered fried shrimp, french fries and coleslaw. The shrimp was absolutely tasteless. It tasted a little like chicken with a strange texture but no flavor of shrimp at all. The coleslaw came in large chunks of very bitter cabbage and was basically inedible. The service was very good as usual and the view and table were nice.

very dissapoint. I came to this location today in first time. Ordered 2 pastas. 1 quesadilla. 1kids chicken menu and drink.<br>Quesadilla and kids menu were ok. 2 pastas wa soooooo salty. me and my wife ate 3 folks and stopped. Because couldn&#39;t eat anymore. Both were just salt... I called staff. And asked about salty pasta. The guy told me. &#34;our pasta is usually salty. If you want? I can change to something.&#34; <br>Huh.. im not mean customer. But pasta were really really really salty. Anyway. I told him. &#34;We need same pasta. But dont put salt please. Ill put salt by myself.&#34;<br>He said ok. And brought new pasta. But still salty..lol<br>I asked him. But he said. &#34; He ordered no salt in pasta to kitchen. But it might be from boiling salty water.&#34;<br>I couldn&#39;t complain about it anymore. We couldn&#39;t eat food anymore. So I just paid. And left.<br>we messed up our saturday dinner. Lost time and money... now is 10:44pm. my kids eating panda express at home. Lol<br>Sorry cheesecake factory. I don&#39;t go this location anymore.

worst experience ever. I have been coming here and it was fine before.  but today the service and the food was awful.  calamari was a bit salty,  ordered a chicken salad sandwich but got a club sandwich.  order took forever,  forgot the lemon on the water and ordered a steak and chicken Madeira combination and I received the smallest portion ever. I was never asked if I wanted rice,  fries,  salad or mashed potato.  it arrived with &#34;mashed potato&#34; and it&#39;s more like a potato salad.  the worst dining experience ever!

The rib eye was melt in your mouth good :) unfortunately the fries that come with it sucked to say the least. I mean McDonalds produces better fries. And last but not least I was very disappointed to find out they serve a low quality ketchup!!! I mean a place like this needs to serve Heinz ketchup and nothing else. Cheese cake factory quit being cheap with it! We can taste the cheap KETCHUP!!!!!!!

I&#39;ve been here several times, and have always enjoyed the wide variety of food as well as delicious cheesecake. However the most recent time I came I received such horrible service, it makes me not want to return ( at least to this location) at all. Our waitress was extremely rude, and would often just walk away from the table as I was still talking. And when we would ask for something she would take quite some time to return back. Ultimately the desert is what keeps me coming back, however due to poor customer service I think it may be some time before returning to this location.

Don&#39;t know why it&#39;s taken me so long to write one about this spot. Been coming here for years. What I like better about this location compared to Marina Del Rey is that it&#39;s bigger, and you don&#39;t feel as bunched up here while waiting for a table, though this place can get crowded. There&#39;s an upstairs area for separate parties. The other night, my party sat outside. The heat lamp provided adequate warmth, but the seating was a bit tight with the table directly behind us. That was a minor bummer. As for the rest, you should know what to expect when eating here. It&#39;s a semi-formal experience, and the atmosphere is usually pretty loud, again, this is expected. Good place to go to for large groups. Their food is great. You get what you pay for. Shrimp with Angel Hair Pasta will always be my favorite. Love the bread. Would be nice if you didn&#39;t always have to valet your car.

Great!  Everything was just great!<br><br>This is a great Cheesecake Factory location as I&#39;ve celebrated many great birthdays and gotten together with great friends here over the 20 great years I&#39;ve lived in this great city of ours.<br><br>Here&#39;s what&#39;s great about this restaurant:  <br><br>Great ambiance!<br>Great marina view!<br>Great sunset!  <br>Great brown bread!  <br>Great calamari appetizer!<br>Great Santa Fe chicken salad!<br>Great passion fruit iced tea!<br>Great white chocolate raspberry cheesecake!<br>Great coffee!<br>Great service!  <br>Great company!<br>Great time!<br><br>Wasn&#39;t this a great review?

One of my favorite restaurants of all time! Food is amazing and serves large portions on the entrees. I recommend:<br><br>Calamari <br>Pasta Da Vinci (omg soooo good!) <br>Crispy chicken costoletta<br>Red velvet cheesecake (huge slice) <br><br>Can&#39;t wait to come back again and try other dishes

Had a great experience TRAVIS our server was AWESOME!! I took my grandmother here for her bday 2.4.17 for lunch.. It was a party of 10 and he took care of us w. No problem!! We got a nice seat by the window LOVE IT

Everyone knows their menu is huge as well as portions. Prices have gone up but prices have gone up everywhere. <br><br>I love their Passion Fruit Iced Tea and would drink a whole pitcher if they would bring me one. <br><br>Just went for some apps tonight. We got my favorite Buffalo Blasts which are just little fried pockets of heaven. Wonton wrappers stuffed with Buffalo Chicken and cheese and then fried. Yum! I get these every time and they never fail me. <br><br>Other Ap ordered was the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes. They were not the greatest. I have had them before and remember them being much better. These ones tonight, the cakes themselves could have been cooked a little longer to get a crisper surface. They were topped with an excessive bunch of goop that was way to much for it&#39;s own good. <br><br>Server was good as service usually is here. We had Jerry tonight and I believe I have had him before and in that same section we were sitting in. Funny....<br><br>No cheesecake as I was overloaded from my cupcakes earlier. But they had a new Red Velvet (surprised it took them this long to make one) cheesecake cake which Jerry said was a huge hit. Maybe next time. <br><br>At this location they have VERY limited self park spots which sucks. Especially bc valet is $3.50 (basically $5 bc of tip) and the guys working valet do not make any extra effort greeting you or getting your car.

I really like this place! I recommend sitting out on the patio. What a lovely view! They even have heat lamps for cooler evenings.<br>We started with the fried calamari &amp; chicken samosas. Oh.My.Goodness! So fresh &amp; delicious!<br>We had been travelling all day with little to eat, so we figured we order some pasta to give us some energy.<br>My husband had the fettucine alfredo. He really liked it, I did not taste it.<br>I ordered the garlic noodles with shrimp. It was pure heaven!<br>We had been here 16 years ago when we got married. I&#39;m sorry it took me 16 years to come back.
This location serves fish that was cooked five days prior. Stick with frozen fish sticks from the grocery store -- they are fresher.
Great customer service! Wait time can be kinda long but its worth it sometimes, otherwise check out the bar as it is self seating. One of my fav places.

I have been coming to this Cheesecake Factory location since I was a child. The menu is EXPANSIVE and parking is never and has never been free here. The weekends are the busiest and even week nights with there always being a wait. My favorite cheesecake is the ORIGINAL. It&#39;s sooo good. Their cheesecakes are definitely on the heavy and rich side but so satisfying  for some reason, everything I have ordered here comes a little bit too salty but I don&#39;t mind since I like salt. I love love love their brown (is it wheat??) bread that they serve before you receive your meal. I&#39;ve never had an issue with customer service here, bathrooms are always clean, and it&#39;s right by the ocean. If you are celebrating a birthday, they will sing to you and give you a tiny sundae with a candle in it, which is much better than what they did in the past which was give absolutely nothing and charge you for a cheesecake! Lol

I was here for a wedding in their upstairs private rooms. The atmosphere was warm and the food is what you expect any chain restaurant to be, average. <br><br>This place forces you to valet part - no self parking permitted. <br><br>Normally this isn&#39;t necessarily a bad thing, especially at $4. But they returned my father-in-law&#39;s car with a nice dent in the front quarter panel. He also happened to be the father of the bride for the wedding. All the staff acted as though they were not responsible and no one came forward to admit the damage. Very frustrating to deal with considering the damage was not there before entering their property. He was forced to return the next day to fill out a form and speak to a different manager and they still refused to acknowledge their error.

Great location with beautiful view if you get seated by window. <br>Valet parking- eh! Kind of lame if you ask me. <br>The food is just okay. Nothing blows my mind. I do love their thai lettuce wraps and a few other appetizers too! When I&#39;m craving cheesecake, I call ahead and take to go.
It&#39;s usually busy here no matter what time I come, but I&#39;ve never had problems with my food. Everything comes out hot and delicious! Service is sometimes great, then other times just ok.

We came in here on a whim because we were craving drinks and dessert... <br>After a few minutes at the bar, while chatting with the SUPER SWEET bartenders; my husband ran to use the bathroom<br>Ok-big deal, who cares about his bathroom trip you say? <br>You will. <br>As he rounded the corner, he ran into UFC legend Anderson the Spider Silva!!!!!!!!<br>He ran back to get me (as I am an avid MMA practitioner and instructor) and I almost died when I rounded that corner. <br>There he was in all his legendary glory, having an early dinner with his kids and other family members. <br>Apparently he is a regular there. <br>He was soooooo sweet and agreed to take pics and stayed to talk with us. <br>I of course was a nervous wreck and could barely speak properly. <br>After schmoozing with the Spider, we went back and took our seats at the bar; only to realize that we were sitting next to Machine Gun Kelly (radio personality)!<br>He too was such a nice guy. <br>Jeez, Los Angeles was a dream.. <br>One of the best trips ever.  <br>If you&#39;re ever in the Redondo Beach area, stop by this specific Cheesecake Factory...<br>It&#39;s sitting pretty right on the water and I&#39;m sure you&#39;ll run into someone &#34;famous&#34;. <br>Happy eating!

Went there with 5 others so there was 6 total ... We ordered some drinks and lunch. <br> It all was good... UNTIL... The birthday girls pizza did not come out with the food ??? the waiter said they did not make it and it would be a few minutes.. ( well we have all been there and it comes to late) so we canceled it .. and said we would share food .. Not that big of a deal RIGHT .. Then the Manager comes to the table says the kitchen made the wrong pizza and they were.. VERY SORRY.. Ok still BS but they were trying right ... Then we order cheese cake for all still nothing .. <br> My bill was 167.. bucks.. and they would not even give the birthday girl a free piece of Cheese Cake         Or recognize our event ... What the heck .. <br><br>   How CHEEP and I felt they could of done something for us besides <br>FLAP THERE LIPS  <br> <br> I an in the same game as them .. We make mistakes.<br>.at our place. The sorry about our mistake is backed up with something tang-able<br>  ..

Ok so its been awhile since I&#39;ve been here &amp; it&#39;s still delicious. We ordered the eggroll sampler, our favorites were the avocado &amp; tex mex rolls. <br><br>I ordered the chicken madeira and steak diane it was delicious &amp; not dry at all. Hubby got the parmesan herb crusted chicken which was just okay, nothing major. <br><br>We also got a slice of lemon raspberry cream cheesecake which was the bomb!<br><br>Customer service was great as well. <br>Valet only &amp; its cash only. Down side they don&#39;t have a ATM near by, had to walk down the street to a nearby hotel :/

The cheesecake factory is good for a solid meal you can count on.  I&#39;m sure most everyone has been here before, but for those who haven&#39;t they have a huge menu of pasta, mexican food, seafood, salads, anything you can imagine, but they actually do most things pretty darn well.<br><br>In recent years they&#39;ve added a small plates menu and a healthy options menu, which is great because they are generally known for giant shareable portions, which unfortunately come with a big calorie load for those of us lacking self control ;)  <br><br>I love the ahi tuna tartar and the pear gorgonzola flatbread, so good, and good size portions for like $6, both under 500 calories, love it.<br><br>The cheesecake is also phenomnal and comes in about 40 different varities if you&#39;re feeling indulgent.  My personal favorite is the carmel turtle, so freaking good. Also a couple often overlooked non-cheescake deserts there worthy of trying out are the lemoncello torte and the warm apple crips a la mode, both excellent.<br><br>This particular location is great because it&#39;s right on the water in Redondo Beach so perfect at sunset time.

I ordered a cheesecake last night via online because it was about 8:30pm and I just wanted to make a fast pick up. I had already paid it online and I ordered a birthday plaque with it. Well when I got there the guy helping at the bakery register said the manager tried to get a hold of me because they didn&#39;t have any plaques for the cheesecake. I was okay with them not having the plaques, however I didn&#39;t have a missed call or an email telling me they didn&#39;t have those available, so I don&#39;t see how They &#34;tried&#34; to contact me. At this point I was like that&#39;s fine just give me the order anyway.. but it took a good while for the manager to come and sort the payment since I had paid for the plaque. It took her a long while to get to me I was almost gonna tell them not to refund the 3 dollars and just give me my cheesecake! Finally the manager came, she was nice while she was refunding my card but After she did the refund I had to wait another while to get the cheesecake even tho I had already ordered it like 40 mins. Prior to me getting there! After going through a good 20 min process to get this cheesecake, I finally got it! I honestly don&#39;t know why they have the option to order online when they aren&#39;t gonna have it ready! And if you don&#39;t have an item ordered call the customer like really call don&#39;t just claim you called and really didn&#39;t. They didn&#39;t even offer a discount or anything of the sort for the inconvenience i had to deal with! It was very upsetting, I got the place I needed  to get to, late just because they didn&#39;t process this all correctly.

So I was very disappointed the last time I came to this location. It was national cheesecake so my hubby said honey meet me at the Cheesecake Factory after work. So I drive from Culver City to Redondo Beach. I get there before my husband and I walk up to the desk to let the hostess know I was looking for a table for two. She says &#34; Do you have a name? Not what is your name. But before I get to that there was a lady there before me and the hostess gave her the worse attitude. So back to me, I tell her my name and she starts to make a joke about my name and continued to laugh and joke about it. I took offense to it, and I&#39;m not one to complain. So I just had to ask my waitress what her name was because it was bothering me. So she got the manager over, who by the way was really nice she asked was everything ok? I told her what happened she asked if I could get anything, I said no I am just big on customer service. She did handle the situation I did see her after that seat the other guest. My food and cheesecake and waiter was awesome, no complaints there. I frequent this location and I will continue, I just hope not to have that type of experience.

I just came here for the 30th anniversary cheesecake and the blended alcoholic drinks..... :) <br><br>the best, avocado egg rolls are great as well, as their lighter options menu, and that wheat bread with butter we get as a starter. :)

I&#39;ve hosted multiple corporate events here, and have always gotten compliments on the quality of food, and room set up. The staff here is highly attentive, efficient,  and dedicated to excellence. The AC is on full blast, and a few folks complained, but overall great experience.

Not a place I go often due to the calories one eats when here.  It&#39;s a nice place to come when you need a nice place to celebrate a birthday or a promotion at work when you don&#39;t have time to plan.  It&#39;s such a nice location right on the water and with a stunning view of Redondo beaches dock.
Management needs to address window blinds during sunsets. It&#39;s very uncomfortable to have dinner with full sun on eyes.

Loved this location. Its valet only. Its such a huge returant. More than enough room at the bar with seating tables. I usually go to the Marina one - but this one is so much more roomier. Food was great and service was good and quick for a Friday night.

My Mother selected this place for her Bridal Shower which was yesterday. At first I was a little apprehensive because she originally wanted a room, but there weren&#39;t any available. We selected a section close to the Northside exit of the restaurant which ended up being perfect. I don&#39;t believe there was glass up when originally viewed the area, but there was glass up yesterday separating it from the bar area. The manager Brent was AMAZING. He was extremely helpful and  suggestive with our order so that we could have the perfect items and portions to accommodate our guest. We had a ton of different servers but who stuck out the most was Tyler. Tyler was extremely friendly, very accommodating, and overall made this experience a very pleasant one for the group. I appreciate these two gentlemen, as well as the rest of the staff for their amazing hospitality.

I just like the ambiance of the Cheesecake Factory. My go-to choice whenever I go is either the shrimp scampi or Cajun Jambalaya. Yum!
