The shrimp scampi is sautéed in a delicious garlic light wine sauce and is served over linguini or rice. You can also request it be served over a bed of sautéed spinach to lose the starch calories. The Cajun jambalaya has shrimp and chicken with green and red peppers, red onions and bits of tomato tossed in linguini. I always ask for extra spice and it is like an explosion of flavor. I take turns getting either or every time I go. Can&#39;t wait for my next visit!
Oh boy, the Margarita did its job, giving them 5 star, cheesecake was very good, nuts, caramel, no doubt. All of sudden evening is getting better.

Worst costumer service for pickups and take out. Staff is very rude. They are always under staff. It takes forever for them to bring out the food. All the women working there have attitude problems. Not professional at all. Never going back. Yesterday went to pickup the food. Got 3 drinks and there was two bags of food. When asked for cup holder the Asian girl on counter said. She doesn&#39;t have cup holder and its not my problem how you gonna carry everything to car...... Like really??   (Note to manager)<br>NO DO NOT send me comment or message to go to your website and Let you know the experience in details. I can abbreviat here. Your restaurant is a big mess. Fix it.

Let me start off by saying, its a bit pricey, but its worth it. Amazing burgers, amazing cheesecake, great service, and a great view of the marina towards the back of the restaurant. A good place to go for a special occasion.<br><br>5/5

I had an early morning flight out of PDX &amp; didn&#39;t give myself enough time to eat breakfast. The little bag of peanuts provided on the plane wasn&#39;t enough to carry me over so by the time my plane landed in LAX I was famished. I met with my cousin, her fiancé &amp; his family for lunch here at the Factory. This wouldn&#39;t be my first choice of places to eat &amp; obviously we wouldn&#39;t be here if they had sought guidance through Yelp.<br><br>My cousin &amp; I ended up sharing a pizza &amp; I ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio. The pizza was an unmemorable one. Maybe two hours later, while we&#39;re driving down the freeway, I started to feel nauseous. It was bumper-to-bumper traffic &amp; as time passed I became worse. We finally made it to the mall where I was to meet my aunt &amp; other cousin &amp; I couldn&#39;t keep it in any longer. I got sick &amp; it was embarrassing since I just met my cousin&#39;s fiancé for the first time only a few hours before. I continued to get sick throughout the wedding rehearsal &amp; rehearsal dinner to a point where I wasn&#39;t sure if I&#39;d make the wedding the following day. In the end I did make it feeling 100% better.<br><br>I couldn&#39;t figure out if it was the food or the wine but my postprandial experience was unappreciated. I&#39;ve eaten at other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s in the U.S. &amp; it just hasn&#39;t ever tasted good to me. I don&#39;t know why it&#39;s as popular as it is. People you&#39;re wasting your time, money, calories &amp; carbs on one star quality food. There&#39;s so much more to offer beyond the Factory. Seek &amp; you shall find.
If they are busy, the service is just bad.<br>We had ants running on our table.<br>It took more than 20 minutes to get another table.<br>So we had to eat and fight simultaneously.

Will never be back here ever again went with a party of 5 and they gave me a booth for 4 and set a chair in the middle of the aisle to seat the 5th person , service was horrible seems rather racist . Poor service

I took my buddy, Russell here for his bday on Friday.  We have been here a few times and always enjoyed it.  <br><br>Our server, Morgan, was attentive and friendly.  The only thing was that our bread took a while to come out to us and there was no mention of it, so I thought maybe they stopped serving it.  It was tougher than it used to be, when it did arrive.  I ordered the rib eye, and it was decent, but kinda fatty and about 20% of it was pushed to the side, after I cut it away.<br><br>Russell ordered a combo dish and loved it.  He finished it in no time, hehe.  I had the mango key lime cheesecake for dessert, and Russ had the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake.  We loved them both.<br><br>I wish valet service wasn&#39;t mandatory, and self-parking was allowed.
This is probably the slowest deliveries in South Bay. It takes a lot to prepare taking out foods. The kitchen should be faster.

I was lied too they said they they don&#39;t take reservations..  I get there 3 minutes later and the rude hostess said it&#39;s a 20 minute wait..all the female hostess were rude and terrible customer service. Whom ever hear a restaurant that doesn&#39;t take reservations. ..I won&#39;t be back

First, this review is not indicative of the service. The waitstaff were amazing, and that is something the Cheesecake Factory should be proud of. I would give 5 stars for our server Adrian I believe?  He was on top of everything and a real polished pro who understands that good service is how he earns more money.   The hostess station was not so pleasant, nor very informative. When we called, she could not give us an idea how long we might wait said she &#34;could not predict the future.&#34;  I think if you work enough nights at a place (that annoyingly takes no reservations) you could give a ballpark estimate about how long a guest should expect to wait. I think we don&#39;t need Nostradamus to predict the future but maybe since that is part of your job,  maybe be aware of how long folks may expect to wait. Not brain surgery it&#39;s customer service.  You might know the average wait time because your restaurant doesn&#39;t take reservations, this is the worst, most annoying part of this establishment. I cannot believe folks wait so long for basically a glorified Denny&#39;s. Food is good, portions are hearty, but you wont feel great afterwards. There is a ton of butter and oil in the Scampi. Chicken Romano is good, sandwiches all good, not amazing but good fatty American food. <br> Inside: It is dark, a little too dark for me. And we were seated next to the door to somewhere  outside that made it feel like we were in a wind tunnel every 25 seconds when it opened. <br>I felt like I was in a cave with the dim lights, stone tables and floors. This could have been a much better review but the first people one has to deal with, need to be a little more aware of what they are doing and if you expect folks to wait over an hour I would try a little tenderness and not be so matter of fact or even a little bit unpleasant to folks. The place is packed so I guess it really does not matter.

I was expecting a long wait on Friday night, but we waited maybe 2 minutes. We came for cheesecake and it was good. Dan finished his banana cheesecake and I almost finished my Chocolate cheesecake. Our server was good

Where do I start, I went this past Saturday for a birthday dinner. We waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for a table because they don&#39;t take reservations, SMH. After we got seated it was disappointment after disappointment. We had to remind our server what our drink order was. I asked if they made a certain cocktail and her response was a shrug. We had to keep asking to replenish our water and worst of all she forgot to put in my husband&#39;s order!! He had to wait 15 minutes for his food to come out. All I heard all night was, &#34;My apologies&#34; from our server. When his food finally came out we were all finished so we had it packed to go. They should&#39;ve comped his meal. A decent restaurant would have comped it. We ordered dessert, she forgot about one dessert. Like, literally forgot about it. So she had to go back and get it. We got our bill and told her how to split it. She came back and asked again. We got the bill 10 minutes before we got our cheesecakes! Worst service ever! We complained to the manager but honestly she just gave us a a very generic  &#34;I&#39;m sorry&#34;.  Never coming back to this location again. Go to the Marina Del Rey or The Grove location WAY BETTER SERVICE.

This review is one I am having mixed emotions about writing. I like this location and haven&#39;t had any issue with it but today I was not happy and thought I should let it be known. Normally when I go here, and it&#39;s not terribly frequent, every thing is quite delightful. The waitstaff is usually cheerful, kind and helpful and food is always good. The food was good as usual but the service left much to be desired. Our waitress, Amber S., needs to find another line of work. Seriously. She hardly checked on us after we were served our food unless I flagged her down. She went sailing past our table numerous times without checking to see if we needed anything and I could hear her at other tables surrounding us asking if they needed this or that but we always had to catch her in mid-flight. After about the third flag down, I sensed a bit of an attutude so I decided it was time to go. We then went another stretch of her basically ignoring us unless we flagged her down. Once she brought the check, she waited until I had my attention diverted and she zips by and grabs the folder off of the table before I could address what needed to be done in regards to the bill because I was using a giftcard as partial payment of the check. Anyway, I&#39;m not going to go on and on about this but as you can see this was frustrating as hell at best. I&#39;m not sure if this job for her is a means to an end or if this will be a career choice for her. Whichever it is, this is a customer service oriented job with emphasis on CUSTOMER SERVICE. Her &#34;niceties&#34; were quite transparent and it was obvious she is not enjoying her job. And if that&#39;s the case then at this point all I can say to someone like this is to find your passion so you aren&#39;t low key salty all the time. Furthermore, sweeten up your attitude, treat people respectfully and in the meantime don&#39;t take your frustrations out on innocent customers who&#39;ve done nothing but merely walk into your establishment and end up having the misfortune of being seated in your section. <br><br>***The 1 star rating is for the waitress not a commentary on the Redondo Beach location as a whole.***

When it comes to eating at decent restaurant one should have some expectations  like having quality food served hot in reasonable time . I been coming here many times without anything to question always hot food and prompt service . Tonight was different sub-par service and lukewarm food at best . There are plenty establishments in the area to patronize this one will be one of them anymore  ,for what I payed Denny&#39;s does much better .

So the patio is nice but I think Marina del Rey`s is better.  Lots of boats to look at...timing is key sitting here bcuz of the sun...umbrellas don`t help...waitstaff friendly and let you dine...the regular tea is weak...pretzel crusted chicken  a 10+  but the Asian lettuce wrap tacos a disaster to eat without wearing them....should come with instructions!!  Seriously.  You can&#39;t self- park here so prepare for valet charge $4.00.. at 5pm-ish

I never been disappointed! Everything you order is delicious!!! My boyfriend too me on Sunday morning for my bday brunch! Since he know I LOVE  their orange chicken! There fried avocado is to die for !!! Come with fried mushroom, fried avocado and fried zucchini ! It&#39;s a must try at least once ! I love their double chocolate cheesecake! Carrot one is good too. I promise you&#39;ll enjoy anything you get!! You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory! Costumer service is always great too ! You can get a really nice view if you eat in the patio. If you want to do a romantic dinner . It&#39;s also a great place. It&#39;s so pretty at night in the patio. And they have heaters!
Last Saturday we celebrated my wife birthday. The best food as always. And great service.
The service here is really great. They are usually pretty busy so you may have to wait a bit for your order. Food is up to par.

Ate here last night with nephew &amp; wife.  This place has been a favorite for years but not so impressed with my recent selection..chicken parmesan pizza style.   Pounded and breaded chicken breast crust with cheese &amp; marinara sauce topping with a swirls of Angel hair alfredo,on top. Had seen this technique done on a cooking channel &amp; and was excited to try.  Unfortunately my order was over-cooked and burnt on bottom. I should have sent back to the chicken for a new order but was running my mouth and really didn&#39;t notice the aftertaste. Concept sounds good, but poor execution.   Might suggest C.F. consider making the chicken base as a bowl and use a Caesar salad as the topping.  Wouldn&#39;t order again..as always service was spot on

This was my first time at this Cheesecake Factory. And was definitely not impressed. I orders the Shrimp scampi. It had a funny sour taste to it. I was sure it was the white wine so I didn&#39;t say anything. But the shrimp was very rubbery. The Angel hair pasta was good but there wasn&#39;t much. And for $21 it should get you full. That wasn&#39;t the case here so I ordered the crab cake appetizer. Which was good but could have been fried a little longer. Also that stuff they put on the plate with the crab cakes like the little chips not a fan. On the plus side.The Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake was very good hint the 2 stars.

Had a special event we were celebrating, was unable to ride in a car and so we ordered a pizza since I think they make the best pizza in town.  It&#39;s priced higher than most but it has always been worth it until this day.   We picked it up to go and brought it home.   This Pizza was undercooked and just plain nasty.    I called to complain and the manager said he would take it off our bill which wasn&#39;t enough, if you ask me since that&#39;s why I wasted my time even going there.  <br><br>Anyway, to add insult to injury, my credit card bill arrived today and surprise, surprise, that nasty pizza was never taken off the bill.  Shame on you Cheesecake Factory!

PROS : <br>location (although there&#39;s a lot of construction going on)<br>friendly service<br>large portions<br>reasonable prices<br>full bar<br><br>CONS : <br>valet<br>small self-parking lot<br>gets really busy<br><br>FAVORITES : <br>green tea (with mint!)<br>pretzel crusted chicken<br>fried mac &amp; cheese <br>Miso Salmon<br>Chris&#39; Outrageous cheesecake (great if you love german chocolate cake)<br><br>OVERALL : <br><br>We&#39;ve been going to this particular location for years and we&#39;ve always had a good experience. Our most recent visit went very well. Our server was attentive, quick and friendly. She definitely was on top of everything - refils, suggestions etc. <br><br>Food is great. Large portions! Share or take half of everything you order home.<br><br>One note, if you can&#39;t avoid using the valet service, be sure to inspect your vehicle. We witnessed more than a few close calls while the attendants were driving the customer&#39;s cars around the lot. They seem to be in a rush to park the cars and aren&#39;t too careful. Just a warning!<br><br>All in all, we had a good time and will be back.

My ex-tenant, Hector and I decided we would go sightseeing around Los Angeles and Orange Counties.  As a result of our sightseeing excursion around 7:30 PM, we ended our daytrip at Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>We ordered a few items from the Cheesecake Factory menu:  Chocoloate Mousse Cake and coffee, and a couple of appetizers.  One of the appetizers we ordered tasted quite odd, so we told our waitress we didn&#39;t like the taste.<br><br>Wow!  Our waitress was soooo cool!  Surprisingly, our waitress took the appetizer and deducted from our bill!  So AWESOME!  The cheesecake as always is sinfully, undeniably delectable! <br><br>I think I like this location verses the Cheesecake Factory locations in Corte Madera, Marina Del Rey, Beverly Hills, San Francisco . . . Why?  Oh-the ambiance is oh, so romantic sitting at the window facing the Redondo Beach Harbor.  <br><br>Hence, the evening&#39;s ambiance was warm and inviting.  I know I will return to Rendondo Beach Cheesecake Factory.

Normally we have a fabulous experience here...one of our favorite places to go eat. But last night was awful! We didn&#39;t get bread delivered to us until 1/2 way through our main meal (and we asked at least 3 times for it). I also asked for something to be left out of the dish but it was still in the pasta. Our server never asked to refill our drinks...I had to ask her myself as she walked by and saw them empty several times. When she boxed up our food I had the extra bread on my plate asking for that to be sent home (it was not). We ordered to go dessert and asked for 2 sides of caramel which were not in the containers. I just feel like nothing went right and am very disappointed this time.

Seated pretty quick on a busy night. The waitress was kinda hard to flag down and seemed a bit overwhelmed. I ordered the calamari it was just delicious not too hard not to chewy. I had the orange chicken with red velvet cheese cake for desert. Omg the red velvet was so sweet me and my boyfriend couldn&#39;t finish it. The orange chicken was pretty good. The food is always good quality. Vallet people are pretty quick and friendly.

Ok I&#39;m disappointed ;&#34;( we ate here today and usually every time we come it&#39;s good. But today when we ate I got stomach cramps and everything that came with it.., which started after We ate and I left ...I ate the pasta. I wasn&#34;t going to write about it but I&#39;m still up now experiencing cramps etc and not feeling too good. I&#39;m not sure if I will return to cheesecake again or maybe just not this location which makes me sad because this location is near me &amp; cheesecake was one of my Favs ;&#34;((

What a lousy experience. We got there at 4 pm. Got seated right away. Our server seemed to be totally out of it. The place was half full so there was no excuse for the poor service that we received. It took forever for the food to get served. Once the food was served the mashed potato was cold and my steak totally over cooked and tasted like rubber. <br>I go to Cheesecake Factory restaurants all the time mostly because the good has traditionally been consistently decent. However , since about a year ago it seems that every Cheesecake Factory restaurant that we go to has lousy service , the servers and the staff totally rude and not friendly and the quality of the food way bellow their standards of the past. <br>I hope the upper management read this and make changes to improve the quality of service and the experience.

We went here today for lunch. We got seated right away, our server Obi was very attentive and came to check on us several times. I ordered the polenta fries and pretzel-crusted chicken (small plate menu) and my hubby ordered the orange chicken. Food was on our table within 15 minutes. Our sodas were refilled (we didn&#39;t even have to ask for it)<br>Very happy with this location.

I enjoy eating here during the summer. You get a nice view of the bay if you sit on the patio. I kind of stick to my usual items when I order so one of my favorites is the firecracker salmon spring rolls. The dipping sauce is just right. This place can get crowded so expect a bit of a wait on average. Only valet parking is available as well. I don&#39;t eat desserts very often but I do like the red velvet cheesecake when it&#39;s available.
Well<br>Thought we would grab a nice desert after dinner<br>Would you like fork and napkin.  Yes please<br>Oh I don&#39;t care I will not give you any<br>Thanks for the pain in the ass

First let me say that this is my favorite Cheesecake location to go to simply because of the staff and its outdoor seating. Moving on...<br><br>The parking situation can be tricky if you go during their busy hours (duh) but it&#39;s valet so you only have to deal with it until you get to the front of the line. Parking is $4. There&#39;s always people who are a bit fishy when it comes to valet parking but I&#39;ve never had a problem here. They open the door for you, tell you everything you need to know, and send you on your way. When it&#39;s time to go home they get your car to you ASAP, they run to it like they&#39;re in some kind of competition. It&#39;s especially appreciated during cold nights.<br><br>I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE their outdoor seating. The entire time you&#39;re eating you have a view of all the boats docked at the harbor. During the day you have the sun shining with a pleasant breeze and when the sun begins to set it looks really pretty. For those colder nights you find yourself sitting outside they have heaters which definitely do their job because I have never been cold out there but I always have issues when I go to other places. <br><br>Indoor seating is pretty much &#39;seen one, seen all&#39; as far as Cheesecake goes. There&#39;s  nothing really special. I&#39;ve eaten inside once and I have no complaints, I just prefer sitting outdoors. <br><br>Now, the staff. Umm I wish these people worked EVERYWHERE. I have never once had an issue with anyone who has been assigned to my table. There&#39;s never been an attitude and most of the time I end up having a great conversation with them. For my last birthday at one point we carried on a lengthy conversation with someone who wasn&#39;t even assigned to us, he was so animated and hilarious! I definitely love that I never have to worry about how my service is going to be when I go here, they have won me over. <br><br>The food is your regular Cheesecake food, there&#39;s nothing special here that you can&#39;t find in other locations. My favorite thing to get would have to be the sweet corn tamale cakes, which are great for sharing with the entire table, and the herb crusted fillet of salmon. The salmon comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus with some kind of sauce. It&#39;s my go-to dish if I don&#39;t want to flip pages. The cheesecake...there are no flaws. My favorite is the basic strawberry one but I&#39;ve tried many of them and they all are sooooo good. During the holidays they always seem to throw in a new flavor so if you&#39;re a fan of christmas candy chances are one of those will end up being an inspiration for their season cheesecake.

I just realized for the many times I&#39;ve been here, i haven&#39;t written a review yet! First thing you&#39;ll notice: huuuge parking lot BUT valet only! why?!? $4 valet too....<br><br>FOOD:<br>This time around I ordered the jambalaya pasta while my gf ordered the pasta with chicken and scampi sauce. The jambalaya had great flavor: spicy with a bit of sweetness from the onions and bell peppers. However the noodles and shrimp were way over-cooked. Noodles were mushy and past the point of al dente. Shrimp when cooked right has a snap when you bite into it. These had a slightly mushy exterior. Also, the whole dish felt overly oily, but I think that is with all pasta at Cheesecake. 2/5<br>The chicken with scampi sauce is better: the noodles are cooked al dente and the dish didn&#39;t feel as heavy as the jambalaya. 4/5<br>Overall: 3/5<br><br>SERVICE:<br>Our food came in a timely manner and everything went smoothly. Our waitress was nice and checked up on us every so often.<br>Overall: 4/5<br><br>DECOR/AMBIANCE:<br>The restaurant overlooks the bay and is very beautiful during the day, but you won&#39;t see much at night. Dimly lit restaurant that has a casual feel even though I know Cheesecake tries to make it very upscale. <br>Overall: 4/5<br><br>Their pasta can be hit or miss. As with my Jambalaya tonight, it was a miss, but my gf&#39;s dish was good. I really don&#39;t get why they require valet service for a place that has such a large parking lot. Their cheesecakes are great, but only if you have room for it afterwards. Their portions are pretty large. <br><br>PRO-TIP: if you get the pasta, get the sauce on the side so that you can mix in your own amounts to prevent the overly oily and heavy feeling of the sauce.
Delicious delicious delicious!!!! Great service everytime. Happy hour is awesome! Cant go wrong with this location.

What more can you say about CF? Great food, great location. CF is a classic restaurant. Could you imagine a world without CF? All of our hearts would break! Love the Cajun jambalaya, and the carrot cheesecake is to die for. Face it, all of the cheesecakes are to die for! I&#39;ll always come back!

After an epic drink failure at The Slip on the pier. Myself and my companion embarked on a quest for redeeming quality drinks. The journey fought with twists and turns we ended up at Cheesecake factory. Joking aside, our drinks were awesome! I had the Georgia Peach a blended drink with an extra shot of vodka, my friend had a margarita. Bartender was nice, drinks were great thanks for saving us fron our fail of an experience at slips.

I must say I was extremely disappointed. Went out to dinner on Saturday night. We ordered Mac and Cheese balls waited about 20 minuets only for the manager to come over and say they just ran out of that appetizer??? Then we placed our order I ordered chicken Madera and 20 minuets later oh we just ran out of the sauce we use for that dish... umm what!? No apology no nothing. We get our bill I definitely though we&#39;d get a complementary something for the next wit and inconvenience but we did not.  Very disappointed

Pre-birthday dinner for me with my family and folks.  Excellent service, excellent selection of drinks, apps, entrees and, of course, desserts.  We had a great time on the patio enjoying the cool breeze and sunset.  For a chain, this place is great.

There&#39;s no friggin way we could have gotten better service!!!! Adrian was an amazing waiter! He really made us feel like we were at home. Definitely coming back to this place!!! Stay cool Adrian! Hope you are our waiter next time!!!

Been coming here for a long time, but the food was about par for the night.<br><br>The valet parking is the worst at this location.  I noticed that the valet person parked the car very close to the other car and when he went to get my car, he went so fast around the lot, the wheels were squealing.   Then he acts like nothing was wrong.  <br><br>Nevertheless I saw a ding mark after I got home.  I know that they did it cause its a brand new car.<br><br>Never valet at this location.

This review is for Happy Hour since I hate eating in the regular dining room especially during peak times at this place!   (Loud children and hordes of people wandering about?  No thanks).<br><br>Do you like $5 mojitos that are actually made correctly and  $5 appetizers?  Pretty good deal at the waterfront.   You can also get the red velvet cheescake (I always get it to go) but all cake is regular price during HH.  Get the sweet corn cake which is my fav item here and pass on their soggy, boring calamari.<br><br>The waiters can be a bit slow, but not for laziness...just because the place is always packed. <br><br>Last time I checked valet went up to an unnecessary $3.50.  Bring 4 or 5 quarters, park at the meters on the street and get some exercise!

A beautiful view of the harbor, convenient valet parking and yummy food make this a winning restaurant. I love their Chicken Piccata....the best I have found anywhere. The sauce is the perfect blend of lemon and butter, and the chicken is incredibly tender. It is served over angel hair pasta. I ask for it without mushrooms and they happily accommodate. <br><br>For dessert, cheesecake is a must. This most recent time I ordered the Oreo which was sinfully good. I also like the white chocolate raspberry. <br><br>So given that I liked everything, you may be asking why the 4 stars? The reason has to do with being a parent. My daughter is 2 years old and this restaurant had no coloring or crayons. It is quite unusual for a restaurant to not offer anything to keep the little ones busy. Thankfully, I had some crayons and a coloring book in my car. The only change I would suggest is for the restaurant to consider how to keep the little ones busy.

Good food and drinks, terrible service.<br><br>Got drinks at the bar while waiting for a table- bartender was friendly and honest, good pour size also!<br><br>Our pager buzzed so we went back to the host stand, only to stand and wait around no one ever came to seat us? We only were sat because I ran into a friend who serves and she brought us to our table (not her section or her job)<br><br>Our server took a very long time to even just stop by and greet us- and the second time she came back to the table asked all ditzy and lost &#34;you ordered an appetizer?? With me?? What was it?? Did I put it in? Yes. I put it in&#34;<br>We got our drinks at the bar, two other people dropped off water and bread. So literally the one thing I ordered from her she had forgot..<br>Our entree came out, still no appetizer (yup looks like she did forget to ring it in)<br>After asking the food runner AND server about the appetizer, she finally brought the dish out (after entree was finished) and tells us it was &#34;just sitting in the window&#34;. We asked if it was cold and she goes &#34;well I left it under the heat lamp for a little...&#34;<br>We didn&#39;t want it anymore. No apology from a manager or nothing, just taken off the bill. <br>Server was apologetic but kept saying she had a lot of tables... Then ask for a smaller section if you can&#39;t handle it.

So I had a birthday celebration Monday night and charged my dinner. I left my card there. Cheesecake factory put it in a safe HOWEVER now I magically have fraudulent charges two days later on my card! Cheesecake factory claims they I was cyber attached lmao! I have not been attacked online and had fraudulent charges on the card that i have had for 20 years but magically now I get attacked! no what a coincidence that is!!! I noticed the card missing Tuesday morning but didn&#39;t make the connection of leaving it. WOW - no someone copied my card before entering it at the safe! So if I were you ... you better take your card with you or USE CASH ...
I always have to leave room for a piece of their fabulous cheesecake. Sunday brunch on the patio out back facing the water is one of my favorite midday pastimes

Parking was HORRIBLE - after finally figuring out the entrance and getting in line for the valet, he drove up next to my car &amp; signaled for me to roll down the window - after I did so, he asked me if I was leaving or arriving.  Arriving.  He proceeded to tell me that I should go and find a parking spot!  (That was after honking at me to get out of his way)<br>Staff were awful, our waiter was nice, but the service was SLOW and we had a hard time getting drinks/dessert/boxes.  <br><br>While we were sitting their with our kids (toddlers) we heard three different workers swearing as they were talking to one another.  <br><br>WOW.<br><br>The bathrooms?  Wow.  One toilet had no toilet paper, the next had a roll sitting on the ground in a puddle (of what?) and the last had excrement all over the side and down the front of the bowl.  Even the sinks &amp; floor were disgusting.  <br><br>Worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever visited. <br><br>wow.

There are a few times in life where a meal or in this case all the meals taste very bland and terribly flavorless ... The wife and I went on a date to this location today and thinking we are gonna enjoy our date with some delicious food , to bad we where wrong .. smh I&#39;m sorry to have disappointed her today .. We ordered pizza , two flavorless burgers , nachos that we found had a hair in the cheese , some tamale / corn  tostadas which was ok , and some cheese cakes Oreo , basic original cheese cake ... We didn&#39;t eat much today ... we left cheese cake factory very upset and disappointed . Thanks CKF smh ..

Last several times I&#39;ve been here it&#39;s been a bit of chaos. Drink orders wrong, food orders wrong or cold, no greeting for several minutes after being seated. I know it&#39;s busy there but gotta get the madness under control!

You are charged to park and it owns the parking lot in front  how much stinking money do you need?  Give me a break. No charge to park at Joes Crab Shack I guess they are not as money hungry.<br>Lovely view such great food. On the Marina <br>Service good but seemed really busy like a drive by toss without giving eye contact.<br>Just go for desert and leave it at that.

Sad to say I was disappointed. I have been coming here for many years and have often said this was the best local cheesecake. Today my meal was just ordinary. I had the buffalo burger and it was next to flavorless.<br>Not that we needed to eat more but the portions were much smaller than before. Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be in a hurry to go back.

Had dinner tonight with my husband and Adrian was our server. He was very helpful from the start. Got us some wine samplers(ended up going with beer because the wine was too dry). Our food did take a while, but he was constantly coming to our table to ask how we were doing. Awesome customer service. Both of our plates came out very tasty. We&#39;re very content with our visit today. Adrian was an awesome server!

This is probably the best CF in California. Why? Right on the water! I&#39;ve been to a handful of CF&#39;s, and by far, if you get a seat by the window, such a gorgeous view of the marina. Or better yet, a table outdoors! <br><br>Tried the thai chicken pasta, shared with my aunt since they always give you way too much food. It was different but good. Loved the peanut sauce.<br><br>Service is ample here, same as you&#39;d fine anywhere, but really, it&#39;s all about the view and the endless choices at Cheesecake Factory.

I&#39;ve used this location for a banquet upstairs for several years, but never dined here before.  Great food, great service, I was very impressed. It was during the week, so no waiting. I had spring rolls for an appetizer and shrimp soft tacos, and they were both low calories, but very filling and satisfying. And I had their famous cheesecake, and that was delicious! After dinner, my friend and I were just chatting and chatting, and noticed nobody was around. I knew it was going to close by 11pm, so I expected them to kick us out by then, but when we left, it was almost midnight! They did not say anything negative, did not kick us out, and our server even gave me the last refill before she left! Would I come back again, of course!!

I have been coming here for years. I frequent this Cheesecake Factory and the one in Marina Del Rey. If you want a beautiful view of the marina, you should visit the latter. This one does have a gorgeous view of the boat slips and yachts during the day, but there is no light at night so you can&#39;t see anything except the hotel/restaurant across the water. However, the romantic ambiance makes up for the lack of view at night.<br><br>Every time I have come here, I have enjoyed  the food. Maybe nice or twice the service was a miss, but I won&#39;t complain too much because again, the good is amazing. My favorite appetizers are the Firecracker Shrimp and the Buffalo Blasts (cheesy chicken, cheese and buffalo sauce all wrapped in a pastry crust and deep fried to resemble a crunchy, meat-pie-shaped egg roll - pure heaven). <br><br>Main course favorites are Madeira Chicken and Shrimp, Orange Flavored Beef and their BBQ Beef Shortribs (melt in your mouth). And you can&#39;t go wrong with any dessert. They are all delicious. The Ghiradelli Brownie Sundae that we had last week was divine. At least 3 tables next to us asked us what it was because of the presentation. <br><br>For a sweet craving or dinner solution, Cheesecake Factory is your place.

Good restaurant!<br><br>Valet parking only...<br><br>Food was great.. I ordered the Chicken Piccata and it was delicious!<br>Avocado egg rolls are a must try!<br><br>Nice view if you sit by the window.

Ramon &amp; Jeff are always on point <br>The service never disappoints but more importantly the food is awesome<br>Happy hour on weekdays- be sure to order the spinach dip and spring rolls <br>Amazinggg<br><br>Thank you Ramon for an awesome experience tonight

Very disappointed! This place used to be so much better. My Kobe burger was good, but the rest of the food was not great. My daughters pasta was a mess, and my wife&#39;s sandwich was entirely ordinary. Service was pretty shoddy too. We asked for a window seat and even waited for a booth to be made available.  When we were eventually told that our table was ready it wasn&#39;t a window seat as had been promised. Our server was also less than acceptable, and food came out in bits and pieces, with some of us waiting for food while others were already well into eating their meal. They need to jack up their service!

*HORRIBLE!!!! BEWARE!!!! Bad people and bad service!! Last Sunday BrunchWendy served us, she brought the wrong food. I told her what I wanted, watched her clearly write it down, when she brought out my food it was wrong.  Then instead of fixing it she says &#34;I asked you twice&#34; huffed and walked off rude.  Insulting, and quite weird. She attempted to try to make me feel stupid,  She tried to be dishonest and come back trying to say it was what I ordered and put it down.  ARE U KIDDING????  Sadly others (7) at my table ate first and she took her time to get my order out. Most finished way before I did so I had to hurry.  I did get up after a long wait and went over to her tell her how crazy the wait was and how embarrassing it was, a manager in blue and a tie walked over to us, listened for a minute the just walked off.  He clearly did not care!  So we paid and left.  On the way out he (the same lazy manager in blue (I&#39;ll get his name and add later) was leaning over the counter and I said bye to him, and I said &#34;you know you could have asked what the problem was or do something like not charge me&#34; I said that&#39;s a bad way to manage an issue. He said sorry man, let me get your name, I said for what??  He just said &#34;let me take your name&#34;. First of all tell why!  And soundly , too damn late to act like you care when clearly you don&#39;t!  I won&#39;t go back.  I am so tired of this type of chain, your just a number, not a person to these corporate types.  Support places that care.  NOT THIS HORRIBLE PLACE!!!  I

Big portions !  Good food !<br>Yessir... you will always bring home a doggie bag for your fat roommate if you go to this place... 3000 calorie servings people.<br><br>The pasta is super amazing... we get the Cajun pasta... or the basic Chicken pasta bowties.  Split a serving ??  Or take it home to Big Bertha.<br><br>Did you say Cake ?  Cheesie Cake ?   We&#39;ve tried half of the flavors.  Darn good.<br>No Damn Good.    How do they make those cakes ?  So decadent....  Its sinful.<br><br>You have to go to church 3 times to cleanse the decadence after eating there.<br><br>YUM TOWN !

The hostess named Christa is the type of person who should never step foot within the hospitality or restaurant industry. Her attitude and self entitlement is truly unwelcoming to all customers. When we walked in she ignored us and gave a disgusted look, made us wait for 5 minutes before looking up at us. She then said please wait as I finish what I am doing. The restaurant must take action to hire more qualified hostesses. This was the second time I had to deal with her behavior. I will not return and will not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Exquisite location on the Redondo beach marina. So many options for food, drinks, desserts. Honestly cheesecake outdid themselves. Great vibe and ambiance low light setting. The menu is huge and the portions are extremely generous. I personally am a fan of the super antioxidant salad + add side of chicken on top. It&#39;s super healthy and delicious! Between the pastas, specialties, burgers, etc you can&#39;t go wrong! Highly recommend! You can also choose self parking or valet. They seat huge parties so it&#39;s ideal for events and huge reservations.

I&#39;ve been here many times with my family and each time the food was good.  I love the Crusted Chicken Romano, so much so that I&#39;ve ordered it every time so I can&#39;t comment on the rest of the menu. And the cheesecake! How can you go wrong!  It does get crowded and the noise level is pretty high. That would be my only negative comment but it hasn&#39;t stopped me from returning.
This rating is strictly for the valet.  The staff is very rude if you decide to park is the self parking.
It&#39;s ok, the food was a little cold. The wait was not bad. The service was good but we had to wait for our food for awhile, 2 adults and 2 kids bill was 85$

Love the view of the boats.  Like that you can drive up and get a piece of cheesecake to go.  Don&#39;t like that the only parking is Valet.  Don&#39;t like the wait to be seated when busy.  The service tonight was bad.  Long wait for everything.  So long ended up not even getting cheesecake.

I love Cheesecake Factory and never have any complaints about their food. We got the Tex Mex Eggrolls, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta &amp; White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle Cheesecake..everything was yum!<br><br>The reason I&#39;m taking 2 stars away was for the service.<br>Our waitress seemed very rushed the entire evening and forgot to get us stuff like lemon for the water, straws and the bread (my fav part of dining there)!<br>Even when she would stop by to check on us, she would literally be walking by our table and quickly say, &#34;howsthefoodiseverythinggoodgreat!&#34;. I&#39;m just like, huh? Can you please speak a bit slower and actually STOP at our table to ask if everything is fine??<br><br>Another thing that annoyed me was where we got seated. We were seated in a 2-person booth which was adjacent to the kitchen. They had a window on the wall where we could see the kitchen. Some people might like that but I definitely did not. I could just hear pots and pans being banged around and the kitchen staff talking and laughing loudly. So much so that I could barely hear our own conversation.<br><br>As you can imagine, with a frustrating dining experience like this, I definitely don&#39;t think I will go to this Cheesecake Factory location again.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been consistent over the years. Great food, great service, wide selections-- all the main food genres are covered. <br><br>I like to sit on the patio, we live in Southern Cali, let&#39;s take it all in!<br><br>I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory and even Grand Lux (now closed) many, many times over the years, but after this last visit I felt the need to post a review. I just discovered their gluten-free menu and it is amazeballs! I&#39;ve never seen a restaurant offer so many gluten free options. That menu book was at least 4 pages-- pretty impressive. They even have gluten free chocolate cake. YUM! <br><br>Soooo, I&#39;m going to have to bring CF back into my happy hour and brunch rotation. :)

We were there 6/25 for my daughters birthday and I have to say our waitress Sydney was EXCELLENT, she had the best attitude and personality I&#39;ve experienced in a long time. The food was great, everyone enjoyed it.

This is my favorite restaurant in the world!! Quote me because its no lie. I can&#39;t deny u cheesecake factory. U have the best calamari ive ever had in my life. The nicely fried and well seasoned squid can be eaten alone or dipped into the delicious cocktail sauce that I can probably drink by the shot if nobody was watching.  <br>My favorite meal has got to be Chicken Madeira..idk what&#39;s in the sauce,  but it got me hooked.  Strawberry lemonade is also yummy but you have to be in the mood for it. It can be too sweet sometimes,  but nothing a little extra water can&#39;t fix.  <br>I&#39;ve never went without having a cheesecake so you know im an expert. My fave so far has got to be the banana cheesecake and the chocolate mouse cheesecake. All cheesecakes taste fresh n always arrive to the table in such gorgeous presentation that sometimes it takes me minutes to take in the beauty before I devour it like a shark to a surfer.  I love you CF. See you soon.

First off, you&#39;re forced to use the valet which costs $3.50. If you&#39;re looking for a nice, cozy place to eat where you can view the ocean, you&#39;re not gonna find it here. This Cheesecake Factory is usually busy and packed. <br><br>Our waiter Darren was a complete gentlemen who was very knowledgeable about the menu and the current discounts of the day. I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich. I did have to wait a little longer for whatever reason to get my order but at least the sandwich was quite delicious. The salad that came with it wasn&#39;t so bad either. <br><br>But looking at the name of this place, I just simply had to try out an actual cheesecake. We ordered a whole pie... Hrm, that sounds awkward... What do you call a whole circle of cheesecake anyway? In any case, I have to say that I was disappointed with it. For a place to be called Cheesecake Factory and not have the ability to churn out superb cheesecake is as disappointing as everyone in your life forgetting it&#39;s your birthday. <br><br>You know, if we&#39;re gonna have to pay $3.50 for valet, I expect them to retrieve my car in a timely fashion. We had to wait outside far longer than we had to. It actually would have been faster for us to walk to our car and drive out of there ourselves. <br><br>Finally, I didn&#39;t see any Vultures, Siege Tanks, Hellions, Thors, or Goliaths around. I asked if they used an infernal pre-igniter upgrade to defrost their cheesecakes. All I got was a look of bewilderment. Oh well, it doesn&#39;t seem like there&#39;s a tech lab attached to this factory.
The staff was great but the food was not the quality that you normally would expect from the Cheesecake Factory.
Best server hands down is Leyloni Gonzalez, always on top of her job, quick, and greets wit a great nice smile

Normally not a fan of chains or Cheesecake Factory, so I was not happy this was the lunch place of choice. Especially since we are all the way out in Redondo beach and going to a restaurant that is just right around the corner from us back at home! Really?? <br><br>But I had not been to a Cheesecake Factory in years (unless I was picking up a cheesecake which I DO recommend) and I was pleasantly surprised to a section of small plates/tapas in the tome of a menu!  Right up my alley! I was able to talk one of the other guests at the table into sharing several small plates and having a tapas style meal. <br><br>The bread is still good just as I remember it. Chewy, dense, whole grain or squaw style. <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUtlkWr8TSG6e5C_76fhw?select=Lpn6R9XBhIMd9EwtkwHNfg">yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUt…</a><br><br>I sipped on my Strawberry martini while enjoying the view of boats bobbing on the water. <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUtlkWr8TSG6e5C_76fhw?select=-l2iaL0LY9FoHnhidORTXA">yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUt…</a><br><br>And when all the little tapas arrived, I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The Pear gorgonzola flatbread was nice. I do however prefer the pear cut into thinner slices blanketed over the bread so there is a more perfect amount of pear in each bite. These were big cubes sprinkled on so some bites had too much pear, and other bites no pear at all. <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUtlkWr8TSG6e5C_76fhw?select=PUjR3f7RqNeYlloyEaxVfA">yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUt…</a><br><br>The white bean hummus was very nice and creamy. Good texture. <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUtlkWr8TSG6e5C_76fhw?select=IguFYDoqkLQTjfvB9J1HiA">yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUt…</a><br><br>Stuffed mushrooms were bathed in a nice sauce and very flavorful. <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUtlkWr8TSG6e5C_76fhw?select=B0CevUFCIMcOkJfmhRhYiQ">yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUt…</a><br><br>But the highlight for me was the wonderful kale salad. It&#39;s so nice to see raw kale salads more often when I go out. I usually  have to make these at home myself. The others companions with me didn&#39;t  even know you could eat kale raw. They all loved this salad.<br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUtlkWr8TSG6e5C_76fhw?select=4F3C3elwrpLR7Myqy3NdgA">yelp.com/biz_photos/LRUt…</a><br><br>I would probably be willing to go back to CF to try more of the small plates and get more kale salad. Still never on the top of my list to go to, but now I won&#39;t bitch if someone else picks it.

We were a table of 7 people, we ordered the food after 10 mins, it took 40 min for the food to come, and after it finely was all on the table it wasn&#39;t even warm... <br>The waitress was very kind and came all the time to check on us and once we lost our patients and said we&#39;re not saticfied, she called the manager which was so rude! <br>He said we are only waiting 35 mins (which is also a lot, but- we definitely waited for at least 40 as we texted someone right after we ordered so we we tracked the time.<br>After I clarified we are not satisfied with the whole experience he still didn&#39;t give a damn, and completely ignored our complaints...  <br>Unfortunate and very disappointing...

I really like this location, it is probably one of my faves. I NEVER have any problems with customer service when I visit the cheesecake factory, in any city, and I think that speaks volumes of the chain.<br><br>The CF has a huge menu and EVERYTHING is appetizing. You can almost never go wrong, unless you go and order something that you are not used to eating.<br><br>Parking is always hectic here, and I believe that it is solely vallet parking on the weekends.

Arrived at The Cheesecake Factory willing and excited to have lunch.  Was well takin care of by our first server, only to find he was a &#34;break-server&#34; (meaning he was filling in for our real server.). When he introduced us to our real server we were disappointed.  The high level of care our break-server gave us was quickly downgraded to a server that took 5-8 minutes to refill our drinks, bring us dessert, and bring the check.  No one wants to wait around for dessert and then wait for the check.  I almost didn&#39;t want to eat my cheesecake in protest!  But it was a &#34;Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. Oh well, the sacrifices one must make.  Alas, I will not be returning to this Cheesecake Factory.  <br><br>Finally, after paying up my $50.00 for lunch, I was still expected to pay for parking, which by the way is the only way you can park.  Yes, valet is the only way to enjoy this Cheesecake Factory and you must pay with cash or be advised to walk to The Crowne Plaza hotel with an ATM in the lobby.  This is a good 10-15 minute walk across Catalina and back.  No signs to advise you cash only, the parking guy told me &#34;the Cheesecake Factory wouldn&#39;t let him post it at the podium when you are forced to valet because its tacky.  So remember!!<br><br>**THE PARKING ONLY TAKES CASH**.

Was having a good time as possible after a memorial service at sea. I had one bloody Mary, ordered a second one and was served a virgin. (not cool). I complained my drink was weak. Julia <br>said it&#39;s not a virgin. I sent it back. She brought me a shot to pour in my drink... Cool, right? No! They charged me for 2 bloody marys AND a shot..... Not the way I wanted to memorialize someone.
My favourite place, delicious and patio area is good to dine. Try salted caramel cheesecake, kobe burger, fish tacos and of course fresh strawberry cc yummyyyyy

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory we ever had!  A group of 6 and at least 3 of the orders had some issue.  My issue was my Chicken Bellagio tasted different. It lacked the Chicken Bellagio flavor that I am accustomed to! The noodles had a lot more cream sauce on them, almost like an Alfredo! That was different! My daughter ordered Hk day Truffle Chicken, it was cold! Even the chicken was cold in the middle.  That plate had been sitting a while somewhere! The waiter indicated he would replace the meal. He took it to the kitchen and brought the same plate back! Still with the missing piece of chicken and mashed potatoes that she initially tasted! He lied and said that they prepared a new one for someone else and gave it to her instead.  Clearly that was a lie! The service that evening was horrible, the wait was long but not only that, the food was not prepared in a manner that we have grown accustomed to from what used to be our favorite Cheesecake Factory location.

Cheesecake Factory is the place which you can always rely on. I have tried their food at different locations and have never been disappointed. I love their falafel salad, veggie burger and chocolate cakes. Nice ambience and reasonably priced. This location is situated in nice neighborhoods and is always super busy.

Of all the locations I&#39;ve visited, Redondo Beach is my favorite. It&#39;s not crowded like the rest and the service is not only fast but great. You&#39;re also right on the water so you can take a walk along the dock.
Love the place mannnnnnn, I wish I eat this food every day but I cant health reasons of course don&#39;t want to be big lol

This location is ALWAYS crowded, expect to wait 15-60 minutes if you go during peak hours.<br><br>My family and I ate in the bar, which usually has no wait.  The service is slower, but you will still get in and out without having to wait.  The bar also has televisions for sport viewing.<br><br>My recent experience was good, I enjoyed the fish tacos, which includes 4 tacos.  They were tasty (B+).  They also make some good scratch drinks, look at their menu and see what sounds good.

OMG...<br>We always go to this location with family and friends. However we decided to take my in laws on Labor Day and we got there around 12pm. I never experienced a horrible service in my life that we got yesterday. I was soooo ashamed front of my in laws. Our server was so unfriendly with a big attitude... Everything we asked for it took her a long time to bring. When we got there it wasn&#39;t busy yet so I&#39;m surprised that it took 50 min to get 4 orders of California Omelette. And after 50 min when I asked the server why is taking such a long time to bring our food she said well you asked for cream cheese that usually on Mondays we don&#39;t have that much..um okay. She had our toast and before she puts it down with an attitude she said so should I take back ur toast or you want it? I mean really is this how they trained you here? When I asked for the manager all he had to say was sorry and our food should be ready soon. Two other tables got there after us and they ordered lunch menu they both got their foods and was ready to pay...I always go to this location, but after yesterday I will find a different place to go spend my money or take my family. Oh and I ordered my omelette with egg whites and asked for tomatoes, and when I got my food after 50 min my omelette was with regular egg and on the side with crispy potatoes. My husband asked just for a regular coffee it took her 15 min just to bring his creamer...I mean his coffee was cold already... I understand its busy but have some manner and treat your customers with some respect. Horrible service so unprofessional..still in shock of her attitude.
I love the cheesecake factory. Great food and service. <br>I highly recommend the Cajun chicken little. That&#39;s the best dish.

What has the cheesecake factory become? <br><br>Back in my day, the cheesecake factory was a classy joint. A place for Valentine&#39;s Day, New Year&#39;s Eve dinners, and classy birthdays. Tonight it was a night where I saw sandals, football jerseys,and gym shorts. <br><br>Yes, the place was packed. The wait to get a table at one point was an hour and a half. However I am disappointed with the quality and the standard that the cheesecake factory has evolved into. Sadly, cheesecake factory is comparable to TGIF Fridays or Chili&#39;s now. <br><br>Although the food was delicious as always, I sadly give the cheesecake factory three stars; because that is what it has become, average.<br><br>RIP to a legend.

We came here on a weekend and the place was packed and the only available parking was valet. But I was craving Cheesecake...It was really loud inside and it seems like tables were crammed together to accommodate bigger crowds. Every food I had in any of this establishment was always meh but cheesecakes are always good -- Red Velvet Cheesecake is the best! However, since we are going for a stroll at the beach too, bf suggested I eat real food (I only wanted to order Cheesecake) so I tried the Egg Rolls--it was delicious! I devoured the whole plate and since the portion is just right, I had enough space for dessert. :)

You can never go wrong eating here the food always has quality Standard and if you don&#39;t like it they would be more than happy to exchange it or remove it off your bill the staff is polite and the atmosphere is amazing will return.

Me and my fiancé went to this place last night. We always go to Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s our spot but last night was by far the best time. First they had valet parking for only 4 bucks. Second we both tried something different from what we normally eat there and they were both delicious. The fish taco was awesome!!! Best dish I have had there since I&#39;ve been eating there!!!! Third we ordered the Linda&#39;s fudge cake and for the first time it had nuts on it. That was different from other CCF I have been too. Still a great night!!!

Been meaning to give a huge shout out to our server, Leana.  We asked a bunch of questions about the ingredients in the food and she didn&#39;t know some of the answers but she found out and was extremely helpful.  Went above and beyond.  Great attitude and super friendly.

I&#39;ve been to many different locations for The Cheesecake Factory, but I would say this is one of my favorites. The ocean/waterfront provides the perfect backdrop for dining (definitely recommend coming here if you are planning a romantic meal for that special someone).<br><br>The first time I came to this location, it was for an anniversary dinner on a weeknight and it was pretty late - around 9 p.m. But that ended up being extremely beneficial, as there were hardly any customers and our server was most attentive.<br><br>One of the reasons why The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants is due to its extensive menu. There is truly something for everyone on there (picky eaters and those who love exotic cuisine). And did I mention the selection when it comes to cheesecakes/desserts?<br><br>For first-timers, here&#39;s what I would recommend (based on my love for cheese and easy-to-please palate):<br><br>Fried Macaroni and Cheese (appetizer): This gooey, cheesy mac and cheese mixture gets even better when deep fried and covered with a thin, crispy crumb layer. Cheese simply oozes out of the shell with every bite (truly a must for cheese lovers). The four mac and cheese balls are served with a creamy marinara sauce (not a very strong tomatoey taste) and bits of shredded cheese on top.<br><br>Macaroni and Cheese Burger (glamburger): This burger definitely falls under the &#34;gourmet&#34; category. It&#39;s unique because it includes a slightly flattened deep-fried mac and cheese ball (like the ones featured in the appetizer mentioned above) atop a charbroiled patty, Cheddar cheese sauce, lettuce, tomato, pickles, an onion and mayo. I would recommend only eating half of this savory burger if you plan to save room for dessert.<br><br>Grilled Cheese Sandwich (sandwich): This used to be a staple on the very bottom of the &#34;Glamburgers and Sandwiches&#34; portion of the menu, but the eatery has since taken it off ever since the menu was revised. I was told, however, that I could still order this delicious grilled cheese upon request. The dish features the customer&#39;s choice of cheese sandwiched between two pieces of egg-battered bread and is served with French Fries that are generously salted and tasty.<br><br>Chicken Madeira (specialties): This chicken dish is famous as the eatery&#39;s &#34;most popular chicken dish.&#34; Flavorful and savory, this one is definitely a winner. The dish contains a couple pieces of tender, sautéed chicken breast topped generously with melted Mozzarella cheese and pieces of asparagus. It&#39;s also covered with flavorful mushroom Madeira sauce and is served with fluffy mashed potatoes. Again, if you&#39;re a cheese lover, you&#39;ll want to indulge in this savory dish.<br><br>Chicken Piccata (specialties): The flavor from the capers combined with the strands of Angel Hair pasta are probably the crowning glories of this dish. It features sautéed chicken breast topped with lemon sauce, mushrooms and capers. I would recommend asking for extra cheese for additional flavor/savoriness.<br><br>Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple (cheesecake): Be forewarned - this is probably one of the sweetest cheesecakes on the menu, but it&#39;s definitely one of my favorites. This decadent dessert features the original cheesecake in an Oreo Cookie crust and includes caramel, chunks of Butterfingers and Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cups, and peanut butter throughout. Peanut butter lovers will especially appreciate the fresh dollop of peanut butter mousse that comes atop the cheesecake. <br><br>Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake (cheesecake): Even though this sounds overwhelmingly sweet, ironically, this cheesecake isn&#39;t as sweet as its close cousin, the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple, because it contains layers of moist chocolate fudge cake in between the layers of cheesecake (versus layers of pure cheesecake). The layers of moist chocolate cake offset and complement the layers of cheesecake in a nice way, and peanut butter lovers will rejoice upon eating the dollop of peanut butter mousse atop the dessert. There are generous chunks of Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cups (my favorite candy) loaded in the cheesecake layers, and there are also thin layers of caramel. Finally, the crust is an absolute wonder, as it&#39;s covered with Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cups as well. <br><br>Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake (specialty cheesecake): Currently, the regular &#34;Oreo&#34; cheesecake has been replaced with the &#34;Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake&#34; on the dessert menu. I personally prefer the regular &#34;Oreo&#34; cheesecake because it does not contain the layer of Oreo Cookie mousse (whereas the &#34;Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake&#34; does). However, both cheesecakes have winning qualities, including generous chunks of Oreos baked into the layers of cheesecake, a sweet milk chocolate icing and a decadent Oreo Cookie crust.

If you are looking for a dining establishment with great ambience, this is your place. It sits right on the harbor so that even if you choose the indoor seating, you get a great view of the boats in the harbor and the water looks as though it goes right up to the restaurant. The waiting staff is also very, VERY friendly and geared towards customer satisfaction. I was feeling adventurous and chose a new alcoholic beverage that I don&#39;t usually drink, and did not like it. I asked our waiter for another drink, and after he brought it out, I asked if he could please take the other (nearly full) drink away. I wasn&#39;t expecting it, but he didn&#39;t charge for the drink I had originally ordered! <br><br>Now, as for the food quality itself.... it leaves a little to long for. They aren&#39;t experts in seasoning, and the food was ok, but you could probably get a better quality at Applebees. That being said, their quality in making cheesecakes is unparalleled.<br><br>Also, just be prepared that there isn&#39;t really parking in the adjacent area and they are valet only ($4).

Don&#39;t bother. What was once a FANTASTIC restaurant is now a joke. The food is good and the desserts are great, but the service? FORGET it! <br>It took a full hour to be seated after being told it would be 30 minutes. It took an hour to receive the first three of seven plates for dinner. The manager shows up as the last plate is being delivered (20 minutes later) and speaks ONLY to that guest. He completely ignores the fact that 6 other people are sitting in front of cold food. He brings a dessert to that guest. Is that supposed to fix everything? $200 to be treated like THAT?!? REALLY?!? When this restaurant opened in the 80&#39;s it was AMAZING! As a fellow restaurant employee, several of my friends started working here. It was GREAT!! It was a gold standard. The food was ALWAYS delicious. The service was IMPECCABLE. You are now an embarrassment. Close your doors and leave our city.

I have expierenced better. My family and I went to CCF yesterday during lunch and there was 2 lady&#39;s in the front , didnt greet us quickly asked how many of us were there. We asked if we could sit outside and the lady said sure give me a second let me see where I can seat you. We finally went outside and the lady was going to put us in the sun (with a 10 month old baby). When we asked if we can get somewhere outside in the shade she said no because there was going to be a party there in a little, (BUT I THOUGHT THERE WAS NOOO RESERVATIONS)?. <br><br>We finally just said ok lets just go sit inside. Our server was Alberto he was pretty nice, professional, and very patient. <br>We ordered our food quickly, got our drinks,and bread.<br><br>I would say that the only thing that is wrong with this place is that some staff are and look very un-professional. I think the manager was discussing a problem with another worker infront of us.<br>OVERALL 2 STARS IS ENOUGH...

We ordered the Fried Mac and Cheese. So delicious. I also ordered the Catfish. That wasn&#39;t as great. It didn&#39;t taste seasoned at all. The sauce was okay but adding a little salt to the fish before frying it would have done wonders. <br>We had to valet our car since there was no parking and unfortunately we didn&#39;t have any cash. There is NO ATM so we had to walk to the hotel up the street to get cash to pay the valet. That sucked! Had a cramp from the walk.
Delan was amazing great customer service very responsive polite. He made sure we were taking care of our entire time.

This place was packed at 8:45 on on a Sunday! I&#39;m new to the area but wasn&#39;t going to give up a free piece of cheesecake so I picked up dinner as well. I&#39;m paying for it now. <br><br>I called in the order &amp; I got the Renee special there ate 2 options on this plate - I knew I didn&#39;t like how dry the turkey was when I had this during another visit so I ordered the chicken almond salad sandwich. ... but ended up with the turkey. (I KNEW the girl taking my order needed to repeat it back to me but I didn&#39;t make her, &amp; the order was wrong) well so turkey @ California &#39; s CF is dry like in Texas. I wasn&#39;t asked what dressing I wanted, and ended up with no plastic-ware to eat my salad, soup and cheesecake with.... I ended up only finishing the soup.  Now I&#39;m sick to my stomach.

Once our favorite spot to bring our Foreign Visitors for a Lovely Experience on the Harbor at Redondo Beach. Prior to this visit, it has been a no-brainier, Cheesecake Factory pleases where ever you go. <br><br>Unfortunately, this location must be under new management, or the Waiting and Cook Staff needs a New Supervisor, because this place has let go of their usual high standards! Whatever the problem is, there is NEVER ANY REASON TO BE RUSHED TO ORDER AS SOON AS ONE SITS DOWN?? THEN AFTER BEING SNUBBED FOR 20 minutes , FOR NOT BEING READY? THEN  HAVE EVERYTHING DUMPED AT THE TABLE.... WATER, DRINKS, BREAD, APPETIZERS AND MAIN COURSE AT THE SAME TIME..! With an attitude as to asking them why?? Why this was happening??? What a JOKE..! We are not prudes here, nor do we expect special treatment. Just your low-key Redondo Beach Locales. We Just want the norm, a possible smile, Time to Look at the TWENTY PAGE MENU....YES!? And a reasonable relaxed environment to enjoy ourselves, and leisurely eat some good food. We were so embarrassed to think this place would impress some special guests. Of course they judge this as the Norm for an American Experience.....just OMG!<br><br>Being possibly they had been busy, short handed, or training was going on might have been the case the last two visits. Sorry, not being nasty here, as it seemed none of the above was the case. It was not that busy, and quite a few empty tables with waiting staff manager wandering around texting and ignoring the whole affair. Unfortunately, this time and the time before, in 2016, The food was simply awful, like Entree Salads, how hard is it? Lacking an dressing, spoiled tomatoes? The other, Shepard&#39;s Pie, just is AWFUL now...! Before this visit, the other disaster,  it was a simple chicken dish and pizza, was a joke...just slop....what the hell? What is going on?<br><br>What ever is the problem, Management, the waiting staff, and food prep, servers all are either pathetically undertrained, or just do not care. Simply put, just rude, impatient young folk, that do not care, that reflects a WE DON&#34;T CARE IMAGE for the whole restaurant. Who the hell would want a piece of Cheesecake after this horror, we won&#39;t be back to this location. I hope the disease of this place doesn&#39;t infect the whole chain.<br><br>And this was NEVER our experience for 20 years of going here, I think it has been. So sad, but maybe things are just going to continue it seems so that is my experience. R.I.P. CF...!
The manager is named Erin. She was very helpful and understanding, &#39;cause of her I always come back to cheesecake factory. They should hire more people like her. Great manager
Of all the Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been, this has the best views because it overlooks the boat docks rather than streets or parking lots.

The food was very good. I like their complimentary appetizers. It tends to get busy on Saturday nights and evenings. We luckily didn&#39;t have to wait. The service was great. Our waiter was very attentive and social. I had a great time and meal. I would definitely come again.
Food is delicious, not a long wait for a table, and have awesome servers! Shout out to our server Rob, the sweetest and most caring one!

First time here as a Yelper. <br><br>I&#39;m giving this place a 5 star. It has been 7 years since I last ate here and just never really cross my mine to come back. But, after today, I will be back soon to eat here again. <br><br>They sat my party quickly. The waitress was very polite in helping me to decide what I should eat. I had the Chicken Bellagio and it was delicious. <br><br>This place has a valet service; I prefer to park myself thank you, they were very courteous from when I left my car to giving my ticket to the valet cashier to the valet who drove my car up to me. Total professional and with a smile on their face.<br><br>Oh! One more thing, stop by the pie counter and pick up a slice of cheesecake. It took awhile but  seeing how busy they where I was patient as the cashier had a pretty smile.

I have always loved the cheesecake factory, and will always love the cheesecake factory! This location is probably one of my favorite locations because of the beautiful view of the harbor. What could be better than yummy cheesecakes, a martini, and a gorgeous view? Even though this place stays busy, I have always received great service and quick seating. The only thing I don&#39;t like about this location is that you almost have to valet your car.

Great place for any event my husband and I recently had our wedding at the Cheesecake Factory in redondo beach and the food was amazing the bartenders were on point SUMMER was extremely helpful during our wedding She made sure everything was coordinated and we stayed on schedule we highly recommend this place for anyone who is getting married they helped us to stay with in our budget and to top it off our wedding was a complete success and everyone loved the food thanks to the Cheesecake Factory coordinating team specially Abby. Nancy and Joel June 25th 2016 pm wedding!!!

I love the cheesecake factory!<br>I&#39;m not a regular customer and just come here for special occasions/celebrations/etc.<br><br>I was just here a few weeks ago with my husband, our mothers, &amp; sisters-in-law having a post mother&#39;s day lunch - it worked out perfect, we waited no more than 20min and had a delicious lunch on the outside patio.<br><br>Most of the servers are quick and attentive, if you get the one that&#39;s not, there are plenty of others that can help and make sure your waiter is around at all times.<br><br>I&#39;ve tried a few appetizers: egg rolls, potstickers, popcorn shrimp, calamari, and macaroni balls. However, they serve delicious bread that&#39;s fulfilling just by itself.<br><br>The servings are a decent size and many times enough to take home.<br>I&#39;ve tried a few plates but I always go back to my favorite, the CHICKEN &amp; BISCUITS! it&#39;s so delicious I&#39;m getting hungry just writing this = )<br><br>I definitely recommend trying a cheesecake slice, it goes perfect with the meal, and there are plenty of different selections to choose from.<br><br>Yeah there is a valet but it&#39;s only a couple of bucks compared to other places that charge $5 and up, but you can always park on the street or the small self park lot.
Easy and free parking. Quick service with a friendly staff. Great food.<br>Had brunch in the patio with a pretty amazing view on a warm summer afternoon.
The service was slow. Our silverware was dirty, it was gross!!! The food was very good.

I&#39;ll preface this review by saying that I&#39;m not, in general, a huge fan of chain restaurants, so I am biased against giving any Cheesecake Factory 5 stars as no Cheesecake Factory has ever &#34;wowed&#34; me. However, if you are generally a fan of The Cheesecake Factory, then the one in Redondo Beach is a lovely location overlooking the RB Harbor, and on a sunny afternoon, I would try for the coveted patio seating. If you prefer inside, there are rows of booths and tables lining up near the window for the ocean view. I have found the service to be good at all of my visits. <br><br>-Valet parking is $4, but there is also metered street parking (coins only).<br>-Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t take <br>reservations, and this location can become especially busy on weekend nights. <br>-There is event space upstairs that is nice for large group events. <br><br>Finally, in my most recent visit I tried the asparagus salad with olive oil, pine nuts, sun dried tomatoes and a fried egg on top. It was DELICIOUS!! <br><br>I also had the soup of the day, the mushroom soup, and I also really enjoyed it!<br><br>Overall experience with the Redondo Beach Cheesecake Factory is positive.

I&#39;m giving them a 2 for their rule of 20 min. 20 min to take a drink order, 20 min to take your dinner order, 20 min to get dinner (that&#39;s ok), 20 min to clean away the dishes after the last person is done eating, 20 min to take your cheesecake order, and 20 min to get the birthday girls cheesecake because the need to write on the plate (they had to put it on top of her dinner plate which they never cleared, nice huh?).  The good news is you save on the bar order because they never check back on drink refills. We spent 3 hours here with REALLY slow service and just ok food. Location and cheesecake just doesn&#39;t make up for all the other issues this place has
Water view, very friendly<br>We ordered shrimp scampi, shrimp Alfredo and shrimp bistro. Not a fanatic for shrimp just coincidence.  Foods were really good and the service accommodating.

Worst restaurant experience!  We waited about 40 minutes to be seated.  After being seated our waitress brought us two glasses of water (for a table of 6).  When we asked for two more waters without lemon she brought us hot water (no lemon, but no ice either).  All of this, lwhile being seated on the patio at a table that had little to no umbrella cover on a sunny day.  The view was great, so I don&#39;t sound too negative.<br><br>Food was sad. I ordered the honey truffle chicken, which looked so good in the advertisement.  It was bland and the asparagus had nothing on it. It was like food you receive with a dietary restriction.<br><br>My husband ordered the salmon and shrimp.  They looked so sad on the plate, one tiny piece of salmon and about four small shrimp artistically placed on the canvas of a plate with asparagus and fries.<br><br>Next, my son orders the spaghetti and meatballs, and receives poorly sauced spaghetti with a burnt (black) meatball.  When I told the waitress about the spaghetti she looked at me and said nothing. I had to ask if we could get another meatball because my son had not touched his food. She took the meatball and brought us a new one ( Too bad it was the end of our meal) and comp&#39;d my son&#39;s meal).  But for me, it was too late.<br><br>Refills on drinks (what is that!????)<br><br>We ended up getting cheesecake to go, which was the highlight of the legendary &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;.  <br><br>Overall, I won&#39;t be eating at this Cheesecake Factory and sadly to say I most likely will be getting my cheesecake to go from any other location.  This one experience has tainted my ideal view of Cheesecake Factory.  They look so nice and delicious, but my experience was not worth the money, time or aggravation.

This has to be one of my and my boyfriend&#39;s favorite places to fine. <br><br>It&#39;s not too expensive and not too cheap to be like, what are we doing here for a date night? We like to park across the street to pay metered parking because to pay valet to .. stand in front of  parking lot seems obscene to me. I still haven&#39;t grasped the idea of why they have valet parking. <br><br>Their menu is too damn long but hey, options are always fantastic when dining. It seems that even for our foodie tummy&#39;s, we have vowed to stick to our dishes. Every time, I get a glass of wine and a pan seared salmon dish and my boyfriend gets a glass of wine with his chicken belliago. <br><br>Their cheesecake is the best and of course, we always opt to take a slice .. or two .. home. I stick the good ol&#39; faithful of original and my boyfriend just tried the tuxedo. I have to say that it was a little reminiscent of strawberry in the chocolate or cherry? But it was yummy. <br><br>For the most part, I like that whenever I come here, there isn&#39;t that long of a wait. Without a reservation, there&#39;s a 20 minute wait but there&#39;s always a seat in the bar area.

Came here with my boyfriend on a Wednesday night. We were seated right away in the patio area. It was really nice and the weather was perfect. Our server was really nice and got our order out quickly. I ordered the Parmesan her crusted chicken. It was okay but the green beans were bland. I also ordered the passion fruit mojito which I loved! Would definitely recommend! Also would recommend coming to this specific location because of the view of the harbor!
Loved the meal I had here! Kylie was a great help today I was really unsure of what to eat and she was able to help me find the best meal ever!
Had an amazing experience at Cheesecake Factory today! The food was delicious, as always! The waitress,Kylie, was super accommodating, helpful, and funny!
