I REALLY want to give this four stars, but I&#39;ll explain why I didn&#39;t.<br>So I&#39;ve been a guest at the Cheesecake Factory a number of times over the years with above average service.<br>The food quality is overall pretty good.<br>Deserts are amazing as always.<br>Be prepared to be willing to spend some money as it is more of a high end restaurant. <br>So I went today for my brothers 22nd birthday.<br>We sat outside, and although it was chilly, the windows block out wind and the heaters do an amazing job.<br>Our server Cid, was a good server. Not too talkative, just did a basic server job.<br>Now I work in the restaurant business and I know 7 steps of service.<br>Food took about 25 minutes which isn&#39;t horrible but a little lengthy.<br>I ordered the lemon herb chicken as that was what he recommended. I don&#39;t eat bone in skin chicken and I thought the chicken would be breasts, now a full half chicken.<br>I was pretty disappointed but I figured to try it out. The flavor was bland. I had a different server take it back. My meal was comped off, but my appetite was ruined.<br>Another reason why I give this 3 versus 4 stars is because my dad had ordered a cheesecake and I had told the server previously it was my brothers birthday. So I figured they&#39;d bring him out a complimentary sundae like they did a table nearby. But instead our server decided to assume that my dad was ordering the cheesecake as a birthday desert and not to go.<br>I mean I&#39;m sorry, but maybe you should clarify with your guests and communicate I bit better to avoid such mistakes.<br>If I could, it&#39;d be 4 stars.<br>But as of now, it remains at 3!

Besides the fact that there was a metal twist tie in my friends salad, the food was delicious. Be sure to bring your piggy bank because the food isn&#39;t cheap. The variety of cheesecakes stare you down as you enter the restaurant and do not let you not pick one up after your meal. It&#39;s truly brilliant to put the cheesecakes on display at the entrance of the restaurant. Meanwhile your bill is through the roof.

What happened? Cheesecake Factory has been a destination for us- birthdays, celebrations, a good meal, good solid service in a efficiently run operation. A go to, a hallmark, beautiful location.... with all of these positives, a Sunday lunch with family should have been awesome...<br>First off, the food was sloppy, had some questionable particles, bland, unappetizing, such a bummer. The service basically sucked. When your server is gone for over 10 minutes, come on. We were seated next to a bussing station, which I know would piss people off, but no!  One server was throwing her plates into the bus bin. There was major complaining going on between employees, and it was just plain dirty and gross. The hardest working guy in there who gave it his all was the bus boy and even after he finished cleaning up after all of the sloppy servers, they would seriously just carelessly drop $h!t on the floor again. At this point in life, I get to say, &#34;not going back there!&#34; Definitely not going back to Cheesecake Factory!
We ordered soooooo much food! But it was all delicious. I have no complaints at all. I always love to eat here. But today for some reason they were on point! Great food and company.

This place has a nice atmosphere, the prices are not bad considering the location and good food. The burgers are delicious and meat loaf is really good too. The waiter helped with great food and dessert suggestions. The velvet cheesecake is amazing.

Food at the Cheesecake Factory is pretty much the same no matter which restaurant you visit unless you happen to visit a really bad location! I&#39;ve eaten at locations in Houston, Dallas, Denver, Las Vegas, San Diego, Los Angeles, and San Francisco and always know that I will get huge servings and delicious cheesecake, if I&#39;ve left enough room and not filled up on the bread! <br><br>The Redondo Beach location stands out in my mind simply because of the location! The restaurant is located right on the marina and if you&#39;re lucky enough to score on of the tables in the patio area you&#39;ll get to dine with a nice view, a breeze and the sound of sea lions! I&#39;ve never had to wait for a table although I&#39;ve only ever eaten here at lunch time, I&#39;m sure the dinner hours would be much busier!<br><br>Easiest way to park in the area is to use the restaurants valet although it will cost you $2.50 before tip.

My partner and I arrived right before the dinner rush which was perfect. We were able to pretty much sit anywhere. We waited less than a min to be seated. Tyler was our server and he was great! He was very prompt and checked on us often, but not annoyingly often. We got the cauliflower bites among other things.  They were amazing and the highlight for me. Our food was fresh and very well assembled. Our drinks were nice as well. Tyler got really swamped by the time we left but still got us in and out efficiently. I only took off 1 star because there wasn&#39;t many vegetarian options. Also we paid $4 for valet, but we parked and picked up our own car, so we basically paid $4 to park which sucked. But overall a good experience.

I come here a lot with my boyfriend we always order their Long Island Iced Teas which are strong and delicious. I also always get the skinny lettuce wrap tacos, Asian style and they are like 7 bucks and really delicious. We also always get a slice of cheesecake to take home which are always amazing. The only tip i have is if you order a whole cheesecake to go, they come frozen, not fresh. Order individual slices if you want cheesecake that tastes good.

The menu is HUGE! You can get any thing from pasta, Sandwiches, salads, fish, chicken, steak, Asian cuisine, Mexican food and more! The kid menu is nice and you can choose from fries or fruit.  They have great lunch specials until 5pm and brunch on Sundays.  The martini&#39;s are large and delicious.  The bread they bring to the table when you get there is warm and so fresh! There is great harbor views! It can get crowed at times so I like to go for lunch or an early dinner.
My kids and I love this Cheesecake Factory. The food is consistently fantastic &amp; the large portions are plentiful. Rob O. is the best server. We always request him. His service is incredible.

Let me start off by saying the food was good and service was wonderful from everyone BUT our server. She seemed annoyed with us the whole time. We literally just left and I thought I could brush it off but her attitude was just so unnecessary. <br><br>I came here with my mom and her two friends for a quick celebration lunch for me graduating and passing my licensing test to become a nail tech. My moms english is not bad at all but her two friends cant speak/understand as well so i ordered for them. It didn&#39;t seem to slow her down, i felt like actually it was helping her since their english would be difficult to understand. But the whole time she acted annoyed with our table. I let it go but it was when we were leaving. <br><br>We asked for boxes since we had a lot of food leftover and she asked for our plates. When she grabbed them she asked one of my moms friend to &#34;leave the fork&#34; and her friend thought she meant on the table so she did. And the server said &#34;no leave the fork i need it to put the food in the boxes&#34; but like i said her english isn&#39;t the best so i was like oh okay and proceeded to grab the fork for her but instead she looked at us rolled her eyes and walked away saying &#34;no its fine ill just grab another one&#34; i was like wtf?? But when she came back she gave us ONE BAG so my moms friend said &#34;oh separate please&#34; and the server replied with &#34;YEAH i know I&#39;m going to bring some after&#34; in the rudest tone! At that point i ordered in some cheesecakes togo i said &#34;could i have two lemon raspberry in two separate boxes and bags&#34; and she stares at me and goes &#34;annnnd?&#34; I repeated my order again and she stares again and goes &#34;okay anddd?&#34; And so i said &#34;yeah thats it just those two in different boxes&#34; and she goes &#34;yeah OK just making sure THATS it&#34; and she walked away.. Like wth it wasn&#39;t the worst but her attitude was not okay and she seemed annoyed for no reason.<br><br>You don&#39;t need to be all perky and giggly but the least you could be is POLITE.
45 minutes wait for two cheese burgers. 15 bucks for water down crown and Coke. Never again going to come back

I frequent this restaurant at least twice a month. I always enjoy my meal. I always order the herb crusted salmon, with mashed potatoes and asparagus. I guess I don&#39;t like change. Some serves are better than others, but I&#39;ve had a really bad one. <br><br>Always enjoyable.

The food is good and service is wonderful. Every waiter I&#39;ve ever encountered here goes out of their way to make your experience a good one. Parking is valet only but I don&#39;t mind it too much. Wait times can get pretty crazy if you don&#39;t have a reservation.
Excellent service!!! I totally recommend the angel hair pasta and key lime cheesecake for dessert!! Yummy!!!

Went here for my boyfriends graduation dinner, was a Monday night and the wait was short about 5 mins. Service was great, food was super yum! I had the garlic noodles with shrimp, it was soooo good, asparagus and mushrooms were so good, and it had just the right amount of garlic, mmm mmm yumm! Everyone was super happy witH their meals and the vanilla bean cheesecake was wow! <br>Everything was perfect!

This place is dead at lunch hour...guess it&#39;s too far away for most of the lunch hour crowd in El Segundo and other cities.  It did start picking up a bit by the time we left.  I don&#39;t say that it was dead in a necessarily negative way...it&#39;s just really quiet. <br><br>Has a great view of the marina and a beautiful patio with flowers and umbrellas.  Who doesn&#39;t like eating outside when the weather is beauiful?  <br><br>The lunch portions are plenty large enough for most people...did not have room for cheesecake... :-/

Huge pieces of cheesecake and A LOT of options to chose from, I had a hard time deciding what to get but ended up with the banana cream cheesecake. It was good but nothing I will order again when there is so many other flavors!
This has got to be the Cheesecake Factory with the best view in town. It faces all the beautiful boats. Its a breathtaking image. Zip coffee with a slice of oreo cheesecake. Yummy!

My sister and I came out of town and stopped by to eat here! Our server Marley was so cool &amp; nice! Thanks for making our quick experience here a good one! Food was also really good! I was craving sweet potato fries really bad and they definitely were satisfying

Poor service. Had to ask for forks. Brought all of one persons food while everyone else waited for 15 minutes. What happened to the onion strings. One used to get enough for you meal and now it&#39;s less than a handful. Moreover they started by bringing us onion rings. Took over 30 minutes to get two salads, salmon and a burger at 2:00. Only came because of a gift card and will not return.

Cheesecake Factory is always a safe bet when dining out - but the Redondo Beach location may be the very best location in the entire chain. We almost always sit out on the patio (even in oh-so-cold January), as the heaters more than compensate for the cool temperatures. It&#39;s just so therapeutic to us to dine and enjoy the view of the Redondo marina just a few feet away.<br><br>The service is EXCELLENT, particularly Anthony, Kacey, Melinda, Klare, Robert, Sandymar, Sean, Summer, Heather, Mariel, Antoinette and Amber (yes, we&#39;ve been there a few times).<br><br>Some of our particular favorites on the menu include the Mexican Tortilla Salad, Sheila&#39;s Cashew Chicken Salad, the Kobe Burger (with green salad), the Buffalo Blasts, Onion Rings, Fish &amp; Chips, the Tuscan Salad, and the Huevos Rancheros. And of course, the cheesecake rocks - Vanilla Bean is one of our favorites, but the pumpkin cheesecake in October and November is a definite treat. The Key Lime/Mango cheesecake is like having a bite of a summer day. I have it on good authority from my wife that the Pomegranate Margarita is da bomb, too (I don&#39;t drink, so I have to take her word for it).<br><br>You can park on the street for $1/hour (bring quarters), but you&#39;re going to be there at least two hours, and Redondo PD is very aggressive with ticketing. The valet parking for $4.00 is worth not having to hassle with the street parking and the parking enforcement.<br><br>All in all, one of the nicest places to dine sea-side in the South Bay.

Yes, it is a chain restaurant, but I find myself here every now and then. I like the fresh bread they serve with any order. They also have a variety of choices on the menu (the menu is a short novel Lol) The cheesecake?? Even if you don&#39;t have room to eat a slice there, take one home for later. Warning: choosing a flavor may be a challenge for some! I have tried the strawberry shortcake. It was good with fresh strawberries, but my vote still goes to the cheesecake. Also, I always make sure to sit by the window for a view of the marina!Of course, the potions are big, especially the pasta...which means sometimes I share with the hubz. Sharing is caring. ;)

I usually come here all the time and it has never been as bad as today.... the wait was ok understandable 20/30 minutes we get seated and server doesn&#39;t come to see us takes over 20 minutes 2 people come in about 10 minutes after me I noticed MY server goes and has a talk with them. Takes their order and I&#39;m wondering when is he coming... he comes over DOESNT ask if we want drinks goes to the back to see if they have what I asked for comes back around 5 minutes and we&#39;re already sitting here for almost 40 minutes the persons food comes that came in AFTER I came in and I still have not taken my order or gotten any drinks feeling really frustrated.... my food comes in everything good server doesn&#39;t come AT ALL to check if we need refills or if everything is good he comes until we&#39;re done we ask for our 3 cheesecakes we only get one supper frustrating....   got here at 9pm it&#39;s got our food around 10:40pm!!!!

This was my first visit to this location. I came for my cousin&#39;s birthday dinner and was pleasantly surprised we didn&#39;t have to wait long to be seated for a party of 10. Our table was behind the hostess but it was secluded enough that we hardly noticed. The view from the table was also amazing. The server, Obi, was great. He was attentive and friendly. The food was delicious and the cheesecakes didn&#39;t disappoint. I highly recommend this place for large groups and family dinners. An additional plus, the skinny drink and meal menu.

Always a great time, once you plow through the cataloguey menu with 10 plus pages. An extensive menu, the wait staff is generally happy, my last waitress was super sweet and fun.<br><br>Moderately priced, good food that comes up fairly fast!<br>Good portions, and yum yum. It is trendy and gets busy around sunset, but there is always plenty of room for inside and outside dining!<br><br>Don&#39;t forget my fave: White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake, it is...after all...the Cheesecake Factory!

For a corporate company, this establishment is poorly managed. Perhaps it&#39;s just this location. There were several things that made this experience frustrating. I will start with...<br><br>The good:<br>1. We were seated quickly<br>2. Complimentary, fresh, warm bread <br>3. Decent prices<br>4. Fair portions<br>5. Friendly service<br>6. Ample menu options. <br><br>Now for...<br><br>The not good:<br>We sat for 15 minutes before being greeted by our server, whom didn&#39;t actually &#34;greet us.&#34; He put bread down and said he&#39;d be back. Another 10 minutes passed and he finally came back. Not even with an apology, like &#34;so sorry for the wait, we&#39;re backed up,&#34; etc. It was a Wednesday night and not that busy (hence why we were seated quickly). We already knew what we wanted to order, so we placed our drink, appetizer and entree orders in at once because we weren&#39;t sure how long it would be until we saw him again (Side note: he was very nice, just VERY SLOW). It was literally another 10-15 minutes until our drinks came. I kid you not, we arrived at TCF at 8 pm, and our food did not arrive until 9:10! We ordered food at 8:45. He never refilled our waters (until we finally caught him and had to ask). In fact, the food runner (who said he&#39;s also a server) was awesome, and we saw him more than our server. He brought us extra bread etc. We had to track our server down for our check and didn&#39;t leave until 10 pm! This is unacceptable. Especially with a place like this. The food isn&#39;t that great. Not worth waiting that long. <br><br>There needs to more more of a sense of urgency with the service and awareness that most people don&#39;t want to be waiting that long. They should have the food runners also refilling water if the servers cannot. Smh.
Delicious food, and outstanding service the portions were very nice and the exsprsso was perfect.  Very happy with the whole Cheese Cake Factory

We&#39;ve eaten at this Cheesecake Factory location the last few times we&#39;ve been to Cali and always enjoy the ambiance and food. Each time we&#39;ve been here it&#39;s typically evening hours on the weekend and we never wait any longer than 20-30 mins even when fully packed, which is pretty impressive in comparison to other locations I&#39;ve been to both back home and other cities. The food is consistently good, servers are always friendly, and the view of the ocean is nice even at night time. Great spot for date night or family and friend dinner outings.

Natalie is the best! I have been to this location several times and the service has never left me this happy. She is extremely warm and knowledgeable about the menu. She has great suggestions, a beautiful smile and personality. She literally is the perfect example of what a waitress should be. I will be back for sure and it&#39;s all because of Natalie, thank you!!!
The combos are very good, fried shrimps and avocado egg rolls are amazing, always fresh! Overall the place of one of the best in South Bay, very cozy with great view and outside patio

First time going here, I ordered take-out for dinner. I was very surprised their relatively huge lot was solely for valet! (Was it 4 bucks? I don&#39;t remember-check the reviews below me). What a way to make money.<br><br> It was very crowded which made me relieved that I didn&#39;t dine-in though I suppose it&#39;d be fun with a group of people. It&#39;s beautiful at night of course. <br><br>I was pleased with the way I was treated there. Very nice. <br><br>I&#39;m not a pig ok...but I opened the take-out tray and for $17+ tax, what was in there looked like leftover portion. I think my asparagus may have been on the burnt side, but the food was overall good.<br><br>It&#39;s times like this when I wish I were a millionaire. Delish-

the sun never came out and it was dreary and chilly. maybe that worked its&#39; way into this review. <br><br>the food was ok. the spot itself is pretty awesome, next to the water/marina. valet parking only, pretty consistent with other Cheesecakes. staff was cool. sit outside, only if the sun is out... not really much to say about this place other than that. eh.
We went here last night with my husband our waiter is so polite and very pleasant his name is DARREL B.  plus our food and drinks is so good!

My hubby and I took our two boys out for a family date night this past Sunday and choose the Cheesecake Factory.  Upon arrival, there was a huge amount of people waiting for tables but I have to say that it was only about a 15 minute wait.  Not bad.  However, the clientele that was there was pretty gross.  Nobody dressed up to go out to eat.  What&#39;s wrong with people these days?  It was loud.  People were pushy.  I understand it&#39;s not a 5 star restaurant but they are still going out to eat.  Put a little effort into yourself and don&#39;t talk so loud that everybody around you can hear you!  A lady kept talking about how tall I was hoping that I would chime in...  Finally, she tugs on my arm and asks how tall I am.  Funny....<br><br>My son ordered chicken breast w/ veggies and mashed potatoes off of the kids menu.  Super yummy.  My other son ordered the burrito off of the adults menu.  It was HUGE but also yummy.  I ordered the Kung Pao Shrimp.  It was yummy but not what you&#39;d expect...  but delicious all the same.  Not sure I would order it again as it was a little heavy and I felt like my butt was growing as I took each bite!  lol  My hubby ordered some noodle dish and it SUCKED.  He barely ate any of it.  The waiter asked if everything was okay and I told him that my hubby&#39;s dish was not good.  He just did the &#34;oooooh&#34; sad face.  The end.  What?!  No trying to make it better or even seem interested.  I would want to know more being that he could at least make a recommendation to the kitchen or future guests...  <br><br>We all ordered a cheesecake each to take home. You can&#39;t go wrong with any choice you make.  I ordered the carrot cake which was very light.  I think this was the least of my favorite as it didn&#39;t have much flavor.  No true carrot cake / spice flavor that you would expect.  The fudge cake was amazing!  and the red velvet cake was superb!  the smokes cheese cake was my husband&#39;s choice but I didn&#39;t try it....  <br><br>All in all, if you want a good meal but a loud environment...  go here.  The menu is HUGE!!!  They even have an entire &#34;skinny menu&#34; to choose from if you are cautious with what goes into your body.  <br><br>Our bill was $150...  not the cheapest date night but we did order a lot.

I&#39;ve been to this location in the past, and although The Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t my favorite restaurant, I do enjoy some of their menu items. The food during our visit yesterday was no different, so my review is based on customer service.<br><br>I took my parents to this location yesterday for lunch and received lack of customer service. I can&#39;t say it was bad or terrible, but a lack of service because we felt our server was hardly around or took a long time. It took a while until we first saw our server, so I figured we order everything all at once - drinks, appetizers, and main dishes.<br><br>While waiting, I noticed it was taking a while before we got our waters. In fact, my dad&#39;s cocktail was brought sooner by another server than our waters from our actual server. Anyone notice something odd about that, but me? I don&#39;t know how long it takes to make cocktails, but I&#39;m pretty sure it would take much longer to make cocktail drinks than pour a glass of water. Also, it&#39;s probably a lesser complaint than what I&#39;m about to share, but when our bread was brought out, I noticed our server had another table&#39;s check booklet on top of our bread. You don&#39;t know who&#39;s hands or dirty tables these booklet carrying checks have touched. So, to see that on top of our bread was a little rude, I thought.<br><br>After our meal, I asked for the check and boxes for our leftovers. Again, it took a while for our server to deliver these items. She first comes by for our boxes, but doesn&#39;t have our check. When finally she hands me our check on her second trip to our table, she was nowhere to be found for me to pay for our meals. At this point, I pretty much had it because I was in a hurry. So, I went to the front counter expecting to pay there. To my disbelief, I was told by 3 ladies near the front counter working the dessert bar that I would have to go back to our table to pay. WTF? Not until I asked a gentleman behind the counter if he was the manager did I find out that it was absolutely fine to pay at the front counter. At that point, I pretty much lost it. I&#39;m not one to be vocal and start a scene with my complaints, but the fact 3 ladies at the front counter, including one who takes down the number of guests at the front, did not have a clue what to do totally blew my mind. Either they did not have any idea how to resolve a problem or they did not want to deal with it. I&#39;m really upset how the situation was handled. I had to wait until I asked the gentleman behind the register, if he was the manager in order for me to pay at the front counter. I&#39;ve never worked as a server, but if you can&#39;t ring a customer at the front counter because it&#39;s the duty of the table server, I&#39;m sure there&#39;s a manager who can override and get it done. Why did no one do that in the first place? Because I was able to get it done... and I don&#39;t even work there.<br><br>The food is delicious, but the customer service here during our visit yesterday was nonexistent. The ladies who work here rubbed me off the wrong way and gave me the impression they had no clue how to resolve an issue. A COMPLETE DISREGARD for customer satisfaction. I honestly received fast and satisfactory treatment from their valet. The servers at this location can learn something from their valet because these guys sure know how to hustle.

We just finished dinner here. We waited 20 min to be seated. The waitress did not bring the bread that you usually get at Cheesecake Factory. We had to ask for it because kids love it and I felt embarrassed by the look I got when I asked for it. We had to ask for straws several times. We ordered some appetizers and some dishes to share. After we placed the order the waitress asked &#34;that&#39;s all?&#34; with a tone that was more &#34;you are ordering three appetizers and two main dishes and two kids meals  for 3 people and two kids, that is not enough&#34;! So I told her yes if it is ok we would only like to order what we just told you. All the food came at the same time. All of that would not be a big deal but after 10 min the waitress started showing up every 3-4 minutes cleaning the table and asking if want to order more food or drinks. She took my half full glass of lemonade and I had to tell her I am not done we barely started eating. We told her everything is fine and then she came while I literally had my fork in my mouth and my kids were in the middle of their dinner asking &#34;should I box up anything for you&#34;? That was 12-15 min after the food came. We used to eat here every Sunday but their new service made sure we are not returning. We spent 20 min waiting and 30 min sitting here including waiting for the food to be brought out. I love Cheesecake Factory but this one became in the last three months the restaurant with the worst service in the are.

Okay; so what can I say about this chain that hasn&#39;t already been written?<br><br>Pro&#39;s<br> - anyone can find something to eat on this menu<br> - the strawberry martini is TO DIE FOR!!  I wanted another but was driving so had to stick to one (with long, slow sips)<br> - despite the place being super-packed on a Sat. night, my party of 2 was quickly seated in about 15 minutes<br> - my server was awesome!  He was super-friendly, attentive and had great product knowledge<br> - despite most items being horrible calorie bombs, the food is always consistently yummy (miso salmon... drool)<br> - so many choices in cheesecake, we took ours to go and I enjoyed it over 3 days =) <br> - great views of the marina<br><br>Con&#39;s<br> - is there really a reason to have valet parking AND to charge $3.50 for it??  You know those two quarters are going towards the tip! <br> - the calories in the food are KILLER and it&#39;s not a place you can frequent, often <br> - prices continuously creep on up there.  Paying $18 for a salmon dish isn&#39;t the worst but isn&#39;t the best<br><br>All-in-all, this is a good place to head to when you have picky eaters and you when you still want decent portions.

I love this place, it never disappoints! I&#39;ve had several dishes here, with the miso salmon being my favorite.  The starters are delicious, the view is delightful, service is always courteous, and the drinks! The drinks are god sent.  My favorite is the mojito and long island, but the mojito is what I usually order.  Sometimes there is a wait, but it never bothers me because I know how much I&#39;m going to like the experience.  The funny thing is that I&#39;m not too crazy about their cheese cake.  I prefer Cheesecake at McCormick and Schmicks, a seafood restaurant, and I prefer the seafood at the Cheesecake Factory!  Ha! Anyways, I always look forward to the Cheesecake Factory!

This is hands down the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake factory by an extreme margin. Our party of 6 are all fans of the chain, and we were simply shocked at how poor the service was with our waitress (mid-late 30s blond with really short hair). We were there on the 28th, seated on the patio at around 9:30 pm. This is the nicest Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve seen to date, which made the service even more disappointing.<br><br>To preface my issues ... I realize restaurants are strangers serving other strangers. We don&#39;t know each other, and I don&#39;t think the world revolves around me or my loved ones BUT as customers, we want to 1) eat good food, and at a sit down establishment such as Cheesecake ... 2) be made feel our business is valued and presence desired. If someone is having a special day (especially) and we&#39;ve chosen the establishment you work at to celebrate, it&#39;s extremely insulting to be treated with total apathy regarding customer service in general, much less that something special is happening. After all, it&#39;s why you .... the waiter or waitress .... are able to collect a tip which should be commensurate with your level of service (the waitress is fortunate I have enough integrity and too big a conscience to NOT leave a 0% tip ... but in hindsight, I truly wish I would have).<br><br>The night we attended was my Daughter&#39;s 23rd birthday and an ideal rendezvous point for &#34;the rest of the family&#34; to meet with her and her fiance (who had just proposed in a helicopter just prior to meeting us). After having waited an hour and fifteen minutes to be seated, it was another 15 minutes after being shown to the table before we were greeted by our waitress. After being informed by a member of our party as to &#34;the birthday girl&#34; being present as well as the proposal just having happened, the waitresses response was an indifferent &#34;Oh&#34; followed by a monotone request to another guest asking them what they wanted. We had to ask 3 times for straws. My daughter&#39;s steak was served with no knife, and we sat for another 10-15 waiting to see her before finally flagging a different waiter down (we were also brought our straws by a different male waiter). Additionally, I placed my order and our waitress was gone for 15 minutes before returning to tell me they no longer carry that item on the menu and she&#39;d forgotten to tell me previously. When leaving, she dumped a dirty fork in my GFs lap (who was wearing a white dress) and responded (still consistently apathetic) by saying &#34;Yeah, I saw it going over the side there&#34;, but didn&#39;t apologize at all. In fact, not once was there an apology for anything being slow, forgotten, etc. <br><br>What makes this all more insulting is observing this waitress&#39;s service to the female couple at the table just next to ours. One of the female customers informed the waitress she&#39;d just proposed to her (now) fiance sitting next to her, and they were engaged. It was the first (and only) semblance I saw of happiness, kindness, and customer service come from this waitress and one would think they&#39;d all been life long besties based on the warm socializing and prompt customer service that consistently transpired. <br><br>The ONLY saving grace to this place getting 2 stars vs 1, is the 2 male waiters that assisted with our table. They seemed genuinely concerned as to whether we had what we needed, and displayed more sense of urgency in meeting our needs than what was actually necessary, but given our waitress&#39;s behavior, it was simply nice to see and much appreciated.<br><br>Food was (at least) consistent with what can be expected at Cheesecake Factory. If it&#39;s a regular night out, you&#39;re not in any kind of hurry, and customer service is irrelevant as long as food is good, then &#34;sure&#34;go here. If there&#39;s any kind of special event going on and you don&#39;t wanted it tainted by someone with an absolute shite attitude serving you, it&#39;s worth giving consideration to another location. Despite seeing positive reviews as well regarding this particular CF, it&#39;s interesting to note the parallels in description of bad service for those who also rated it poorly. Guess we were one of the unlucky ones, and my advice is to not take the dice roll if it&#39;s an important occasion.
Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic is definitely a go to;-) also buffalo blast are a great appetizer:-) a huge menu and a bit pricey but well worth it on a special occasion or 2.

Came for Mother&#39;s Day brunch had reservations still waited for a table , mind u we had 7 kids under 12 that were hungry !!! The manager summer came and sat us right away , ok so we ate and an hour into it we get our bill REALLY were not even done so we pay and never saw our server again it&#39;s ok we&#39;re not thirsty well just drink out spit !!!! Found summer again and she helped us if it wasn&#39;t for her we were going to walk out this was my first and last time for brunch here next year we&#39;ll stick to ports o call like we&#39;ve been going to !!!!

Another great meal at Cheesecake Factory.  Relaxing and great service.  Valet parking is now $4 and there are no street side spots any longer.  Had the Crispy Chicken Costoletta.  Leftovers were wonderful.

The best selection of Cheesecake that I have ever seen. Always go here for special events like Bdays and such. Have never had a bad slice of pie/cake. They all taste amazing. My favs are White Choc Macadamia and Kahluah. Do not usually eat dinner here, but when we do it is always delish! The wings are juicy, lots of flavor. Highly recommmend!
I love cheesecake factory!! This time I got strawberry and peanut butter flavored cheesecakes. They were heavenly..:)

I came in to purchase an original cheesecake order to go. All I have to say is it&#39;s extremely expensive and such a tiny little cake! I suggest going to Costco for half the price and double the size. I only came here because I had a gift card so it was basically free. Yay for free cheesecake, but boo for how much of my gift card was gone. I should have used it on food!

We are from the bayarea and we frequent the Cheesecake Factory in Walnut Creek Ca, a 5 star dining restaurant. The truth is that the food was great but the service was terrible. It took the manager one hour to advise us that they ran out of salmon and that they would not be serving the dish for one of my guest. What really did it was that when I informed the manager that we were displeased about the amount of time it took to let us know, over an hour, was not acceptable. The manager  raised her voice and responded with attitude, frowned red face and said; &#34;It is not our fault the person before us beat us to the last salmon&#34;. That was incorrect because the person who did not order enough salmon for that night dropped the ball and that person was at fault. Dont know who makes the orders of food and fish, my guess it was the same restaurant manager that displayed unprofessionalism and disregard for care and service for their guest. Additionally, when they brought out the salad I informed one of the waiters that the salad she had in her hand was for my father, sitting across from me, but she  continued to ask another waiter who the salad was for. The waiter pointed at my father confirming what I had just told her who that salad was for. She disregarded my advise, ignored me and proceeded without an apology. We spent $700 dollars dining on one of our favorite restaurants we frequent, but the Redondo Beach Cheese Cake Factory was our worst dining experience hands down.
Really nice place love the service and the food is great. Will be coming back again soon to enjoy myself and all they have to offer
We had a great time here with excellent service from Derek. Beautifully placed in the Marina.

This place is shit. The hostesses are amazing. My boyfriend and I got our table for our party and no waiter even came to greet us or offer water. Our waitress was AWESOME! I loved her sarcastic humor, but caring attitude. Too bad I can&#39;t remember her name since NONE of the waiters/ waitresses introduced themselves. The spaghetti and meatball dish made me sick and I&#39;m still having symptoms. My boyfriend got the Shepard&#39;s pie and got sick. Their original cheese cake was absolutely horrid. Oh my god, I beg you: don&#39;t get it. The raspberry lemon cheese cake was great. The red velvet cheese cake was eh. The waiters practically ignore you so it was really hard to get a to-go box and bag. When someone did notice my hand up, this blond waitress was really mean about getting me a box and was very bitchy to my mom. My mom asked her a simple question and rudely responded with, &#34;Your waitress is coming!&#34; I&#39;m sorry to bother you? Shit, dude. CKF was apart of my bucket list, and I am EXTREMELY disappointed. Don&#39;t bother going.

I have been to many Cheesecake Factory but this one is at the bottom of the list. The food had no flavor like it was taken out of the freezer and put into an oven. I brought the whole family and got seated in a non lit table... not the romantically lit, just no light. My cocktail did not have any alcohol in it along with my wife, which both got sent back. Far from being impressed, but at least my bill was high... yay!

My friend and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner tonight! It&#39;s been a while since I have eaten dinner here!  Before dinner we went to the bar and had a delicious cocktail made from a sweet bartender named Axl Trias! Very upbeat and wasn&#39;t afraid to tell me what to order after I asked for his expertise drink to enjoy! He made a great cocktail and gave us great service! Will look for him again when I come back!!! We were seated and had the pleasure of having a wonderful waitress named Tatyana! She was very sweet and calm (I don&#39;t like hyper or anxious servers) she was perfect. I asked her for her personal recommendation on what to order and she was not afraid to tell me! Going with what she suggested, I ordered the CHICKEN Madeira! A Sautéed Chicken Breast Topped with Fresh Asparagus and Melted Mozzarella Cheese. Covered with Fresh Mushroom Madeira Sauce and Served with Mashed Potatoes. My friend ordered the FETTUCCINI ALFREDO! It had a  Rich Parmesan Cream Sauce. Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly! We ordered the chocolate cake and Tatyana pack it beautifully to go! If if wasn&#39;t for these two wonderful workers, I probably would not come back! Tatyana and Axl Trias Gave Outstanding, Award Winning Customer Service!!!They Rock!!!xoxo!
Had lunch here June 2016. Great service, great food and great views. Remember to leave room for dessert!

We came for my daughter&#39;s birthday. Let me just tell you the service is outstanding and it&#39;s all because of Natalie! She was extremely patient. The hostess was irritated with us when we requested to be reseated... So we were off to a bad start. When Natalie approached us with her warm smile and kind personality she immediately changed our attitudes. We ordered what she suggested and it was outstanding. We never had to ask for a refill or anything she was on top of everything. She is extremely warm and makes you feel very welcome. Every time we come we will request her to be our server. Thank you so much for perfect service and one of the best meals we&#39;ve had!!!!!!

This location sucks!! I was here with just me and a friend. We didn&#39;t get any service for the 1st 15 minutes. We didn&#39;t get menus until the next 20. I ordered the BBQ chicken salad, it&#39;s a great big salad with a 4oz cup of dressing and a 8oz scoop of meat. I sent that salad back so quick. This place is horrible. Location is nice, restaurant is nice and clean but your service sucks, pick it up. SN: do not sit in the bar area.

I have never been so disappointed with a Cheesecake factory as I have this one. It started with cold appetizers, then the plates sat there for almost 20 minutes.  When they did finally clear them they brought out a warm salad with the dinner. There were no refills on wate or ice tea ! We went to the comedy show after and I truly wish  we would of had dinner there. The only good thing was the cheesecake we brought home, compliments of the manager. We will not be going back when we return to visit our son.
Service is better this time around.  Our server is much better this time around.  Alexis was excellent

Love this place! Love the bread... Always get the hibachi steak plate! So good! We&#39;ve been coming here for years... Only problems have been the steaks. My husband ordered a rib eye, and got a piece of meat that was mostly fat. Gave it back. Didn&#39;t get charged. Didn&#39;t order a replacement. :-\ My kids ate good. Chicken teriyaki, Mac n cheese, chicken fingers... Yummy place! Then we took home cheesecakes! I had the red velvet Cheesecake. Delightful!

Let me just say that I&#39;m a big fan of Cheesecake, but definitely not this location!!! <br>Will I spend another dime at this location? OVER MY DEAD BODY! <br><br>I&#39;ve always gotten very good service at other Cheesecake so I was very surprised when I was stuck with a RUDE, inattentive waitress! Oh she was just awful! So far I&#39;ve read other Yelper&#39;s unpleasant experience is because they thought the server thought they were young and would not tip well? Hello?? How judgmental is that? Sometimes it&#39;s the elderly that doesn&#39;t tip well! If the service is good, I will tip you well! <br><br>It was not that busy that night and it literally...I mean literally took 20 mins to have anyone come to our table to ask for beverages or any sorts of greeting. And took another 10-15 mins for the waitress to come over to take our order. Let me just say that our waitress did NOT apologize for making us wait so long and just took our order. Shortly after that, she stumbled to the table next to ours and apologizing to them about slow service. OH I know she knew we were listening to her apologizing. ummm WOW, they have their drinks, appetizers and gets treated like a royalty... Oh yah, I forgot, they were older than us. Now it all make sense. <br><br>I was just sitting there in disappointment because it was my friend&#39;s birthday and I can&#39;t believe we&#39;re getting such awful service and feeling neglected. I felt so bad.....When I got my dish, it was not the same as other Cheesecake locations! It was sooo bland! omg...unbelievable! But my friend&#39;s plate was good so that was a relief. As much as I wanted to tip her a penny, I didn&#39;t....I was once a server too so I know it would be hurtful if someone tipped me a penny(Not that anyone did. =P~) I still tipped but of course very, very.....very  little.<br><br>Yah yah, the view was suppose to be nice but whatever! You can go to other location and have better service. Poor service can ruin your mood. Oh another thing I found out is that you are NOT required to valet park, but when we were there, they MADE us valet park, so I don&#39;t know what&#39;s going on there. The valet park didn&#39;t bother me much.

My boyfriend and I stopped in to get cake to take home for dessert, and didn&#39;t check the bag. My $8 piece of carrot cake looked like someone&#39;s leftovers, a sliver from the back half of the cake and then a large pile of crumbs that they tried to hide under a mountain of whipped cream. Check your takeout, folks!

In general I love CheeseCake Factory. They always have great food. we came in for a light dinner and dessert. <br>Small Plates: Kale Salad: this is by far my favorite salad it is really really good<br>Mushroom &amp; Avocado Fries: this is really good and good complement for any side salad<br>Turtle cheesecake: Yummy this is my favorite Love<br>Blueberry Cheesecake: pass way to sweet for me

The food is obviously excellent, anyone who has eaten here is well aware of this. The Godiva cheesecake that I am currently eating in bed is phenomenal and I&#39;m already looking forward to eating my leftovers from my giant portion of the Parmesan crusted chicken Romano.  My boyfriend&#39;s steak was cooked to perfection and full of flavor. The waiter that we had was great too, always making sure that my Arnold Palmer was full. <br><br>The biggest issue I had was with the cleanliness of the restaurant. Our table was on the back patio. As soon as we sat down I noticed the table had been cleared, but it didn&#39;t seem like anyone had wiped it down. There were still remnants of food from the last party who had sat there and my appetizer plate was dirty.  There were also a few ants on the table, which didn&#39;t make things seem very appetizing. The restrooms were also not in the best of shape, there was toilet paper scattered about on the floor. I understand how crowded this spot gets and how busy the staff must be, but I feel like cleanliness should be a priority in any food establishment.

Always will keep coming back. We ate dinner over the harbor and the meal was perfect. I had the fettucine Alfredo and my husband the Steak Diane, plus the avocado rolls for an appetizer with of course, Cheesecake for dessert. <br><br>Needless to say we had lunch for the next day also, but everything was superb and perfectly romantic.

Food was alright I had the chick chipotle pasta. It wasn&#39;t the most amazing dish. The setting was really nice as the sun was going down but other than that it was so so. The server was a cool person but he wasn&#39;t really prompt.

My friend moved to the Bay Area years ago and she and I come here sometimes twice a week. We always used the valet services since it&#39;s always busy, especially on weekends. This Sunday, my friend and I went there and found that the valet service was not there and the parking was overwhelmed with people, all of whom - including us - had to make several turns around the lot to find a parking spot. Ten minutes later, and we still couldn&#39;t find a spot; so we went to another parking service and were told that they are full. In the end, we had to street park the car, 400 feet away, and walk.<br>We didn&#39;t mind paying $5 to have this service available, and we still don&#39;t mind it. It was a really bad experience, and now we think twice before going there.

Service was slow, i didn&#39;t think it was extremely busy, but food was good otherwise.<br><br>One waitress stopped by to drop off our Portabella Mushroom, Avocado, and Zucchini Fries, but did not pick up our empty plates of what was the Grilled Artichoke--i thought that was weird. Another waitress dropped off two plates since we were sharing, one happens to be dirty. I had to ask for another clean plate. Sanitation is questionable. <br><br>Portabella Mushroom, Avocado, and Zucchini Fries were awesome. I would order it again. It was crispy and well-balanced. The veggies were not overpowered by batter.<br><br>Grilled Artichoke was good, but nothing special. i probably wouldn&#39;t order this again.<br><br>Lemon Herb Chicken; the chicken was slightly dry, but the lemon herb flavor was good. Carrots were cooked perfectly, not too soggy or too crunchy. Mashed potatoes were tasty as always.

I visited this location and the service was AWFUL!! After waiting a long time for a table, the host walked us to a dirty table. We stood there like idiots for two minutes. No one came to our table for 15 minutes. I finally asked someone walking by who our waiter was. I complained to the manager online and she was unapologetic with a measely 25 dollar gift card. Save yourself the headache and DO NOT ATTEND this location!

I absolutely LOVE this place! I&#39;m a regular here and the service is exceptionally superb. Tonight however was over the top. My 7 year old mentioned to Kenzo that he was really hungry and Kenzo brought his food out first with the appetizers. I thought that was amazing. Thanks CCF and thank you so much Kenzo!!!!
The bread was delicious, as always! And the vegan cobb salad is always my go-to! It was unfortunate I found a piece of cheese in it, but it was a quick fix. Good service.

First off let me say that Natalie is awesome! Such a sweetheart :) she has a fantastic attitude and a smile to match. She was very helpful guiding me towards ordering a cocktail and she gave her honest opinion on the house cocktails which I really appreciated. She was prompt in greeting myself and my guest (we arrived separately) and she took our entree orders in a timely fashion. The bread service took a bit of time to come out but I&#39;m guessing that&#39;s because they had just reached their peak hour of guests arriving. Our food was great (grilled fish tacos and smokehouse burger) and she was kind enough to ask us if we wanted our desserts for here or to go. We actually did want them to go so I was happy I didn&#39;t have to ask for that. I tried the 30th anniversary cheesecake and while it was okay it kind of paled in comparison to some of their other dessert selections. Other than that overall it was a great experience! One suggestion that I would make is for you guys to either install your own atm because your valet only accepts cash or to have some kind of system that accepts credit or debit cards outside. Especially when 95 percent of your parking lot is for valet. Also keep Natalie happy because she is awesome :)

Love coming here for their chicken Madeira, I come at least once a month to the Cheesecake Factory and I have yet not had a bad experience, their staff are great I love Jazz she&#39;s a great waitress, makes sure our food comes out quick, she&#39;s very welcoming and always makes sure our cups are never empty and is constantly checking up on how our food is, the location is very beautiful u can either sit inside or out ( I always choose outside) and the view is amazing., for desert I always get the red velvet cheesecake which is the most delicious cheesecake in my opinion, I really love this location more than the marina del Rey , I just feel more welcomed here

Sat about 20 minutes before a server even came over and greeted us. I get that sometimes sections can become confusing once servers start getting cut (I work in a restaurant) but I thought maybe the meal will make up for it.  I don&#39;t eat meat so I ordered the four cheese pasta. First of all, it tasted like a frozen meal. Second of all, I didn&#39;t finish it so I got a box to take it to go (no way in hell I&#39;m paying that much to not finish my meal even though it tasted frozen). When I was emptying the rest of my pasta into the bowl I found what looked like chewed up beef. It was the most disgusting thing ever.

Very disappointed in this Restraunt policy&#39;s. Trying to make reservations for a friend with disabilities and the stupid manager  tells me that wouldn&#39;t be fair to other customers. What&#39;s not fair is having a disability.

This place seems always pretty consistent with the food and dessert! I have never had to send anything back, or complain about food or service. However, a manager was running the cheesecake counter and failed to help or direct the growing line. That was pretty frustrating since I&#39;ve never use their dessert counter before. This location is good for groups of people, ocean views, sunsets, and good food.

We were visiting and had lunch here with friends. We ate out in the patio which was a nice relaxed view of the marina. I was impressed that their glutenfree menu had improved (even a GF cheesecake which was delicious). I had the chicken caesars salad (without croutons), which was very large. It was very good, too.

First time visiting The Cheesecake Factory of Redondo Beach.  It is in a great location overseeing the Marina Lagoon.  The ambience and restaurant was pleasant.  Loved the first waiter, the second one was ok.  But overall great customer service.  My friend and I ordered the same plate, Chicken and Shrimp Jambalaya.  She gave me a good tip that works well for those who do not like their meals too spicy because it is spicy, just ask for a side of Alfredo Sauce and pour it all in the pasta and it will boost up to a even better taste!! Loved it!  Will definitely come back during lunch hour.

Lovely location by the waterfront. Very diverse menu that could please any palate. The portions are huge. My friend and I both had delicious falafel salads. Too bad that my friend found a bug in hers. The management did not charge for our salads and offered us free cheesecake for desert. Still had to take off a star for this mishap. Out-of -this-world cheesecakes!!

Brandon was great waiter! He was helpful, kind and very attentive. He was very detailed with our order and he remembered when we asked for anything extra.  The food was also on point!  Better than the one in Sherman Oaks where we usually go. All in all - great food, great service, and great view!!!

Wow. In shock. I can&#39;t believe what happened tonight. Hair in food twice!!!!!!!!!!! Table for two. Both of us had hair in our food. I ordered catfish. She ordered a Berger. They brought out our food and messed up our order. Not bad by it self. Just messed up and brought fries instead of salad. My catfish had hair wrapped around it in the breading. Gross. I never send food back but this was unacceptable. The manager came out and apologized and was going to bring out a fresh order. I was hungry and said ok. Bring another catfish. They asked if we needed anything else. We asked for our salad. They said sure. They brought out a salad. My wife took a bite and I saw the look of horror. I couldn&#39;t believe it. She pulled a hair out of her mouth. Closer inspection revealed lot of hair in her salad. We were in shock and disbelief. Never going to go back. Still feeling nauseous. To add another negative to our experience the bathrooms were disgusting!! If you decide to go to this Cheesecake Factory chew carefully.

Love the Cheesecake Factory and have visited many across the USA over the last couple of years. The Jumbalia is my favourite. However a little disappointing at this location. Service and cheesecake were excellent. The reason for a 3 star rating is the fact that I had no choice but to pay for valet parking in front of the restaurant. Despite being a paying customer of the restaurant they still choose to sting me a little more to park.

This review is for the Special Events team.  They do not honor scheduling agreements that was made a year in advance with repeated corporate customer.  Really disappointed of the service and will take our business elsewhere.

If you ever go, ask for Brian or Kirsten to be your server! They&#39;re awesome! The food was great, and we had a 45 min wait which wasn&#39;t bad considering we had 15 people. The wait for the food wasn&#39;t terrible either. Great service and great food. I&#39;m definitely going back.

Happy hour is amazing, but even better was our waitress Leanna. They were slammed with high school graduation dinners and Leanna didn&#39;t miss a beat. Kept her cool and did an amazing job making this a great evening for all of us.

Fun happy hour and good views. Food is better then average. They have large portion sizes and the drinks rock.<br><br>It&#39;s all about the drinks at HAPPY HOUR.  Also try the calamari. It&#39;s the best here with the homey mustard.

You come to the Factory for above average settings, above average food and great ambiance. I will admit the food sometimes looks better than it tastes but not often. <br><br>The lunch specials, especially the fresh grilled salmon, are great deals. <br><br>The valet is excessive at $4 plus tip. <br><br>But you can&#39;t beat the location and the experience. I will always come back

Actually 3.5 stars, but in honor of National Cheesecake Day, I rounded up to 4.<br><br>Some basics first. They have a very small lot for self parking and take-out (it was completely full when we got there), valet parking is $4. They don&#39;t take reservations, so it&#39;s best to arrive either very early or very late. Despite being a large restaurant, expect a wait if arriving during prime dinner hours. On our visit, we arrived around 5:30pm and were told we could be seated immediately inside, but there would be a long wait for outside seating. We opted to sit inside.<br><br>We started with 2 appetizers, Fried Calamari and Crispy Crab Wontons. The calamari was perfectly cooked, nice crispy exterior, and came with garlic dip and cocktail sauce. The wontons were also well prepared and came with a sweet chili sauce. For our entrees, we ordered the Mushroom Burger, Pepperoni Pizza, Chicken Enchiladas, Grilled Coulotte Steak, and Renee&#39;s Special which consisted of a 1/2 turkey sandwich, cup of soup du jour, and a small green salad. Everyone seemed to enjoy their entree except for the Chicken Enchiladas. The black beans and cilantro rice were both surprisingly spicy, and the enchiladas themselves were just so-so.<br><br>The desserts were the highlight of our meal, as should be expected from a restaurant named Cheesecake Factory. We ordered the Dulce de Leche Caramel, Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;mores Galore, Pineapple Upside-Down, and Wild Blueberry White Chocolate cheesecakes. All were equally good in their own right. Each came with a double portion of whipped cream, and each slice could have been easily shared by 2 or 3 people. Needless to say, we ended up taking home quite a few leftovers.<br><br>Service was courteous and efficient, with our drinks and food arriving promptly after ordering, and soft drinks being refilled as needed. The Cheesecake Factory boasts quite an extensive menu (I lost count after page 15 ...) with seemingly endless choices for appetizers, entrees, and of course, cheesecakes. With so much of their menu left untouched by our group, it just begs for multiple return visits.

Usually my reviews focus on the food and customer service. This review will specifically focus on the service. Food was excellent. not going to lie. Its so good that I have been back once since then. Our waitress did a job, on a scale of 1 to 10; an 8. She was tired and overworked (been on shift nearly 12 hrs). When we got the bill, we specifically instructed her to split the bill in half charge the $24 tip on my friends card since the other person was their guest. Anyway, a few days later...I called the bank to inform them I lost my ATM card and if there were any charges in the last few days. The only charge was Cheesecake Factory at 64 dollars. It should have been 40 for the meal. The server ended up charging both me and my friend 24 dollars each. That&#39;s $48 for a $80 meal. That&#39;s b.s. No way we are paying more than 50% for tip.<br><br>I called the restaurant and spoke to the manager, Robert Ghyczy. I explained to him the situation and said he would investigate. He kept calling every 20-30 minutes for about 2 hrs keeping me updated, which I truly appreciate. He found the mistake and offered to return the money on the card which would have taken up to 6 weeks (stupid merchant policy IMO on their bank) or take a gift card which would only take 3-5 business days to arrive at my house. I choose the gift card.<br><br>Props go out to the manager for taking care of this in a very timely and professional manner, I have used the card and the food and service rocked.

I give the location 5 stars by far the best location of TCF I&#39;ve seen.<br>Food : I had the Veggie Burger with Sweet potato fries the Veggie Burger was messy and smooshy since the patty was made from Quinoa the flavor was also bland I&#39;d like to see more of an effort for the vegetarians. <br><br>The service was good our server was friendly - I would come back just not order the same thing.

The setting was very nice and the place is big so getting in isn&#39;t a huge issue. The food was very good as you would expect. The service was a little on the edgy side and very slow.  Allocate a long time for dinner if you go here.<br><br>The parking is a little strange.  They hit you up for valet ($4 + tip) which seems a little silly considering the parking lot is huge and right next to the entrance.

You can always count on a great meal at the Cheesecake Factory, but I felt my last visit was not up to their usual greatness. The server was ok, but even after two reminders for a glass of ice and lemon for the ice tea, we never received it. Also, ordered the fettuccini Alfredo with chicken. Don&#39;t mind paying for the added chicken($4), but there was only four small pieces(bites) of chicken. Thought it was excessive. Even $2 would have been too much for so little chicken. Won&#39;t stop me for going back as there is plenty of choices, just won&#39;t add chicken again.

My bf and I were craving some good cheesecake so I headed down to pick some up to go. It was a Tuesday night so I thought they would not be to busy. Boy was I wrong. Luckily they do have a spot for 10 minute parking if you tell the valet that you are just picking it up to go. <br><br>The cheesecake was delicious as always, although $17 for 2 slices of cheesecake seemed a bit steep. I have had cheesecake at Junior&#39;s in NYC and it was not that expensive and in my opinion it tasted better, but for the south bay this was very good. <br><br>I went with a classic cheesecake with strawberries which was delicious and my bf had the chocolate raspberry truffle which he said was &#34;Nom nom nom&#34; so two thumbs up there.  <br><br>If you are having a craving for good cheesecake this is a great place to go.

It&#39;s almost surreal to be writing a negative review about the cheesecake factory in Redondo Beach. I have been a frequent, almost weekly, guest for probably the better part of 25 years now. I love everything about this restaurant the location the decor the layout. This past Sunday, two days ago,  I stopped by the restaurant for brunch. We were seated near the window  and I found a big clump of hair hanging from the window. I waved over the waiter and asked him if he would clean it up - I have no idea how the buser could have missed it - which they immediately did. I ordered tea and while waiting found that my silverware could not possibly have been washed. They came over to replace the teaspoon and then brought a dirty filthy tea cup which looked like someone had rubbed food on the outside of it. At that point I asked to speak with the manager. The manager came over and identified himself as someone who who had been transferred in from the  Marina Del Rey location  &#34;clean things up&#34; at Redondo Beach. I found it fascinating that even with the tales of the hair and the spoon and the cup he offered me a new cup of tea at no charge. Space cleaned a bit smarmy to me but I moved forward. When my food came my sisters had a very large very thick black hair in it. At that point we called the dinner dad. The manager comes back by tells us he is not going to charge us for our food. Really??!! Something is very, very, wrong. He should&#39;ve been falling all over himself apologizing for The experience but instead he was making it sound like he was doing us a favor by not charging us for food that we couldn&#39;t even eat. Very, very disappointed in the cleanliness and the lack of service recovery.

Very pretty location right on the water. The location itself is visually great. The waitress kept forgetting our requests. Maybe you should right it down, Honey?<br><br>What I swallowed:<br><br>PASSION FRUIT MOJITO: SUPER SWEET but bursting with minty flavor. If it wasn&#39;t so sweet it would actually be really good.<br><br>AHI TUNA SALAD: The tuna was fresh and the tomatoes were hearty. The avocado was a bit mushy and on the brown side. <br><br>On our way home, we all noticed we had a &#39;funny&#39; taste in our mouths. What was it? Some weird, lingering after taste? I thought it was me &#39;cuz I had fish but all three of us had it (one friend had fish and chips and the other had a chicken dish) so that&#39;s a bit concerning.<br><br>Four stars for the location/ambiance.<br>Three stars for the food and service.<br>Two stars for the weird after taste feeling we all experienced.<br><br>$3.50 for valet parking. There was parking located right on the street so if you see some, park there.
Came here last week for my birthday and had a steak for the first time, and it was AMAZING!! The service was a little spotty, but the food made up for any server mistakes.

Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food quality varies based on location in my experience. This location is one of the better ones. And I think the portions are bigger here too. Or maybe I was hungrier when I went to the other locations.<br>As always you get plenty of calories per meal and a healthy part of that is coming from carbs and oil. So there&#39;s that. <br>The one thing you only get at this location is the view. Try to get a table on the balcony and sit there looking out on the boat dock. It&#39;s quite beautiful. Also try the Arnold Palmer.

Very dissapointed at this place. Dinner was unedible. Do not  order the combination plate of steak diane and shrimp scampi. It is a total rip off. No flavor and too much garlic  overpowering ths whole dish. Plus, they only serve you 3 shrimps and three pieces of steak, total false advertisement of what the menu offers. Service was terrible our waitress Pricilla was so rude and not helpful at all. Terrible experience not coming back.

Came here to celebrate a birthday. What a terrible experience, which is a shame because we have always liked the Cheesecake Factory. This location simply has the worst customer service, and I am sure there are a few attentive staff, but unfortunately everyone we encountered was disrespectful of our time. The waitress did not refill our drinks once and left us waiting for 20 minutes after we finished our meal. I wanted to order cheesecake, but we decided against it because of how long it would take. In retrospect, we should have just ordered at our table instead of on our way out - when we approached the counter, the woman at the register was frantically stapling receipts and did not even acknowledge our presence. What&#39;s worse is the hostess came to order cheesecake and the woman at the front took her order! We kept waiting and after 10 minutes, we received a smeared-top cheesecake slice. For the price and the treatment, this was not worth it. We will be visiting other places where they serve delicious cheesecake where we are treated properly and kindly. Management should address the lack of customer service here: it&#39;s disastrous.

the food here is hashtag amaze balls yo! i love love love their pasta and chocolate shakes! my kids get the kids meal and it&#39;s quite a big portion!!!!!!!!server anthony... do yo self a favor and please switch servers if u get him! he&#39;s mean and mean and mean.

The service is always fantastic, the food delicious and they&#39;ve added a low calorie section to the menu great vegetable salad with all the flavor. <br>I would recommend an ATM inside due to valet only taking cash it is an inconvenience to walk across the street to crowne plaza hotel to take out a $20 or just take cards at valet.<br>Lastly have a glass of there carefully selected wine the Pinot Noir was great.<br>Thanks cheese cake team for the service.<br>Thanks especially to our server (the young lady with the thick black frame glasses serving the bar area on sunday nights)

Went back to Cheesecake and ordered the Rib Eye again.  Steak was way overlooked this time, but the manager came and apologized and they cooked me another one.  Service was great!  Josh was our server and he did a great job continuously checking on us.  Still don&#39;t like the mandatory valet.

If your a sucker for cheesecake, like me, then this is the place for you! They have great variety and have pretty decent portion single slices of cheesecake. Their lunch specials are great deals! There&#39;s is a little of everything and the portions were bigger than other lunch specials in other restaurants. Service was nice and friendly and food was amazing! A lil expensive but so worth it! However, they have limited free parking so you might be stuck paying 2.50 for valet parking. Otherwise, I highly recommend it!

I came here on a Saturday afternoon for a friend&#39;s birthday dinner. Our server Adrian was amazing. Three of those stars are for him and his great service. He rattled off the daily specials without missing a beat and had a smile on his face the whole time. We asked him a question about one of the drinks and he gave his honest opinion, which being a server I can appreciate. Our drinks did take a little while to come out but we saw he had a large party and he was apologetic and came back often to check on us. Our meal was delicious and served piping hot. I had the chicken bellagio and it was amazing. Anything with prosciutto has me sold. My boyfriend got the  margherita pizza and it was good too. My friend got the chicken Madeira and told me to find the recipe for it because she liked it so much. We ordered some cheesecakes to go because it was fight night and the boys were getting restless. The only thing that spoiled the note was actually right toward the beginning of the meal before we had even sat down. <br>We were given the option of dining room or patio and since it was nearing sunset we chose the patio. When we were being walked to our table we noticed it was a little far and we were passing a lot of empty tables. We kept walking father back. We were sat at the absolute last table on the patio, next to the server station where you can hear their conversations, people would pass by us with trays of dishes and when the drop the plates down it sounded pretty loud . It was a little noisy so my friend&#39;s husband asked if we could be sat somewhere closer to the middle or even the table next to us which had a great view of the water. She said no that table wasn&#39;t available. We didn&#39;t question any further because we just wanted to have a good time. About 2 minutes passed and they came back and we&#39;re going to sit three men at a table in the middle but asked to sit at the same table we tried to sit at. They led them straight to it while at my table we all just kind of looked at each other. My friend told me that she kind of felt discriminated against because we didn&#39;t get a choice when three white men did. Were all pretty young and Hispanic. Other than this, the dinner and service was great. Maybe next time we&#39;ll choose to sit inside.

Love it here. We really just came for the cheesecake. But, we were peckish, so we ordered Chicken Bellagio to share. There was enough food to fill both of our bellies with just enough space for sharing a dutch apple a la mode.

OK- don&#39;t get me wrong, I love cheesecake factory.  For a chain restaurant they have delicious food; however, THIS specific cheesecake factory is not my favorite.  <br><br>First off, it&#39;s not very convenient- you have to valet to get in.  I like the CF locations in OC that are in a mall.  Second, the service is not very good.  The servers get annoyed when you ask for more bread, and it always seems understaffed.<br><br>For some reason, this cheesecake factory is my least favorite.  I&#39;ve been to many different locations, but this one is just different....  Unfortunately, it&#39;s the closest one to my house, so I wil just have to deal.

DO NOT ORDER STEAK HERE. They are not a Steak Restaurant. Twice in a row they did my Steak very very poorly. However, other dishes are good as my family say so. Service is good and the staff is nice. Steaks are horrible.

Love the view here! Other Cheesecake Factory aren&#39;t located near the waterfront. I would recommend coming here if you forgot to order a birthday cake beforehand. Lots of choices and it&#39;s ready asap.

They never disappoint me. I love the all of their salmon dishes specialities as well as the hibachi steak. I never eat the cheesecake. The cocktails are pretty good too. I like their skinny margarita. I come here on a regular basis. I highly recommend
Our women&#39;s golf group had our holiday luncheon yesterday for 70 people. The food and service was outstanding. The committee got lots of compliments. Thanks Cheesecake Factory.

I always enjoy my visits here. Not a fan of the cheesecakes but definitely love the food! Their customer service is great! My favorite plate Hibachi steak it is Heavenly! Totally recommend this is a great restaurant for a date the ambiance at dinner is very mellow and lovely!

On December 29th, 2016, at approximately 9:20pm, my friend and I visited this restaurant for dinner, like we have countless times before. We were promptly seated in a booth, and we were told that Antoinette would be our waitress. She had never before been our waitress. She took much longer than usual to take our orders, and then we waited for our food. As we waited for nearly an hour, Antoinette must have passed our table nearly 10 times without saying a word. After we sat down, an African American family sat behind us and Antoinette stopped at their table 4 or more times, and they received their food before we did. By the time we began eating, the African American family had already left, and I made an effort to check by looking behind me. I watched Antoinette, and she was waiting on 4 different tables near us, but never once stopped to ask us if we needed water, NOR did she tell us &#34;your food will be out shortly, sorry for the wait, etc.&#34; She also was not knowledgeable, and wanted to charge me extra for a turkey burger patty. She told me that if I wanted the turkey burger patty wrapped in lettuce, that it would be considered protein style, and that it would be an additional charge. However, in previous times there was no additional charge, and with barbeque sauce. <br>I told my friend that I was going to wait till 10:25pm, more than an hour after we arrived at the Cheesecake Factory, to inquire about the whereabouts of our food. At 10:25pm, I walked up to the hostess and told her that we had been here for more than an hour, and we did not have our food yet. I then saw our &#34;waitress&#34; Antoinette, and asked her &#34;where is our food, it&#39;s been an hour&#34; and she rudely said &#34;I DON&#39;T MAKE THE FOOD, WHY DON&#39;T YOU GO BACK INTO THE KITCHEN AND ASK WHERE YOUR FOOD IS.&#34; I was shocked and speechless, and then I told her &#34;isn&#39;t that your job?&#34; and she rudely responded &#34;YOU DON&#39;T TALK TO ME THAT WAY.&#34; I told her that I had the right to ask where my food was and she stormed off and once again said &#34;YOU DON&#39;T TALK TO ME THAT WAY.&#34; <br>It became crystal clear that my friend and I were being directly targeted, and this was a clear case of discrimination. I spoke to the manager, Aurelia, who was polite and professional, and she immediately brought out our food. It turns out that our food was just sitting on the counter, and ANTOINETTE WAS AWARE OF THIS, BUT SHE PURPOSELY DID NOT WANT TO BRING OUR FOOD OUT. Antoinette never apologized, she just walked by and gave me nasty looks.<br>I will remind all of you that Antoinette is an employee of The Cheesecake Factory, and represents the company, and according to Respondent Superior, a company is liable for the wrongful actions of their employees. Antoinette failed to conduct herself according to the code of conduct of Cheesecake Factory, and failed to perform her duties, and went as far as telling me to perform her duties for her, when she told me to &#34;go back into the kitchen and ask where my food was.&#34; In addition, she used insulting language when she raised her voice and told me that &#34;she doesn&#39;t cook the food.&#34; <br>I will NEVER allow Antoinette&#39;s uncivilized, and hostile conduct to go unnoticed. While employees sometimes make mistakes, this was a CLEAR CASE of malicious, hateful, and purposeful conduct that Antoinette carried out with the specific intent of ruining our dinner experience; therefore. I am 100% convinced that Antoinette was completely aware of the fact that our food was ready, and was purposely neglecting us, and she was just waiting for me to inquire about my food so she could lash out. <br>I emailed the district manager, Mr. DeMoro, on Dec. 29th, and he never responded. I had to call him, and he said &#34;Oh I forgot.&#34; I called again, and he told me that Antoinette offered NO explanation as to why she acted the way she did, and that disciplinary action had been taken against her. The Better Business Bureau (BBB) grade for this place is a &#34;D-&#34;, I&#39;m not surprised. They never responded to my BBB complaint. How unprofessional. The CEO of Cheesecake Factory (Mr. Overton) dropped out of his sole graduate degree (UC Hastings Law School). When I called corporate, some Irish woman spoke to me on his behalf, and told me that I &#34;chose to stay&#34; and finish dinner after the incident with Antoinette, as if I was partially to blame, when I absolutely wasn&#39;t. I felt that she was speaking WAY above her level, but this is typical of undereducated people. UPDATE: they cut the size of their black out cake by a 3rd, and they are charging the same price, $8.50 for a tiny piece of cake. Disgraceful! I won&#39;t be returning to this loud, unprofessional, and dismissive establishment EVER AGAIN. I can get better service and ambiance elsewhere, and BETTER &amp; CHEAPER DESSERTS. Lastly, the coffee here is DISGUSTINGLY watery. Cheesecake Factory is currently being sued for an issue with their bill split tips. I hope this company goes bankrupt in my lifetime.

Enjoy the bread, it will taste good, with butter even better, like it should.<br>My food was timely, the service was nice, This place you&#39;ll enjoy more or less for the price.<br>The food looked good, and was filling, yet felt unsatisfied.<br>The dessert the same, was not wowed, could have done with or without.<br>Overall if you want medium upscale slightly above average tasting good looking cuisine then come down to the Cheesecake Factory and you&#39;ll see what I mean.

I&#39;m surprised I haven&#39;t written a review for this location, considering I own stock in the company and have been here a million times. People think this is my favorite place to eat. Just because I suggest it for lunch doesn&#39;t mean I love the place - it&#39;s just convenient for a large group of indecisive people. There you go.<br><br>Good food, usually good service, and clean atmosphere. If you sit next to a window, you can look through the dirty water and sometimes see garibaldi swimming around.<br><br>I don&#39;t think I need to talk much about their menu. <br><br>Note: You can make reservations for lunch, but not dinner. And they have a couple of private rooms upstairs, in which my company has done events.
